Ensign, ist Battal. Pa., Regt., II Apr. 1758; Lieut., Pa. Troops, 19 Apr. 1760-1764; Capt., 31 July 1764-1765; Chaplain, Rev. War, 1775-1 Aug. 1777; Germ. Ref.; d. Annville, Pa., 15 Aug. 1780.

name: John Conrad Bucher Ii
settled at: Middletown (^Fredk.) Md., Zion or Kittatinny Mountain Church

name: John Conrad Bucher Ii
settled at: North Annville (Leb)., Pa., Hill Church or Quittopehilla Church

name: Jedediah Buckingham
raw: JEDEDIAH BUCKINGHAM, A.M., b. Saybrook, Conn., 2 Oct. 1696, son of Thomas, Jr. and Margaret (Griswold) Buckingham; A.B., Y.C., 1714, A.M.; preached at Newark, N. J., October 1716-Dec. 1718; Presb.; d. Norwalk, Conn., 28 Mar. 1720, a. 24.

name: William Buckingham
raw: WILLIAM BUCKINGHAM (also spelled Beckingham), b. England; a Friend at Cohansey, N. J.; bapt. ca. 28 Jan. 1697 as a Quaker-Bapt.; sett. Newtown, Upper Providence, Pa., 12 Oct. 1697-1701 (the chh. was incorp., 12 Oct. 1697, and disrupted, 1700); sett. Nottingham, Md., 1700-1701; was living in Chester co.. Pa., 1680, 1688, and at Chichester, 14 Feb. 1701; mason; bought house and 150 acres of land at Upper Providence, 7 Apr. 1687, and on i Oct. 1696, another 100 acres; 7th Day Bapt.; d. Chester co.. Pa., ca. 1701.

name: Thomas Budd
raw: THOMAS BUDD, sett. Newtown, Pa., at Upper Providence, 12 Oct. 1697-1701; co-pastor with William Buckingham, Abel Noble, Thomas Martin and Enoch David: too many ministers for one small chh.; sett. Nottingham, Md., after 1701 ; 7th Day Bapt.

name: Samuel Buell
raw: SAMUEL BUELL, D.D., b. Coventry, Conn., 20 Aug. 1716, son of Capt. Peter and Hannah (Welles) Buell; A.B., Y.C., 1741, A.M.; S.T.D., Dart. Coll., 1791; Ord. New Fairfield, Conn., 9 Nov. 1742; itinerant preacher, 1742-1745; inst. East Hampton, L. L, N.Y., 19 Sept. 1746- 1798; Cong.-Presb.; d. East Hampton, L. I., N.Y., 19 July 1798, a. 82.

name: Abraham Bueninger
raw: ABRAHAM BUENINGER, b. Bulach, Zurich, Switzeriand, 1720; came to Pa., 1742; Ord. 1756; missionary to the Indians; sett. West Indies; sett. Codorus, Pa., 1746-1748; sett. Salem (Washington) N.Y., 1770-1811; Morav.; d. Salem, N.Y., Mar. 1811, a. 91.

name: Gottlob Buettner
raw: GOTTLOB BUETTNER (Bittner), b. 1717; arriv. Bethlehem, Pa., 26 Oct. 1741; Ord. Oley, Pa., 11 Feb. 1741/2; sett. Heidelberg (Berks) Pa., 1742-1742; sett. Marion (Berks) Pa., Chh. at Stouchsburg, Mar. 1742-1742; sett. Shekomeko (Dutchess) N.Y., Indian Chh., 1742-1745; Morav.; d. Pine Plain, Shekomeko, N.Y., 1745, a. 28.

name: Comer Bullock
raw: COMER BULLOCK, b. 1734; sett. Stanford (Dutchess) N.Y., Oct. 1759-1778; sett. Stanford (2nd Bapt. Chh.), 9 May 1778-1812; Bapt.; d. Stanford, N.Y., 10 June 1812, a. 78.

name: Christian Burkholder
raw: Bishop CHRISTIAN BURKHOLDER, b. Switzerland, i June 1746, son of Christian Burkholder; arriv. Philadelphia, July 1755; Ord. minister, 1770; Ord. Bishop, 1780; sett. West Earl (Lane.) Pa., Groffdale Chh., 1770-1809; sett. East Earl (Lane.) Weaverland Chh., 1770- 1809; Menn.; d. Groffdale, Pa., 13 May 1809, a. 63.

name: Hans Burkholder
settled at: Pequea (Lane.) Pa., New Danville meeting house
raw: Bishop HANS BURKHOLDER (Burghholtzer, Burgholzer), preacher in Langnau, Emmenthal, Berne, Switzerland; imprisoned July 1708— 18 Mar. 1710; left Mannheim, Germany for Pa., 1717; arriv. Philadelphia, 24 Aug. 1717; sett. Pequea (Lane.) Pa., New Danville meeting house, i7i7-i745;Menn.;d. Pequea, Pa., ca. 1745.

name: Ulrich Burkholder
raw: ULRICH BURKHOLDER, brother of Bishop Christian Burkholder of Groffdale; sett. Brecknock (Lane.) Pa., before 1778-1804; Menn.; d. 1804.

name: Matthias Burnet
raw: MATTHIAS BURNET, D.D., b. Battle Hill, N. J., 24 Jan. 1749, A.B., Princeton, 1769, A.M., 1772, D.D., 1802; A.M., Y.C, 1785; Ord. Jamaica, L. I., N.Y., Apr. 1775; sett. Jamaica, 1774-May 1785; inst. Norwalk, Conn., 2 Nov. 1785-1806; Presb.; d. Norwalk, Conn., 30 June 1806, a. 58.

name: James Burnside
settled at: The Minisinks (the area between Delaware Water Gap, Pa., Paulin's Kill, N. J., and Wallkill, N. J.)
raw: JAMES BURNSIDE, b. Meath, Leinster, Ireland, June 1708; arriv. Ga., 1743; accountant for the Trustees of the colony of Savannah; minister at The Minisinks (the area between Delaware Water Gap, Pa., Paulin's Kill, N. J., and Wallkill, N. J.), 1745-1749; Bethlehem, Pa., Brodhead Settlement at Dansbury, Pa., 1747-1749; Wallkill (Sussex) N. J., 1747-1749; farmer; member. Provincial Assembly of Pa., 1752; Moravian; d. near Bethlehem, Pa., Aug. 1755.

name: Aaron Burr
trustee: Princeton, 1746-1748, President, 9 Nov. 1748-1757 (Princeton was then called the College of New Jersey)
raw: President AARON BURR, A.M., b. Fairfield, Conn., 4 Jan. 1715/6, son of Daniel and Elizabeth Burr; A.B., Y.C, 1735, A.M.; Ord. Newark, N. J., 25 Jan. 1737/8; sett. Newark, N. J., 1736-17SS; Princeton, N. J., ist. Chh., 1756-1757; Trustee, Princeton, 1746-1748, President, 9 Nov. 1748-1757 (Princeton was then called the College of New Jersey); he was father of Lieut.-Col. Aaron Burr (1756-1836), Vice-President of the United States, 1801-1805; Presb.; d. Princeton, N. J., 24 Sept. 1757, a. 42.

name: Blackleach Burritt
licensed: lied churches in Conn., N.Y., and Vt.
son of: Peleg and Elizabeth (Blackleach) Burritt by the British, 18 June 1779-Aug. 1781
raw: BLACKLEACH BURRITT, b. Huntington, Conn., son of Peleg and Elizabeth (Blackleach) Burritt; Ord. Pound Ridge (Westchester) N.Y., 16 June 1774; sett. Pound Ridge, 1772-1 Apr. 1776; taken prisoner in the Rev. W^ar by the British, 18 June 1779-Aug. 1781; later supplied churches in Conn., N.Y., and Vt.; Cong.; Presb.; d. Winhall, Vt., 1794, a. ca. 50.

name: John Burrows
raw: JOHN BURROWS, b. Taunton, Somersetshire, England; Ord. Taunton, Eng.; arriv. Philadelphia, Nov. 1711; sett. Middletown (Monmouth) N. J., 1713-1738; d. Middletown, N. J., 1738.

name: Abner Bush
raw: ABNER BUSH, inst. Goshen (Orange) N.Y., Fall of 1758; sett. Goshen, 1758-1766; Marlborough (Ulster) N.Y., 1766-1773; Newburgh (Orange) N.Y., 1774-1774; Presb.

name: Andrew Busse
raw: ANDREW BUSSE, arriv. N.Y., N.Y., 2 June 1756; sett. Bethlehem, Pa., as chaplain, 1756-1776; Moravian.

name: Joachim Busse
raw: JOACHIM BUSSE, Qrd. in Europe; minister at Berlin, Germany; arriv. N.Y., N.Y., 24 Sept. 1751; sett. St. Thomas, West Indies, 1751; Moravian.

name: William Butcher
raw: WILLIAM BUTCHER, b. Birmingham, Pa., 18 May 1699; sett. Birmingham (Delaware) Pa., and Newlin (Chester) Pa., 1719-1721; sett. Cohansey, N. J., 1721-1724; Bapt.; d. Cohansey, N.J., 12 Dec. 1724, a. 26, s.p.

name: Eliab Byram
son of: the Hon. Maj. Ebenezer and Hannah (Hayward) Byram
raw: ELIAB BYRAM, A.B., b. Bridgewater, Mass., son of the Hon. Maj. Ebenezer and Hannah (Hayward) Byram; A.B., H.C., 1740; Qrd. Mendham (Morris) N. J., May 1744; sett. Mendham, N. J., Qct. 1743-1751; inst. Amwell (Hunterdon) N.J., Chh. at Reaville, 14 Aug. 1751; sett. Amwell, N. J., 25 June 1751-1754; Presb.; d. Amwell, N. J., Apr. 1754.

name: James Caldwell
degrees: A.M., A.B., Princeton, 1759, A.M., Trustee, 1768-1781, clerk of the Board, 1772-1781, Treasurer, 1777-1779
raw: JAMES CALDWELL, A.M., b. Cub Creek (Charlotte) Va., 17 Apr. 1734, son of John Caldwell; A.B., Princeton, 1759, A.M., Trustee, 1768-1781, clerk of the Board, 1772-1781, Treasurer, 1777-1779; Qrd. New Brunswick Presbytery, 17 Sept. 1760; preached in the Carolinas, 1760-1761; sett. Elizabethtown, N.J., Mar. 1762-1776; Chaplain, 3rd N.J. Battalion, Continental Army, 1776-1781; Assistant Deputy Quartermaster-General of the Continental Army; an eligible member of the Society of the Cincinnati; member, N.J. Senate, 1781; Presb.; d. (killed) Elizabethtown, N. J., 24 Nov. 1781 (GS); his wife was also shot by a British soldier.

name: John Christopher Frederick Cammerhoff
raw: Bishop JQHN CHRISTQPHER FREDERICK CAMMERHQFF, b. Hillersleben, near Magdeburg, 28 July 1721; studied at Bergen; grad. U. Jena, 1738; Lindheim, 1744; Prof, at the Theol. Sem. at Marienborn, Wetteravia; Ord. Zeyst, H^olland, May 1746; consecrated Bishop at London, Sept. 174.6; arriv. Lewes, Del., 28 Dee 1746; sett. Bethlehem, Pa., 10 Jan. 1746/7-1751, as assistant to Bishop Spangenberg; preached in Pa., N. J., and Md.; Morav.; d. Bethlehem, Pa., 28 Apr. 1751, a. 30.

name: John Campanius
raw: JQHN CAMPANIUS, b. Stockholm, Sweden, 15 Aug. 1601, son of John Peter Campanius; U. of Upsala; Qrd. 19 July 1633; arriv. at Fort Christiana on the Delaware, 15 Feb. 1642/3; sett. Tinicum (Bucks) Pa., New Goeteborg Chh., 1643-1648; Chester, Pa., Upland Chh., 1643-1648; Wilmington, Del., Qld Swedes Chh., and New Castle, Del., 1643-1648; returned to Sweden, 16 May 1648; Chaplain to the Admiralty; Rector at Frosthuelt and Hernevi, Sweden, 1648-1683; Sw. Luth.; d. Stockholm, 17 Sept. 1683.

name: Alexander Campbell
raw: ALEXANDER CAMPBELL, K.B. for Va., 30 Dec. 1725; S.P.G. missionary at Appoquinimink, Del., 1726-1729; Middletown, Del., St. Anne's Chh., 1726-1729; Setauket, L. I., N.Y., Caroline Chh., E

name: Colin Campbell
settled at: Burlington, N. J., St. Mary's Church
raw: CQLIN CAMPBELL, A.M., b. Earnhill, Scotland, 1707, son of Colin Campbell; ed. Inverness; A.M., Aberdeen, 1729; K.B., Isle of Nevis, W.I., 9 Feb. 1737/8; sett. Burlington, N. J., St. Mary's Chh., 10 May 1738-1766; S.P.G. missionary; Bristol (Bucks) Pa., Chh. of St. James the Greater, 1741-1766; Mt. Holly (Burlington) N. J., St. Andrew's Chh., 1742-1766; his portrait hangs in St. Mary's Chh., Burlington, N.J.; Ep.; d. Burlington, N. J., 9 Aug. 1766.

name: James Campbell
edited_raw: JAMES CAMPBELL (See Colonial Clergy of North Carolina), h. Campbellton-on- Argyleshire, Scotland
raw: JAMES CAMPBELL (See Colonial Clergy of North Carolina), h. Campbellton-on-Kintyre, Argyleshire, Scotland; came to America, 1730; lie. 1735; Ord. 3 Aug. 1742; sett. Tinicum (Bucks) Pa., 1738-1749 (inst. 24 May 1744); Tohickon (Bucks) Pa., 1739-1749; Newtown (Bucks) Pa., 1739-1749; Durham (Bucks) Pa., 1742-1749; Forks of the Delaware, Pa., 1742-1749; Greenwich (Warren) N. J., 1742-1749; Oxford (Warren) N.J., 1742-1749; Rocky Spring Chh., Letterkenney (Franklin) Pa., 1749-1757; Conococheague or Falling ; Spring Chh., Guilford (Franklin) Pa., 1749-1757; in 1757, he removed to N.C; Presb.; d. Cape Fear, N.C, 1781.

name: John Campbell
raw: JOHN CAMPBELL, b. Scotland, 1713; came to America, 1734; ^^^ at the Log College; lie. Presbytery of New Brunswick, ,14 Oct. 1747; Ord. New Providence, 21 Nov. 1750; sett. Charlestown (Chester) Pa., 27 Oct. 1747-1753; Lower Providence (Montg.) Pa., 1747-1753; Brandywine Manor, Pa.; Norriton (Montg.) Pa., 1747-1753; Presb.; d. Providence, Pa., I May 1753, a. ca. 40 (GS).

name: John Campbell
raw: JOHN CAMPBELL, b. Scotland, 1718; served on the island of Jamaica; Presb.; d. N.Y., N.Y., 21 June 1770, a. 52 (GS).

name: Robert Campbell
raw: ROBERT CAMPBELL, Ord. Canaan (Litchfield) Conn., 20 Oct. 1761; sett. Canaan, 1761-1762; sett. Stillwater (near Bemis Heights), N.Y., 1762-1789; Cong.

name: David Candler
raw: DAVID CANDLER, sett. York (York) Pa., Christ Chh., 1743-1744; Hanover (York) Pa., St. Michael's Chh., 1743-1744; Conewago (Adams) Pa., 1743-1744; sett. Frederick (Fredk.), Md., 1743-1744; Monocacy Chh., Md., 1743-1744; his parish extended from the Susquehanna to the Potomac; Luth.; d. Hanover, Pa., Dec. 1744.

name: David Candler
edited_raw: his parish extended from the Susquehanna to the Potomac

name: Richard Caner
son of: Henry and Abigail Caner (brother of Henry Caner, D.D., of King's Chapel, Boston)
raw: RICHARD CANER, A.M., b. Boston, Mass., 4 June 1717, son of Henry and Abigail Caner (brother of Henry Caner, D.D., of King's Chapel, Boston); A.B., Y.C., 1736, A.M.; Ord. London, Eng., Oct. 1741; sett. Norwalk, Conn., June 1742-1745; sett. Stated Island, N.Y., St. Andrew's Chh., 1745; Ep.; d. New York City, 14 Dec. 1745, a. 28, of smallpox.

name: Richard Caner
settled at: Stated Island, N.Y., St. Andrew's Church

name: Jean Carle
raw: JEAN CARLE, b. Nimes, France; arriv. N.Y., N.Y., 27 July 1754; original trustee of Columbia U.; inst. New York, N.Y., French Chh. of the Saint Esprit, 4 Aug. 1754-1764; sett. New Rochelle (Westchester) N.Y., French Chh., 1754-1764; resigned 23 May 1763; sailed for London, 17 Apr. 1764; Chaplain, French Hospital, London, England, 1764-1790; French Ref.

name: Jean Carle
settled at: New York, N.Y., French Church of the Saint Esprit

name: Hugh Carlisle
settled at: Newtown (Bucks) Pa. and Plumstead (Bucks) Pa., June Nov.
raw: HUGH CARLISLE, prob. b. in Ireland; adm. to New Castle Presbytery, bef. Sept. 1735; sett. Newtown (Bucks) Pa. and Plumstead (Bucks) Pa., June 1736-Nov. 1737; Amwell (Hunterdon) N.J. and Union (Hunterdon) N.J., Bethlehem Chh., Nov. 1737-1738; Lewes Presbytery, 14 Mar. 1738-1742; Presb. (It would seem that Hugh Carlisle who sett, at St. George's Parish (Harford) Md., 1744-1749; Ep. was the same man.)

name: James Carman
raw: JAMES CARMAN, b. Cape May, N.J., 1677; Ord. Hightstown (Mercer) N.J., 1745-1756; Bapt.; d. Hightstown, N.J., 28 Oct. 1756, a. 79.

name: John Carmichael
ordained: Brandywine Manor (Chester) Pa., Forks of the Brandywine, 21 Apr. 1761-1785
degrees: A.M., came to America, 1737 A.B., Princeton, 1759, A.M.
raw: JOHN CARMICHAEL, A.M., b. Tarbert, Argyleshire, Scotland, 17 Oct. 1728, son of Donald and Elizabeth (Alexander) Carmichael; came to America, 1737; A.B., Princeton, 1759, A.M.; Ord. Brandywine Manor (Chester) Pa., Forks of the Brandywine, 21 Apr. 1761-1785; Charlestown (Chester) Pa., 1763-1773; Presb.; d. Forks of the Brandywine, Pa., 15 Nov. 1785, a. 57.

name: Casparus Carpentier
licensed: lied occasionally the French Church in New York City, 1657-1684
raw: CASPARUS CARPENTIER, prob, son of the Rev. Caspar Carpentier; minister at Amersfoort, Holland, 1650; Amsterdam, Holland, 1650; arriv. in America, 1657; sett. New Castle, Del. (Dutch Ref. Chh), 1657-1684; he also supplied occasionally the French Chh. in New York City, 1657-1684; Dutch Ref.; d. New Castle, Del., 1684.

name: Ezekiel Carr
licensed: lied the French Huguenot Church in Boston
raw: EZEKIEL CARRÉ (Carreus), matric. Geneva, 1670; minister of the Huguenot chhs. at Mirambeau and La Roche Chaláis in France; came to America ca. 1673; sett. New York City, French Chh., 1673-1678; sett. Huguenot Chh. at Narragansett, R.I., 1686-1691; also occasionally supplied the French Huguenot Chh. in Boston; French Ref.; disappears after 1691.

name: Robert Carter Ii
settled at: Perth Amboy (Middlesex) N.J., St. Peter's Church
degrees: A.M., matric. Oriel Coll., Oxford, 7 June 1739, a. 18 A.B., II Feb. 1742/3, A.M., 1747
son of: William Carter of Kimmel, Flintshire, Wales
raw: ROBERT CARTER, A.M., b. 1721, son of William Carter of Kimmel, Flintshire, Wales; matric. Oriel Coll., Oxford, 7 June 1739, a. 18; A.B., II Feb. 1742/3, A.M., 1747; K.B. to New Providence, Bahamas, 27 Sept. 1749; sett. Perth Amboy (Middlesex) N.J., St. Peter's Chh., 1760-1762; Ep.

name: Henry Cary
raw: HENRY CARY, sett. Pawling (Dutchess) N.Y., 1766 (and possibly to 1770); Bapt.

name: Wheeler Case
raw: WHEELER CASE, A.M., A.B., Princeton, 1755, A.M.; inst. Pleasant Valley (Dutchess) N.Y., 1765-1791; Charlotte, N.Y., near Albany, 1774; Poughkeepsie (Dutchess) N. Y., 1774-1774; Presb.; d. Pleasant Valley, N.Y., 31 Aug. 1791.

name: Isaac Cassel
raw: ISAAC CASSEL, b. 21 Aug. 1746; sett. Skippack (Montg.) Pa., 1774-1823; Menn.; d. Skippack, Pa., 2 Sept. 1823.

name: Julius Cassel
raw: JULIUS CASSEL, b. Kriesheim, Germany, bef. 1681, son of Rev. Yillis Kassel; arriv. Pa., 16 Oct. 1727; Ord. betw. 1725 and 1738; sett. Skippack, Pa., 1730-1750; Menn.; d. Skippack, Pa., 1750.

name: Robert Cathcart
raw: ROBERT CATHCART, b. Ireland; received in New Castle Presbytery, 15 Apr. 1730; Ord. 1730; sett. Middletown (Del.) Pa., 1730-1754; sett. Brandywine Manor (New Castle) Del., 1730-1754, in Christiania Hundred; sett. Wilmington, Del., 1740-1754; Presb.; d. Wilmington, Del., 1754.

name: Robert Cathcart
settled at: Brandywine Manor (New Castle) Del., , in Christiania Hundred

name: Samuel Cavin
raw: SAMUEL CAVIN, b. Ireland, 1701; Ord. Greencastle (Franklin) Pa., 16 Nov. 1739; sett. Conococheague (Franklin) Pa., 16 Nov. 1737- Mar. 1738; Antrim, Greencastle, Pa., Mar. 1738/9-1749; Guilford, Falling Spring Chh. at Chambersburg, Mar. 1738/9-May 1741; Montgomery (Orange) N.Y., Good Will Chh., 26 May 1743-1744; Greencastle, Pa., 6 Nov. 1744-1749; North Middleton (Cumberland) Pa., Meeting House Springs Chh., 1745-1750; Lower Pennsborough (Cumberland) Pa., Silver Spring Chh., 1745-1750; Cumberland at Gettysburg, Pa., 1740-1741; Presb.; d. Silver Spring, Pa., 9 Nov. 1750, a. 49 (GS).

name: Isaac Chalker
raw: ISAAC CHALKER, A.M., b. Saybrook, Conn., 12 Sept. 1707, son of Lieut. Abraham and Deborah (Barber) Chalker; A.Bi, Y.C., 1728, A.M.; Ord. for Cornwall and Montgomery, N.Y., 1734; sett. Cornwall (Orange) N.Y., Bethlehem Presb. Chh., 1734-1743; Wallkill (Ulster) N.Y., 1734-1740; inst. Buckingham, Conn., Oct. 1744; sett. Buckingham, Dec. 1743-1765; sett. New Paltz (Ulster) N.Y., 1760^-1760; Presb.; Dutch Ref.; d. Buckingham, Conn., 28 May 1765, a. 57.

name: Thomas Bradbury Chandler
degrees: D.D., A.B., Y.C., 1745, A.M. A.M., Christ Chh. Coll., Oxford, 25 May 1753 D.D., Oxford, 23 Jan. 1766 A.M., Colunjbia U., 1758, D.D., Columbia U., 1767
son of: William and Jemima (Bradbury) Chandler by Bishop of London, 1751
raw: THOMAS BRADBURY CHANDLER, D.D., b. Thornpson, Woodstock, Conn., 26 Apr. 1726, son of William and Jemima (Bradbury) Chandler; A.B., Y.C., 1745, A.M.; A.M., Christ Chh. Coll., Oxford, 25 May 1753; D.D., Oxford, 23 Jan. 1766; A.M., Colunjbia U., 1758, D.D., Columbia U., 1767; Ord. by Bishop of London, 1751; lie, 20 Aug. 1751; K.B., N.J., 4 Sept. 1751; catechist, Elizabethtown, N.J., 1748- 1750; sett. Elizabethtown, N.J., St. John's Chh., 3 Nov. 1751-1775; June 1785-1790; refugee to England, May 1775-1785; sett. Woodbridge, N.J., 1752-1763; d. Elizabethtown, N.J., 17 June 1790, a. 64.

name: Jedediah Chapman
ordained: Orange, N.J., at Newark Mountain, 22 July 1766-13 Aug. 1800
degrees: A.M., A.B., Y.C., 1762, A.M., Princeton U.
raw: JEDEDIAH CHAPMAN, A.M., b. East Haddam, Conn., 27 Sept. 1741, son of Robert and Mary (Church) Chapman; A.B., Y.C., 1762, A.M., Princeton U.; lie. 5 June 1764; Ord. Orange, N.J., at Newark Mountain, 22 July 1766-13 Aug. 1800; inst. Geneva, N.Y^, 8 July 1812; sett. Geneva, N.Y., 1800-1813; Chaplain, N.J. regt., 1776; moderator of the synod of N.Y. and Pa., 1787; Presb.; d. Geneva, N.Y., 22 May 1813, a. 72.

name: Richard Charlton
degrees: A.B., K.B. for Leeward Islands, 4 Apr. 1730
raw: RICHARD CHARLTON, A.B., K.B. for Leeward Islands, 4 Apr. 1730; sett. Newburgh (Orange) N.Y., St. George's Chh., 1730-1730; New Windsor, N.Y., 1730; Waiden (Orange) N.Y., St. Andrew's Chh., 1732-1747, N.Y., N.Y., Trinity Chh., 1732-1746; Staten Island, N.Y., St. Andrew's Chh., 1747-1777; Ep.; d. Staten Island, N.Y., 1777.

name: Pierre Joseph Chaumonot
raw: PIERRE JOSEPH CHAUMONOT, S.J., b. ChatiUon-sur-Seine, France, 1611; became a Jesuit at Rome, 1632; arriv. Quebec, i Aug. 1639; at Lake Huron, Sept. 1639; missionary among the Onondagas of N.Y., 1655-1657; sett. Syracuse, N.Y., St. Mary's Chapel, 1655-1657; founder of Lorette at St. Charles, Quebec; R.C; d. Quebec, 21 Feb. 1693.

name: Pierre Joseph Chaumonot
edited_raw: Indian missionary among the Onondagas of N.Y.

name: Benjamin Chesnut
raw: BENJAMIN CHESNUT, A.M., b. England; A.B., Princeton, 1751, A.M.; Ord. Woodbury (Glouc), N.J., 3 Sept. 1751; sett. Woodbury, N.J., 1749-17 May 1753, 1766-1775; Gloucester (Camden) N.J., Timber Creek Chh. at Blackwood, 1750-1753, 1766-1775; Pennsneck (Salem) N.J., at Quihawken, 1749-1753; Charlestown (Chester) Pa., 1753- May 1763; Lower Providence (Montg.) Pa., Nov. 1753-May 1763; New Londonderry (Chester) Fagg's Manor Chh., 1753 ff.; Forks of the Delaware, Pa., 1753; Norriton (Montg.) Pa., 1758-1763; Berlin (Camden) N.J., at Waterford, 1766-1775; Presb.; d. Gloucester, N.J., 21 July 1775.

name: James Clark
raw: JAMES CLARK, sett. Flatbush, L.I., N.Y., at Midwout, 1685-1695; New Utrecht, L.I., N.Y., 1680-1695; Dutch Ref.

name: Jesse Clark
ordained: Austerlitz (Columbia) N.Y., 16 Apr. 1760-1780, as the ist minister
raw: JESSE CLARK, A.B., b. New Haven, Conn., 21 Mar. 1728, son of Nathan and Phebe (Lines) Clark; A.B., Y.C, 1756; Ord. Austerlitz (Columbia) N.Y., 16 Apr. 1760-1780, as the ist minister; Cong.; d. Austerlitz, N.Y., ca. 1800.

name: Thomas Clark
raw: THOMAS CLARK, M.D., b. Scotland; M.D., \J. of Glasgow; fought in the war against the Pretender, 1745-1746; liv. Stirling, Scotland, Apr. 1748; Ord. Ballybay (Monaghan) Ireland, 23 July 1751-1764; arriv. N.Y., N.Y., 28 July 1764; sett. Salem (Washington) N.Y., 1764-1779; Perth (Fulton) N.Y., New Perth Chh., 1764-1779; Cambridge (Washington) N.Y., 1769-1779; Cedar Spring and Long Cane Chhs., S.C, inst. 1786; sett. 1779-1793; physician; Associate Presb.; d. Long Cane, S.C, 25 Dec. 1793.

name: John Clarke
raw: JOHN CLARKE, A.B., b. 1718; A.B., Princeton, 1759; lie. 1759; Ord. 1760; sett. Allen (Northampton) Pa., 1762-1767; inst. Upper Mount Bethel (Northampton) Pa., Forks North Chh., 13 Oct. 1762- 4 Nov. 1767; sett. Bethel (Harford) Md., Upper Node Forest Chh., 1769-1781; sett. Bethel and Lebanon, Pa., 1781-1797; Presb.; d. western Pa., 1797.

name: John Clarke
settled at: Bethel (Harford) Md., Upper Node Forest Church

name: John Clarke
settled at: Upper Mount Bethel (Northampton) Pa., Forks North Church

name: Josias Clarke
settled at: Boston, Mass., King's Chapel, asst. min.
degrees: A.B., b.Tarvin, Cheshire, England, 1622, son of the Rev. Sabaoth Clarke A.B., Queens' Coll., Oxford, 1644/5
raw: JOSIAS CLARKE, A.B., b.Tarvin, Cheshire, England, 1622, son of the Rev. Sabaoth Clarke; matric. New Inn Hall, Oxford, 9 Apr. 1641, a. 19; A.B., Queens' Coll., Oxford, 1644/5; Rector of Tattershall, Cheshire, 1658; Chaplain of the Fort at New York, N.Y., 1684-1686; sett. Boston, Mass., King's Chapel, asst. min., 1686-1687; ret. to England, 7 Apr. 1687; Vicar of Broxbourne, Herts., 1689-1694; Ep.

name: Richard Samuel Clarke
settled at: North Salem (Westchester) N.Y., St. James's Church
raw: RICHARD SAMUEL CLARKE, A.M. (See Colonial Clergy of New England, p. 57), sett. North Salem (Westchester) N.Y., St. James's Chh., 1764-1766; Ep.

name: James Clarkson
raw: JAMES CLARKSON, b. Scotland, ca. 1738; came to America, 1772; Ord. Chanceford (York) Pa., Guinston Chh., 1773; sett. Chanceford, Pa., 25 Aug. 1773-Mar. 1808; Assoc. Presb.; d. Valley Field, Chanceford, Pa., 30 Oct. 1811, a. 73.

name: Thomas Clayton
raw: THOMAS CLAYTON, K.B. to Md., 11 Jan. 1697/8; had been Rector of Crofton, Yorkshire; sett. Philadelphia, Pa., Christ Chh., bef. 16 Sept. 1698-1699; 1st Ep. min. to come to Pa.; d. Sassafras, Md., 1699, of yellow fever.

name: John Clement
raw: JQHN CLEMENT, b. Great Britain; Qrd. Rehoboth (Somerset) Md., June 1719; sett. Rehoboth, 1719-1720; sett. Gloucester (Camden) N.J., Timber Creek Chh. at Blackwood, 1720-1750; sett. Pilesgrove, N.J., 1720-1741; Presb.; d. 1766.

name: John Clement
settled at: Gloucester (Camden) N.J., Timber Creek Church at Blackwood

name: Valentine Clemmer
raw: Bishop VALENTINE CLEMMER, Qrd. preacher and Bishop in Europe; arriv. in Pa., 1717; sett. Milford (Bucks) Pa., Great Swamp Chh., 1717-1771; Bishop in Pa.,; living 15 June 1771; Menn.; said to have d. in Lancaster co.. Pa., and to have been buried at Mellingers.

name: John Cleverly
settled at: New Providence (Union) N.J., Turkey Christian Church
raw: JOHN CLEVERLY, A.M., b. Braintree, Mass., 9 Mar. 1695/6, son of Lieut. John and Hannah (Savil) Cleverly; A.B., H.C., 1715, A.M., 1718; schoolteacher at Braintree, 1715-1726; Georgetown, Me., 1728; Freetown, 1730; Morristown, N.J. (then West Hanover), Sept. 1735; apparently not ordained; sett. New Providence (Union) N.J., Turkey Christian Chh., 1737-1739; Rahway, N.J., 1741-1742; Presb.; d. Rahway, N.J., 31 Dee 1776, unm.

name: David Close
raw: DAVID CLQSE, A.M., b. North Salem, N.Y., 1742/3, son of Solomon and Deborah (Brush) Close; A.B., Y.C., 1771, A.M.; Qrd. Patterson (Putnam) N.Y., 24 Nov. 1772-1783; sett. Carmel (Putnam) N.Y., 1774- 1783; Presb.; d. Patterson, N.Y., 19 Mar. 1783, a. 40 (GS).

name: John Close
son of: Solomon Close and brother of David Close, q.v.
raw: JOHN CLOSE, A.M., b. Greenwich, Conn., 1737, son of Solomon Close and brother of David Close, q.v.; A.B., Princeton, 1763, A.M.; A.M. (hon.) Y.C., 1771; Qrd. Huntington, L.I., N.Y., 30 Qct. 1766; sett. Huntington, L.I., N.Y., 1766-4 Apr. 1773; New Windsor (Qrange) N.Y., 1773-1796; Newburgh, N.Y., 1773-1796; Cornwall (Qrange) N.Y., Bethlehem Chh., 1773-1796; sett. Waterford (Saratoga) N.Y. and Middletown, N.Y. (both Dutch Ref. chhs.), 1796-1804; Presb.; d. Waterford, N.Y., 1813.

name: John Close
settled at: Waterford (Saratoga) N.Y. and Middletown, N.Y. (both Dutch Ref. chhs.)

name: John Clubb
raw: JQHN CLUBB, b. Wales; K.B. for Pa., 3 Apr. 1704; asst. min. and schoolmaster, Philadelphia, Pa., Christ Chh., 1704-1708; sett. Qxford (Chester) Pa., Trinity Chh., 1708^1710, 1714-1715; S.P.G. missionary; sett. Middletown, Del. and Appoquinimink, Del., 1712-1713; sett. Radnor in Newtown (Del.) Pa., St. David's Chh., Sept. 1714-Dee 1715, as first minister of the chh.; Ep.; d. Radnor, Pa., 25 Dee 1715.

name: John Clubb
settled at: Radnor in Newtown (Del.) Pa., St. David's Church, Sept. Dee , as first minister of the church

name: Gerhard Daniel Cock
raw: GERHARD DANIEL CQCK, came to America, 1763 ; sett. Rhinebeck Flats (Dutchess) N.Y., D.R. Chh., 1763-1790; Kingsbury (Dutchess) N.Y., 1763-1790; Rhinebeck, N.Y., G.R. Chh., 1764-1790; Rhinebeck Flats (Dutchess) N.Y., 1764-1790; Germantown (Columbia) N.Y., D.R. Chh., 1764-1790; New Paltz (Ulster) N.Y., D.R. Chh., 1768-1770; Claverack (Columbia) N.Y., D.R. Chh., 1770-1776; Linlithgow (Columbia) N.Y., D.R. Chh., 1770-1779; Pine Plains (Dutchess) N.Y., Red or Koch's Chh. at Pulvers, 1772-1790; Germ. Ref., but preached mostly in Dutch Ref. chhs.; d. Germantown, N.Y., 1790.

name: Henricus Coens
settled at: Belleville (Essex) N.J., Church at Second River
raw: HENRICUS COENS, Ord. Amsterdam, Holland, 4 Sept. 1725; sailed for America, 7 Oct. 1725; sett. Belleville (Essex) N.J., Chh. at Second River, 1725-1730; Passaic (Passaic) N.J., Chh. at Acquackanonk, 1726-1735; Pompton Plains (Morris) N.J., Chh. at Pequannock, 1726-1735; Ponds (Bergen) N.J., Chh. at Oakland, 1726-1735; Dutch Ref.;d. N.J., i4Feb. 1735.

name: Benjamin Coles
raw: BENJAMIN COLES, b. Oyster Bay, L.I., N.Y., 6 Apr. 1737; sett. Stratfield, Conn., 1768-1774; Hopewell (Mercer) N.J., 15 Oct. 1774- 1781; Scotch Plains (Union) N.J., 1781-1783; Oyster Bay, L.I., N.Y., 1783-1810; Bapt.; d. Oyster Bay, L.I., N.Y., Aug. 1810, a. 73.

name: Thomas Colgan
degrees: A.B., pensioner. Trinity Coll., Dublin, 6 June 1718, a. 16 A.B., Trinity Coll., Dublin, 1722
raw: THOMAS COLGAN, A.B., b. Dublin, Ireland, 1702, son of John Colgan, weaver; pensioner. Trinity Coll., Dublin, 6 June 1718, a. 16; A.B., Trinity Coll., Dublin, 1722; K.B. for N.Y., 2 June 1726; S.P.G. missionary, 1726; arriv. N.Y., N.Y., 1726; sett. N.Y., N.Y., Trinity Chh., 1726-1732; sett. Jamaica, L.L, N.Y., Grace Chh., 1733-1755; Flushing, L.L, N.Y., St. George's Chh., 1731-1755; Newtown, L.L, N.Y., 1733-1755; Ep-; d. Jamaica, L.L, N.Y., Dec. 1755.

name: Thomas Colgan
settled at: Flushing, L.L, N.Y., St. George's Church

name: Nicholas Collin
degrees: D.D., Ord. Sweden, ca. 1770 D.D., U. of Pa., 1788
raw: NICHOLAS COLLIN, D.D., b. Sweden, 1745; Ord. Sweden, ca. 1770; D.D., U. of Pa., 1788; Rector, Swedesboro (Glouc.) N.J., Trinity Chh. on Raccoon Creek, now Ep., 1773-1783; Raccoon, N.J., 1773- 1783; Pennsneck (Salem) N.J., St. George's Chh., now Ep., 1773-1783; sett. Wicaco, Kingsessing and Upper Merion, all in Pa., 1783-1831; Sw. Luth.; d. Wicaco, Pa., Oct. 1831, a. 86.

name: Bruin Romcas Comingoe
ordained: Lunenburg, Nova Scotia, The Dutch Calvinistic Presbyterian Congregation, 3 July 1770-1819
raw: BRUIN ROMCAS COMINGOE, Ord. Lunenburg, Nova Scotia, The Dutch Calvinistic Presbyterian Congregation, 3 July 1770-1819; Germ. Ref.

name: John Conrad
raw: JOHN CONRAD, b. 6 June 1681; sett. Germantown, Pa., 1712- 1758; Menn.; d. Germantown, Pa., 1758.

name: Samuel Cooke
degrees: A.M., pensioner, 9 Nov. 1743, a. 19 A.M., U. of Pa. (hon.), 1760
son of: Thomas Cooke by Bishop of Norwich, 23 Sept. 1750
raw: Commissary SAMUEL COOKE, A.M., b. Yarmouth, Eng., 1723, son of Thomas Cooke; pensioner, 9 Nov. 1743, a. 19; A.B., Gonville & Caius, Cambridge U., 1747/8; A.M., U. of Pa. (hon.), 1760; Ord. by Bishop of Norwich, 23 Sept. 1750; lie. 3 June 1751; K.B. for N.J., 6 June 1751; Curate, Beccles, co. Suffolk, England; S.P.G. missionary at Freehold (Monmouth) N.J., St. Peter's Chh., Sept. 1751-1765; Spotswood, N.J., 1751-1765; Shrewsbury (Monmouth) N.J., Christ Chh., 1751-1775; Middletown (Monmouth) N.J., Christ Chh., 1751-7 1775, and at South River, Cranbury and Matchaponex, N.J.; ret. to Eng., 24 May 1775-1784; sett. St. John's, New Brunswick, 1785-1786; sett. Fredericktown, N.B., Aug. 1786-1795; Commissary to N.B., 1790-1791; Ep.; d. St. John's River, N.B., 23 May 1795 (drowned).

name: Samuel Cooke
settled at: Freehold (Monmouth) N.J., St. Peter's Church, Sept.

name: Samuel Cooke
settled at: South River, Cranbury and Matchaponex, N.J.

name: Thomas Coombe
chaplain: to Lord Carlisle in Ireland| to the King, 1794
settled at: Philadelphia, Pa., United chhs. (Christ Church and St. Peter's Church)
degrees: D.D., U. of Pa., 1766 D.D., Trinity Coll., Dublin
son of: Thomas and Sarah (Rutter) Coombe by the Bishop of London, 1771
raw: THOMAS COOMBE, D.D., b. Philadelphia, Pa., 12 Oct. 1747, son of Thomas and Sarah (Rutter) Coombe; U. of Pa., 1766; D.D., Trinity Coll., Dublin; Ord. London by the Bishop of London, 1771; K.B. for Pa., 29 Oct. 1771; sett. Philadelphia, Pa., United chhs. (Christ Chh. and St. Peter's Chh.), 30 Nov. 1772-7 July 1778; Chaplain to Lord Carlisle in Ireland; Rector, Donagh Henry, Ireland, 1781-1783; Chaplain to the King, 1794; Prebendary, Canterbury, 1800; Rector, London, England, St. Michael's Queenhithe, and Trinity the Less, 1808-1822; member Am. Phil. Soc, 1773; Ep.; d. London, England, 15 Aug. 1822.

name: Thomas Coombe
edited_raw: Rector, London, England, St. Michael's Queenhithe, and Trinity the Less

name: John Cooper
raw: JOHN COOPER, sett. Trenton, N.J., Green Street Chh., 1776- 1776; Meth.

name: Mylesoper
son of: William Cooper of Millum, Cumberland, England
raw: MYLES COOPER, D.C.L., LL.D., b. 1737, son of William Cooper of Millum, Cumberland, England; matric. Queen's Coll., Oxford, 27 Feb. 1753, a. 16, A.B., 1756, A.M., 1760; D.C.L., Oxford U., 25 Feb. 1767; LL.D., Columbia, 1768; K.B. to N.Y., 11 Aug. 1762; came to America, 1762; Prof, of Moral Philosophy, Columbia, 1762-17-63; President, Columbia, 1763-1775; returned to England, 1775; sett. Edinburgh, Scotland; Ep.; d. Edinburgh, Scotland, 1785.

name: Robert Cooper
degrees: D.D., A.B., Princeton, 1763 D.D., Dickinson Coll., 1792
raw: ROBERT COOPER, D.D., b. Northern Ireland, ca. 1732; A.B., Princeton, 1763; D.D., Dickinson Coll., 1792; Ord. Middle Spring, Pa., 21 Nov. 1765; sett. Southampton (Cumb.) Pa., Middle Spring Chh., 1765-12 Apr. 1797; sett. West Nottingham (Chester) Pa., 1765-1797; sett. Lower West Nottingham (Cecil) Md., Lower Octoraro Chh., 1765-1797; Captain, Pennsylvania Volunteers, 1776; Trustee, Dickinson Coll., 1783-1805; Presb.; d. Middle Spring (near Shippensburg) Pa., 5 Apr. 1805, a. 72.

name: Robert Cooper
settled at: Lower West Nottingham (Cecil) Md., Lower Octoraro Church

name: John Corbley
raw: JOHN CORBLEY, b. Great Britain or Ireland, 1733; sett, western Pa., 1768; sett. Uniontown (Fayette) Pa., 1770-1803; sett. Goshen, Redstone Settlement, Pa., 1775-1803; Bapt.; d. Uniontown, Pa., 9 June 1803, a. 70.

name: Cornelison
settled at: English Neighborhood (Bergen) N.J., , near Ridgefield, N.J.
raw: Domine CORNELISON, sett. English Neighborhood (Bergen) N.J., 1770-1776, near Ridgefield, N.J.; Dutch Ref.

name: Jean Courdil
raw: JEAN COURDIL, b. Nimes, France; Ord. London, 1683; officiated at the home of the Sieur La Cassagne near Nimes; sett. St. Paul's Cathedral, London, England, 1683-1686; sett. N.Y., N.Y., 1686-1689; returned to England, 1689; taken a prisoner to Nantes; sent to Copenhagen; Fr. Huguenot.

name: Davidwell
raw: DAVID COWELL, A.M., b. Wrentham, Mass., 12 Dec. 1704, son of Joseph and Martha (Fales) Cowell; A.B., H.C., 1732, A.M.; Trustee, Princeton, 1748-1760; acting President, Princeton, 1757-1758; Ord. Trenton, N.J., 3 Nov. 1736; sett. Trenton, ist Chh., 1735-11 Mar. 1760; Hopewell, N.J. (Ewing Chh., 1736-1760; Pennington Chh., 1736- 1739); New Side Presb.; unm.; d. Trenton; N.J., i Dec. 1760, a. 56 (GS).

name: Nicholas Cox
raw: NICHOLAS COX, b. New Castle co., Del., 24 Mar. 1742; lie. Philadelphia, 1771; Ord. Wantage (Sussex) N.J., 15 Apr. 1772-1783; sett. Kingwood (at Baptistown) N.J., 4 Nov. 1784-1792; Bapt.

name: Cornelius Cozine
raw: CORNELIUS COZINE, b. Long Island, N.Y., 4 Nov. 1718; sett. New Jersey, ca. 1751; was living in Somerset co., N.J., 1762; sett. Conewago (Adams) Pa., 1772-1788; Dutch Ref.

name: George Craig
arrived: Pa., 12 Sept. 1750, as an itinerant missionary of the S.P.G. in Pa. and N.J.
degrees: A.B., prob. A.B., U. of Aberdeen 28 May 1750
raw: GEORGE CRAIG, A.B., b. Scotland; prob. A.B., U. of Aberdeen 28 May 1750; curate to Dr. Bristowe in England; lie. for N.J., i Sept. 1750; K.B. for Pa., 12 Sept. 1750, as an itinerant missionary of the S.P.G. in Pa. and N.J.; landed at Philadelphia, 17 May 1751; missionary at Alexandria (Hunterdon) N.J., St. Andrew's Chh., 1751-1753; Amwell (Hunterdon) N.J., St. Thomas's Chh., at Lambertville, 1751-1753; Lancaster, Pa. (where he resided), St. James's Chh., 1751-1758; Chu'rchtown, 1751-1759; Salisbury, St. John's at Compassville, 1751-1759; Caernarvon, Bangor Chh., 1751-1759; and Carlisle (Cumb.) Pa., St. John's Chh., 1751-1757; Huntington (Adams) Pa., at York Springs, 1751-1757; and he was settled in the following towns in Delaware co.. Pa., Chester, St. Paul's Chh., 1759-1781; Chichester, St. Martin's Chh., 1759-1783; Concord, St. John's Chh., 1759-1771; and Marcus Hook, St. Martin's Chh., 1759-1783; Ep.; d. Marcus Hook, Pa., after 1783.

name: Alexander Craighead
author: a pamphlet on political independence, 1743
ordained: Bart (Lane.) Pa., Middle Octoraro Chh., 18 Nov. 1735- 1741
raw: ALEXANDER CRAIGHEAD (See Colonial Clergy of Virginia, p. 12), b. ca. 1706, son of the Rev. Thomas Craighead, q.v.; lie. 8 Oct. 1734; Ord. Bart (Lane.) Pa., Middle Octoraro Chh., 18 Nov. 1735- 1741; North Middleton (Cumb.) Pa., Meeting House Springs Chh., 1734-1735; was a Cameronian, 1745-1753; sett, in Va. and N.C., 1749- 1766, being the only minister in 1766 betw. the Yadkin and Catawba rivers, and was the third minister to sett, in N.C; author of a pamphlet on political independence, 1743; Presb.; d. Rocky Creek, N.C, Mar. 1766.

name: John Craighead
degrees: A.B., inst. Letterkenney (Franklin) Pa., Rocky Spring Chh., 13 Apr. 1768-9 Apr. 1799
raw: JOHN CRAIGHEAD, A.B., b. 1742, A.B., Princeton, 1763; inst. Letterkenney (Franklin) Pa., Rocky Spring Chh., 13 Apr. 1768-9 Apr. 1799; Chaplain and Captain, Pennsylvania Volunteers, 1776 fï.; Presb., d. Letterkenney, Pa., 20 Apr. 1799.

name: Thomas Craighead
edited_raw: Donegal and Ballyshannon, co. Donegal, Ireland
degrees: A.M., studied medicine A.M., Edinburgh U., 28 July 1691
raw: THOMAS CRAIGHEAD, A.M., b. Donoughmore, co. Donegal, Ireland, son of Rev. Robert and Agnes (Hart) Craighead; studied medicine; A.M., Edinburgh U., 28 July 1691; Ord. Donegal, Ireland, 1698; minister of the Presb. chhs. of Donegal and Ballyshannon, co. Donegal, Ireland, 1698-1714; arriv. at Boston, Oct. 1714, in the ship "Thomas and Jane"; sett. Freetown, Mass., Jan. 1715-1723; sett. Brandywine, Del., 1724-1730; sett. Mill Creek (New Castle) Del., White Clay Creek, Del., inst. 22 Sept. 1724-1731; sett. Salisbury (Lane.) Pa., Pequea Chh., inst. Oct. 1733-7 Sept. 1736; sett. Newville (Cumb.) Pa., Hopewell Chh. at Big Spring, 1737-inst. Oct. 1738-1739; Southampton (Cumb.) Pa., Middle Spring Chh., 17 Nov. 1737-1739; Letterkenney (Franklin) Pa., Rocky Spring Chh., 1738-1739; physician; Moderator, Presb. synod, 1726; Presb.; d. Newville, Pa., April 1739.

name: Thomas Craighead
settled at: Mill Creek (New Castle) Del., White Clay Creek, Del., inst.

name: Thomas Craighead
settled at: Salisbury (Lane.) Pa., Pequea Church, inst. Oct.

name: John Cross
raw: JOHN CROSS, b. Scotland; Ord. 1732; sett. Basking Ridge, Bernard, N.J., 1732-1742; sett. Staten Island, N.Y., 1732-1742; suspended 23 June 1742; in Oct. 1746, he asked to be restored; Presb.; d. bef. 1750.

name: Robert Cross Gs
raw: ROBERT CROSS, b. near Ballykelly, Ireland, 1689; ed. in Ireland; came to America, 1717; Ord. New Castle, Del., 19 Sept. 1719; sett. New Castle, 1st Chh., 1718-May 1722; Jamaica, L.I., N.Y., ist Chh., 10 Oct. 1723-May 1737; Philadelphia, Pa., ist Presb. Chh., inst. 10 Nov. 1737- 22 June 1758; leader of the Old Side Presb.; d. Philadelphia, Pa., 9 Aug. 1766, s.p. (GS).

name: Henry Crossley
raw: HENRY CROSSLEY, Ord. Schooley's Mountain (Morris) N.J., 1753-1755; Woolverton; Knowlton (Warren) N.J., 1763-1766; Mt. Bethel (Warren) N.J., 1769-1770; Manahawkin (Monmouth) N.J., i774-i775;Bapt.

name: Alexander Cumming
ordained: New York, N.Y., ist Presb. Chh., Oct. 1750
son of: Elder Robert Cumming by his uncle. Rev. Dr. Samuel Blair
raw: ALEXANDER CUMMING, A.M., b. Freehold, N.J., 1726, son of Elder Robert Cumming; ed. by his uncle. Rev. Dr. Samuel Blair; A.M. (hon.) Princeton, 1760; A.M. (hon.) H.C, 1761; Ord. New York, N.Y., ist Presb. Chh., Oct. 1750; sett. N.Y., N.Y., 1750-25 Oct. 1753; New Brunswick (Middlesex) N.J., 1753-1761; inst. Boston, Mass., Old South Chh., 25 Feb. 1761-1763; ist Presb. minister to preach within the bounds of Tennessee; d. Boston, Mass., 25 Aug. 1763, a. 37.

name: Archibald Cummings
raw: ARCHIBALD CUMMINGS, K.B. for Pa., 24 Jan. 1725/6; Rector Philadelphia, Pa., Christ Chh., 9 Sept. 1726-Apr. 1741; Ep.; d. Philadelphia, Pa., 19 Apr. 1741.

name: William Currie
settled at: as S.P.G. missionary, Newtown (Del.) Pa., St. David's Church at Radnor
raw: WILLIAM CURRIE, b. Scotland, 1710; ed. U. of Glasgow; a dissenting minister in Pa.; K.B. to Pa., 7 Oct. 1736; sett, as S.P.G. missionary, Newtown (Del.) Pa., St. David's Chh. at Radnor, 1736-1783; Caernarvon (Lane.) Pa., Bangor Chh., 23 May 1739-1743; Lower Providence (Montg.) Pa., St. James's Chh. at Evansburg, 1736-1776; resigned 13 May 1776; Whitemarsh (Montg.) Pa., St. Thomas's Chh., 1742-1743; Tredyffryn (Chester) Pa., St. Peter's Chh., Great Valley, 1751-1776; res. 1776; Ep.;d. Radnor (near Valley Forge) Pa., 1803, a. 93.

name: Antonius Curtenius
settled at: Hackensack (Bergen) N.J., Church at New Barbadoes
raw: ANTONIUS CURTENIUS, b. Drenthe, Netherlands, 1698; matric. Groningen, 4 Oct. 1724; matric. Leyden, 23 Aug. 1725, a. 26; Ord. Amsterdam, Holland, 3 Oct. 1729; arriv. N.Y., N.Y., 24 Oct. 1730; sett. Hackensack (Bergen) N.J., Chh. at New Barbadoes, 1730-1755; sett. Schraalenburg (Bergen) N.J., 1737-1755; supply at Paramus (Bergen) N.J., 1737-1748; sett. Brooklyn, Bushwick, Flatbush, Flatlands, Gravesend and New Utrecht, all on L.I., N.Y., I7i:i;-i7ç6; Dutch Ref.; d. L.I., N.Y., 1756.

name: Antonius Curtenius
settled at: Brooklyn, Bushwick, Flatbush, Flatlands, Gravesend and New Utrecht, all on L.I., N.Y., I

name: Thomas Curtis
raw: THOMAS CURTIS, b. 1685; Elder at Baptisttown, 1738-1745; Ord. Kingswood, Baptisttown Chh., 28 Oct. 1745-1749; Bapt.; d. Kingswood, N.J., 28 Apr. 1749, a. 64.

name: John Cuthbertson
raw: JOHN CUTHBERTSON, b. Scotland, 1719; Ord. Scotland; missionary in Ireland; arriv. New Castle, Delaware, 5 Aug. 1751; sett. Muddy Run (York) Pa., 1751-1791; Cumberland (Adams) Pa., Rock Creek Chh., 1751-1773; Pequea (Lane.) Pa., 1752-1791; Bart (Lane.) Pa., Octoraro Chh., 1752-1791; Martic (Lane.) Pa., Muddy Run Chh., 1752-1791; Lower Chancefield (York) Pa., 26 Mar. 1771-1791; only Assoc. Ref. Presb. minister in America, 1752-1773; Assoc. Ref. Presb.; d. Bart, Pa., 10 Mar. 1791, a. 72 (GS).

name: Leonard Cutting
degrees: D.D., A.B., Pembroke Coll., Cambridge, 1747/8  A.M., Columbia, 1758
raw: LEONARD CUTTING, D.D., b. Great Yarmouth, Norfolk co., England, 1724, son of Leonard Cutting; A.B., Pembroke Coll., Cambridge, 1747/8 ; A.M., Columbia, 1758; D.D. ;Tutor, Columbia Coll., N.Y., i756-i763;Qrd. London, 1763; lie for N.J., 21 Dec. 1763; K.B. for N.J., 9 Feb. 1764; sett. New Brunswick (Middlesex) N.J., Christ Chh., 1764- 1766; sett. Piscataway (Middlesex) N.J., St. James's Chh., 1764-1766; Rector, Hempstead, L.L, N.Y., St. George's Chh., 1766-1782; Rector, Snow Hill, Md., 1784-1785; Rector, Newbern, N.C., Christ Chh., 1785- 1793; d. New York, N.Y., 25 Jan. 1794, a. 70.

name: Claude Dablon
raw: CLAUDE DABLQN, S.J., b. Dieppe, France, Feb. 1618; entered the Jesuit Order, 1639; came to Canada, 1655; missionary to the Qnondagas, Syracuse, N.Y., St. Mary's Chapel, 1655-1657; at Hudson Bay, Canada, 1661; went to Lake Superior with Pere Marquette; founded Sault Ste Marie mission; Superior General of all Canadian missions, 1670-1680, 1686-1693; R.C.; d. Quebec, P.Q., 3 May 1697.

name: Claude Dablon
edited_raw: missionary to the Qnondagas, Syracuse, N.Y. Mary's Chapel

name: Claude Dablon
edited_raw: Superior General of all Canadian missions,

name: Naphtali Daggett
ordained: Smithtown, L.L, N.Y., Chh. at Nissequoque (Presb.), 18 Sept. 1751
raw: NAPHTALI DAGGETT, D.D., b. Attleborough, Mass., 8 Sept. 1727, son of Ebenezer and Mary (Blackinton) Daggett; A.B., Y.C., 1748, A.M.; A.M., (hon.) H.C., 1771; S.T.D., Princeton, 1774; Ord. Smithtown, L.L, N.Y., Chh. at Nissequoque (Presb.), 18 Sept. 1751; sett. Smithtown, 1749-6 Nov. 1755; inst. Prof, of Divinity, Y.C., 4 Mar. 1756-1780; Près., pro temp., Y.C., Qct. 1766-Mar. 1777; Cong.-Presb.; d. New Haven, Conn., 25 Nov. 1780, a. 54.

name: Pierre Daill
raw: PIERRE DAILLÉ, b. ca. 1648; Prof, at Saumur, France; exiled; came to New York, ca. 1683 (said to have been sent out to America by the Bishop of London); sett. N.Y., N.Y., First Fr. Ref. Chh., 1683- 1696; New Paltz (Ulster) N.Y., 1683-1696; Hackensack (Bergen) N.J., 1683-1696; Staten Island, N.Y., South Side and Fresh Kills Fr. Ref. Chhs., 1683-1688; N.Y., N.Y., Fr. Ref. Chh. of the Saint Esprit, 1683- 1686; sett. Boston, Mass., Fr. Huguenot Chh., 1696-1715; French Ref.- Huguenot; d. Boston, Mass., 20 May 1715, a. ca. 66.

name: Simon Dakin
raw: SIMQN DAKIN, b. Concord, Mass., 27 Jan. 1720/1, son of Simon and Huldah Dakin; Qrd. Northeasttown (Dutchess) N.Y., 1753-1803; Franklin, N.Y., 1751-1773; Bapt.; d. Fishkill, N.Y., 19 Sept. 1803, a. 82.

name: Frederick Dalliker
raw: FREDERICK DALLIKER, b. Zurich, Switzerland, 27 Feb. 1738, son of an artist (possibly of Huguenot descent: De la Cour); Qrd. Zurich, 1757; Chaplain of a French regt., 1760-1766; arriv. Philadelphia, Qct. 1767; sett. Lebanon (Hunterdon) N.J., Rockaway Chh., 6 Nov. 1768-1782; sett. Amwell (Hunt.) N.J., 1768-1770; sett. Alexandria, (Hunt.) N.J., 1768-1782; Tewksbury (Hunt.) N.J., Fox Hill Chh. at Fairmount, 1769-1782; sett. German Valley (Morris) N.J., at Washington, 1768-1781, 1782-1784; sett. Stillwater (Sussex) N.J., 12 Qct. 1769-1782;'and after the Rev. War: Lower Milford (Lehigh) Pa., Great Swamp Chh., 1781-1784; New Hanover (Montg.) Pa., Falkner's Swamp Chh., 1783-1799; Upper Hanover (Montg.) Pa., New Goshenhoppen Chh., 1782-1784; Vincent (Chester) Pa., 1783-1799; Germ. Ref.; d. Falkner's Swamp, Pa., 15 Jan. 1799, a. 60.

name: John Darbee
raw: JOHN DARBEE, M.D., perhaps b. Canterbury, Conn., 1723, son of William and Elizabeth (Spalding) Darbee; A.B., Y.C, 1748, A.M., 1753; M.D., Dartmouth Coll., 1782; lie. 18 Apr. 1749; stated supply. Lower Aquebogue and Mattituck (both in Southold) L.L, N.Y., 1749- 1751; Ord. Oyster Ponds, L.L, N.Y., 10 Nov. 1757; sett. Connecticut Farms (Union) N.J., 1758-1760; sett. Hanover (Morris) N.J., Parsippany Chh., 1760-1767, 1770-1773; physician; Cong.-Presb.; d. Parsippany, N.J., Dec. 1805, a. 80.

name: John Darbee
edited_raw: Lower Aquebogue and Mattituck (both in Southold) L.L, N.Y.

name: James Davenport
ordained: Southold, L.L, N.Y., ist Chh. at Cutchogue, 26 Oct. 1738-1743
degrees: A.M., A.B., Y.C, 1732, A.M. A.M., Princeton, 1749
son of: the Rev. John and Elizabeth (Morris) (Maltby) Davenport
raw: JAMES DAVENPORT, A.M., b. Stamford, Conn., 1716, son of the Rev. John and Elizabeth (Morris) (Maltby) Davenport; A.B., Y.C, 1732, A.M.; A.M., Princeton, 1749; lie. 8 Oct. 1735; Ord. Southold, L.L, N.Y., ist Chh. at Cutchogue, 26 Oct. 1738-1743; founded the Separatist Chh. in New London, Conn., 6 Mar. 1743-1744; member of the New Brunswick Presbytery, 22 Sept. 1746; sett. Amwell, N. J., 1746-1747; sett. Lawrenceville, N.J. (Chh. at Maidenhead), inst. 22 Oct. 1754, and Pennington, N.J. (Chh. at Hopewell), 1737-1738, 1746-1747, 1753-1757; Connecticut Farms, N.J., 1748-1754; Red Mills, Carmel, with Patterson and Philippi, N.Y., 1750-1754; Phillipsburg (Warren) N.J., 1752-1754; Presb.; d. Pennington, N.J., 10 Nov. 1757, a. 40 (GS).

name: James Davenport
edited_raw: Red Mills, Carmel, with Patterson and Philippi, N.Y.

name: John Davenport
ordained: Southold, L.L, N.Y., at Mattituck Chh., 4 June 1775-1777
degrees: A.M., A.B., Princeton, 1769, A.M. A.M., Y.C, 1785 A.M., Brown, 1805
son of: the Rev. James and Parnell Davenport
raw: JOHN DAVENPORT, A.M., b. Philippi, N.Y., 11 Aug. 1752, son of the Rev. James and Parnell Davenport; A.B., Princeton, 1769, A.M.; A.M., Y.C, 1785; A.M., Brown, 1805; Ord. Southold, L.L, N.Y., at Mattituck Chh., 4 June 1775-1777; Lower Aquebogue, L.L, N.Y., 1775- 1777; inst. Deerfield, Mass., 12 Aug. 1795-1805; returned to N.Y., 1809; sett. Bedford, N.Y., Deerfield, N.J., and Lysander, N.Y.; Presb.; d. Lysander, N.Y., 13 July 1821.

name: Christian David
raw: CHRISTIAN DAVID, b. in Moravia, converted from the R.C church; sett. Berthelsdorf, Saxony, 1722; sett. Herrnhut; started from Greenland, 19 Jan. 1733; arriv. N.Y., N.Y., 12 May 1749; came to Bethlehem, Pa., 1749, to get timber for the Greenland mission; carpenter; Moravian. •

name: Enoch David
settled at: Newtown (Del.) Pa., Lower Dublin, Pa., Warwick (Chester), French Creek Church at East Nantmeal, Pa., and Nottingham, Md.
raw: ENOCH DAVID, b. Duck Creek, Delaware, 22 Feb. 1718; called to the ministry at Welsh Tract, Del., 1751; became a Sabbatarian, 1752; Ord. 16 Oct. 1769; sett. Newtown (Del.) Pa., Lower Dublin, Pa., Warwick (Chester), French Creek Chh. at East Nantmeal, Pa., and Nottingham, Md., 1769-1772; he was the only 7th Day Bapt. in Pa., in 1770.

name: Robert Davidson
raw: ROBERT DAVIDSON, D.D., b. Elkton, Md., 1750; A.B., U. of Pa., 1771, A.M., 1780; D.D., 1784; Ord. Philadelphia, Pa., 1772; sett. Philadelphia, Pa., ist Presb. Chh., 1773-1784; Carlisle (Cumb.) Pa., 1784- 1812; Prof, of History, U. of Pa., 1773-1784; Prof, of Greek and Latin Languages, U. of Pa., 1780-1782; Vice-Pres. and Prof, of Belles Lettres and History, Dickinson Coll., i Nov. 1784-1804; Prof, of Moral Philosophy, Dickinson Coll., 1804-1809; Près., pro temp., Dickinson Coll., 1785-1786, 1804-1809; member Ahi. Phil Soc, 1783; Old Light Presb.; d. Carlisle, Pa., 13 Dec. 1812, a. 61.

name: Robert Davidson
edited_raw: Prof, of History, U. of Pa.

name: Robert Davidson

name: Samuel Davies
degrees: ;A.M. (See Colonial Clergy of Virginia, p. 13), A.M. (hon.) Princeton, 1753;
raw: President SAMUEL DAVIES, A.M. (See Colonial Clergy of Virginia, p. 13), b. near Summit Ridge (New Castle) Del., 3 Nov. 1723, son of David Davies; ed. Mr. Blair's Log Coll., at Fagg's Manor; A.M. (hon.) Princeton, 1753; Ord. Hanover, Va., 19 Feb. 1746/7-1759; visited England and Scotland to solicit funds for Princeton U., I7S3-I7SS; »"iv. N.Y., N.Y., 13 Feb. 1755; sett. Princeton, N.J., ist Chh., 1759-1761; Près., Princeton U., 26 Sept. 1759-1761; Presb.; d. Princeton, N.J., 4 Feb. 1761, a. 36 (GS).

name: Hugh Davis
raw: HUGH DAVIS, b. Cardiganshire, Wales, 1665 ; Ord. Rydwilim, Wales; arriv. Pa., 26 Apr. 1711; sett. Tredyffryn (Chester) Pa., Great Valley Chh., 1711-1753; Bapt.; d. Great Valley, Pa., 13 Oct. 1753.

name: John Davis
ordained: Tredyfiryn (Chester) Pa., Great Valley Chh., 16 Nov. 1732-1777
raw: JOHN DAVIS, b. Llanfernach (Pembroke) Wales, i Nov. 1702; arriv. in America, 27 July 1713; called to the ministry, 1722; Ord. Tredyfiryn (Chester) Pa., Great Valley Chh., 16 Nov. 1732-1777; Bapt.; d. Yellow Springs, Pa., 15 Feb. 1777, a. 70.

name: Jonathan Davis
raw: JONATHAN DAVIS, b. Swansea, Mass., 15 May 1675; preached at Trenton, N.J., 1737-175°; Bapt.; d. Trenton, N.J., 1750, a. 75, s.p.

name: Jonathan Davis
raw: JONATHAN DAVIS, b. 1710, son of Elnathan Davis; sett. Cohansey (Cumb.) N.J., Chh. at Shiloh, 27 Mar. 1737-1769; 7th Day Bapt.; d. Shiloh, Cohansey, N.J., 2 Feb. 1769, a. 59.

name: Jonathan Davis
ordained: Cohansey, N.J., Chh. at Shiloh (Cumb.) N.J., 12 Nov. 1768-1785
raw: JONATHAN DAVIS, b. Newark, Del., 7 July 1734, son of Rev. David and Rachel (Thomas) Davis; Ord. Cohansey, N.J., Chh. at Shiloh (Cumb.) N.J., 12 Nov. 1768-1785; 7th Day Bapt.; d. Shiloh, N.J., 23 July 1785.

name: Philip Davis
settled at: Warwick (Chester) Pa., French Creek Church at Nantmeal, about  ff.
raw: PHILIP DAVIS, sett. Warwick (Chester) Pa., French Creek Chh. at Nantmeal, about 1726 ff.; 7th Day Bapt. East Nantmeal, dates not known, but after 1726 and bef. 1769; 7th Day Bapt.

name: Thomas Davis
raw: THOMAS DAVIS, b. Llanfernach (Pembroke) Wales, 1707 (brother of the Rev. John Davis, q.v.); arriv. in America, 27 July 1713; Ord. and sett. Great Valley, Pa.; sett. Hopewell (Mercer) N.J., 1741-1745; Oyster Bay, L.L, N.Y., 1745-1748; Southampton (Bucks) Pa., 1761- 1763; Bapt.; d. Yellow Springs, Pa., 15 Feb. 1777, a. 70.

name: William Davis
raw: WILLIAM DAVIS, b. Wales, 1664; ed. Oxford U.; became a Quaker; arriv. Philadelphia, 1684; became a Keithian Bapt., 1691; excommunicated for heresy by the Pennypack Bapt. Chh., 17 Feb. 1698/9; sett. Lower Dublin, Pa., 1699-1702, 1727-1734; Oxford (Chester) Pa., 1702- 1710; Westerly, R.I., 1711-1727, 1734-1744; Squjan (Monmouth) N.J., 1745-1745; Keithian-Bapt.; 7th Day Bapt.; d. Squan, N.J., 1745, a. 81.

name: William Davis
son of: the Rev. WilHam Davis of Squan
raw: WILLIAM DAVIS, b. 1692, son of the Rev. WilHam Davis of Squan; sett. Squan (Montmouth) N.J., 1752, a. 60.

name: William Davis
raw: WILLIAM DAVIS, b. Castellneth, Glamorganshire, Wales, 1695; came to America, 1722; returned to Great Britain; sett. Vincent, Pa., 1737; New Britain (Bucks) Pa., 1749-1768; Rockhill (Bucks) Pa., 1749- 1768; Kenton, Del., Old Dutch Creek Chh. or Bryn Zion Chh., 1766- 1768; Bapt.; d. Dutch Creek, Del., 3 Oct. 1768.

name: William Dean
ordained: Brandywine Manor (Chester) Pa., Forks of the Brandywine Chh., May 1745
raw: WILLIAM DEAN, b. 1719; came from the North of Ireland, 1739/ 1740; ed. at the Log College; lie. by New Brunswick Presbytery, 13 Oct. 1742; Ord. Brandywine Manor (Chester) Pa., Forks of the Brandywine Chh., May 1745; sett. Brandywine Manor, Pa., 1743-1748; Warwick (Bucks) Neshaminy Chh., 1742-1743; Salisbury (Lane.) Pa., Pequea Chh., 1743-1744; Forks of the Delaware, Lehigh Valley, Pa., 1742-1743, Oct. 1744-1745; Cold Spring (Cape May) N.J., 1744-1745; Cohansey (Cumb.) N.J., 1744-1745; Greenwich (Cumb.) N.J., 1744-1745; Timber Ridge and Forks of the James (Rockbridge) Va., 1747^1748; Presb.; d. Brandywine Manor, Pa., 9 July 1748, a. 29 (GS).

name: George Benneville
raw: Dr. GEORGE de BENNEVILLE, b. London, England, 26 July 1703; came to America, 1745; taught school; practiced medicine and preached at Oley; preached to the "New Mooners," 4 Jan. 1748; became a Moravian; sett. Oley (Berks) Pa., 1748-1755; removed to Philadelphia, I75S) where he practiced medicine until his death; Huguenot; "New Mooner"; Morav.; d. Philadelphia, Pa., 1793, a. 93.

name: Carl De Bevois
raw: CARL DE BEVOIS, pre-lector, Brooklyn, N.Y., 1664-1664; carried on the services; Dutch Ref.

name: David De Bonrepos
degrees: D.D., minister of the Huguenot Chh. on the Island of Saint Christopher, West Indies, 1671-1686
raw: DAVID DE BONREPOS, D.D., minister of the Huguenot Chh. on the Island of Saint Christopher, West Indies, 1671-1686; sett. Boston, Mass., Huguenot Chh., 1687-1689; New Rochelle, N.Y., French Protestant Chh., 1689-1696; New Paltz (Ulster) N.Y., 1696-1700; Staten Island N.Y., French Ref. Chhs. at Fresh Kills, 1696-1714, and South Side, 1697-1714; French Ref.; d. Staten Island, N.Y., 1734.

name: John Debow

Upper Mount Bethel (Northampton) Pa., Forks North Chh., 19 May I775-I775; sett. Hawfields, Eno, and Little River, N.C, 1775-1783; Presb.; d.Hawfields (Alamance) N.C, Sept. 1783.

name: Stephen De Carheil
raw: STEPHEN DE CARHEIL, Recollect Father; sett. Auburn, N.Y., Cayuga mission, N.Y., 1668-1684; Michilimackinac mission, 1689- 1703; R.C. ^

name: John Henry Decker
settled at: Windsor (Berks) Pa., Lebanon Church at the Blue Mountains, now St. Paul's Church
raw: JOHN HENRY DECKER, b. Markoebel, Nassau, 17 Aug. 1730; matric. in Latin at Hanau, Germany, 27 Mar. 1750; took the oath of allegiance at Philadelphia, Pa., 21 Sept. 1751; sett. Windsor (Berks) Pa., Lebanon Chh. at the Blue Mountains, now St. Paul's Chh., 1752- 1755; Brecknock (Lane.) Pa., Muddy Creek Chh., 10 Dec. 1754-4 Oct1761; Ephrata (Lane.) Pa., Bethany Chh., Cocalico,i762-1763; Heidelberg (Berks) Pa., Hain's or Cacusi Chh., 1752-1756; Germ. Ref.; d. prob, at Reading, Pa., ca. 1763.

name: Godfriedus Dellius
raw: GODFRIEDUS DELLIUS, b. 1652; matric. Leyden, i Oct. 1672, in philosophy; Ord. Amsterdam, Holland, 20 July 1682; sett. Albany, N.Y., Dutch Ref. Chh. 1683-1699; Schenectady, N.Y., Dutch Ref. Chh., 1690-1699; missionary to the Mohawk Indians, 1683-1699; returned to Holland; sett. Antwerp, Belgium, 1700-1714, et seq.; Dutch Ref.

raw: PETER DE MAREUIL, sett. Syracuse, N.Y., Onondaga mission, 1702-1710; R.C

raw: CHRISTOPHER DEMUTH, came from Kathelsdorf, Moravia; sett. Bethlehem (Northampton) Pa., Feb. 1748; minister of rural churches, 1748-1754; paper box maker; Morav.; d. Nazareth, Pa., Mar. 1754.

raw: BERNARD DIDERICK, b. Belgium; sett. Conewago (Adams) Fa., Sacred Heart Chh., 1758-1758; Deer Creek (Harford) Md., St. Joseph's Chapel, 1775-1776; Baltimore (Bah.) Md., St. Peter's Chh., 1775 - 1782; R.C; d. Sept. 1793.

name: John Jacob Llenbergkr
settled at: Whitehall (Lehigh) Pa., Egypt Church,  and perhaps ionger
raw: JOHN JACOB DÍLLENBERGKR, b. Switzerland; sett. Whitehall (Lehigh) Pa., Egypt Chh., 1754-1755 and perhaps ionger; Germ. Ref.

name: Alexander Dobbin
raw: ALEXANDER DOBBIN, b. Londonderry, Ireland, 4 Feb. 1742; Glasgow U- (A,B,, A.M..''); Ord. Scotland, 1774; arriv. New Castle, Del,, 1774; sett. Cumberland (Adams) Fa., Roek Creek Chh. at Gettysburg, 1774-1808; Assoc. Ref. Fresb.; d. Gettysburg, Pa., i June iHo'), a. 76.

name: John Dodge
raw: JOHN DODGE, inst. N.Y., N.Y., 2iid or Bethel Bapt. Chh., 14 Jan. iyyi-iyj6; Bapt.

name: George Doll
raw: GEORGE J. L. DOLL, b. Frankfort, Germany, 1739; came to America, ca. 1770; sett. Albany, N.Y. (Germ. Ref. Chh.), 1772-1775; Kingston (Ulster) N.Y., at Esopus, (Dutch Ref. Chh.), 1775-May 1808; Kaatsbaan (Ulster) N.Y., Dutch Ref. Chhs. at Camp, West Camp, Kaatsbaan and Saugeriies, 1775-1780; preached in German, French and Dutch; Germ. Ref.; d. Kinderhook, N.Y., 2X Mar. iSii, a. 72.

name: George Doll
settled at: Camp, West Camp, Kaatsbaan and Saugeriies

name: Peter Henry Dorsius
raw: PETER HENRY DORSIUS, bap^t. Moers, Germany, 2 Jan. 17U, son of John Henry and Feterneiia (Gravers) Dorsius; matric. in îheol., Groningen, Holland, 5 Apr. 1734; matric. in theoL, Leyden, Holland, ij Sept. 1736; Ord. Groningen, Hotland, 29 May 1737; arriv. Fhiladelphia, 26 Sept. 1737; Northampton (Bucks) Fa., Neshaminy G.R. Chh., 1737-174S; NurLhampton (Bucks) Pa., D.R. Chh., 1737-1748; Southampton (Bueks) Fa., North and Southampton G.R. Chh., 1738- 1748; Southampton (Bucks) Fa., Neshaminy D.R. Chh. at Churchville, 1737 1748; Lower Milford (Lehigh) Fa., Great Swamp Chh., 1741-1744; Upper Hanover (Montgomery) Fa., New Gosheahoppen G.R. Chh., 1741-1744; Upper Salford (Montg.) Fa., Old Gosheuhoppen G.R. Chh., 1741-1744; visited Holland, May 1743-Jan. 1743/4; returned ÎO Holland, 1748; Germ. Ref.; d. Holland, ca. 1757.

name: John Doty
chaplain: His Maj. Royal regt., of N.Y., 1777-1781
raw: JOiiN DOTY, A.M., b. New York City, ca. 1750, son of Joseph Doty; A.B., Columbia, 1770; A.M.; lie. for Ñ.Y., i Jan. 1771; K.B. for N.Y., 8 Jan. 1771; sett. Fhiüpstown (Futnam) K.Y., St. Fhilip's Chh. in the Highlands, 16 July 1771-1773; Peekskill (Westchester) N.Y., St. Feter's Chh. in the Manor of Cortlaiidt, 16 July 1771-1773; Sehe- nectady, N.Y., St. George's Chh., 1773-1777; removed to Canada; Chaplain, His Maj. Royal regt., of N.Y., 1777-1781; sett. Sorel, Canada, 1783-1803; Ep.; d. prob, in Canada, 1803.

name: Samuel Dougall
settled at: Metal (Franklin) Pa., Lower Path Valley Presb. Church at Fannettsburg
raw: SAMUEL DOUGALL, sett. Metal (Franklin) Pa., Lower Path Valley Presb. Chh. at Fannettsburg, 11 Oct. 1775-4 O'^^- 179°; Presb.

name: John Drake
raw: JOHN DRAKE, b. Piscataway, N.J., 1655, son of Capt. Francis Drake; Ord. (prob.) Piscataway Bapt. Chh. (at Stilton, Raritan), 1689; sett. Piscataway, N.J., 1689-1739; Bapt.; d. Piscataway, N.J., 7 Apr. 1740.

name: Samuel Drisius
raw: SAMUEL DRISIUS, b. Middleburg, Holland, 1600, of German parents; rnatric. Leyden, 23 Sept. 1620, a. 20; matric. in medicine, Leyden, 14 Jan. 1649 (a. 46); minister in England, 1630-1649, preaching in Dutch, English and French; sailed for America, 4 Apr. 1652; sett. N.Y., N.Y. (then New Amsterdam), ist Chh., D.R., 1652-1673; N.Y., N.Y., French Ref. Chh., 1652-1673; Staten Island, N.Y., Dutch Ref. Chh., 1652-1660; Staten Island, F.R. Chh. at Fresh Kills, 1652- 1660; Staten Island, South Side F.R. Chh., 1652-1660; in 1653, he protested against permitting religious services to the Lutherans in N.Y.; sent as a diplomatic agent to the Governor of Virginia; suggested the establishment of a Latin School in N.Y.C., 1658; took the oath of allegiance to England, 1668; Dutch Ref.; d. N.Y., N.Y., 18 Apr. 1673.

name: Abraham Bois
raw: ABRAHAM Du BOIS (also spelled Duboy), b. Epstein, Germany, 1679; became a Germ. Bapt., 1712; Ord. in Germany; came to America, 1728; sett. Perkiomen (Montgomery) Pa., 1728-1738; Lower Milford (Lehigh) Pa., Great Swamp Chh., 1738-1748; Germ. Bapt.; d. Great Swamp, Pa., 21 Mar. 1748.

name: Benjamin Bois
raw: BENJAMIN Du BOIS, b. Pittsgrove, N.J., 30 Mar. 1739, son of Lewis Du Bois; Ord. 1764; sett. Freehold (Monmouth) N.J., 1764- 1827; Holmdel (Monm.) N.J., 1764-1827; Marlborough (Mon.) N.J., Freehold and Middletown Chh., 1764-1827; elected Trustee of Queen's (now Rutgers) College, 1783; Dutch Ref.

name: Gideon Bois
settled at: Passaic, N. J., Church at Acquackanonk
raw: GIDEON Du BOIS, came to America, 1724; sett. Passaic, N. J., Chh. at Acquackanonk, 1724-1726; Dutch Ref.

name: Gualterus Bois
son of: the Rev. Peter Du Bois of Amsterdam
raw: GUALTERUS Du BOIS, b. Streefkerk, Holland, 1671, son of the Rev. Peter Du Bois of Amsterdam; Ord. Amsterdam, Holland, I June 1699; came to America, 1699; N.Y., N.Y., ist or South Dutch Chh., 1699-1751 ; North Tarrytown, Mt. Pleasant (Westchester) N.Y., Chh. in Sleepy Hollow, supply, 1699-1750; Hackensack, N.J., Chh. at New Barbadoes, supply, 1728-1730; N.Y., N.Y., Middle Dutch Chh. at Nassau Street, 1729-1751; Dutch Ref.; d. N.Y., N.Y., 9 Oct. 1751.

name: Jonathan Bois
raw: JONATHAN Du BOIS, b. Pittsgrove, N.J., 3 Dec. 1727, son of Barnet and Amy (Greenman) Du Bois; ed. at the Presb. School, New London, Pa.; an original Trustee of Queen's (now Rutgers) Coll., 1770; lie. 1750; Ord. Lancaster, Pa., 21 Sept. 1752; sett. Northampton (Bucks) Pa., Dutch Ref. Chh., 1751-1772; Northampton, Pa., Germ. Ref. Chh. at Neshaminy, 1751-1772; sett. Southampton (Bucks) Pa., Neshaminy Dutch Ref. Chh. at Churchville, 1751-1772; Southampton, Pa., North and Southampton Germ. Ref. Chh., 1751-1772; Presb.; Dutch Ref.; Germ. Ref.; d. Southampton, Pa., 16 Dec. 1772.

name: Jonathan Bois
settled at: Southampton (Bucks) Pa., Neshaminy Dutch Ref. Church at Churchville

name: Jonathan Bois
settled at: Southampton, Pa., North and Southampton Germ. Ref. Church

name: Jacob Duch
edited_raw: JACOB DUCHÉ, of Oratory, U. of Pa.
degrees: A.B., U. of Pa., 1757, A.M. D.D., Clare Hall, Cambridge, England, 1780
raw: JACOB DUCHÉ, D.D., b. Philadelphia, Pa., 31 Jan. 1737/8, son of Col. Jacob and Mary (Spencer) Duché; A.B., U. of Pa., 1757, A.M.; D.D., Clare Hall, Cambridge, England, 1780; Prof, of Oratory, U. of Pa., 1759-1782; Trustee, U. of Pa., 1761-1778; Ord. London, 1762; K.B. to Pa., 24 Sept. 1762; asst. minister, Philadelphia, Christ Chh., 1759-1775, and St. Peter's Chh., 1762-1775; sett. Philadelphia, Pa., (United Chhs.: Christ Chh. and St. Peter's Chh.), 25 Sept. 1775-9 Dec. 1777; went to England, Dec. 1777; sett, as Chaplain at St. George's Fields, Lambeth Asylum, London, England, 1777-1789; returned to Philadelphia, 1792; member. Am. Phil. Soc, 1768; Chaplain to Congress, 8 Sept. 1774-17 Oct. 1776; Ep.; d. Philadelphia, Pa., 3 Jan. 1798, a. 60.

name: Jacob Duch
settled at: as Chaplain at St. George's Fields, Lambeth Asylum, London, England

name: Jacob Duch
edited_raw: Christ Church and St. Peter's Church

name: George Duffield
settled at: Newville (Cumb.) Pa., Hopewell Church at Big Spring
ordained: Carlisle, Pa., Old Stone Chh., 25 Sept. 1761-1768
degrees: D.D., of Huguenot parentage A.B., Princeton, 1752, A.B., A.M. D.D., Y.C, 1785
raw: GEORGE DUFFIELD, D.D., b. Pequea, Pa., 7 Oct. 1732, son of George and Margaret DufReld; of Huguenot parentage; A.B., Princeton, 1752, A.B., A.M.; Tutor, 1754-1756; D.D., Y.C, 1785; lie. 1756; Ord. Carlisle, Pa., Old Stone Chh., 25 Sept. 1761-1768; sett. Newville (Cumb.) Pa., Hopewell Chh. at Big Spring, 1761-1768; Carroll (York) Pa., Monahan Chh. at Dillsburg, 1769-1771; Philadelphia, Pa., 3rd Presb. Chh. or Pine Street Chh., 1771-1790; Chaplain, Continental Army, 8 July 1776-1777; Chaplain, Continental Congress; Trustee, Princeton U., 1777-1790; New Side Presb.; d. Philadelphia, Pa., 2 Feb. 1790, a. 57.

name: Thomas Dungan
settled at: Bristol (Bucks) Pa., Bapt. Church at Coldspring
raw: THOMAS DUNGAN, b. London, England, ca. 1632, son of William and Frances (Latham) (Weston) Dungan; came to Newport, R.I., 1637; Sergeant, R.L, 1678; Deputy, R.I., 1678-1681; first Bapt. minister and founder of the first Bapt. Chh. in Pa., 1684; sett. Bristol (Bucks) Pa., Bapt. Chh. at Coldspring, 1684-1688; Bapt.; d. Bristol, Pa., 1688.

name: Edmund Dunham
raw: EDMUND DUNHAM, b. England, 1662; came to Piscataway (Middlesex) N.J., i68i; Ord. Westerly, R.L, 11 Oct. 1705; sett. Piscataway, N.J., 1705-1734; 7th Day Bapt.; d. Piscataway, N.J., 7 Mar. 1734, a. 72.

name: Jonathan Dunham Ii
son of: the Rev. Edmund and Elizabeth (Bonham) Dunham
raw: JONATHAN DUNHAM, b. 1682, son of the Rev. Edmund and Elizabeth (Bonham) Dunham; Ord. deacon, 2 Nov. 1734; sett. Piscataway (Middlesex) N.J., 1734-1777; 7th Day Bapt.; d. Piscataway, N.J., II Mar. 1777, a. 85, of smallpox.

name: Samuel Dunlap
settled at: Montgomery (Franklin) Pa., Welsh Run Church, I
raw: SAMUEL DUNLAP, sett. Montgomery (Franklin) Pa., Welsh Run Chh., I77'i-i77'i; sett. Cherry Valley (Otsego) N.Y., 1774-1774; Presb.

name: John Dylander
raw: JOHN DYLANDER, b. Sweden, 1709; minister at Boerstel, Sweden, 1737; arriv. Philadelphia, 2 Nov. 1737; sett. Philadelphia, Pa., Gloria Dei Chh., 6 Nov. 1737-1741; Lancaster, Pa., Holy Trinity Chh., 1740- 1741; preached in German, Swedish, and English, often as many as sixteen times per week; Swed. Luth.; d. Philadelphia, Pa., 2 Nov. 1741, a. 32 (GS).

name: George Eaglesfield
raw: GEORGE EAGLESFIELD, sett. Philadelphia, Pa., 1723-1725; Hopewell (Mercer) N.J., 1725-1728; Chestnut Ridge (Bait.) Md., ca. 1742; Bapt.

name: Samuel Eakin
chaplain: of New Jersey Militia, Rev. War
raw: SAMUEL EAKIN, A.M., A.B., Princeton, 1763, A.M.; sett. Salem (Salem) N.J., 1774-1776; Pencader Hundred (New Castle) Del., 1776- 1783; Chaplain of New Jersey Militia, Rev. War; Presb.; d. Pencader, Del., 1784.

name: George Eaton
settled at: Lower Dublin (Philadelphia) Pa., Pennypack Bapt. Church
raw: GEORGE EATON, sett. Lower Dublin (Philadelphia) Pa., Pennypack Bapt. Chh., 1734-1761; lay preacher; Bapt.; d. Lower Dublin, Pa., I July 1764.

name: Isaac Eaton
degrees: A.M., A.M. (hon.) Princeton, 1756;A.M. (hon.) U. of Pa., 1761;A.M. (hon.) Brown, 1770;
raw: ISAAC EATON, A.M., b. Montgomery, Pa., 1724, son of the Rev. Joseph Eaton; A.M. (hon.) Princeton, 1756; A.M. (hon.) U. of Pa., 1761; A.M. (hon.) Brown, 1770; Ord. Hopewell (Mercer) N.J., Bapt. Chh., 29 Nov. 1748-1772; Principal, Hopewell Academy, 1756 ff.; Bapt.; d. Hopewell, N.J., 4 July 1772, a. 46.

name: Joseph Eaton
raw: JOSEPH EATON, b. Nantmeal, Radnor, Wales, 25 Aug. 1679; came to America, 1686; called to the ministry, 1722; Ord. 24 Oct. 1727; sett. Montgomery (Montg.) Pa., 1722-1743; Hopewell (Mercer) N.J., 1722- 1730, once a month as supply; New Britain (Bucks) Pa., 1743-1749; Rockhill (Bucks) Pa., 1743-1749; Bapt.; d. New Britain, Pa., i Apr. 1749.

name: Nicholas Henry Eberhard
settled at: Warwick (Lane.) Pa., St. James's Church at Lititz
raw: NICHOLAS HENRY EBERHARD, b. 2 Jan. 1723; arriv. Bethlehem, Pa., 10 Dec. 1751 ; sett. Warwick (Lane.) Pa., St. James's Chh. at Lititz, 1765-1767; sett. Graceham (Fredk.) Md., 1767-1770; Morav.; d. Graceham, Md., 8 Apr. 1770.

name: Samuel Eburne
son of: Richard Eburne, of St. Antholin's Parish, London
raw: SAMUEL EBURNE, b. London, England, ca. 1645, son of Richard Eburne, of St. Antholin's Parish, London; adm. pensioner at St. John's Coll., Cambridge, 3 Oct. 1663, a. 18; Ord. i June 1667; Rector of Stocking-Pelham, England, 1667; sett. Setauket, L.I., N.Y., 1685-1688; sett. Bruton Parish (James City co.) Va., 1688-1697; S.P.G. missionary at the Isles of Shoals, N.H., 1703; res. on L.I., N.Y., 1697-1705, with short absences for services; Ep.

name: Emanuel Eckerling
raw: EMANUEL ECKERLING, b. Strasbourg, Alsace, son of City Councilor Michael Eckerling; arriv. Pa., 1725; sett. Tulpehocken (Berks) Pa., 1735-1735; remov. to Ephrata, 1735; Amwell (Hunterdon) N.J., 1738-1738; Ephrata (Lane), Pa., German Bapt. Chloister, 1738-1745; Dunkard or Germ. Bapt.

name: Gabriel Eckerling
settled at: as prior at Ephrata (Lane.) Pa., German Bapt. Chloister,  ff.
raw: GABRIEL ECKERLING, b. Strasbourg, Alsace; son of City Councilor Michael Eckerling; arriv. in Pa., 1725; sett, as prior at Ephrata (Lane.) Pa., German Bapt. Chloister, 1745 ff.; Dunkard or Germ. Bapt., killed by the Indians, Aug. 1757.

name: Israel Eckerling
ordained: Ephrata (Lane.) Pa., German Bapt. Chloister, Aug. 1740-1745
raw: ISRAEL ECKERLING, b. Strasbourg, Alsace, 1705, son of City Councilor Michael Eckerling; arriv. in Pa., 1725; asst. minister. Lower Frederick (Montg.) Pa., at Falkner's Swamp Chh., 1729-1740; Ord. Ephrata (Lane.) Pa., German Bapt. Chloister, Aug. 1740-1745; prior of the community; ejected 1745; Dunkard or German Bapt.

name: Samuel Eckerling
raw: Dr. SAMUEL ECKERLING, b. Strasbourg, Alsace; son of City Councilor Michael Eckerling; arriv. in Pa., 1725; ejected from the German Bapt. Chloister, 1745; sett. Strasburg (Shenandoah) Va., 1750-July 1764; German Bapt. or Dunkard; d. 15 Jan. 1781.

name: Adolph Eckesparre
raw: ADOLPH ECKESPARRE, arriv. in Pa., Dec. 1756; Ord. deacon; sett. Nazareth (Northampton) Pa., 1759 ff.; officiated at the churches at Ephrata, Nazareth, Gnadenthal, Christianspring and Friedenthal; head master of the school at Nazareth; Moravian.

name: Jonathan Edwards
son of: the Rev. Timothy and Esther (Stoddard) Edwards
raw: President JONATHAN EDWARDS, A.M., b. East Windsor, Conn., 5 Oct. 1703, son of the Rev. Timothy and Esther (Stoddard) Edwards; A.B., Y.C., 1720, A.M.; Tutor, 1724-1726; sett. N.Y., N.Y., 2nd Presb. Chh., 1722-1722; Ord. Northampton, Mass., 15 Feb. 1726/7-22 June 1750; sett. Stockbridge, Mass., preacher to the Indians, 1750-1758; Princeton, N.J., ist Chh., 1758-1758; inst. President of Princeton U., Jan. 1758-Mar. 1758; a leading intellect of America; Cong.-Presb.; d. Princeton, N.J., 22 Mar. 1758, a. 55 (GS).

name: Jonathan Edwards
settled at: Stockbridge, Mass., preacher to the Indians

name: Jonathan Edwards
settled at: President of Princeton U., Jan. Mar.

name: Jonathan Edwards
ordained: New Haven, Conn., White Haven Chh., 5 Jan. 1769- May 1795
son of: the Rev. Jonathan and Sarah (Pierpont) Edwards
raw: President JONATHAN EDWARDS, D.D., b. Northampton, Mass., 26 May 1745, son of the Rev. Jonathan and Sarah (Pierpont) Edwards; A.B., Princeton, 1765, A.M., Tutor, 1766-1769, D.D., 1785; A.M., Y.C., 1769; Ord. New Haven, Conn., White Haven Chh., 5 Jan. 1769- May 1795; inst. Colebrook, Conn., 1797-JuIy 1799; President, Union College, Schenectady, N.Y., 1799-1801; Presb.; d. Schenectady, N.Y., I Aug. 1801, a. 56.

name: Morgan Edwards
degrees: A.M., A.M. (hon.) U. of Pa., 1762;A.M. (hon.) Brown, 1769;
raw: MORGAN EDWARDS, A.M., b. Trevethin, Monmouth, Wales, 9 May 1722; ed. Bapt. Seminary, Bristol, England; A.M. (hon.) U. of Pa., 1762; A.M. (hon.) Brown, 1769; Fellow, Brown, 1764-1789; sett. Boston, CO. Lincoln, England, 1746-1753; Ord. Cork, Ireland, i June ^757~^759i RyCj Sussex co. England, 1760-1761; arriv. Philadelphia, 23 May 1761; sett. Philadelphia, Pa., 1761-1772; sett. Newark, Del., 1772-1775; Bapt.; d. Pencader, Del., 28 Jan. 1795, a. 72.

name: William Edwards
raw: WILLIAM EDWARDS, b. co. Gloucester, England, 24 Oct. 1708; came to America, 1736; became a Moravian, 1741; sett. Bethlehem, Pa., 1749; he was Zeisberger's assistant at Lichtenau, Nov. 1776; founder of Goshen; Representative for Northampton co.. Pa., 1755; Morav.; d. Goshen, Pa., 8 Oct. 1801.

name: Jacob Ehrenhardt
raw: JACOB EHRENHARDT, b. Marstadt, near Worms, Rhein-Hessen, 1716, son of John and Ann Magdalena Ehrenhardt; came to Pa., 1739; resided at Macungie; joined the Moravians, 1742; Ord. deacon, Salisbury (Lehigh) Pa., 1747; sett. Salisbury, Macungie Chh. at Emaus, 1747-1760; Morav.; d. Macungie, Pa., July 1760.

name: Jacob Christian Eicher
raw: JACOB CHRISTIAN EICHER, b. 1709; Ord. Ephrata (Lane.) Pa., German Bapt. Chloister; sett. Ephrata, 1768-1791; prior, 1749-1791; Dunkard or German Bapt.; d. Ephrata, Pa. 20 Aug. 1791, a. 82.

name: Peter Eizelberger
raw: PETER EIZELBERGER, sett. Cocalico (Lane.) Pa., Conestoga Chh., 1772 ff.; Dunkard or Germ. Bapt.

name: John Elder
ordained: Swatara (Dauphin) Pa., Paxton Chh. on Fishing Creek, 22 Dec. 1738-13 Apr. 1791
raw: Colonel JOHN ELDER, b. Edinburgh, Scotland, 26 Jan. 1706, son of Robert and Eleanor Elder; grad. U. of Edinburgh; lie. 1732; eame to America, 1736; Ord. Swatara (Dauphin) Pa., Paxton Chh. on Fishing Creek, 22 Dec. 1738-13 Apr. 1791; sett. Pennsboro (Cumb.) Pa., 1737- 13 Apr. 1791; sett. Derry (Dauphin) Pa., 1740-13 Apr. 1791; Capt. of Rangers, 1757; Colonel in the militia; Old Side Presb.; d. Swatara, Pa.. 17 July 1792, a. 68.

name: Daniel Elmer Ss Gs
ordained: Fairfield (Cumb.) N.J., Church of Christ at Cohansey, 1728
raw: DANIEL ELMER, A.M., b. East Windsor, Conn., ca. 1690, son of Samuel Elmer; A.B., Y.C, 1713, A.M.; supply at Brookfield, Mass., 1714-1715; New Haven, Conn., 1716-1717; Westborough, Mass., 1717-1724; Springfield, Mass., Aug. 1724-1725; remov. to New Jersey, 1727; Ord. Fairfield (Cumb.) N.J., Church of Christ at Cohansey, 1728; sett. Fairfield, 1727-1755; Cong.; Old Side Presb.; d. Fairfield, N.J., 14 Jan. I7SS, a. 65 (GS).

name: Jonathan Elmer
ordained: Florida Parish (Goshen, Florida, Warwick), N.Y., Oct. 1750
raw: JONATHAN ELMER, A.M., b. Norwalk, Conn., 4 June 1727, son of Deacon Jonathan and Mary Elmer; A.B., Y.C, 1747, A.M.; Trustee of Princeton, 1782-1795; Ord. Florida Parish (Goshen, Florida, Warwick), N.Y., Oct. 1750; sett. Goshen (Orange) N.Y., 1750-1754; Florida (Orange) N.Y., 1750-1754; Warwick (Orange) N.Y., 1750-1754; sett. New Providence (Union) N.J., Turkey Christian Chh., i Oct. 1757 (inst. 13 Nov. i765)-3 July 1793-14 Oct. 1793; Presb.; d. New Providence, N.J., 5 June 1807, a. 80.

name: Philip Embury
raw: PHILIP EMBURY, b. Ireland, 1730; sett. Balligarane, Ireland, 1752-1760; eame to America, 1760; N.Y., N.Y., John Street Chh., 1764-1769; N.Y. Conference, 1764-1769; Ash Grave (Washington) N.Y., 1769-1775; Meth.; d. Camden, N.Y., Summer, 1775, a. 45.

name: John Eneberg
raw: JOHN ENEBERG, b. Sweden, 1689; ed. Upsala; Ord. England, 1729; Philadelphia, Pa., Gloria Dei or Wieaeoa Chh., 1729-1733; Wilmington Del., Old Swedes Chh., 1732-1742; Chester (Del.) Pa., Upland Chh., 1732-1742; Sw. Luth.; returned to Sweden, 1742.

name: John Godfrey Engel
raw: JOHN GODFREY ENGEL, arriv. N.Y., N.Y., 12 May 1749; sett. York (York) Pa., 1753-1756; Salisbury (Lehigh) Pa., Chh. at Emaus, 1756-1758; his wife Margaret was also ord. and served with him; Morav.

name: John Theophilus Engelond
settled at: Strasburg (Lane.) Pa., St. Miehael's or Beaver Creek Church
raw: JOHN THEOPHILUS ENGELOND (or John Gottlieb Engelland), eame from Wurtemberg, Germany; had been minister at Hamburg, Germany; sett. Strasburg (Lane.) Pa., St. Miehael's or Beaver Creek Chh., 1751-1754; Ephrata (Lane.) Pa., Bergstrasse Chh., 1753-1758; Elizabethtown (Lane.) Pa., Christ Chh., 1752-1758; Stone Arabia (Montgomery) N.Y., 1763-1773; Middletown, Lower Swatara (Dauphin) Pa., St. Peter's Chh., 1767-1772; Luth. /''

name: Robert English
raw: ROBERT ENGLISH, supply at Crosswicks (Burlington) N.J., 1738; Allentown (Monmouth), 1739; Presb.

name: John Michael Enterlein
raw: JOHN MICHAEL ENTERLEIN, b. Palatinate, Germany, 1726; ed. Leipsic; Ord. 1751; came to America, ca. 1760; sett. Nockamixon (Bucks) Pa., 1763-1771; Springfield (Bucks) Pa., Trinity Chh., 1763- 1771; Franconia (Montgomery) Pa., Indian Creek or Zion's Chh., 1768- 1770; Rockhill (Bucks) Pa., Indianfield Chh., 1768-1770; Derry (Dauphin) Pa., Zion's Chh., 1769-1779; East Donegal (Lane.) Pa., at Maytown, 1771-1781; Elizabethtown (Lane.) Pa., Christ Chh., 1771-1781; Mifflin (Dauphin) Pa., St. John's Chh. at Berrysburg, 1780-1800; Luth.; d. Mifflin, Pa., Mar. 1800.

name: Reinhardt Erickzon
raw: REINHARDT ERICKZON, b. Groningen, Holland, 1695/1700; matric. at Groningen, 28 Aug. 1714; Ord. Amsterdam, Holland, 4 Sept. 1725; came to America, 1725; sett. Hackensack (Bergen) N.J., New Barbadoes Chh., Paramus (Bergen) N.J., Schraalenburg, N.J., 1725- 1728; Schenectady, N.Y., 1728-1736; Schoharie, N.Y., at Huntersfield, 1730-1731; Claverack (Columbia) N.Y., 1731-1732; Freehold (Monmouth) N.J., 1736-1764; Middletown (Monm.) N.J., at Holmdel, 1736- 1764; Dutch Ref.; d. 1771.

name: Andrew Eschenbach
raw: ANDREW ESCHENBACH, came from Naumburg, Germany; arriv. Philadelphia, Oct. 1740; Ord. in Europe, 1740; sett. Bethlehem, Pa., 1740-28 Sept. 1741-1747; sett. Oley (Berks) Pa., 1740-1742; Philadelphia, 1743-1747; left the church, 1747; farmer at Oley, Pa., 1747; Morav.; d. Oley, Pa., 1763.

name: John Ettwein
raw: Bishop JOHN ETTWEIN, b. Trendenstadt, Wurtemberg, 29 June 1721; Ord. deacon, 1746; arriv. N.Y., N.Y., 15 Apr. 1754; sett. N.Y., N.Y., Moravian Chh., 1754-1755; missionary among the Indians; came to North Carolina, 22 July 1758; sett. Bethabara, N.C., 1759-1766 (at Wacovia); senior pastor at Bethlehem, Pa., 20 Sept. 1766-1802; sett. Hope (Warren) N.J., 1769-1770; "traveled thousands of miles, often on foot, and preached in eleven of the thirteen original colonies"; consecrated Bishop, 25 June 1784-1801, retired 1801; founder of the "Soc. for Prop, the Gospel among the Heathen . . . 1787"; Moravian; d. Bethlehem, Pa., 2 Jan. 1802.

name: David Evans
settled at: Tredyffryn, Pa., Old Side Church, at Great Valley
ordained: Welsh Tract Chh. (Pencader Hundred), Del., 3 Nov. 1714- 1720
degrees: A.M., came to America, 1701 A.B., Y.C., 1713, A.M.
son of: Elder David Evans, Esq., of Welsh Tract
raw: DAVID EVANS, A.M., b. Wales, ca. 1690, son of Elder David Evans, Esq., of Welsh Tract; came to America, 1701; A.B., Y.C., 1713, A.M.; Ord. Welsh Tract Chh. (Pencader Hundred), Del., 3 Nov. 1714- 1720; sett. Tredyffryn, Pa., Old Side Chh., at Great Valley, 1720-23 Apr. 1740; Sadsbury, Pa., Chh. at Upper Octoraro, 1720-1724; Norriton (Montgomery) Pa., 1727-1731; Pilesgrove, N.J., 30 Apr. 1741-1751; Pennsneck, N.J., Chh. at Quihawken, 1741-1751; Presb.; Old Side; d. Pilesgrove, N.J., 4 Feb. 1750/1.

name: Evan Evans
degrees: D.D., matric. St. Alban's Hall, Oxford, 12 Mar. 1691/2, a. 21  A.B., Brasenose Coll., Oxford, 1695, A.M., 1714, B.D., 1714, D.D., 1714
raw: EVAN EVANS, D.D., b. Carnoe, Montgomery, Wales, 1671, son of Evan David Evans; matric. St. Alban's Hall, Oxford, 12 Mar. 1691/2, a. 21 ; A.B., Brasenose Coll., Oxford, 1695, A.M., 1714, B.D., 1714, D.D., 1714; curate, Wrexham, North Wales; Rector, Gwaynysgor, Flintshire, 1697; Ord. 1700; K.B. for Philadelphia, 5 July 1700; sett. Philadelphia, Pa., Christ Chh., 1700-15 Feb. 1717/8; Lower Providence (Montgomery) Pa., St. James's Chh. at Evansburg, 1700-1707, 1709-1716; Newtown (Del.) Pa., St. David's Chh. at Radnor, 1700-1714, 1716- 1718; Concord, Pa., St. John's Chh., 1700-1703; Chester, Pa., St. Paul's Chh., 1702-1704; Oxford (Chester) Pa., Trinity Chh., 1716-1718; (also preached in Welsh at Montgomery, 1700-1704, and Radnor, and at Chichester, 1700-1704, Oxford, 1702-1704, Perkionien and Newcastle, 1700-1705, all in Pa., and Evesham, N.J., 1700-1713); sett. St. George's Parish (Harford) Md., Spesutia Chh. near Perrymans, 1718-1721; Ep.; d. St. George's Parish, Md., Oct. 1721.

name: Evan Evans
settled at: St. George's Parish (Harford) Md., Spesutia Church near Perrymans

name: Israel Evans
chaplain: first N.Y. regt., 1775|, 2hd N.Y'. regt., 1776|, N.Y. Brigade, Continental Arniy, 1777-1783
degrees: A.M., A.B., Princeton U., 1772 A.M., Dart. Coll., 1792
raw: ISRAEL EVANS, A.M., A.B., Princeton U., 1772; A.M., Dart. Coll., 1792; Chaplain, ist N.Y. regt., 1775; Chaplain, 2hd N.Y'. regt., 1776; Brigade Chaplain, N.Y. Brigade, Continental Arniy, 1777-1783; retired June 1783; Presb.; an elligible officer for membership in the Society of the Cincinnati in the State of New York; d. 1807.

name: Joel Evans
son of: the Rev. David and Ann Evans
raw: JOEL EVANS, A.B., b. Great Valley, Pa., son of the Rev. David and Ann Evans; A.B., Y.C, 1740; lie. 17 Sept. 1741; sett. Woodbury (Gloucester) N.J., 1741-1742; Deerfield (Cumb.), N.J., 1741-1742; Appoquinimink (New Castle) Del., Apr. 1742-1 Apr. 1743; Presb.; d. Appoquinimink, Del., Apr. 1743.

name: Nathaniel Evans
settled at: Mount Holly (Burlington) N.J., St. Andrew's Church
degrees: A.M., non grad., U. of Pa., 1762, A.M. (hon.) 1765
raw: NATHANIEL EVANS, A.M., b. Philadelphia, Pa., 8 June 1742, son of Edward and Rebecca Evans; non grad., U. of Pa., 1762, A.M. (hon.) 1765; Ord. London (Bsp. of London), 1765; lie. 22 Sept. 1765; missionary for S.P.G.; K.B. for N.J., 23 Sept. 1765; Waterford, Colestown (Cumb.) N.J., St. Mary's Chh., 1765-1766; Clarksboro, formerly Berkeley in Greenwich (Cumb.) N.J., St. Peter's Chh., 1765-1766; Gloucester (Greenwich in Cohansey) (Cumb.), St. Stephen's Chh., 1765-1766 (Gloucester, Waterford and Berkeley were within the town of Greenwich in Cumberland co.); Egg Harbor (Atlantic) N.J., 1765-1766; Haddonfield (Camden) N.J., 1765-1766; sett. Mount Holly (Burlington) N.J., St. Andrew's Chh., 1766-1767; Delaware (Camdl) N.J., 1766- 1767; poet; Ep.; d. Haddonfield, N.J., 29 Oct. 1767; bur. in Christ Chh., Philadelphia.
