name: Nathaniel Evans
edited_raw: Clarksboro, formerly Berkeley in Greenwich (Cumb.) N.J.

name: Nathaniel Evans
edited_raw: Gloucester (Greenwich in Cohansey) (Cumb.), (Gloucester, Waterford and Berkeley were within the town of Greenwich in Cumberland co.)

name: Samuel Evans
son of: the Rev. David and Ann Evans
raw: SAMUEL EVANS, A.M., b. Great Valley, Pa., son of the Rev. David and Ann Evans; A.B., Y.C, 1739, A.M.; Ord. Tredyffryn, Great Valley, Pa., 5 May 1742-1747; sett. Norriton (Montg.) Pa., 1742-1747; went to Europe for Ep. ordination but failed to receive it; Old Side; Presb.; d. ca. 1766.

name: John Ewing
degrees: D.D., A.B., Princeton U., 1754, A.M., Tutor, 1756-1758 A.M., U. of Pa., 1759 D.D., Edinburgh U., 1773
raw: JOHN EWING, D.D., b. Nottingham (Cecil) Md., 21 June 1732; A.B., Princeton U., 1754, A.M., Tutor, 1756-1758; A.M., U. of Pa., 1759; D.D., Edinburgh U., 1773; Ord. Philadelphia, Pa., ist Chh., 1759-1802; v.p.. Am. Phil. Soc; Provost, U. of Pa., 1779-1802; Prof, of Natural Phil., U. of Pa., 1758-1759; Presb.; d. Philadelphia, Pa., 8 Sept. 1802, a. 70 (GS).

name: Nicholas Eyres
ordained: N.Y., N.Y., ist Bapt. Chh., Sept. 1724-1731
raw: NICHOLAS EYRES (Ayres), b. Chipmanslade, Wiltshire, England, 22 Aug. 1691; came to N.Y., 1711; Ord. N.Y., N.Y., ist Bapt. Chh., Sept. 1724-1731; resigned Oct. 1731; inst. Newport, R.L, 2nd Bapt. Chh., Oct. 1731-1759; Bapt.; d. Newport, R.L, 13 Feb. 1759.

name: John Christopher Faber
son of: a minister at Gimmeldingen, and cousin of the Rev. John T'heobald Faber
raw: JOHN CHRISTOPHER FABER, b. Mosbach on the Neckar, Rhein-Pfaltz, 1732, son of a minister at Gimmeldingen, and cousin of the Rev. John T'heobald Faber; matric. Heidelberg, 26 Feb. 1752: Ord. in Germany; arriv. Philadelphia, 1767; sett. Worcester (Montg.) Pa., Wentz's or Skippack Chh., Oct. 1767-Oct. 1768; Baltimore, Md., ist Germ. Ref. Chh., 1768-1771; Pipe Creek, Md., 1768-1775; Taneytown, Md., 1772-1785; West Manheim, Pa., David's or Sherman's Chh., 1772-1776; Codorus (York) Pa., St. Jacob's Chh., 1776-1776; also Zion's Chh., Blimyer's Chh., and Jerusalem Chh., all in Pa., 1776; Germ. Ref.; d. 1796.

name: John Theobald Faber
settled at: Upper Salford (Montgomery) Pa., Old Goshenhoppen Church, Nov.
raw: JOHN THEOBALD FABER, Sen., b. Zozenheim, Palatinate, 13 Feb. 1739, son of the Rev. John Faber; matric. Heidelberg, 5 Feb. 1760; Ord. Heidelberg, 20 Apr. 1763; arriv. Philadelphia, 24 Oct. 1766; sett. Upper Salford (Montgomery) Pa., Old Goshenhoppen Chh., Nov. 1766-6 Oct. 1779; Upper Hanover (Montg.) Pa., New Goshenhoppen Chh., 24 Oct. 1766-6 Oct. 1779; Lower Milford (Lehigh) Pa., Great Swamp Chh., 1766-1779; Milford (Bucks) Pa., Trumbaur Chh., 1773- 1779, 1782-1785; Lancaster, Pa. and New Providence, Pa., Sept. 1779- Sept. 1782; Rockhill (Bucks) Pa., Indianfield Chh., July 1782-1785; Bedminster (Bucks) Pa., Tohickon Chh., 1782-1785; Germ. Ref.; d. Upper Hanover, Pa., 2 Nov. 1788, a. 49 (GS).

name: Jacob Fabritius
edited_raw: JACOB FABRITIUS (a German or Pole), studied
ordained: Grosglogau, Silesia, ca. 1669 Philadelphia, Pa., Gloria Dei or Wicacoa Sw. Luth. Chh., Trinity Sunday, 1677-1693
raw: JACOB FABRITIUS (a German or Pole), studied at Altdorf; Ord. Grosglogau, Silesia, ca. 1669; sett. N.Y., N.Y., Holy Trinity Luth. Chh., 1669-1671; Chester (Del.) Pa., Chh. at Upland, 1671-1677; Ord. Philadelphia, Pa., Gloria Dei or Wicacoa Sw. Luth. Chh., Trinity Sunday, 1677-1693; Wilmington, Del., Old Swedes Chh., 1677-1691; Tinicum (Bucks) Pa., 1677-1677; Crane Hook (New Castle) Del., Chh. at Tran Hook, 1688-1691; he was suspended for a time, 15 Sept. 1675; preached in Dutch and Swedish; Sw. Luth.; d. Philadelphia, Pa., 1693.

name: Daniel Falkner
raw: DANIEL FALKNER (or Falckner) b. Langen-Reinsdorf, Zwichau, Saxony, 25 Dec. 1666, son of the Rev. Daniel Falkner; ed. Erfurth; Ord. Germany, 1693-1700; arriv. Philadelphia, 23 June 1694; returned to Europe, 1698; arriv. in Pa. again, 1700; sett. New Hanover (Montgomery) Pa., Falkner's Swamp Chh. (the first Luth. Chh. in Pa.), 1704-1714; left Pa. in 1709, though he appears to have continued to preach at Falkner's Swamp until 1714; sett. Fairmount (Hunterdon) N.J., Fox Hill Chh. at Tewksbury, 1714-1734; Mahwah (Bergen) N.J., Ramapo Chh. (also called Remmespack), 1714-1734; Millstone (Somerset) N.J. (also called Muehlstein, Millstein) at Hillsborough near Harlingen, 1714-1734; Bedminster (Somerset) N.J., Pluckemin Chh. (also called Hill Congregation, Pluckemin, Im Gebirge, In the Highlands), 1714-1734; Potterstown (Hunterdon) N.J., Rockaway Chh. (also called Rackeway) two miles from New Germantown, 1714-1734; Raritan (Somerset) N.J., 1714-1734; Montgomery (Orange) N.Y., Chh. on the Wallkill (also called Uylekil and Remrepugh), 1714-1734; and the following Luth. chhs. in N.J. and N.Y., 1723-1734: Albany, N.Y.; Claverack (Columbia) N.Y., St. Thomas's Chh.; Coxsackie (Greene) N.Y.; Four Mile Point, N.Y.; Kinderhook (Columbia) N.Y.; Klickenberg, N.Y.; Langen Rack, N.Y.; Newburgh, N.Y., Quassie Chh.; Newtown, N.Y.; Queensbury (Warren.?) N.Y.; Rhinebeck (Dutchess) N.Y.; Rosendale (Ulster) N.Y.; Saddle River (Bergen) N.J.; Shawanggunk (Ulster) N.Y.; and Tarbush, N.Y.; from 1724 to 1725: East Camp, N.Y., Christ Chh.; and from 1724 to 1734: Kaatsbaan (Ulster) N.Y. and West Camp (Ulster) N.Y. at Saugerties—26 congregations in all; bailiff, 1701; physician; Luth.; d. New Germantown (Hunterdon) N.J., ca. 1741.

name: Daniel Falkner
settled at: Mahwah (Bergen) N.J., Ramapo Church (also called Remmespack)

name: Daniel Falkner
settled at: Bedminster (Somerset) N.J., Pluckemin Church (also called Hill Congregation, Pluckemin, Im Gebirge, In the Highlands)

name: Daniel Falkner
settled at: Potterstown (Hunterdon) N.J., Rockaway Church (also called Rackeway) two miles from New Germantown

name: Daniel Falkner
settled at: Montgomery (Orange) N.Y., Church on the Wallkill (also called Uylekil and Remrepugh)

name: Justus Falkner
settled at: N.Y., N.Y., Holy Trinity Luth. Church
ordained: Philadelphia, Pa., 24 Nov. 1723 (the first ordination of a Lutheran minister in America)
son of: the Rev. Daniel Falkner by Daniel are added the 27 chhs. served by his brother Justus, we have 52 chhs.
raw: JUSTUS FALKNER (Falckner), b. Langen-Reinsdorf, Saxony, 22 Nov. 1672, son of the Rev. Daniel Falkner; matric^ Halle, 20 Jan. 1693; came to Pa., 1700; Ord. Philadelphia, Pa., 24 Nov. 1723 (the first ordination of a Lutheran minister in America); burgess, Germantown, Pa., 1701; sett. N.Y., N.Y., Holy Trinity Luth. Chh., 2 Dec. 1703- 1723; also in 1703: Raritan, N.J., 1703-1714, Kinderhook, N.Y., 1703-1723, Mahwah, N.J., Ramapo Chh., 1703-1714; Coxsackie, N.Y., 1703-1723; added in 1704 were: Saddle River (Bergen) N.J., 1704- 1723; Hackensack (Bergen) N.J., 1704-1723; and in 1705: Albany, N.Y., 1705-1723; and in 1712: Athens, N.Y., Loonenburgh Chh., 1712-1723; besides N.Y., N.Y^., and Albany, he had i in 1715, seven congregations: 3 in N.J. and 4 in N.Y. These were: summer congregations: Hackensack, Raritan, Remmespach, i.e. Ramapo, Piscataway, Elizabethtown and Phillipsburg (Warren), all in N.J.: winter congregations: Athens, i.e. Loonenburgh, Klickenberg, Four Mile Point, Coxsackie, Kinderhook and Claverack, all in N.Y. In 1716 were added as regular congregations: Claverack, N.Y., St. Thomas's Chh., 1716- 1723; Four Mile Point, 1716-1723; and Klickenberg, 1716^1723, all in N.Y. In 1719, seven new chhs. were added: Newburgh, i.e. Quassick Chh., 1719-1723; Rosendale, or Rosenthal in Ulster co., 1719-1723; Shawanggunk (Ulster), 1719-1723; Langen Rack, 1719-1723; Newtown, 1719-1723; Tarbush, 1719-1723; Queensbury, 1719-1723; Rhinebeck (Dutchess), 1719-1723; and Schoharie, 1719-1723, all in N.Y. state. Finally in 1720, three more N.Y. chhs. were added: East Camp, Christ Chh., 1720-1723; Kaatsbaan (Ulster), 1720-1723; and West Camp (Ulster), Chh. at Saugerties, 1720-1723. If to the 25 chhs. served by Daniel are added the 27 chhs. served by his brother Justus, we have 52 chhs.; Luth.; d. Newburgh, N.Y., a 51.

name: Justus Falkner
settled at: Rosendale, or Rosenthal in Ulster co.

name: Gabriel Falk
settled at: Philadelphia, Pa., Gloria Dei or Wicacoa Church
raw: GABRIEL FALK, b. West Gothland, Sweden; Ord. Skara Castle, Sweden; sett. Philadelphia, Pa., Gloria Dei or Wicacoa Chh., 7 Jan. 1733-1733; sett. Molatton (Berks) Pa., St. Gabriel's Chh., Manathanim, Douglassville, Pa., 1735-1745; sett. New Hanover (Montgomery) Pa., Falkner's Swamp Chh., 1735-1742; preached at Purrysburg, S.C, 30 Jan. 1739; preached at Savannah, Ga., 24 June 1739; only once at these two places so far as is known; sett. Pelacheeola, Ga., 1739-1740, dism., 1740; returned to Charleston, S.C; Sw. Luth.

name: Gabriel Falk
settled at: Molatton (Berks) Pa., St. Gabriel's Church, Manathanim, Douglassville, Pa.

name: Gabriel Falk
settled at: New Hanover (Montgomery) Pa., Falkner's Swamp Church

name: Gabriel Falk
settled at: these two places so far as is known

name: Robert Feeks
raw: ROBERT FEEKS, b. Flushing, L.L, N.Y., 22 June 1685, son of John and Elizabeth (Prior) Feeks; Ord. Oyster Bay, L.L, N.Y., 1724; sett. Oyster Bay Bapt. Chh., 1703-1773; Bapt.; d. Oyster Bay, L.L, N.Y., 2 Apr. 1773, a. 88.

name: Samuel Finley
ordained: as an evangelist at New Brunswick, N.J., 13 Oct. 1742
degrees: D.D., arriv. Philadelphia, 28 Sept. 1734 D.D., U. of Glasgow, 1763 D.D., Prineeton U., 1749
raw: President SAMUEL FINLEY, D.D., b. eo. Armagh, Ireland, 1715; arriv. Philadelphia, 28 Sept. 1734; ed. at the Log College; D.D., U. of Glasgow, 1763; D.D., Prineeton U., 1749; lie. 5 Aug. 1740; Ord. as an evangelist at New Brunswick, N.J., 13 Oct. 1742; sett. Deerfield (Cumb.) N.J., 1740-1743; sett. Greenwich (Cumb.) N.J., 1740-1743; sett. Cape May (Cape May) N.J., Chh. at Cold Spring, 1740-1743; sett. Lower West Nottingham, Md., 1744-14 July 1761, where he established an academy; sett. West Nottingham (Chester) Pa., 1744-1761; sett. Princeton, N.J., 1761-1766; president of Princeton U., J'uly 1761-1766; Presb.; d. Philadelphia, Pa., 17 July 1766, a. ca. 60 (GS).

name: Samuel Finley
settled at: Cape May (Cape May) N.J., Church at Cold Spring

name: Seth Fletcher
raw: SETH FLETCHER, son of the Rev. William Fletcher; teaeher at Hampton, N.H., 1652-1654; sett. Durham, N.H., 1656-1657; Wells, Me., 1657-1660; Saeo, Me., 1661-1675; sett. Southampton, L.L, N.Y., 1677-1679; sett. Elizabeth, N.J., 1680-1682; Cong.; d. Elizabeth, N.J., bef. 18 Sept. 1682 (adm. gr.).

name: Christian Frederick Foering
raw: CHRISTIAN FREDERICK FOERING, b. Hanover, Germany, 1736; stud, under the Rev. Dr. Caspar Dietriek Weyberg, and at Prineeton U.; Ord. Germantown, Pa., 21 Sept. 1769; sett. Germantown, 1769-1772; sett. Whitpain (Montgomery) Pa., Boehm's Chh., 1769- 1772; Worcester (Montg.) Pa., Wentz's or Skippack Chh., 11 June 1769-Feb. 1772; Frankford (Philadelphia) Pa., 1770-1772; N.Y., N.Y., Germ. Ref. Chh., 1773-1774; Hillsborough (Somerset) N.J., D.R. Chh. at Millstone, Oct. 1774-1779; Germ. Ref.; d. Hillsborough, N.J., 29 Mar. 1779.

name: John Forbes
raw: JOHN FORBES, b. Scotland (poss. the John Forbes of Banff, U. of Aberdeen, 1730); K.B. for East N.J., i Sept. 1733; sett. Freehold, St. Peter's Chh.; Middletown, Christ Chh.; Shrewsbury, Christ Chh., all in Monmouth co., N.J., 1733-1736; resided at Toponemus near Christ Chh., Middletown; Ep.; d. Monmouth eo., N.J., bef. 9 Nov. 1736 (adm. of his estate gr. that date).

name: John Forbes
edited_raw: Shrewsbury, all in Monmouth Co, N.J.

name: Robert Rdham
settled at: Hempstead, L.L, N.Y., as the first min.
degrees: A.M., adm. Gonville and Caius Coll., Camb. U., 3 July 1622 A.B., 1625, A.M., 1629
raw: ROBERT FÇRDHAM, A.M., b. Sacomb, Hertfordshire, England, 1603, son of Philip Fordham; adm. Gonville and Caius Coll., Camb. U., 3 July 1622; matric. 1623; A.B., 1625, A.M., 1629; came from England, 1640; sett. Hempstead, L.L, N.Y., as the ist min., 1643-1647; sett. Southampton, L.L, N.Y., 1647-1674; Cong.; d. Southampton, L.L, N.Y., Sept. 1674.

name: Jonah Fordham
son of: the Rev. Robert and Elizabeth (Benning) Fordham
raw: JONAH FORDHAM, A.B., b. ca. 1633, son of the Rev. Robert and Elizabeth (Benning) Fordham; A.B., H.C., 1658; sett. Hempstead, L.L, N.Y., 1660-1674; sett. Southampton, L.L, N.Y., 1674-1680; sett. Brookhaven, L.L, N.Y., Setauket Chh., 1691-1696; Cong.-Presb.; d. Southampton, L.L, N.Y., 17 July 1696, a. 63.

name: William Foster
settled at: East Fallowfield (Chester) Pa., Doe Run Church
ordained: Sadsbury (Chester) Pa., Upper Octoraro Chh., 19 Oct. 1768-1780
raw: WILLIAM FOSTER, A.B., b. Little Britain (Lancaster) Pa., 1739/ 40, son of Alexander Foster; A.B., Princeton, 1764; lie. 21 Apr. 1767; Ord. Sadsbury (Chester) Pa., Upper Octoraro Chh., 19 Oct. 1768-1780; sett. East Fallowfield (Chester) Pa., Doe Run Chh., 1768-1780; Presb.; d. Upper Octoraro, Pa., 30 Sept. 1780, a. 41.

name: James Frambach
settled at: Conewago (Adams) Pa., Sacred Heart Church, ca.  and ff.
raw: JAMES FRAMBACH, S.J., sett. Conewago (Adams) Pa., Sacred Heart Chh., ca. 1758 and ff.; R.C.; d. Conewago, Pa., 1795.

name: John Christopher Franke
raw: JOHN CHRISTOPHER FRANKE, arriv. at Bethlehem, Pa., Sept. 1742; schoolmaster at Nazareth, Pa., 18 July 1743-1745, 1759 ff.; Ord. deacon, 1749; sett. Oley (Berks) Pa., 1751-1752; sett. Salisbury (Lehigh) Pa., at Emaus, 1752-1753; Philadelphia, Pa., 1754-1756; Chaplain at Gnaden thai; his wife Christina was also ordained; sett. Warwick (Lancaster) Pa., St. James's Chh. at Lititz, 1763-1765; Moravian.

name: John Christopher Franke
settled at: Warwick (Lancaster) Pa., St. James's Church at Lititz

name: Theodore Frankenfield
raw: THEODORE FRANKENFIELD, b. Herborn, Germany, 25 Nov. 1727, son of Nicholas Herbert Frankenfield; ed. at Herborn, 26 Apr. 1736-27 Apr. 1741; Ord. at The Hague, 1752; arriv. N.%, N.Y., 27 July 1752; arriv. Frederick, Md., 4 May 1753; sett. Frederick, Md., 1753- 1756; sett. Monocacy Chh., near Frederick, 1753-1756; sett. Conococheague, Md., St. Paul's Chh., 1753-1756; sett. Conewago (York) Pa., Zion's or Quickel's Chh., 1753-1756; sett. Union (Adams) Pa., 1753- 1756; Germ. Ref.; d. Frederick, Md., June 1756.

name: Theodore Frankenfield
settled at: Conewago (York) Pa., Zion's or Quickel's Church

name: Michael Frantz
raw: Bishop MICHAEL FRANTZ, b. near Basel, Switzerland, 1687; came to America, 1727; Ord. 1737; sett. Cocalico (Lancaster) Pa., Conestoga Chh., 1735-1748; Germ. Bapt.; d. Cocalico, Pa., Dec. 1748.

name: William Frazer
raw: WILLIAM FRAZER, b. Scotland, 1743, prob, studied at Aberdeen; lie. by the Bsp. of London, 21 Dec. 1767; S.P.G. missionary; K.B. for N.J., 12 Jan. 1766; sett. Amwell (Hunterdon) N.J., St. Andrew's Chh. at Lambertville, May 1768-1776, 1784-1795; Alexandria (Hunterdon) N.J., St. Thomas's Chh., Kingwood, May 1768-1775, 1782-1785; Musconetcong, near Alexandria, 1768-1776; Tory, 1776-1784; sett. T'renton (Mercer) N.J., St. Michael's Chh., 1787-1788; rector of St. Michael's, 1788-1795; Ep.; d. Trenton, N.J., 6 July 1795, a. 52 (GS).

name: Bernardus Freeman
ordained: at Westphalia for service at Albany
raw: BERNARDUS FREEMAN, b. Westphalia, Germany; Ord. at Westphalia for service at Albany; came to America, 1700; sett. Schenectady, N.Y., 1700-1705, as missionary to the Mohawks, and minister of the chh.; sett. Brooklyn, Bushwick, Flatbush and New Utrecht, L.L, N.Y., 26 Dec. 1705-1741; Freehold (Monmouth) N.J., 1705-1709; Holmdel (Monmouth) N.J., 1705-1709; Mariborough (Monmouth) N.J., 1705- 1709; minister emeritus, 1741-1743; supply at Staten Island, N.Y., Richmond Union Chh. and Port Richmond Chh., 1705-1741; Dutch Ref.; d. 1743.

name: Bernardus Freeman
settled at: Brooklyn, Bushwick, Flatbush and New Utrecht, L.L, N.Y.

name: Bernardus Freeman
settled at: Staten Island, N.Y., Richmond Union Church and Port Richmond Church

name: Ferdinandus Frelinghuysen
raw: FERDINANDUS FRELINGHUYSEN, son of Theodorus Jacobus Frelinghuysen; U. of Utrecht, 1752; Ord. Amsterdam, Holland, 3 July 1752; called to Kinderhook, N.Y., but d. on the passage, 1753, of smallpox; Dutch Ref.

name: Henricus Frelinghuysen
settled at: Marbletown, Rochester and Wawasing, all in Ulster co., N.Y.
raw: HENRICUS FRELINGHUYSEN, son of Theodore Jacob Frelinghuysen; Ord. in America, 1754; sett. Marbletown, Rochester and Wawasing, all in Ulster co., N.Y., 1754-1757; Dutch Ref.; d. Rochester (Ulster) N.Y., 1757.

name: Jacobus Frelinghuysen
degrees: A.B., son of Theodore Jacob Frelinghuysen, A.B., Princeton, 1750
raw: JACOBUS FRELINGHUYSEN, A.B., son of Theodore Jacob Frelinghuysen, A.B., Princeton, 1750; preached at Wawasing, N.Y., 1752; Rochester (Ulster) N.Y., 1752-1753; Utrecht U.; Ord. Amsterdam, Holland, 3 July 1752; sailed for America, but d. on passage, 1753, of small pox; Dutch Ref.

name: John Frelinghuysen
settled at: Raritan, Sourland, near Harlingen, Six Mile Run, at Franklin, Neshanic, North Branch at Redington, and Three Mile Run, all in Somerset co., N.J.
raw: JOHN FRELINGHUYSEN, b. Three-Mile Run, N.J., 1727, son of the Rev. Theodore Jacob Frelinghuysen; Ord. Amsterdam, Holland, 1749; sett. Raritan, Sourland, near Harlingen, Six Mile Run, at Franklin, Neshanic, North Branch at Redington, and Three Mile Run, all in Somerset co., N.J., 1750-1754; Dutch Ref.; d. L.L, N.Y., Sept. 1754; buried at Raritan.

name: Theodorus Frelinghuysen
raw: THEODORUS FRELINGHUYSEN (Freylinghuysen), bapt. 26 May 1723, son of the Rev. Theodore Jacob Frelinghuysen; studied under J. H. Goetschius; Ord. Amsterdam, Holland, 1745; sett, at Albany, N.Y., 1749-1759; Catskill (Greene) N.Y., 1749-1752; Schaghticoke (Rensselaer) N.Y., 1749-1759; Dutch Ref.; d. Holland, 1761.

name: Theodorus Jacobus Frelinghuysen
settled at: Embden, Westphalia and East Friesland, Holland
raw: THEODORUS JACOBUS FRELINGHUYSEN, b. Hagen, Westphalia, 6 Nov. 1692, son of the Rev. Johannes Henricus Frylinghousen; Ord. Embden, Westphalia, 1717; Subrector of the Latin Academy at Enkhuizin, Holland, Sept. 1718-1719; sett. Embden, Westphalia and East Friesland, Holland, 1717-1719; arriv. America, 1719/20; sett. Raritan, 31 Jan. 1719/20-1747, and during the same time. New Brunswick (Middlesex), as well as Six Mile Run, Three Mile Run and North Branch at Readington, all in Somerset co., N.J.; Sourland, near Harlingen, 1729-1747; Northampton (Bucks) Pa., Dutch Ref. Chh., 1721- 1730 and Neshaminy Chh., 1721-1730; North and Southampton Chh., occasionally, 1721-1739; he was the first Ref. Chh. minister to settle in central N.J.; Dutch Ref.; d. Raritan, N.J., 1747.

name: James Fremin
raw: JAMES FREMIN, S.J., sett. Syracuse, N.Y., Onandaga mission, 1656-1658; Fonda, N.Y., Mohawk mission, 1667-1667; Victor, N.Y., Seneca mission, i Nov. 1668-1669; La Prairie, 1669; Green Bay, Wise; R.C

name: James Fremin
edited_raw: Victor, NY, Seneca mission, i Nov.

name: Andreas Frey
ordained: Lower Frederick (Montgomery) Pa., Falkner's Swamp Chh., 8 Mar. 1727/8
raw: ANDREAS FREY, Ord. Lower Frederick (Montgomery) Pa., Falkner's Swamp Chh., 8 Mar. 1727/8; sett. Falkner's Swamp, 1728- 1743; became a Moravian, 1743; went to Europe, 1743; returned and became a German Bapt. again; d. after 20 Apr. 1750.

name: John Frick
settled at: Lower Milford (Lehigh) Pa., Great Swamp Church
raw: JOHN FRICK, sett. Lower Milford (Lehigh) Pa., Great Swamp Chh., 1748-1770; lay preacher, 1770; Germ. Bapt.

name: John Andreas Friederichs
raw: JOHN ANDREAS FRIEDERICHS (or Friederici, Friderici), ed. Halle and Goettingen; sett. Williams (Northampton) Pa., at Cedarville, 1756-1760; Lower Milford (Lehigh) Pa., Upper Milford Chh., 1754-1763; Upper Saucon (Lehigh) Pa., St. Paul's, Blue or Organ Chh., 1754-1762; Moore (Northampton) Pa., Emmanuel Chh., 1754- 1778; Lehigh (Northampton) Pa., St. Paul's Chh., at Cherryville, 1762- 1769; Lynn (Lehigh) Pa., Jerusalem Chh., at Allemaengel, 1770-1774;. Allen and Lehigh (Northampton) Pa., 1772-1778; Luth.; he is called "old, bedridden, impoverished", 1778, but the church records show that he was minister again at Williams, Pa., 1783-1793.

name: John Jacob Fries
raw: JOHN JACOB FRIES, had a collegiate ed.; arriv. N.Y., N.Y., 9 Sept. 1753; in North Carolina, 15 Apr. 1754; sett. Bethabara, N.C, at Wacovia, 1754-1755; Philadelphia, Pa., 1770-1774; chaplain at Bethlehem, Pa., May 1777-1793; Moravian; d. Bethlehem, Pa., 1793.

name: Christian Froelich
raw: CHRISTIAN FROELICH, b. Felsburg, Hesse-Cassel, 19 Aug. 1715; came to Pa., with Bishop Nitschmann, Dec. 1740; he was an itinerant preacher in New England, 1745, and a missionary to the West Indies; his trade was sugar-baker; Morav.; d. Bethlehem, Pa., 5 Apr. 1776.

name: Solomon Froelich
raw: SOLOMON FROELICH, D.D., b. Red Hook, N.J., 29 May 1730; A.M., Princeton, 1774; Trustee, Rutgers, 1783-1810; D.D., Rutgers, 1811; Ord. n June 1775; sett. Jamaica, Newtown, Oyster Bay and Success, L.L, N.Y., 1775-1776; Fishkill and Poughkeepsie, N.Y., 1776- 1780; also Hillsborough and Neshanic, N.J., 1780-1786; Hackensack and Schraalenburg, N.J., 1786-1822; Lecturer in Theology, 1792-1797; Professor of Theology, 1786-1822; Dutch Ref.; d. Schraalenburg, N.J., 8 Oct. 1827.

name: John Fromelt
raw: JOHN FROMELT, arriv. N.Y., 21 Oct. 1763; sett. Bethlehem, Pa., 1763; general superintendent of all organizations of young men; Moravian.

name: Johannes Casparus Fry Enmoet
raw: JOHANNES CASPARUS FRY;ENMOET, b. Switzerland, 1720; Ord. 16 Dec. 1744; sett. The Minisinks, at Montague (Sussex) N.J., Lower Wallpack Chh., at Flatbrookville (Sussex) N.J., Port Jervis (Orange) N.Y., at Deerpark, Smithfield (Monroe) Pa., Shawanee Ghh. at Lower Smithfield: i June 1741-Dec. 1756; Lehman (Pike) Pa., Lower Wallpack Chh., at Bushkill, Delaware (Pike) Pa., at Dingman's Ferry, Layton (Sussex) N.J., Wallpack Chh., i June 1741-12 Aug. 1756; Wawarsing (Ulster) N.Y., supply, 1745-1751; Claverack (Columbia) N.Y., Germantown (Columbia) N.Y., Linlithgow (Columbia) N.Y., Kingsbury (Dutchess) N.Y. : 30 Oct. 1756-1770; Kinderhook (Columbia) N.Y., 12 Sept. 1756-1778; Gallatin (Dutchess) N.Y., 1759-1766; Red Hook Landing (Dutchess) N.Y. and Schodack (Rensselaer) N.Y., supply, 1770-1778; Germ. Ref. but preached mostly in Dutch Ref. chhs.; d. K.inderhook, N.Y., 1778.

name: Johannes Casparus Fry Enmoet
settled at: Shawanee Ghh. at Lower Smithfield PA

name: Christian Funk
raw: Bishop CHRISTIAN FUNK, b. Franconia township (Montgomery) Pa., 1731, son of Bishop Henry and Anne (Meyer) Funk; Ord. minister at Franconia, Pa., 1756; Ord. Bishop, 1769; sett. Franconia, Pa., 1757- 1778; excommunicated, 1778, for his sympathies towards the patriot cause; Menn.; d. Francon.ia, Pa., 31 May 1811, a. 80.

name: Henry Funk
raw: Bishop HENRY FUNK, arriv. in Pa., 1719; sett. Franconia (Montgomery) Pa., Indian Creek Chh., 1719-1760; sett. Lower Salford (Montg.) Pa., 1719-1760; Bishop; will made 13 June 1759; Menn.; d. Franconia, Pa., 1760.

name: Henry Funk
raw: HENRY FUNK, b. Montgomery co.. Pa., 1730, son of Bishop Henry and Anne (Meyer) Funk; Ord. Milford (Bucks) Pa., Great Swamp Chh., 1768-1778; excommunicated, 1778, for same reasons as for his brother; removed to Va., 1786; Menn.; d. Rockingham co. Va., 1817.

name: Jacob Funk
raw: JACOB FUNK, b. 30 May 1730, nephew of Bishop Henry Funk; Ord. Franconia (Montgomery) Pa., 1765; sett. Franconia, Pa., Indian Creek Chh., 1765-1774; Germantown, JPa., 1774-1796; resided at Cheltenham, Pa., 1774-1816; Menn.; d. Germantown, Pa., 11 Mar. 1816, a. 86.

name: Martin Gaby
raw: MARTIN GABY, Ord. Oley (Berks) Pa., after 1770; sett. Oley, Pa., 1770 and ff.; German Bapt.

name: Charles Gage
settled at: the Fort, N.Y., N.Y., under the Roman Catholic Governor of N.Y., Thomas Dongan
raw: CHARLES GAGE, arriv. N.Y., N.Y., 1686; Roman Catholic Chaplain at the Fort, N.Y., N.Y., under the Roman Catholic Governor of N.Y., Thomas Dongan, 1686-1688; R.C.

name: Hector Ernest Gambold
raw: HECTOR ERNEST GAMBOLD, b. Punchester (Pembroke) South Wales, son of Bishop John and Elizabeth Gambold; in Bethlehem, Pa., 1742; Ord. (deacon) 1755; Ord. minister before 1763; sett. Philadelphia, Pa., 1751-1751; Staten Island, N.Y., as the ist settled minister, 1763- 1784; also sett, between 1743 and 1755 at the following preaching stations: Ammasland (Del.) Pa., Darby Creek Chh., Bridgeton (Cumb.) N.J., Cohansey Chh., Calkoen's Hook (Del.) Pa., Cape May, N.J., Cold Spring Chh., Great Egg Harbor, N.J., Little Egg Harbor, N.J., Maurice River (Cumb.) N.J., N.Y., N.Y., Pennsneck, N.J., Quihawken Chh., and Swedesborough (Glouc.) N.J.; also at Oblong (Dutchess) N.Y., Chh. at Amenia Union; Morav.; d. Bethlehem, Pa., Nov. 1788.

name: John Gano Gs
chaplain: N.Y. Conti- nental Brigade, served to 3 Nov. 1783
ordained: 29 May 1754, as a missionary for the South
raw: JOHN GANO, b. Hopewell, N.J., 22 July 1727, son of Daniel and Sarah (Britton) Gano; Ord. 29 May 1754, as a missionary for the South; sett. Morristown, N.J^., 1754-25 Sept. 1757; sett. Jersey Settlements (Davidson) N.C., 1758-1760; sett. N.Y., N.Y., ist Bapt. Chh., 1762- 1788; sett. Town Fork Chh., near Lexington, Ky., 1788-1798; commissioned Captain in N.C., 1758-1760; Brigade Chaplain, N.Y. Conti- nental Brigade, served to 3 Nov. 1783; an original member of the Society of the Cineinnati in the State of New York; Bapt.; d. Frankfort, Ky., Aug. 1804, a. 77 (GS).

name: John Gano Gs
settled at: Town Fork Church, near Lexington, Ky.

name: Julian Garnier
settled at: Syraeuse, N.Y., Onondaga mission, N.Y., St. John the Baptist Church
raw: JULIAN GARNIER, S.J., sett. Syraeuse, N.Y., Onondaga mission, N.Y., St. John the Baptist Chh., 1667-1670; sett. Vietor, N.Y., Seneea mission, N.Y., St. Miehael's Chh., 1670-1683, 1702-1709; sett. Rome, N.Y., St. Franeis Xavier's mission to the Oneidas, 1667-1667; R.C.

name: Julian Garnier
settled at: Rome, N.Y., St. Franeis Xavier's mission to the Oneidas

name: Freeborn Garrettson
raw: FREEBORN GARRETTSON, b. Md., 15 Aug. 1752; served in Frederiek eo., Md., 1776-1776; served in the N.Y. Conferenee, 1776- 1827; Meth.; d. N.Y., N.Y., 26 Sept. 1827, a. 66.

name: Jacob Gass
raw: JACOB GASS ("brother Jethro"), adm. Ephrata Chloister (Lane.) Pa., 9 June 1728; prior at Ephrata, 27 Sept. 1745-1746; 5 Sept. 1746- 1749; Germ. Bapt.; d. Ephrata, Pa., 12 Oct. 1749.

name: Philip Gatch
raw: PHILIP GATCH, b. near Baltimore, Md., 2 Mar. 1751, son of George Gatch; missionary preacher in N.J., Del., and Md., 1773-1788; sett. Frederick, Md., 1774-1774; sett. Va., 1788-1797; Ohio circuit, 1797- 1835, part time; assoc. judge, court of common pleas, 1803-1824; Meth.; d. Clermont co., Ohio, 25 Dec. 1835.

name: John Gabriel Gebhard
raw: JOHN GABRIEL GEBHARD, b. Waldorf, Palatinate, Germany, 2 Feb. 1750; matric. Heidelberg, Jan. 1768; lie. 1771; arriv. N.Y., N.Y., 14 Jan. 1772; sett. Whitpain (Montgomery) Pa., Boehm's Chh. and Worcester (Montg.) Pa., Wentz's or Skippaek Chh., 19 Apr. 1772-4 Sept. 1774; Milford (Bueks) Pa., Lower Milford Chh., at Trumbaursville, 1773-1773; N.Y., N.Y., Germ. Ref. Chh., Nov. 1774-1776; Claveraek (Columbia) N.Y., Duteh Ref. Chh., 4 July 1776-1826; also at Taghkanie (Columbia) N.Y., 1777-1797; Ghent (Columbia) N.Y., at Squampawmoek, 1782-1787; Hillsdale (Columbia) N.Y., 1793-1814; Germ. Ref.; d. Claveraek, N.Y., 16 Aug. 1826.

name: Abraham Gehman Ii
settled at: Rockhill (Bucks) Pa., Beehtel's or Gehman's Church
raw: ABRAHAM GEHMAN, son of Christian Gehman; arriv. Philadelphia, II Aug. 1732; sett. Rockhill (Bucks) Pa., Beehtel's or Gehman's Chh., 1770-1792; trustee of Roekhill Chh., 1773; Menn.; d. Roekhill, Pa., 1792.

name: John Gehman
raw: JOHN GEHMAN, b. Pa., 12 Feb. 1741, son of Christian Gehman; Ord. 1773; sett. Upper Milford (Lehigh) Pa., Zionsville Chh., 1773- 1806; he was also ealled Hans Gehman; Menn.; d. Upper Milford, Pa., 23 Dec. 1806.

name: John Geisinger
settled at: in the Great Swamp Church distriet of Pa.
raw: JOHN GEISINGER, ord. betw. 1773 and 1785; sett, in the Great Swamp Chh. distriet of Pa.; Menn.

name: Daniel Geissler
raw: DANIEL GEISSLER, an assistant to Johannes Kelpius, in the Theosophieal Community, Wissahiekon, Pa.; Pietist; d: Pa., 1745.

name: Alexander Gellatly
raw: ALEXANDER GELLATLY, b. Perth, Scotland, ca. 1720; arriv. in Pa., 1752; inst. Bart (Lancaster) Pa., Middle Octoraro Chh., 23 Oct. 1754; sett. Bart, 1753-1761; sett. Oxford (Chester) Pa., 1753-1758; Assoc. Presb.; d. Warwick, Pa., 12 Mar. 1761, a. 41 (GS).

name: Samuel Gelston
raw: SAMUEL GELSTON, b. Ireland, 1692; came to New England, 1715; lie. in Md., 21 Sept. 1715; Ord. Southampton, L.L, N.Y., 17 Apr. 1717; sett. Southampton, 1717-1727; sett. New London (Chester) Pa., 27 Aug. 1728-1733; physician; d. 22 Oct. 1782, a. 90.

name: John Siegfried Gerock
settled at: Lancaster (Lane.) Pa., Holy Trinity Church, Mar.
raw: JOHN SIEGFRIED GEROCK, b. Wuertemberg, Germany; Ord. Darmstadt, Hessen, bef. 1752; arriv. Charleston, S.C, 1753; sett. Lancaster (Lane.) Pa., Holy Trinity Chh., Mar. 1753-29 Mar. 1767; sett. Strasburg (Lane.) Pa., St. Michael's or Beaver Creek Chh., 1753- 1767; sett. Sharpsburg (Washington) Md., Mt. Calvary Chh., 1758- 1767; N.Y., N.Y., Holy Trinity Chh., 1769-1773; Baltimore, Md., Luth. Chh., 1773-1787; Luth.; d. Baltimore, Md., 1787.

name: John Siegfried Gerock
settled at: Strasburg (Lane.) Pa., St. Michael's or Beaver Creek Church

name: Lawrence Girelius
settled at: Wilmington, Del., Old Swedes Church, now Ep.
raw: Provost LAWRENCE GIRELIUS, arriv. at Wilmington, Del., 21 Oct. 1767; sett. Wilmington, Del., Old Swedes Chh., now Ep., 1767- 1791; sett. Chester (Del.) Pa., Chh. at Upland, 1767-1791; Provost of the Swedish Lutheran Church of America, 1767-1791.

name: John Christopher Gobrecht Ii
raw: JOHN CHRISTOPHER GOBRECHT, b. Angerstein, near Goettingen, Germany, il Oct. 1733, son of Daniel Gobrecht; arriv. Philadelphia, II Sept. 1753; Ord. Bedminster (Bucks) Pa., Tohickon Chh., 26 Sept. 1766; sett. Bedminister, Pa., 12 Oct. 1766-9 Dec. 1770; Milford (Bucks) Pa., Lower Milford Chh. at Trumbaursville, 1766-1770; Rockhill (Bucks) Pa., Indian Field Chh., 1766-1770; Franconia (Montgomery) Pa., Indian Creek Chh., 1766-1770; sett. West Cocalico (Lane.) Pa., Swamp or Little Cocalico Chh., 15 Dec. 1770-5 Dec. 1779; Earl (Lane.) Pa., Zeltenreieh Chh., 1770-1779; Breeknoek (Lane.) Pa., Muddy Creek Chh., 15 Dee. 1770-1779; Elizabeth (Lane.) Pa., Zion Chh., 1770-1779; Ephrata (Lane.) Pa., Bethany Chh., 1770-1779; Pequea (Lane.) Pa., 1772-1779; Hanover (York) Pa., 1779-1806; Mt. Joy (York) Pa., 1779-1806; Hamilton (York) Pa., 1779-1806; Latimore (Adams) Pa., 1779-1806; Germ. Ref.; d. Hanover, Pa., 6 Nov. 1815, a. 82.

name: John Christopher Gobrecht Ii
settled at: West Cocalico (Lane.) Pa., Swamp or Little Cocalico Church

name: Jacob Godshalk
raw: Bishop JACOB GODSHALK (Gottschalk or Gaedtschalch), b. Gock, Germany, 1670; Ord. Germantown, Pa., 8 Oct. 1702; chosen Bishop, 9 May 1708; sett. Germantown, Pa., 1702-1713; Skippack (Montg.) Pa., 1714-1763; sett. Towamencin (Montg.) Pa., Kulpsville Chh., 1750- 1763; Menn.; d. Skippack, Pa., 1763 (will made 26 Dec. 1760; proved 3 June 1763).

name: Andrew Goeranson
settled at: Philadelphia, Pa., Gloria Dei or Wicacoa Church
raw: ANDREW GOERANSON, sett. Philadelphia, Pa., Gloria Dei or Wicacoa Chh., 1768-1779; Philadelphia, St. James's Chh., Kingsessing, 1768-1779; Upper Merion (Montg.) Pa., Christ Chh., 1768-1779; Sw. Luth.

name: Jacob Goering
raw: JACOB GOERING, b. Chanceford, Pa., 17 Jan. 1755, son of Jacob and Margaret Goering; ed. Halle; lie. Laneaster, Pa., 1774; sett. Carlisle (Cumberland) Pa., 1774-1783; Dover (York) Pa., Salem or Strayer's Chh., 1774-1783; Paradise (York) Pa., Holz Sehwamm Chh., 1775- 1783; Upper Bermudian, Pa., 1774-1783; Latimore (Adams) Pa., Lower Bermudian Chh., 1774-1783; Lower Settlement, Pa., 1774-1783; sett. York (York) Pa., Christ Chh., 1783-1807; Luth.; d. York, Pa., 1807, a. 53.

name: John Henry Goetschius
settled at: Lower Salford (Montg.) Pa., Reifii's or Skippack Church
son of: the Rev. Maurice and Esther (Werndli) Goetschius
raw: JOHN HENRY GOETSCHIUS (or Goetschy), b. Bernegg, Zurich, Switzerland, 8 Mar. 1717/8, son of the Rev. Maurice and Esther (Werndli) Goetschius; matric. 23 Mar. 1734, at the Latin School at Zurich; arriv. Philadelphia, 29 May 1735, in the "Mercury"; lie. 28 May 1736; Ord. 7 Apr. 1741; reordained 1748; German Ref. ministry: sett. Lower Salford (Montg.) Pa., Reifii's or Skippack Chh., 1735-1739; Upper Salford (Montg.) Pa., Old Goshenhoppen Chh., 1735-1740; Upper H^anover (Montg.) Pa., New Goshenhoppen Chh., Jan. 1735/6-1740; Lower Milford (Lehigh) Pa., Great Swamp Chh., 1735-1740; Whitehall (Lehigh) Pa., Egypt Chh., 1735-26 Oct. 1736; Lower Saucon (Northampton) Pa., Saucon Chh., 1735-1739; Maxatawny (Berks) Pa., De Long Chh., 1735-1739; Oley (Berks) Pa., 1736-1736; Bern (Berks) Pa., Bern Chh., 24 Mar. 1739-1741; Mill Creek (Lebanon) Pa., Tulpehocken or Trinity Chh., 1736-1741; Heidelberg (Berks) Pa., Hain's or Cacusi Chh., 1736- 1739; Salisbury (Lehigh) Pa., Jerusalem Chh., 1737-1739; Worcester (Montg.) Pa., Wentz's or Skippack Chh., 1735-1741; Northampton (Bucks) Pa., Dutch Ref. Chh., 1738-1740; Richmond (Berks) Pa., Moselem Chh., 1739-1740; Southampton (Bucks) Pa., North and Southampton Chh., 1739-1741; also Neshaminy Chh. at Churchville, 1739- 1741. Dutch Ref. ministry; Jamaica, Oyster Bay, Newtown, Success, all L.L, N.Y., 1741-1748; Hackensack, N.J., New Barbadoes Chh., 1748-1774; Schraalenburg (Bergen) N.J., 1748-1774; Germ. Ref.; Dutch Ref.; d. Schraalenburg, N.J., 14 Nov. 1774.

name: John Henry Goetschius
settled at: Upper Salford (Montg.) Pa., Old Goshenhoppen Church

name: John Henry Goetschius
settled at: Upper Hanover (Montg.) Pa., New Goshenhoppen Church, Jan. /

name: John Henry Goetschius
settled at: Lower Milford (Lehigh) Pa., Great Swamp Church

name: John Henry Goetschius
settled at: Mill Creek (Lebanon) Pa., Tulpehocken or Trinity Church

name: John Henry Goetschius
settled at: Heidelberg (Berks) Pa., Hain's or Cacusi Church

name: John Henry Goetschius
settled at: Worcester (Montg.) Pa., Wentz's or Skippack Church

name: John Henry Goetschius
settled at: Southampton (Bucks) Pa., North and Southampton Church

name: John Henry Goetschius
settled at: Jamaica, Oyster Bay, Newtown, Success, all L.L, N.Y.

name: John Mauritius Goetschius
settled at: Schoharie, N.Y., German and Dutch Ref.
raw: Dr. JOHN MAURITIUS GOETSCHIUS, A.M., b. Thurgau, Switzerland, July 1724; ed. as a physician; came to America, 1744; A.M. (hon.) Princeton, 1773; Trustee, Rutgers, 1770-1771; lie. 1754; sett. Schoharie, N.Y., German and Dutch Ref., 1757-1760;, Shawangunk (Ulster) N.Y., Chh. at Bruynswick, Dutch Ref.; 1760-1771; New Palz (Ulster) N.Y., Fr. Ref. Chh., 1760-1771; Dutch Ref.; d. Mar. 1771.

name: Maurice Goetschius
raw: MAURICE GOETSCHIUS, b. Zurich, Switzeriand, 1686; matric. Zurich Latin School, 4 Dec. 1702; Ord. St. Gall, 1710; sett. Bernegg, St. Gall, Switzerland, 1712-1720; sett. Saletz, Switzerland, 1720-1731; deposed, 1731; arriv. Philadelphia, 29 May 1735; d. same day; Germ. Ref.; d. Philadelphia, Pa., 29 May 1735.

name: Stephen Goetschius
raw: STEPHEN GOETSCHIUS, A.B., b. ca. 1752, son of John Henry Goetschius; studied under his father; A.B. (hon.) Princeton, 1774; lie. 1775; Ord. June 1777; sett. New Palz (Ulster) N.Y., 1775-1796; sett. New Huriey (Ulster) N.Y., Chh. at Plattekill, 1775-1796; Marbletown (Ulster) N.Y., 1796-1814; Shokan, N.Y., 1796-1814; Saddle River and Pascack, 1814-1835; he org. 9 chhs. in Ulster co.; Dutch Ref.; d. Bergen CO., N.J., 1837.

name: Stephen Goetschius
settled at: New Huriey (Ulster) N.Y., Church at Plattekill

name: John Ernst Goetwasser
settled at: N.Y., N.Y., Holy Trinity Church, as the first minister
raw: JOHN ERNST GOETWASSER, Ord. Holland, 10 Apr. 1657; arriv. N.Y., N.Y., 6 June 1657; sett. N.Y., N.Y., Holy Trinity Chh., as the ist minister, 1657-1658; sett. Albany, N.Y., 1657-1658; Luth.

name: Benjamin Goldsmith
ordained: Lower Aquebogue, at Riverhead, L.L, N.Y., 28 June 1764
raw: BENJAMIN GOLDSMITH, A.M., b. Southold, L.L, N.Y., 5 Nov. 1736, son of John Goldsmith; A.B., Y.C, 1760, A.M., 1765; Ord. Lower Aquebogue, at Riverhead, L.L, N.Y., 28 June 1764; sett. Lower Aquebogue, 1764-1810; sett. Southold, L.L, N.Y., Mattituck Chh., 1777- 1810; Presb.; d. Lower Aquebogue, L.L, N.Y., 19 Nov. 1810, a. 74.

name: Francis Goodhue
raw: FRANCIS GOODHUE, A.B., b. Essex, Mass., 4 Oct. 1678, son of Dea. William and Hannah (Dane) Goodhue; A.B., H.C, 1699; sett. Jamaica, L.L, N.Y., 1705-1707; Presb.; d. Rehoboth, Mass., 15 Sept. 1707.

name: John Gordon
raw: Dr. JOHN GORDON, Chaplain at the Fort, N.Y., N.Y., 25 Aug. i683-i683;Ep.

name: John Gordon
raw: JOHN GORDON, sett. Penn (Chester) Pa., St. John's Chh., 1744- (1750); Frederick (Frederick) Md., i7(38)-(i765): Ep.

name: Patrick Gordon
SPG: missionary and the first in N.Y.
raw: PATRICK GORDON, Chaplain, Royal Navy, arriv. N.Y., N.Y., Apr. 1702; sett. Jamaica, L.L, N.Y., Grace Chh., 1702-1702; Flushing, L.L, N.Y., 1702-1702; 2nd S.P.G. missionary and the ist in N.Y.; d. Jamaica, L.I., N.Y., July 1702.

name: Peter Gordon
raw: PETER GORDON, mentioned in Pa., ca. 1708; Scotch Franciscan; R.C

name: John Gorgas
raw: JOHN GORGAS, sett. Germantown, Pa., 1712-1725; Menn.; d. after 1725.

name: Matthew Gottlieb Gottschalk
raw: MATTHEW GOTTLIEB GOTTSCHALK, b. Amswalde, Brandenburg, 1716; theol. student at Lindheim, 1744, a. 28; came to Bethlehem, Pa., Jan. 1747; itinerant minister in Md., 1745; sett. Antietam (Washington) Md., 1745-1747; Conococheague, Md., 1745-1747; Monocacy, Md., 1745-1747; South Branch of the Potomac, West Virginia, 1745- 1747; sett. Bethlehem, Pa., 1747-1748 as an itinerant minister in Pa. at Alsace, Coventry, Goshenhoppen, Neshaminy, Oley and Skippack, 1747-1748; Morav.; d. Bethlehem, Pa., Aug. 1748.

name: Matthew Gottlieb Gottschalk
edited_raw: South Branch of the Potomac, West Virginia

name: Ebenezer Gould
raw: EBENEZER GOULD, A.M., b. Guilford, Conn., son of Benjamin and Elizabeth Gould; A.B., Y.C, 1723, A.M.; Ord. Greenwich (Cumberland) N.J., 1728-1739; inst. Southold, L.L, N.Y., chhs. at Cutchogue and Mattituck, Sept. 1740; sett. Cutchogue and Mattituck, 1740-1747; sett. Orient, L.L, N.Y., 1740-1747; sett. Middlefield, Conn., 10 Oct. 1747-1756; Cong.; Presb.; d. East Granville, Mass., 1778.

name: Ebenezer Gould
settled at: Southold, L.L, N.Y., chhs. at Cutchogue and Mattituck, Sept.

name: William Graf
raw: WILLIAM GRAF, b. Liningen, Germany; ed. Giessen; Ord. Hackensack, N.J., 1760-1775; sett. Saddle River (Bergen) N.J., Zion's Chh., 1760-1775; Spruce Run (Hunterdon) N.J., 16 July 1775-1808; Whitehouse (Hunterdon) N.J., at Leslyland, 1775-1808; New Germantown (Hunterdon) N.J., Zion's Chh. at Tewksbury, 1775-1808; Potterstown (Hunterdon) N.J., Rockaway Chh., 1775-1808; Bedminster (Somerset) N.J., St. Paul's Chh., 1775-1808; Raritan (Somerset) N.J., 1775-1808; Pluckemin (Somerset) N.J., 1775-1808; Luth.; d. Spruce Run, N.J., 1808.

name: John Michael Graff
raw: Bishop JOHN MICHAEL GRAFF, ed. Jena, 1738; U. of Koenigsberg; Ord. in Europe; arriv. N.Y., N.Y., 24 Sept. 1751; consecrated Bishop, 1773; sett. Nazareth, Pa., 1755-1762; sett. Philadelphia and New York, 1762-1762; went to North Carolina, 20 Apr. 1762; sett. Bethabara, N.C., 1762-1773; Salem, N.C., 1774-1782; hymn writer; Morav.; d. Salem, N.C., 29 Aug. 1782.

name: Chauncey Graham
degrees: A.M., A.B., Y.C., 1747, A.M. A.M., Princeton, 1752
son of: the Rev. John and Abigail (Chauncey) Graham
raw: CHAUNCEY GRAHAM, A.M., b. Lebanon, Conn., 13 Nov. 1731, son of the Rev. John and Abigail (Chauncey) Graham; A.B., Y.C., 1747, A.M.; A.M., Princeton, 1752; Ord. Fishkill (Dutchess) N.Y., 25 Jan. 1749/50; sett. Fishkill, Rumbout Chh., 1750-1773; sett. Poughkeepsie (Dutchess) N.Y., 1750-29 Sept. 1752; physician; Chaplain, 1760, in the expedition to Canada; ran an ordinary in Fishkill; Presb.; d. Fishkill, N.Y., 30 Mar. 1784, a. 53.

name: John Grant
degrees: A.M., sett. Charleston, S.C., Scotch Chh., ca. 1745
raw: JOHN GRANT, A.M., b. ca. 1716 (parentage unknown), A.B., Y.C., 1741, A.M.; sett. Charleston, S.C., Scotch Chh., ca. 1745; Ord. Westfield (Union) N.J., Sept. 1746-1753; Presb.; d. Westfield, N.J., 16 Sept. 1753, a. ca. 37.

name: Wilhelmus Grasmeer
raw: WILHELMUS GRASMEER, minister at Graftdyck, Holland, 1647- 1650, but deserted his chh. there; m. a dau. of the Rev. Johannes Megapolensis; arriv. N.Y., N.Y., 1650; preached at Rensselaerwyck, N.Y., Feb. 1651-Aug. 1651 ; sett. Albany, N.Y., 1651-1652; excommunicated; returned to Holland, 1652; restored to good standing; sett. Ursem, Holland, 4 Aug. 1679; Dutch Ref.

name: Wilhelmus Grasmeer
settled at: Graftdyck, Holland,  , but deserted his church there

name: John Graybill
raw: Bishop JOHN GRAYBILL, son of (Rev.) John Graybill; came to Lancaster co.. Pa., 1772; sett. Monroe (Juniata) Pa., 1772 ff.; Bishop; Menn.

name: James Greaton
settled at: Huntington, L.L, N.Y., St. John's Church
raw: JAMES GREATON, A.M., b. Roxbury, Mass., 10 July 1730, son of James and Catherine Greaton; A.B., Y.C., 1754, A.M., A.M. (hon.) H.C., 1760; inst. Boston, Mass., Christ Chh., 30 May 1760-1767; left 31. Aug. 1767; sett. Huntington, L.L, N.Y., St. John's Chh., 1768-1773; Brookhaven, L.L, Setauket, Caroline Chh., 1768-1773; Islip, L.L, N.Y., St. John's Chh., 1768-1773; Oyster Bay, L.L, N.Y., Christ Chh., 1768- 1773; Ep.; d. Huntington, L.L, N.Y., 17 Apr. 1773, a. 42.

name: Joseph Greaton
raw: JOSEPH GREATON, S.J., b. London, England, 12 Feb. 1679; adm. S.J., 5 July 1708; at Liege, Belgium, 1710; St. Omer's, France, 1711; sett. St. Chad, Staffordshire, England, 1715-1720; arriv. in Md., 1721; sett. Conewago (Adams) Pa., Sacred Heart Chh., 1721-1752; Philadelphia, Pa., St. Joseph's Chh., 1729-1752; Bohemia, Md., 1750-1752; took up a patent of 373 acres at Washington, Pa., 1748; Superior, 1740-1753; R.C; d. Bohemia Manor, Md., 9 Aug. 1753.

name: Jacob Greder
raw: JACOB GREDER, came from the Palatinate, Germany; arriv. Philadelphia, 17 Aug. 1733; sett. Skippack (Montgomery) Pa., 1733-1759; res. near Graterford, Pa.; Menn.

name: Enoch Green
raw: ENOCH GREEN, A.B., A.B., Prineeton, 1760; inst. Deerfield (Cumberland) N.J., 9 June 1767-1776; Chaplain, Continental Army, 1775- 1776; Presb.; d. Greenfield, N.J., 2 Nov. 1776.

name: Jacob Green
raw: Dr. JACOB GREEN, A.M., b. Maiden, Mass., 22 Jan. 1722, son of Jaeob and Dorothy (Lynde) Green; A.B., H.C, 1744, A.M.; A.M. (hon.) Prineeton, 1749; taught school at Sutton, Mass., 1744; lie. Sept. 1745; Ord. Hanover (Morris) N.J., Whippany Chh., Nov. 1746-1790; sett. Hanover (Morris) N.J., Parsippany Chh., 1746-1760; v.p., Princeton, 1758-1759; physician; Presb.; d. Hanover, N.J., 24 May 1790, a. 68 (GS).

name: Nehemiah Greenman
raw: NEHEMIAH GREENMAN, A.M., prob. b. Norwalk, Conn., July 1721, perhaps son of Nehemiah Groman; A.B., Y.C, 1748, A.M.; lie. 20 Oet. 1748; sett. Moriehes, Brookhaven, L.L, N.Y., 1748-1749; Little Quogue, Westhampton, L.L, N.Y., 1748-1749; sett. Madison (Morris) N.J., Bottle Hill Chh., Apr. 1750-1752; Ord. Pilesgrove, N.J., 5 Dee. 1753; sett. Pilesgrove, 1753-9 Apr. 1779; sett. Logtown (Salem) N.J., Lower Alloway's Creek Chh., 1753-1779; Pennsneck (Salem) N.J., Chh. at Quihawken, 1753-1779; Presb.; d. Pittsgrove, N.J., 25 July 1779, a. 58 y. 21 d.

name: Nehemiah Greenman
settled at: Madison (Morris) N.J., Bottle Hill Church, Apr.

name: Nehemiah Greenman
settled at: Logtown (Salem) N.J., Lower Alloway's Creek Church

name: Christian Gregor
raw: Bishop CHRISTIAN GREGOR, Ord. in Europe; arriv. Bethlehem, 16 Nov. 1770; sett. Bethlehem, 1770-1772; returned to Europe, 6 May 1772; made an offieial visit to the Moravian ehhs.; eonseerated Bishop, 1789; hymn writer; Morav.

name: Elnathan Gregory
raw: ELNATHAN GREGORY, A.B., b. prob, at Norwalk, Conn., 1734; A.B., Prineeton, 1757; sett. Carmel (Putnam) N.Y., 1760-1773; Cong.; d. Carmel, N.Y., 1816, a. 82.

name: James Greir
ordained: Bedminster (Bueks) Pa., Deep Run Chh., June 1776
raw: JAMES GREIR, A.B., b. Plumstead, Pa., 1750, son of John and Agnes (Caldwell) Greir; A.B., Prineeton, 1772; Tutor, 1773-1774; lie. 1775; Ord. Bedminster (Bueks) Pa., Deep Run Chh., June 1776; sett. Bedminster, Pa., 1776-1791; Presb.; d. Deep Run, Bedminster, Pa., 19 Oct. 1791.

name: David Griffith
chaplain: and Surgeon, 3rd Va. regt.. Continental Army, 1776-1779
degrees: D.D., M.D., physieian, 1763-1770 D.D., U. of Pa., 1786
raw: DAVID GRIFFITH, D.D., M.D., b. N.Y., N.Y., 1742; physieian, 1763-1770; M.D., D.D., U. of Pa., 1786; Ord. London, England, 19 Aug. 1770; K.B. for N.J., 3 Sept. 1770; S.P.G. missionary at Gloueester and Waterford, N.J., 1770-1771 (i.e. Gloueester, Waterford, and Berkeley in the town of Greenwich, N.J.); sett. Greenwich, formerly Waterford, N.J., 1770-1771; Clarksboro, formerly Berkeley, St. Peter's Chh., 1770-1771; Gloucester City (Cumb.) N.J., 1770-1771; Delaware (Camden ) N.J., St. James's Chh., 1770-1771; sett. Shelburne Parish (Loudoun) Va., 1771-1776; Chaplain and Surgeon, 3rd Va. regt.. Continental Army, 1776-1779; res. 18 Mar. 1779; an original member of the Society of the Cincinnati in the State of Virginia, 1783; sett. Fairfax Parish (Fairfax) Va., 1780-1789; Bishop elect of the Dioeese of Va., May 1786; Ep.; d. Philadelphia, Pa., 3 Aug. 1789, a. 48.

name: David Griffith
edited_raw: Clarksboro, formerly Berkeley in Greenwich (Cumb.) N.J.

name: David Griffith
settled at: Gloueester and Waterford, N.J.,  (i.e. Gloueester, Waterford, and Berkeley in the town of Greenwich, N.J.)

name: John Griffith
raw: JOHN GRIFFITH, Ord. Charlestown (Chester) Pa., 1753-1763; preached in Welsh; Presb.; d. Charlestown, Pa., ca. 1763.

name: Abel Griffiths
son of: the Rev. Benjamin and Sarah (Miles) Griffiths
raw: ABEL GRIFFITHS, b. Montgomery, Pa., 23 Dec. 1723, son of the Rev. Benjamin and Sarah (Miles) Griffiths; Ord. 1761; sett. Birmingham (Delaware) Pa., Brandywine Chh., 12 Apr. 1761-1767, 1775-1791; Newlin (Chester) Pa., Hephzibah Chh., 1761-1767, 1775-1791; Vincent (Chester) Pa., 1761-1767, 1775-1791; sett. Salem (Salerh) N.J., 1767- 1771; Bapt.; removed to Ky., 1791.

name: Benjamin Griffiths
raw: BENJAMIN GRIFFITHS, b. Llanllwyni, Cardiganshire, Wales, 16 Oct. 1688, half brother of Abel and Enoch Morgan; canie to America, 1710; Ord. Montgomery (Montgomery) Pa., 23 Oct. 1725; sett. Montgomery, Pa., 1722-1768; sett. Hilltown (Bucks) Pa., Perkasie Chh., 1737-1768; sett. New Britain (Bucks) Pa., Upper Perkasie Chh., 1754- 1768; Bapt.; d. Montgomery, Pa., 5 Oct. 1768, a. 80.

name: Benjamin Griffiths
settled at: New Britain (Bucks) Pa., Upper Perkasie Church

name: John Daniel Gros
degrees: D.D., bapt. Webenheim, Zweibruecken, Germany, 22 June 1738, son of Lorenz and Anna Magdalena Gros
raw: JOHN DANIEL GROS, D.D., bapt. Webenheim, Zweibruecken, Germany, 22 June 1738, son of Lorenz and Anna Magdalena Gros; matric. Marburg, 20 Apr. 1758; matric. Heidelberg, 21 Apr. 1761; Regent, New York U., 1784-1787; Trustee, Columbia, 1787-1792; S.T.D., Columbia, 1789; Prof, of German and Geography, Columbia, 1784-1795; arriv. Philadelphia, 4 Dec. 1764; Ord. Whitehall (Lehigh) Pa., 1765; sett. Whitehall, Pa., Egypt Chh., 20 Dec. 1764-1770; Allentown (Lehigh) Pa., Zion Chh., 1765-1770; North Whitehall (Lehigh) Pa., Schlosser's or Scrub Oak (Grund Eichel) Chh., 1765-177Í ; South Whitehall (Lehigh) Pa., Jordan Chh., 1765-1770; Lehigh (Northampton) Pa., Driesbach Chh., 1765-1770; Lower Saucon (Northampton) Pa., 1770- 1773; Northampton (Bucks) Pa., Neshaminy Chh., 1765-1770; Rockhill (Bucks) Pa., Indianfield Chh., 1770-1773; Southampton (Bucks) Pa., North and Southampton Chh., 1765-1770; Springfield (Bucks) Pa., Trinity Chh., 1770-1773; Kingston (Ulster) N.Y., 1773-1783; Chaplain, Rev. War, 1781-1782; N.Y., N.Y., Germ. Ref. Chh., 1783-179S; Stone Arabia, N.Y., 1796-1800; Canajoharie, N.Y., 1796-1800; Germ. Ref.; d. Canajoharie, N.Y., 27 May 1812.

name: John Daniel Gros
settled at: North Whitehall (Lehigh) Pa., Schlosser's or Scrub Oak (Grund Eichel) Chh.

name: John Daniel Gros
settled at: Southampton (Bucks) Pa., North and Southampton Chh.

name: Joseph Grover
raw: JOSEPH GROVER, A.M., b. Tolland, Conn., 1742, son of Joseph Grover; A.B., Dartmouth Coll., 1773, A.M.; Ord. Hanover, N.J., Parsippany Chh., 1774; sett. Parsippany, N.J., 1773-1798; sett. Bristol, N.Y.; Presb.; d. Bristol, N.Y., 1826, a. 84.

name: Bernard Adam Grube
edited_raw: Indian missionary in Monroe co.. Pa.
settled at: Bethabara, North Carolina (at Wacovia), Oct. , as the first Moravian minister in N.C.
raw: BERNARD ADAM GRUBE,, b. near Erfurth, Germany, 1715; grad. U. of Jena; arriv. Bethlehem, Pa., 26 June 1746: Indian missionary in Monroe co.. Pa., 1752; sett. Bethabara, North Carolina (at Wacovia), Oct. 1753-1754, as the first Moravian minister in N.C.; sett. Kent, Conn., 1758-Oct. 1760; sett. Province Island, Nov. 1763-Mar. 1765; sett. Warwick (Lancaster) Pa., St. James's Chh. at Lititz, 1765-1780; sett. Bethlehem, Pa., May 1787-1808; sett. Hope (Warren) N.J., 1791- 1793; sett. Emaus (Lehigh) Pa., 1791-1808; Morav.; his wife Sarah was his assistant; d. Bethlehem, Pa., 20 Mar. 1808, a. 93.

name: Bernard Adam Grube
settled at: Warwick (Lancaster) Pa., St. James's Church at Lititz

name: John Guild
raw: JOHN GUILD, A.B., b. prob, at Wrentham, Mass., 23 Nov. 1712, son of John and Mercy (Foster) Guild; A.B., H.C, 1734; lie. 19 Sept. 1737; Ord. Hopewell, N.J., 11 Nov. 1741; sett. Hopewell, Pennington Chh., 1739-1787; sett. Lawrenceville, N.}., Maidenhead Chh., 1739- 1766; Presb.; d. Pennington, N.J., 10 July 1787.

name: Samuel Guldin
son of: Hans Joachim and Anna Maria (Koch) Gueldi
raw: SAMUEL GULDIN, bapt. Bern, Switzeriand, 8 Apr. 1664, son of Hans Joachim and Anna Maria (Koch) Gueldi; matric. U. of Bern, 1679; minister at Stettlen, Switzerland, Aug. 1692-1696; assistant minister at the Cathedral of Bern, 21 Dec. 1696-9 June 1699; but was dism. for Pietistic views; sett. Boltigen, Switzerland, 1701-1701; came in the ship "Maria Hope"; arriv. at Philadelphia, 23 Sept. 1710; preached at Philadelphia, Oley, Roxborough, and Germantown, Pa.; sett, i Dec. 1710, as magister and chaplain of the Pietist Community at Wissahickon, Pa.; later he resided at Roxborough, Philadelphia, Pa., as a farmer and preacher; he was the first recorded minister of the German Reformed faith to settle permanently in Pennsylvania, 1710; Germ. Ref.; d. Philadelphia, Pa., 31 Dec. 1745, a. 81.

name: Gottfried Haberecht
settled at: Nazareth (Northampton) Pa., Forks of the Delaware Church, , as a Moravian
raw: GOTTFRIED HABERECHT, b. Schoenheide, Lower Silesia, Germany, May 1700, of Lutheran parents; arriv. Savannah, Ga., 1735; came to Pa., 1738; sett. Nazareth (Northampton) Pa., Forks of the Delaware Chh., 1738-1739, as a Moravian; sett. Ephrata (Lancaster) Pa., 1739- Sept. 1741, as a Germ. Bapt. or Dunkard; sett. Bethlehem (Northampton) Pa., 1741-1743, as a Moravian, and was restored to full membership, 23 June 1742, in the Morav. fold; returned to Europe, Jan. 1743; missionary at Algiers, 1747-1748; at London, 1749; at Jamaica, W.I., 1754- 1759; sett. Bethlehem, Pa., 1759-1767; Germ. Bapt.; Morav.; d. Christian Spring, Pa., 26 Feb. 1767.

name: Gottfried Haberecht
settled at: Ephrata (Lancaster) Pa.,  Sept. , as a Germ. Bapt. or Dunkard

name: John Frederick Haeger
ordained: (Bsp. of London) 20 Dec. 1709, as an Ep.
son of: the Rev. Prof. John Henry and Anna Catharine (Friesenhagen) Haeger (his father having been the Germ. Ref. minister at Massanutton Chh., Germania Ford (Orange) Va., 1714-1718, and at Weaverville (Fauquier) Va., 1718-1733)
raw: JOHN FREDERICK HAEGER, bapt. Siegen, Westphalia, Germany, 28 Sept. 1684, son of the Rev. Prof. John Henry and Anna Catharine (Friesenhagen) Haeger (his father having been the Germ. Ref. minister at Massanutton Chh., Germania Ford (Orange) Va., 1714-1718, and at Weaverville (Fauquier) Va., 1718-1733); matric. Herborn, 5 July 1703; matric. Lingen, 1705; at U. of Lingen, 1705-14 Nov. 1707; lie. Siegen, 14 Feb. 1708; came to N.Y. with 2138 Palatine settlers. May 1709; Ord. (Bsp. of London) 20 Dec. 1709, as an Ep.; K.B. for N.Y., 5 Jan. 1709/10; arriv. N.Y., N.Y., 19 June 1710; sett. East Camp (Ulster) N.Y., 1710- 1721; Kaatsbaan (Ulster) N.Y., 1710-1721; Rhinebeck (Dutchess) N.Y., 1715-1721; West Camp (Ulster) N.Y., 1710-1721; Schoharie (Schoharie) N.Y., 1710-1721; chaplain, expedition to Canada, 1712; pioneer Germ. Ref. minister in N.Y. state; Germ. Ref.; Ep.; d. Albany, N.Y., 1721.

name: Gerardus Haeghoort
raw: GERARDUS HAEGHOORT, Ord. Amsterdam, Holland, 2 Apr. 1731 ; arriv. N.Y., N.Y., 24 July 1731; sett. Freehold (Monmouth) N.J., 1731-1735; Holmdel (Monm.) N.J., 1731-1735; Marlborough (Monm.) N.J., 1731-1735; Belleville (Essex) N.J., at Second River, 1735-1776; Dutch Ref.; d. ca. 1783.

name: John Hagen
settled at: Nazareth (Northampton) Pa., Church at the Forks of the Delaware
raw: JOHN HAGEN, arriv. Savannah, Ga., 18 May 1740; canae to Pa., Feb. 1742; Ord. Bethlehem, Pa., 1742; missionary to the Indians; sett. Nazareth (Northampton) Pa., Chh. at the Forks of the Delaware, 24 July 1742-1747; Morav.; d. Shamokin, Sunbury (Northampton) Pa., 1747-

name: John Valentine Haidt
raw: JOHN VALENTINE HAIDT, arriv. N.Y., N.Y., 15 Apr. 1754; sett. Philadelphia, Pa., 1754-1756; sett. Graceham (Frederick) Md., 1757- 1758; sett. Bethlehem, Pa., 1758-1780, as minister; painter; Morav.; d. Bethlehem, Pa., Jan. 1780.

name: Benjamin Hait
ordained: and inst. Amwell (Hunterdon) N.J., Chh. at Reaville, 4 Dec. 1755
raw: BENJAMIN HAIT, A.M., (or Hoit), b. Norwalk^ Conn.; A.B., Princeton, 1754, A.M.; Ord. and inst. Amwell (Hunterdon) N.J., Chh. at Reaville, 4 Dec. 1755; sett. Amwell, 1755-29 May 1765; Montgomery (Orange) N.Y., Good Will Chh., Nov. 1765-1769; Connecticut Farms (Union) N.J., 1769-1779; Presb.; d. Connecticut Farms, N.J., 27 June 1779.

name: Thomas Haliday
degrees: A.M., U. of Edinburgh, 1702), K.B. to N.J., 10 Oct. 1710
raw: THOMAS HALIDAY (or Halliday) (prob. A.M., U. of Edinburgh, 1702), K.B. to N.J., 10 Oct. 1710; sett. Perth Amboy (l^íiddlesex) N.J., St. Peter's Chh., 1711-1713, 1717-1718; Hopewell (Mercer) N.J., 1714- 1717; Elizabethtown (Union) N.J., St. John's Chh., 1714-1717; Piscataway (Middlesex) N.J., St. James's Chh., 1714-1718; Woodbridge (Middlesex) N.J., Trinity Chh., 1714-1718; Trenton (Mercer) N.J., 1711- 17Í7 and Shrewsbury (Monmouth) N.J., 1711-1717 occasional services at both places; he was removed from his ofiice as a trouble maker by Commissary Barclay, 1718; removed to Appoquinimink (New Castle) Del., 1718-1722; Ep.; d. bef. 22 May 1722.

name: Jeremiah Halsey
raw: JEREMIAH HALSEY, A.M., b. 1733; A.B., Princeton, 1752, A.M.; Tutor, 1757-1767; Trustee, Princeton, 1770-1780; Clerk, Board of Trustees, 1772; sett. Lamington (Somerset) N.J., Chh. at Bedminster, 17 Apr. 1770-1780; Presb.; d. Lamington, N.J., 2 Oct. 1780, a. 47.

name: Adam Hammaker
settled at: Mt. Joy (Lancaster) Pa., Great Swatara Church,  ff.
raw: ADAM HAMMAKER, sett. Mt. Joy (Lancaster) Pa., Great Swatara Chh., 1770 ff.; Germ. Bapt.; lay preacher.

name: Noah Hammond
raw: NOAH HAMMOND, b. Newton, Mass., 14 Feb. 1718, son of Isaac and Mary (Chamberlain) Hammond; Ord. New London, Conn., ca. 1748; sett. Brookhaven, L.I., N.Y., Coram Chh., 1749-1774; Bapt.; d. Coram, L.L, N.Y., 14 Nov. 1774, a. 56.

name: John Frederick Handschuch
raw: JOHN FREDERICK HANDSCHUCH, b. Halle, Saxony, Germany, 14 Jan. 1714; ed. Halle, I733-I737; U. of Leipzig, 1737; Ord. Altenberg, 1744; sett. Graba, Germany, 1744-1746; arriv. Philadelphia, 5 Apr. 1748; sett. Lancaster (Lane.) Pa., Holy Trinity Chhl, 3 May 1748- May 1750; Earl (Lane.) Pa., Chh. at New Holland, 1748-1749; Strasburg (Lane.) Pa., St. Michael's or Beaver Creek Chh., 1748-1751; Germantown, Pa., St. Michael's Chh., 20 May 1751-1764; Upper Dublin (Montgomery) Pa., Puff's Chh., 1754-1757; Philadelphia, Pa., St. Michael's Chh., 1756-1764; taught French and German at Philadelphia Academy, 1755-1758; Luth.; d. Philadelphia, Pa., 9 Oct. 1764, a. 50.

name: John Hanna
settled at: Alexandria (Hunterdon) N.J., Mt. Pleasant Church, May
raw: JOHN HANNA, A.M., M.D., A.B., Princeton, 1755, A.M.; M.D.; sett. Alexandria (Hunterdon) N.J., Mt. Pleasant Chh., May 1760-1801; Union (Hunterdon) N.J., Bethlehem Chh., 1761-1801; Kingwood (Hunterdon) N.J., Mt. Bethel Chh., 1763-1801; physician; Presb.; d. Alexandria, N.J., 4 Nov. 1801.

name: William Hanna
ordained: Albany, N.Y. (Presb.), 1761-May 1767 (Ep.) lie. for Culpeper co.. Va., 11 June 1772
raw: WILLIAM HANNA, A.M., b. Litchfield, Conn., ca. 1738; A.B., Columbia, 1759, A.M., 1765; A.M., Y.C., 1768; Ord. Albany, N.Y. (Presb.), 1761-May 1767; became an Ep.; Ord. (Ep.) by Bsp. of London, 1772; lie. for Culpeper co.. Va., 11 June 1772; K.B. for Va., 18 June 1772; sett. Culpeper co.. Va., 1772-1775; sett. Christ Chh. Parish (Queen Annes) Md., 1775; Westminster Parish, Md., 1778-1785; Annapolis, Md., St. Anne's Chh., 1779-1780; attorney and physician; Presb.-Ep.; d. Westminster Parish (Anne Arundel) Md., 1785, a. 48.

name: Jacob Rutsen Hardenburgh
raw: President JACOB RUTSEN HARDENBURGH, D.D., b. Rosendale (Ulster) N.Y., 1736, son of Col. Johannes and Maria (DuBois) Hardenburgh; A.M., Princeton, 1770; S.T.D., 1771; S.T.D., Columbia, 1789; original trustee of Rutgers Coll., 1770-1785; President, Rutgers Coll., 1785-1790; Ord. in America, 1758; sett. Raritan (Somerset), N.J., ist Chh. at Bridgewater, now Somerville, i May 1758-Oct. 1761, 1763- 1781; Bedminster (Som.) N.J., 1758-1761, 1763-1781; Harlingen (Som.) N.J., Chh. at Montgomery, 1758-1761; Neshanic (Som.) N.J., Chh. at Hillsborough, 1758-1761; Hillsborough (Som.) N.J., Chh. at Millstone, 1758-1781; Readington (Hunterdon) N.J., North Branch Chh., 1758- 1761, 1763-1781; supply at Conewago (Adams) Pa., Chh. at Hunterstown, 1770-1770; Marbletown, Rochester, Wawarsing and Rosendale, all in Ulster co., N.Y., 1781-1786; New Brunswick (Middlesex) N.J., 1785-1790; member, Prov. Cong., N.J., 10 June 1776; Dutch Ref.; d. New Brunswick, N.J., 30 Oct. 1790, a. 52 (GS).

name: Jacob Rutsen Hardenburgh
edited_raw: Rosendale, all in Ulster Co, N.Y.

name: Robert Harding
raw: ROBERT HARDING, S.J., b. Nottingham, England, 6 Oct. 1701; adm. S.J., 1722; came to America, 1732; sett. St. Thomas's Manor, Md., 173 2-1749; arriv. Philadelphia from England, Aug. 1749; sett. Concord (Chester) Pa., Chh. at Ivy Mills, 1749-1772; sett. Philadelphia, Pa., St. Joseph's Chh., 1749-1772; Macopin (Passaic) N.J., Chh. at Echo Lake, and missionary to N.J., 1762-1772; Philadelphia, Pa., St. Mary's Chh., 1763-1772; R.C; d. Philadelphia, Pa., i Sept. 1772, a. 70.

name: Robert Harding
settled at: Concord (Chester) Pa., Church at Ivy Mills

name: Robert Harding
settled at: Echo Lake, and missionary to N.J.

name: Samuel Harker
edited_raw: SAMUEL HARKER (or Harcour), of Huguenot extraction
raw: SAMUEL HARKER (or Harcour), of Huguenot extraction; Princeton U., non grad.; lie. 6 Nov. 1751; Ord. Roxbury (Morris) N.J., Succasunna Chh., 31 Oct. 1752-1763; Mount Olive (Morris) N.J., at Schooley's Mt., 1752-1763; Chester (Morris) N.J., at Black R.iver, 1752-1763; Succasunna (Morris) N.J., see Roxbury above; chaplain; Arminian; Presb.; will dated 22 Mar. 1764; d. at sea enroute to England.

name: John Harriman
degrees: A.M., bapt. New Haven, Conn., 24 Jan. 1647/8, son of John and Elizabeth Harriman A.B., H.C, 1667, A.M.
raw: JOHN HARRIMAN, A.M., bapt. New Haven, Conn., 24 Jan. 1647/8, son of John and Elizabeth Harriman; A.B., H.C, 1667, A.M.; sett. New Haven, Conn., 1670-1674, 1676-1682, 1683-1687; Southampton, L.L, N.Y., 1675-1676; East Haven, Conn., 1683; inst. Elizabethtown (Union) N.J., 30 Sept. 1687; sett. Elizabethtown, 1687-1705; Cong.; d. Elizabethtown, N.J., 20 Aug. 1705.

name: Henry Harrison
settled at: the Fort, N.Y., N.Y., , under Gov. Thomas Dongan
raw: HENRY HARRISON, b. Netherlands, of English parents; arriv. N.Y., N.Y., 1685; R.C. ehaplain at the Fort, N.Y., N.Y., 1685-1688, under Gov. Thomas Dongan; R.C.

name: William Harrison
edited_raw: Philadelphia, May , while Mr. Vieary was siek
SPG: missionary in N.J., 31 Aug. 1721| missionary, 1722-1723| missionary, 1722-1723
settled at: Staten Island, N.Y., St. Andrew's Church
raw: WILLIAM HARRISON, b. ea. 1678; Ord. Mar. 1720/1; S.P.G. missionary in N.J., 31 Aug. 1721; supply, Philadelphia, Pa., Christ Chh., May 1722-1722, while Mr. Vieary was siek; Hopewell (Mereer) N.J., S.P.G. missionary, 1722-1723; Lawrenee (Mereer) N.J., Maidenhead Chh., 1722-1723; Amwell (Hunterdon) N.J., St. Anne's Chh., 1722-1723; Alexandria (Hunterdon) N.J., St. Thomas's Chh., Kingwood, S.P.G. missionary, 1722-1723; Trenton, N.J., 1722-1723; sett. Staten Island, N.Y., St. Andrew's Chh., 1723-1739; Ep.; d. Staten Island, N.Y., 4 Oet. 1739.

name: Constant Hart
raw: CONSTANT HART, sett. Wantage (Sussex) N.J., prob, from 1763 to 1772, eertainly in 1770; Bapt.

name: John Hart
raw: JOHN HART, b. Whitney, eo. Oxford, England, 16 Nov. 1651; eame to Pa., preaehed among the Indians until 1691 ; sett. Southampton (Bueks) Pa., Keithian Bapt. Chh., 1697-1702; may have preaehed at Lower Dublin, Pa., Pennepaek Bapt. Chh., 1702 ff.; Keithian Bapt.; Bapt.; lay preaeher.

name: John Hart
settled at: Lower Dublin, Pa., Pennepaek Bapt. Church,  ff.

name: Joshua Hart
degrees: A.B., Prineeton, 1770, A.M.;A.M. (or Hartt), sett. Hempstead, L.L, N.Y., 1772-1776, 1787-1807
raw: JOSHUA HART, A.M. (or Hartt), b. Huntington, L.L, N.Y., 17 Sept. 1738; A.B., Prineeton, 1770, A.M.; Ord. 2 Apr. 1772; sett. Hempstead, L.L, N.Y., 1772-1776, 1787-1807; inst. Smithtown, L.L, N.Y., Chh. at Nissequoque, 29 Apr. 1774; sett. Smithtown, 1774-1787; dism. 6 Sept. 1787; sett. Fresh Ponds, L.L, N.Y., 1787-1829; Presb.; d. Fresh Ponds, L.L, N.Y., 3 Oet. 1829, a. 91.

name: Joshua Hart
settled at: Smithtown, L.L, N.Y., Church at Nissequoque

name: Oliver Hart
raw: OLIVER HART, A.M., b. Warminster (Bueks) Pa., 5 July 1723; A.M. (hon.) Brown, 1769; lie. 20 Dee. 1746; Ord. 18 Oet. 1749; inst. Charleston, S.C, 15 Feb. 1749/50; sett. Charleston, 1750-1780; inst. Hopewell, N.J., 16 Dee. 1780; sett. Hopewell, 1780-1795; Bapt.; d. Hopewell, N.J., 31 Dee. 1795, a. 72.

name: Jacob Hartman
ordained: East Lampeter (Laneaster) Pa., Mellingers meeting house, 1760
raw: JACOB HARTMAN, b. 1714; Ord. East Lampeter (Laneaster) Pa., Mellingers meeting house, 1760; sett. East Lampeter, 1760-1796; Menn.; d. East Lampeter, Pa., 18 Mar. 1796, a. 82.

name: John Christopher Hartwig
raw: JOHN CHRISTOPHER HARTWIG, b. Thueringen, Saxe Gotha, Germany, 6 Jan. 1714; Ord. London, England, 24 Nov. 1745; sett. Bedminster (Som.) N.J., St. Paul's Chh., 1745-1748; Raritan (Som.) N.J., 1745-1748; New Germantown (Hunterdon) N.J., Zion's Chh. at Tewksbury, 1745-1748; East Camp (Ulster) N.Y., Christ Chh., 1746-1760; Haekensaek (Bergen) N.J., 1748-1749; Mahway (Bergen) N.J., Ramapo Chh., 1748-1749; N.Y., N.Y., Holy Trinity Chh., 1748-1749, 1761, 1782; Saddle River (Bergen) N.J., Zion's Chh., 1748-1749; Rhinebeek (Dutehess) N.Y., 1749-1750; Hyde Park (Dutehess) N.Y., Wuertemberg Chh., 1749-1750; Upper Hanover (Montgomery) Pa., New Goshen- hoppen Chh., 1750-1751; Upper Providence (Montg.) Pa., Augustus Chh. at Trappe, 1751-1751; Exeter (Berks) Pa., Schwartzwald Chh., 1757-1759; Muhlenberg (Berks) Pa., Alsace Chh., I7S7-I7S9; Reading (Berks) Pa., 1757-1759; Frederick, Md., 1762-1763, 1768-1769; Winchester (Frederick) Va., Strasburg Chh., 1762, 1769, 1781; Boston, Mass., 1784; Waldoborough, Maine, 1784; chaplain in a German regt., ist French War and the French and Indian Wars; he left his large estate to found Hartwig Seminary, at Hartwig, Otsego co., N.Y., 1816; Luth.; d. Clermont, N.Y., 17 July 1796, a. 82.

name: John Christopher Hartwig
settled at: Upper Hanover (Montgomery) Pa., New Goshen hoppen Church

name: Thomas Harvey
raw: THOMAS HARVEY, S.J., arriv. N.Y., N.Y., Aug. 1683; sett. N.Y., N.Y., 30 Oct. 1683-1688, as Jesuit Chaplain to Gov. Col. Thomas Dongan of N.Y.; sett. St. Mary's City (St. Mary's) Md., 1688-1696; assumed name Smith occasionally to escape the penal code; R.C, d. St. Mary's City, Md., 1696, a. 84.

name: Bernard Michael Hausil
ordained: Luth. sett. Halifax, Nova Scotia, St. George's Parish, 1795- 1799
son of: the Rev. Bernard Hausil by Bsp. of London, 1785
raw: BERNARD MICHAEL HAUSIL, b. Heilbronn, Wuertemberg, Germany, 1727, son of the Rev. Bernard Hausil; arriv. Annapolis, Md., 1752; Ord. Luth.; sett. Frederick, Md., 1752-1759; Antietam (Washington) Md., 1754-1759; Chhs. in Berks co.. Pa., as follows: Exeter, Schwartzwald Chh., 1759-1762, Muhlenberg, Alsace Chh., 1759-1762, Perry, Zion's Chh., 1759-1763, Reading, Trinity Chh., 1759-1762; Easton (Northampton) Pa., St. John's Chh., 1763-1769; Upper Saucon (Lehigh) Pa., St. Paul's, Organ or Blue Chh., 1764-1769; Elizabethtown (Lane.) Pa., Christ Chh., 1766-1768; N.Y., N.Y., Holy Trinity Chh., 1770-1783, senior minister; Tory; beeame an Ep.; Ord. by Bsp. of London, 1785; sett. Halifax, Nova Scotia, St. George's Parish, 1795- 1799; Luth.-Ep.; d. Halifax, N.S., 9 Mar. 1799.

name: Hayger
raw: Domine HAYGER (Hege or Haeger), arriv. at Bethlehem, Pa., June 1749; Morav.

name: Samuel Heaton
raw: SAMUEL HEATON, b. New Haven, Conn., 9 Dec. 1709, son of Nathaniel Heaton; lie. North Castle (Westehester) N.Y., 28 May 1734; Presb.; d. Norwalk, Conn., Jan. 1736.

name: Samuel Heaton
raw: SAMUEL HEATON, b. Wrentham, Mass., 18 Nov. 1711, son of Samuel and Sarah Heaton; sett. N.J., ea. 1734; Ord. 1751; sett. Opequon Creek (Berkeley) now West Virginia, at Mill Creek, 1751-1754; Konolowa (Cumb.) Pa., 1754-1756; Cape May (Cape May) N.J., 1756-1760; Dividing Creek (Cumb.) N.J., 1761-1777; Bapt.; d. Dividing Creek, N.J., 26 Sept. 1777, a. 65.

name: Samuel Heaton
settled at: Opequon Creek (Berkeley) now West Virginia, at Mill Creek

name: John Egidius Hecker
son of: Johann Wigand and Anna Juliana Heeker
raw: JOHN EGIDIUS HECKER, b. Dillenburg, Nassau, Germany, 26 Jan. 1726, son of Johann Wigand and Anna Juliana Heeker; ed. Herborn U.; arriv. Philadelphia, 23 Sept. 1751; sett. Bedminster (Bueks) Pa., Tohiekon Chh., 19 Apr. 1756-Feb. 1762; Lehigh (Northampton) Pa., St. Paul's Chh., 1756-1765; and Driesbaeh Chh., 1756-1763; Lower Saueon (Northampton) Pa., 1756-1766; Moore (Northampton) Pa., Emmanuel Chh., 1756-1773; Springfield (Bucks) Pa., Trinity Chh., 1756-1766; Upper Milford (Lehigh) Pa., Zionsville Chh., 1757-1762; Allentown (Lehigh) Pa., Zion Chh., 1762-1765; Milford (Bucks) Pa., Lower Milford Chh. at Trumbaursville, 1762-1766; and prob. Heidelberg (Berks) Pa., Hain's or Cacusi Chh., 1762-1766; Germ. Ref.; d. Moore, Pa., Nov. 1773.

name: John Gottlieb Ernestus Heckewelder
raw: JOHN GOTTLIEB ERNESTUS HECKEWELDER, b. Bedford, England, 12 Mar. 1743, son of David and Regina Heckewelder; arriv. N.Y., N.Y., 15 Apr. 1754; Indian missionary at Muskingum, Ohio, 1762; in the Susquehanna valley. Pa., 1765; and in charge of the Mackiwihilusing mission; for 19 years he was a fellow laborer among the Indians with David Zeisberger; he was the founder of Salem, on the Tuscarawas, and his was prob, the first marriage of white people in the present state of Ohio; his name stands second only to that of David Zeisberger as a missionary to the Indians; Morav.; d. Bethlehem, Pa., 31 Jan. 1823.

name: Peter Heckman
ordained: and sett. Tulpehocken (Berks) Pa., Little Swatara Chh., 1770 ff.
raw: PETER HECKMAN, Ord. and sett. Tulpehocken (Berks) Pa., Little Swatara Chh., 1770 ff.; Germ. Bapt.

name: Matthew Hehlau
settled at: Warwick (Lancaster) Pa., St. James's Church at Lititz, Nov.
raw: Bishop MATTHEW G. HEHL, b. 1708; grad. Tuebingen U.; arriv. Bethlehem, 10 Dec. 1751; consecrated Bishop, 1751; assistant to Bishop Spangenberg, 1751-1752; Bishop in charge of the Moravian church in America, 1752; missionary in North Carolina, 22 Aug. 1756; sett. Warwick (Lancaster) Pa., St. James's Chh. at Lititz, Nov. 1756-1787; he also supervised Lititz; AUemaengel, in Lynn (Northampton) Pa.; Mill Creek, 12 miles from Heidelberg, Pa.; Muddy Creek, now Reamstown; Donegal, now Mt. Joy; Heidelberg, Oley, Lancaster and York, Pa.; Graceham and Carroll's Manor, Md.; Morav.; d. Lititz, Pa., 4 Dec. 1787, a. 79.

name: Matthew Hehlau
edited_raw: Heidelberg, Oley, Lancaster and York, Pa.

name: John Dietrich Matthias Heintzelman
raw: JOHN DIETRICH MATTHIAS HEINTZELMAN, b. Salswedel, Altenmark, Brandenburg, Germany, 1726, son of Dr. HÍeintzelman; ed. U. of Halle; Ord. Wernigerode, Saxony, 11 July 1751 ; arriv. Philadelphia, I Dec. 1751; sett. Philadelphia, Pa., St. Michael's Chh., 1751-1756; Luth.; d. Philadelphia, Pa., 9 Feb. 1756, a. 30.

name: John Conrad Albertus Helffenstein
son of: the Rev. Peter and Anna Margaretha (Dietz) (Helffrich) Helffenstein
raw: JOHN CONRAD ALBERTUS HELFFENSTEIN, b. Mosbach, Palatinate, Germany, 16 Feb. 1748, son of the Rev. Peter and Anna Margaretha (Dietz) (Helffrich) Helffenstein; matric. Heidelberg, 7 May 1764; Ord. 1771; arriv. N.Y., N.Y., 14 Jan. 1772; sett. Germantown, Pa., 1772-27 Dec. 1775, 1779-1790; Frankford, Pa., 1772-1775; sett. Lancaster, Pa., Jan. 1776-July 1779; clerk of the Coetus, 1779, 1787; president of the Coetus, 1781, 1788; Germ. Ref.; d. Germantown, Pa., 17 May 1790, a. 42.

name: John Henry Helffrich
son of: the Hon. John Peter and Anna Margaretha (Dietz) Helffrich
raw: JOHN HENRY HELFFRICH, b. Mosbach, Hessen, 22 Oct. 1739, son of the Hon. John Peter and Anna Margaretha (Dietz) Helffrich; matric. Heidelberg, 2 Feb. 1758; Ord. 22 Sept. 1761; sett, at Sinsheim, Rohrbach, Reyen, Kirchhard, Steinfurth, 1761-1771; arriv. N.Y., N.Y., 14 Jan. 1772; sett, the ff. chhs. in Berks co. Pa., Mar. 1772-1810: Maxatawny. De Longe Chh., and St. John's Chh. at Kutztown, Oley, Manatawny Chh.; and the ff. chhs. in Lehigh co. Pa., Mar. 1772-1810: Lowhill, Heidelberg, and Weisenberg, Ziegel's and Weisenberg Chhs.; Longswamp (Berks) Pa., 1775-1810; and the following chhs. in Lehigh CO. Pa.: Salisbury, Jerusalem Chh., 1779-1785; Upper Milford, Zionsville Chh., 1779-1810; Upper Macungie, St. Paul's Chh. at Trexlerstown, 1784-1810; Lower Macungie, Little Lehigh Chh. at Macungie, 1785-1810; and ilynn, Lynntown Chh. at Lynnville, 1804-1810; Germ. Ref.; d. Maxatawny (Berks) Pa., 5 Dec. 1810, a. 77 (GS).

name: John Henry Helffrich
edited_raw: the ff. chhs. in Lehigh co. Pa. : Lowhill, Heidelberg,

name: John Henry Helffrich
edited_raw: the following chhs. in Lehigh CO. Pa.: Salisbury

name: Justus Henry Christian Helmuth
settled at: Lancaster (Lane.) Pa., Holy Trinity Church, Whitsuntide
degrees: D.D., A.M. (hon.) Princeton, 1787, D.D. (hon.) 1787;A.M. (hon.) U. of Pa., 1780; D.D. (hon.) 1785; Prof, of German, U. of Pa., 1784 ff.
raw: JUSTUS HENRY CHRISTIAN HELMUTH, D.D., b. Helmstadt, Brunswick, Germany, 16 May 1745, son of John Christopher and Justina Helmuth; ed. Halle; A.M. (hon.) Princeton, 1787, D.D. (hon.) 1787; A.M. (hon.) U. of Pa., 1780; D.D. (hon.) 1785; Prof, of German, U. of Pa., 1784 ff.; Ord. Wernigerode, 1768; arriv. Philadelphia, 2 Apr. 1769; sett. Lancaster (Lane.) Pa., Holy Trinity Chh., Whitsuntide, 1769-25 May 1779; Elizabethtown (Lane.) Pa., Christ Chh., 1769-1771; Elizabeth (Lane.) Pa., Emmanuel Chh., 1774-1775; Strasburg (Lane.) Pa., St. Michael's or Beaver Creek Chh., 1769-1775; Philadelphia, Pa., Zion's and St. Michael's Chhs., Mar. 1780-1820; member. Am. Phil. Soc, 1784; Luth.; d. Philadelphia, Pa., 5 Feb. 1825, a. 80.

name: Samuel Hemphill
settled at: Philadelphia, Pa., first Presb. Church, May
raw: SAMUEL HEMPHILL, came from the Presbytery of Strabane, Ireland, 1734; sett. Philadelphia, Pa., ist Presb. Chh., May 1734-1734; tried and dropped for Arminianism in his sermons; Presb.

name: John William Hendel
degrees: D.D., matric. Heidelberg, 10 May 1759-10 Feb. 1762; D.D. (hon.) Princeton, 1787;
son of: John Jacob and Anna Sybilla (Otten) Hendel
raw: JOHN WILLIAM HENDEL, D.D., b. Duerkheim, Palatinate, Germany, 20 Nov. 1740, son of John Jacob and Anna Sybilla (Otten) Hendel; matric. Heidelberg, 10 May 1759-10 Feb. 1762; D.D. (hon.) Princeton, 1787; came to America, 1764; sett. Lancaster (Lane.) Pa., Jan. 1765-Sept. 1769; Pequea (Lane.) Pa., 1765-1769; Mt. Joy (Lane.) Pa., Miller's Chh., 1765-1769; Stephenstown (Frederick) Va., 1766- 1770; North Annville (Lebanon) Pa., Hill or Quittopehilla Chh., 1765- 1769; he preached, 1769-1782, to the ff. chhs. in Berks co. Pa.: Center, Lower Heidelberg, St. John's Chh., Tulpehocken, Host Chh., Upper Tulpehocken, Blue Mountain or North Kill Chh.; and during the same period, 1769-1782, to the ff. chhs. in Lebanon co. Pa.: Jackson, Muhlbach or MiUbach Chh., Mill Creek, Tulpehocken or Trinity Chh., Bethel, Heidelberg, Schaeffer's Chh.; also North Lebanon (Lebanon) Pa., St. Jacob's or Kimmerling Chh., and Swatara (Lebanon) Pa., 1771- 1782; thus in 1773, he was preaching to ten congregations; sett. Lancaster, Pa., Holy Trinity Chh., 1782-Feb. 1794; sett. Philadelphia, Pa., 9 Feb. 1794-1798; v.p.. Franklin Coll., 1787-1794; Près. Council, Germ. Ref. Chh., 1768, 1779, 1789 and 1791; Germ. Ref.; d. Philadelphia, Pa., 29 Sept. 1798, of yellow fever.

name: John William Hendel
settled at: North Annville (Lebanon) Pa., Hill or Quittopehilla Chh.

name: Matthew Henderson
raw: MATTHEW HENDERSON, b. Fifeshire, Scotland, 1735; Ord. Scotland, 1758; sett. Oxford (Chester) Pa., I7S8-I77S; Pencader (New Castle) Del., 1758-1775; later he went to Washington co. Pa., where he was preaching in Chartiers, Buffalo in Hopewell, Mingo in Union, and at Mill Creek, in 1782; Associate Presb.; d. Washington co. Pa., 2 Oct. 1795, a. 60.

name: James Hendricks
raw: JAMES HENDRICKS, sett. Hanover (York) Little Conewago, Pa., ca. 1770; Germ. Bapt.; lay preacher.

name: Gerhard Anthony Jacob Henkel
raw: GERHARD ANTHONY JACOB HENKEL, bapt. (as Anthony Jacob Henckel), at Mehrenberg, Germany, 27 Oct. 1668, son of George and Anna Eulalia (Dentzer) Henckel; a descendant of Count Henkel of Poeltzig; grad. in theol., U. of Giessen, 16 Mar. 1692; Ord. Eschelbronn, Germany, 28 Feb. 1692; sett, near Frankfort-on-the-Main, Germany; sett. Germanna (Orange) Va., Massanutton Chh., 1714-1716; returned to Germany, 1716; came to America, 1717; sett. Germantown, Pa., St. Michael's Chh., 1717-1728; new Hanover (Montgomery) Pa., Falkner's Swamp Chh., 1717-1728; Richmond (Berks) Moselem Chh., 1723-1728; Mill Creek (Lebanon) Pa., Reed's or Old Tulpehocken Chh., 1723-1728; Oley (Berks) Pa., Manatawny Chh., 1723-1728; Oley (Berks) Pa., Christ or Hill Chh., 1723-1728; Washington (Berks) Coldbrookdale Chh., 1723-1728; Rockland (Berks) Pa., Bieber Creek Chh., 1723-1728; in one or two instances, these were preaching stations before the chh. named above was organized; Luth.; d. Germantown, Pa., 12 Aug. 1728 (will dated the same day).

name: Frederick Levvis Henop
raw: FREDERICK LEVVIS HENOP, b. Kaiserslautern, Palatinate, 7 Oct. 1740, son of a minister; matric. Heidelberg, 29 Nov. 1758; arriv. in America, 1765; sett. Chhs. in Pa., 1765-1769: Durham (Bucks), Greenwich (Berks) Dunkel Chh.; and in Northampton co.. Dryland, Easton, Lehigh, St. Peter's Chh. and Plainfield, St. Peter's Chh.; Greenwich, N.J., 1765-1769; Frederick, Md., 8 Oct. 1769-Sept. 1784; Middletown (Frederick) Md., Zion or Kittatinny Mountain Chh., 1770-1784; Glades, Md., 1770-1784; Lovettsville (Loudoun) Va., 1770-1784; Stephenstown (Frederick) Va., 1770-1784; Strasburg (Shenandoah) Va., at Staufferstown, 1770-1784; Timberville, Va., Roeder's Chh., 1770-1784; Winchester (Frederick) Va., 1770-1784; Woodstock (Shenandoah) Va., at Millerstown, 1770-1784; Germ. Ref.; d. Frederick, Md., late in Sept. 1784.

name: Ar Vid Hernborn
settled at: Philadelphia, Pa., Gloria Dei or Wicacoa Church, ca.
raw: AR VID HERNBORN, sett. Philadelphia, Pa., Gloria Dei or Wicacoa Chh., ca. 1720; Sw. Luth.

name: Frederick Emanuel Hermann
raw: FREDERICK EMANUEL HERMANN (or Herrmann), came from Herrnhay, Germany; arriv. N.Y., N.Y., 12 June 1748; sett. Bethlehem, Pa., 1748-1755; Philadelphia, Pa., ca. 1760; warden, 1752; Moravian.

name: Christian Herr
settled at: West Lampeter (Lane.) Pa., at Willow Street
son of: the Rev. Hans and Elizabeth (Kendig) Herr
raw: Bishop CHRISTIAN HERR, b. Switzerland, son of the Rev. Hans and Elizabeth (Kendig) Herr; Ord. in Europe; arriv. Philadelphia, Sept. 1710; sett. West Lampeter (Lane.) Pa., at Willow Street, 1710-1735; Menn.; d. after 1735.

name: Hans Herr
raw: Bishop HANS HERR, b. Switzerland, 17 Sept. 1639, son of Emanuel Herr; came to Pa., Sept. 1710, with his four sons; sett. West Lampeter, Pa., 1710-1725; he patented land at Pequea, Pa., 23 Oct. 1710; ist Bishop on the Pequea River; Menn.; d. Pa., 11 Oct. 1725, a. 86.

name: Hans Herr
raw: HANS HERR, son of Hans Herr and grandson of Bishop Hans Herr; Ord. Strasburg (Lane.) Pa., 1739; sett. Strasburg, Pa., 1739-1783; Providenee (Lane.) Pa., Blaek Horse Chh., 1739-1783; Menn.; d. Pequea, Pa., 1783.

name: John Herr
raw: Bishop JOHN HERR, son of Emanuel and Maudlin (Braekbill) Herr, and grandson of Bishop Hans Herr; Ord. 1740; sett. Strasburg (Lane.) Pa., 1740-1797; Menn.; d. Strasburg, Pa., 1797.

name: Samuel Herr
raw: SAMUEL HERR, arriv. N.Y., N.Y., 22 June 1748; sett. Bethel (Lebanon) Pa., 1752-1756; sett. York (York) Pa., 1758-1760; Moravian.

name: Abraham Hershey
settled at: East Hempfield (Lane.) Pa., Church at Rohrerstown
raw: ABRAHAM HERSHEY, brother of Bishop Benjamin Hershey and Benediet Hershey; eame to Laneaster eo. Pa., 1719; sett. East Hempfield (Lane.) Pa., Chh. at Rohrerstown, 1719-1733; West Lampeter (Lane.) Pa., Chh. at Willow Street, 1719-1733; Menn.; d. after 1733.

name: Andrew Hershey
raw: ANDREW HERSHEY, b. Switzerland, 1702, brother of Bishop Christian Hershey, removed to the Palatinate, Germany; eame to Laneaster, Pa., 1719; sett. East Hempfield, Pa., Rohrerstown, Chh. (perhaps 1719-1792, but eertainly before 1775-1792); sett. East Hempfield, Millersville Chh., 1757-1792; sett. Manor (Lane.) Pa., 1775-1792; Menn.; d. Rohrerstown, Pa., 1792, a. 90.

name: Benedict Hershey
raw: BENEDICT HERSHEY, brother of Bishop Benjamin Hershey and Abraham Hershey, sett. West Lampeter (Lane.) Pa., 1719-1733; Menn.; d. after 1733.

name: Benjamin Hershey
raw: Bishop BENJAMIN HERSHEY, Senior, b. 1697, son of Bishop Christian Hershey; minister and Bishop in Europe; eame to Laneaster eo. Pa., 1717; sett. East Hempfield (Lane.) Pa., Rohrerstown Chh., 1717-1789; East Hempfield, Millerstown Chh., 1757-1789; Manor (Lane.) Pa., Masonville Chh., 1739-1789; Menn.; d. Rohrerstown, Pa., 29 July 1789, a. 92.

name: Benjamin Hershey
edited_raw: Junior, son of Bishop Benjamin Hershey
settled at: East Hempfield (Lane.) Pa., at Rohrerstown, before
raw: Bishop BENJAMIN HERSHEY, Junior, son of Bishop Benjamin Hershey; sett. East Hempfield (Lane.) Pa., at Rohrerstown, before 1775-1812; Ord. Bishop, 1789, to sueceed his father; Menn.; d. R.ohrerstown. Pa., 1812.

name: Christian Hershey
settled at: East liempfield (Lane.) Pa., Church at Rohrerstown
raw: Bishop CHRISTIAN HERSHEY, brother of Bishop Benjamin and Andrew Hershey, appears to have come over perhaps in 1708, and to be sett, at Manor in 1725 as minister; he eertainly eame over, perhaps the seeond time, arriving at Philadelphia, 3 Sept. 1739; sett. East liempfield (Lane.) Pa., Chh. at Rohrerstown, 1708-1725; Manor (Lane.) Pa., at Habeekers meeting house, 1739-1799; Manor, Masonville Chh., before 1757-1799; he was the first minister at East Hempfield; Menn.; d. Manor, Pa., ea. 1799.

name: John Henry Hertzer
raw: JOHN HENRY HERTZER, b. Wuertemberg, Germany; eame to Ameriea from Herrnhut, and arriv. N.Y., N.Y., 26 Nov. 1743; sett. Graeeham (Frederiek) Md., 1745-1745; Warwick (Lane.)
