Pa., 1745, at Lititz, minister in rural distriets; Lynn (Lehigh) Pa., Allemaengel Chh., 1747-1747; Morav.; d. Quittopehille (Lebanon) Pa., May 1748.

name: Jacob Hertzler
settled at: Upper Bern (Berks) Pa., North Kill or Blue Mountain Church, near Hamburg
raw: Bishop JACOB HERTZLER, b. Switzerland, 1709; Ord. in Switzerland; came to Pa., 1749; sett. Upper Bern (Berks) Pa., North Kill or Blue Mountain Chh., near Hamburg, 1749-1770; first Amish Bishop in America; d. near Hamburg, Pa., 1770.

name: Andrew Hesselius
raw: ANDREW HESSELIUS, nephew of Bishop Svedberg; sett. Chester (Del.) Pa., Chh. at Upland, 1713-1723; Wilmington, Delaware, Old Swedes Chh., 1713-1723; Hwitler Kill, Pa., St. James's Chh., 1720-1723, as S.P.G. missionary; sett. Gagnef, Sweden, 1723 ff. ; Sw. Luth.

name: Samuel Hesselius
settled at: Philadelphia, Pa., Gloria Dei or Wicacoa Church
raw: SAMUEL HESSELIUS, b. Delacarlien, Sweden; nephew of Bishop Svedberg; Ord. Skara, Sweden, 27 Apr. 1718; arriv. Philadelphia, 3 Dec. 1719; sett. Philadelphia, Pa., Gloria Dei or Wicacoa Chh., 1719-1723; Southampton (Bucks) Pa., Neshaminy Dutch Ref. Chh., at Churchville, 1719-1721 ; Molatton (Berks) Pa., Sw. Luth. Chh., now St. Gabriel's Ep. Chh. at Manathanim, Douglassville, 1720-inst. Oct. 1723-1731; New Hanover (Montgomery) Pa., Falkner's Swamp Luth. Chh., 1720- 1723; Wilmington, Del., Old Swedes Chh., 1723-1731; Chester (Del.) Pa., Sw. Luth. Chh. at Upland, 1723-1731; Chester, Pa., St. Paul's Ep. Chh., 1726-1728; returned to Sweden after 10 Oct. 1731; sett. Rumfertuna (Westeras) Sweden, 1731; Sw. Luth.

name: John George Heydecker
raw: JOHN GEORGE HEYDECKER, arriv. Bethlehem, Pa., 25 June 1742; sett. Falkner's Swamp Chh., 1742-1742; Morav.; d. Falkner's Swamp, Pa., 10 Sept. 1742; buried at Bethlehem.

name: Johannes Hildebrand
raw: JOHANNES HILDEBRAND, b. Germany, 1679; well educated; came early to Germantown, Pa.; sett. Ephrata (Lane.) Pa., 1739-1765; wrote pamphlets against the Moravians, 1743; Germ. Bapt.; d. Ephrata, Pa., 1765.

name: Henry Hirtzel
settled at: Maxatawny (Berks) Pa., St. John's Church at Kutztown
raw: HENRY HIRTZEL, sett. Maxatawny (Berks) Pa., St. John's Chh. at Kutztown, 1770-1772; Lynn (Lehigh) Pa., Ebenezer Congregation and Jaeob's Chh., 1772 ff.; Long Swamp (Berks) Pa., and Little Lehigh, 1774-1780; he was a mason by trade; Germ. Ref.

name: Jeremiah Hobart
raw: JEREMIAH HOBART, A.M., b. Hingham, England, 6 Apr. 1631, son of the Rev. Peter Hobart; A.B., H.C, 1650, A.M.; sett. Wells, Me., 1667; Ord. Topsfield, Mass., 2 Oet. 1672-1680; dism. 21 Sept. 1680; inst. Hempstead, L.I., N.Y., 17 Oct. 1683-1691; inst. Haddam, Conn., 14 Nov. 1700, as the ist minister; Haddam, Conn., 1691-1715; Cong.; d. Haddam, Conn., 6 Nov. 1715, a. 84.

name: Jonathan Hobart
raw: JONATHAN HOBART, Y.C., 1724; sett. Trenton (Mereer) N.J., ca. 1724; Presb.

name: Joshua Hobart
raw: JOSHUA HOBART, A.M., b. England, ca. 1628, son of the Rev. Peter Hobart; A.B., H.C, 1650, A.M.; preached at Beverly, Mass., 1650-1655; preached at Barbadoes, and then went to London; returned and was Ord. Southold, L.L, N.Y., 7 Oct. 1674-1717; Cong.; d. Southold, L.L, N.Y., 28 Feb. 1716/7, a. 88.

name: John Jacob Hoch
raw: JOHN JACOB HOCH, prob, came from Rotenberg, Hessen; matric. Marburg 22 Sept. 1712; Ruling Elder and lay preacher at Lancaster, 1733-1736; Ord. Lancaster (Lane.) Pa., 20 June 1736-1737; sett. Ephrata (Lane.) Pa., 1736-1737; Germ. Ref.

name: George Lewis Hochheimer
raw: GEORGE LEWIS HOCHHEIMER, arriv. America, i Nov. 1755; sett. York (York) Pa., Christ Chh., 1756-1758; Sandy Run (Lexington) S.C, Chh. at Saxe Gotha, 1765-1774; Luth.; d. after 1774.

name: George Lewis Hochheimer
settled at: Sandy Run (Lexington) S.C, Church at Saxe Gotha

name: John Jacob Hochreutiner
raw: JOHN JACOB HOCHREUTINER, b. St. Gall, Switzeriand, 27 Apr. 1721, son of a minister; ed. St. Gall; lie. 16 Dec. 1743; Ord. Amsterdam, Holland, 15 Nov. 1747; arriv. Philadelphia, 13 Aug. 1748; assigned to Lancaster, Pa., 1748; Germ. Ref.; d. Philadelphia, Pa., 14 Oct. 1748, by the explosion of a gun.

name: Christopher Hoepfner
raw: CHRISTOPHER HOEPFNER, came from Halle, Germany, to Bethlehem, Pa., ca. i Feb. 1748; Ord. deacon, 1756; Morav.; d. Santa Cruz, Dec. 1760.

name: Balthasar Hoffman
raw: BALTHASAR HOFFMAN, b. Harpersdorf, Silesia, 1687, son of Christopher and Ursula (Anders) Hoffman; sett. Vienna, 5 May 1721- 1726; came to Pa., 12 Sept. 1734; sett. Lower Salford (Montgomery) Pa., Schwenkfelder Community, ï 740-1775; 2nd Schwenkfelder minister in America; d. Salford, Pa., 11 July 1775, a. 89.

name: John Holbrooke
edited_raw: Maurice River (Cumb.) N.J. and Greenwich in Cohansey, N.J.
raw: JOHN HOLBROOKE, grandson of the Rev. John Holbrooke, A.M., of Oriel Coll., Oxford, 1661; Ord. by Bsp. of Coventry and Litchfield, 1722; curate of Chilcot, Derbyshire, England, 1722; K.B. for N.J., 23 Dec. 1723; arriv. in N.J., 1724; S.P.G. missionary at Salem (Salem) N.J., St. John's Chh., 1724-1728, 1736; Maurice River (Cumb.) N.J. and Greenwich in Cohansey, N.J., 1724-1728; St. George's Parish (Harford) Md., 1725-1726; Hungar's Parish (Northampton) Va., Oct. 1729-1747; Ep.; d. Hungar's Parish, Va., 1747.

name: Israel Holgh
raw: ISRAEL HOLGH, sett. Wilmington, Del., Old Swedes Chh., 1644- 1646; Tinicum (Bucks) Pa., New Goeteborg Chh., 1647-1650; Sw. Luth.

name: William Hollingshead
degrees: D.D., A.B., U. of Pa., 1770 D.D., Princeton, 1793
raw: WILLIAM HOLLINGSHEAD, D.D., b. Philadelphia, Pa., 8 Oct. 1748, son of William Hollingshead; A.B., U. of Pa., 1770; D.D., Princeton, 1793; Ord. Fairfield (Cumberland) N.J., chh. at Cohansey, 1773- 1783; sett. Charleston, S.C, Independent Cong. Chh., 1783-1Ô17; Cong.; d. Charleston, S.C, 26 Jan. 1817, a. 67 (GS).

name: Elkana Holmes
raw: ELKANA HOLMES, lie. Kingwood (Hunterdon) N.J., 2 Apr. 1774; Ord. Kingwood, N.J., 1775; sett. Knowlton (Warren) N.J., 22 Aug. 1775 ff.; sett. North River (Warren) N.Y.; Bapt.

name: Holstead
raw: Mr. HOLSTEAD (or Halstead), sett. Fishkill (Dutchess) N.Y., 1745 ff.; Bapt.

name: James Honeyman
son of: the Rev. James and Mary (Leask) Honeyman
raw: JAMES HONEYMAN, b. Kinneff, Kincardinshire, Scotland, ca. 1675, son of the Rev. James and Mary (Leask) Honeyman; Ord. bef. 22 Mar. 1702/3; Chaplain, British Navy, 1704; missionary, S.P.G., at Jamaica, L.L, N.Y., Grace Chh., 1704-1704; sett. Newport, R.L, Trinity Chh., 1704-1750; his portrait hangs in Trinity Chh.; Ep.; d. Newport, R..I., 2 July 1750.

name: Henry Hook
raw: HENRY HOOK, b. Ireland; Ord. Ireland, 1718; sett. Fairfield (Cumberland) N.J., Cohansey Chh., 1718-1722; Greenwich (Cumb.) N.J., 1718-1722; New Castle, Del., ist Chh., 1723-1726; inst. Drawyer's Creek, Del., 14 Sept. 1724-1741; Appoquinimink (New'l Castle) Del., 1724-1741; Chester Town (Kent) Md., 1737-1741; Presb.; d. Drawyer's Creek, Del., 1741.

name: Andrew Horne
raw: ANDREW HORNE, arriv. N.Y., N.Y., 25 Oct. 1744; Ord. deacon, 1755; sett. Salisbury (Lehigh) Pa., Chh. at Emaus, 1751-1752; at Crown Inn, 15 Sept. 1757 ff.; wife Dorothy also ordained; Moravian.

name: Nicholas Hornell
raw: NICHOLAS HORNELL, b. Sweden; sett. Hoeoer, Scania, Sweden; Ord. London, England, 1747; arriv. York, Pa., 8 July 1763; sett. York (York) Pa., Christ Chh., 8 July 1763-30 June 1765; Hellam (York) Pa., iCreutz Creek Chh., 1763-1765; Lower Windsor (York) Pa., 1763-1765; West Manchester (York) Pa., St. Paul's or Wolf's Chh., 1763-1765; retired from the ministry, 1765; Luth.

name: Azariah Horton Gs
settled at: Madison (Morris) N.J., Bottle Hill Church, Nov.
son of: Jonathan and Mary (Tuthill) Horton by Presbytery of N.Y., 1741
raw: AZARIAH HORTON, A.M., b. Southold, L.L, N.Y., 20 Mar. 1715, son of Jonathan and Mary (Tuthill) Horton; A.B., Y.C., 1735, A.M.; Ord. by Presbytery of N.Y., 1741; sett. New Providence (Union) N.J., 1740-1741; Southampton, L.L, N.Y., missionary to the Shinnecock Indians, 1741-1751; supply, Southampton, L.L, N.Y., 1750-1751; Smithñeld (Monroe) Pa., Indian missionary at Shawnee, 1741-1750; sett. Madison (Morris) N.J., Bottle Hill Chh., 1752-Nov. 1776; res. Chatham, N.J.; Presb.; d. Chatham, N.J., of smallpox, 27 Mar. 1777, a. 62 (GS). ;,

name: Simon Horton
raw: SIMON HORTON, A.M., b. Southold, L.L, N.Y., 30 Mar. 1711, son of Joshua and Elizabeth (Grover) Horton; A.B., Y.C, 1731, A.M.; Ord. Connecticut Farms (Union) N.J., Sept. 1735; sett. Connecticut Farms, N.J., Sept. 1734-1746; sett. Newtown, L.L, N.Y., 1746-1772, 1775- 1786; sett. West Indies, 1774; Presb.; d. Newtown, L.L, N.Y., 8 May 1786, a. 75.

name: Nathaniel Horwood
settled at: Salem, N.J., , but the incumbent remained
raw: NATHANIEL HORWOOD, A.M., b. 1680, son of Edward Horwood of Westminster, London; matric. Trinity Coll., Oxford,î 13 Oct. 1699, a. 19; A.B., 1703, A.M., 1706; Rector, Bundleigh, Devonshire, England, 1712-1726; K.B. for N.Y., 30 Aug. 1726; was to have been settled at Salem, N.J., 1726, but the incumbent remained; sett. Burlington (Burlington) N.J., St. Anne's, now St. Mary's, Chh., 1727-1730; Ep.; d. Burlington, N.J., 28 July 1730.

name: Nathaniel Horwood
settled at: Burlington (Burlington) N.J., St. Anne's, now St. Mary's, Church

name: Jacob Hostetter
raw: Bishop JACOB HOSTETTER, b. ca. 1682; Ord. Switzerland; preacher and Bishop in Europe; came to America, ca. 1712; sett. East Hempfield (Lane.) Pa., Rohrerstown Chh., 1712-1761; East Hempfield, Millersville Chh., 1757-1761; Pequea (Lane.) Pa., Chh. at New Danville, 1717-1761; Pequea, Byerland Chh., 1747-1761; Menn.; d. Manor township (Lane.) Pa., 1761.

name: Michael Houdin
settled at: Trenton (Mercer) N.J., St. Michael's Church, June
ordained: by the Archbishop of Trêves, Easter, 1730
raw: MICHAEL HOUDIN, A.M., b. France, 1705; Ord. priest by the Archbishop of Trêves, Easter, 1730; Superior at a Convent of Franciscans, Montreal, Canada; became an Ep., Easter, 1747; sett. Trenton (Mercer) N.J., St. Michael's Chh., June 1750-1757; S.P.G. missionary, I Nov. 1750; Amwell (Hunterdon) N.J., St. Andrew's Chh., 1753-1755; AUentown (Monmouth) N.J., Christ Chh., 1750-1753; Alexandria (Hunterdon) N.J., St. Thomas's Chh., Kingwood, 1750-1757; missionary visits also to Burlington, Bethlehem, and Greenwich (Cumb.), N.J., 1750-1757; chaplain and interpreter at the taking of Quebec, 29 Apr. 1757-28 Nov. 1758; also chaplain, 6 Feb. 1759-June 1761; New Rochelle (Westchester) N.Y., Trinity Chh., 20 Aug. 1761-1766; R.C; Fr. Huguenot;'Ep.; d. New Rochelle, N.Y., Sept. 1766.

name: Michael Houdin
edited_raw: missionary visits also to Burlington, Bethlehem, and Greenwich (Cumb.), N.J.

name: William Housel
raw: WILLIAM HOUSEL, b. Neuritt, Germany, 1728; sett. Amwell (Hunterdon) N.J., after 1760; Germ. Bapt.

name: Joseph Houston
ordained: Elk River (Cecil) Md., The Rock Chh., 15 Oct. 1724
raw: JOSEPH HOUSTON, b. Ireland; ed. in Scotland; Ord. Elk River (Cecil) Md., The Rock Chh., 15 Oct. 1724; sett. Elk River, 1724-1739; sett. Montgomery (Orange) N.Y., at Wallkill, Good Will Chh., Jan. 1739/40-1740; Presb.; d. Wallkill, N.Y., 29 Oct. 1740.

name: Joseph Houston
settled at: Montgomery (Orange) N.Y., at Wallkill, Good Will Church, Jan.

name: Alexander Howie
raw: ALEXANDER HOWIE, K.B. for Pa., 11 Feb. 1730/1; S.P.G. missionary; sett. Whitemarsh (Montgomery) Pa., St. Thomas's Chh., 24 June 1733-1741; Oxford (Chester) Pa., Trinity Chh., 1733-1741; resigned 1741 ; Lower Providence (Montg.) Pa., St. James's Chh. at Evansburg, 1734-1741; went to the West Indies, 1741; Ep.

name: John Hubbard
raw: JOHN HUBBARD, A.M., b. Boston, Mass., 9 Jan. 1676/7, son of John and Ann (Leverett) Hubbard; A.B., H.C, 1695, A.M.; Ord. 1698; sett. Jamaica, L.L, N.Y., 1702-1705; Presb.; d. Jamaica, L.L, N.Y., 5 Oct. 1705, a. 28.

name: Nathaniel Hubbell
raw: NATHANIEL HUBBELL, A.M., b. Fairfield, Conn., 11 Aug. 1702, son of Richard and Hannah (Sillaway) Hubbell; A.B., Y.C., 1723, A.M.; sett. Westfield (Union) N.J., 1727-1745; Hanover (Morris) N.J., Whippany Chh., 1727-1730; and the following missionary stations (later chhs.) in Morris co., N.J., 1727-1730: Morristown, chh. org. 1742; Chatham, at Madison, chh. org. 1747; and Hanover, at Parsippany, chh. org. 1760; Presb.; d. Lebanon (Hunterdon) N.J., 1760.

name: Griffith Hughes
degrees: A.M., matric. St. John's Coll., Oxford, 16 May 1729, a. 22 A.B., A.M., 1748
raw: GRIFFITH HUGHES, A.M., b. Merionethshire, Great Britain, 1707, son of Edward Hughes of Towyn; matric. St. John's Coll., Oxford, 16 May 1729, a. 22; A.B., A.M., 1748; came to Pa., 1732/3; sett. Caernarvon (Lane.) Pa., Bangor Chh., 1732/3-25 June 1736; S.P.G. missionary at Newtown (Del.) Pa., St. David's Chh. at Radnor, 1733-1736; and Lower Providence (Montgomery) Pa., St. James's Chh. at Evansburg, 1733-1736; Ep.; returned to England, 1736.

name: John Hughes
settled at: Newtown (Del.) Pa., St. David's Church at Radnor, , perhaps as an asst. to Griffith Hughes
raw: JOHN HUGHES, sett. Newtown (Del.) Pa., St. David's Chh. at Radnor, 1733-1736, perhaps as an asst. to Griffith Hughes; Ep.

name: Hugston Hughes
settled at: Cape May (Cape May) N.J., Church at Cold Spring
raw: HUGSTON HUGHES, sett. Cape May (Cape May) N.J., Chh. at Cold Spring, 1726-1727; Presb.

name: Philip Hughes
chaplain: of the 44th regt, of Foot, 1759. (See Philip Hughes, there may be some eonneetion here.)
degrees: D.D., in Colonial Clergy of Maryland, p. 49
raw: PHILIP HUGHES, eame from the dioeese of Waterford, Ireland; appointed to serve at Perth Amboy (Middlesex) N.J., 1759, but deelined; Chaplain of the 44th regt, of Foot, 1759. (See Philip Hughes, D.D., in Colonial Clergy of Maryland, p. 49; there may be some eonneetion here.)

name: John Humphrey
degrees: A.B., sizar. Trinity Coll., Dublin, 13 Nov. 1699, a. 16 A.B., 1704
son of: Dr. Thomas Humphreys by Bsp. of London, 1710
raw: JOHN HUMPHREY(S), A.B., b. Limerick, Ireland, 1683, son of Dr. Thomas Humphreys; sizar. Trinity Coll., Dublin, 13 Nov. 1699, a. 16; A.B., 1704; sehoolmaster, N.Y., 1706-1710; Ord. by Bsp. of London, 1710; K.B. for Pa., 3 Nov. 1710; sett. Oxford (Chester) Pa., Trinity Chh., 1711-1713, 1718-1719; S.P.G. missionary at Chiehester (Delaware) Pa., 1713-1714, Marlborough (Chester) Pa., 1715-1726, Newtown (Del.) Pa., St. David's Chh. at Radnor, 1717-1718; sett. Chester (Del.) Pa., St. Paul's Chh., 1714-1726; Coneord (Del.) Pa., St. John's Chh., 1714-1726; Mareus Hook (Del.) Pa., St. Martin's Chh., 1724- 1729; St. George's Parish (Harford) Md., 1724-1725; Annapolis (Anne Arundel) Md., St. Anne's Chh., 11 Feb. 1724/5-1739; Ep.; d. Annapolis, Md., 8 July 1739, a. 53.

name: Andrew Hunter
raw: ANDREW HUNTER, Ord. Greenwieh (Cumberland) N.J., 4 Sept. 1746; sett. Greenwieh, 1746^1775; Deerfield (Cumb.) N.J., 1746-1760; New Side Presb.; d. Greenwieh, N.J., 28 July 1775.

name: Jonathan Hunting
son of: the Rev. Nathaniel and Mary (Green) Hunting
raw: JONATHAN HUNTING, bapt. Easthampton, L.L, N.Y., 24 Oet. 1714, son of the Rev. Nathaniel and Mary (Green) Hunting; Y.C, 1735; asst. to his father at Easthampton, L.L, N.Y., but not sett, on aceount of ill health; Presb.; d. Hartford, Conn., 3 Sept. 1750, a. 36.

name: Nathaniel Hunting
raw: NATHANIEL HUNTING, A.M., b. Dedham, Mass.,, 15 Nov. 1675, son of John and Elizabeth (Payne) Hunting; A.B., H.C., 1693, A.M.; Ord. Easthampton, L.L, N.Y., 13 Sept. 1699; sett. Easthampton, 1696- 1746; dism. 19 Sept. 1746; Presb.; d. Easthampton, L.I.,'N.Y., 21 Sept. I7S3-

name: Nathaniel Huntting
degrees: A.M., bapt. Easthampton, L.L, N.Y., 6 Sept. 1702, son of the Rev. Nathaniel and Mary (Green) Hunting, A.B., 1722, A.M.
raw: NATHANIEL HUNTTING, 3rd., A.M., bapt. Easthampton, L.L, N.Y., 6 Sept. 1702, son of the Rev. Nathaniel and Mary (Green) Hunting, A.B., 1722, A.M.; he began preaehing but ill health required the relinquishment of his ministry; Captain, N.Y., militia; Presb.; d. Easthampton, L.L, N.Y., 18 July 1770, a. 68 (GS).

name: Traugott Frederick Illing
arrived: Pa., 11 Sept. 1772, but eontinued to serve Lutheran ehhs.
raw: TRAUGOTT FREDERICK ILLING, sett. Elizabethtown (Lane.) Pa., Christ Chh., 1758-1766; he is said to have beeome an Ep., and did reeeive K.B. for Pa., 11 Sept. 1772, but eontinued to serve Lutheran ehhs.; sett. Lower Swatara (Dauphin) Pa., St. Peter's Chh. at Middletown, 1773-1788; Pequea (Lane.) Pa., St. John's Chh., 15 Apr. 1784- 1788; Luth.; Ep.

name: Traugott Frederick Illing
settled at: Lower Swatara (Dauphin) Pa., St. Peter's Church at Middletown

name: Charles Inglis
degrees: D.D., came to America, 1755 A.M., Oxford, 6 Apr. 1770 D.D., Oxford, 25 JFeb. 1778
raw: Bishop CHARLES INGLIS, D.D., b. Glenkilcar, Donegal, Ireland, ca. 1734, son of the Rev. Archibald Inglis; came to America, 1755; A.B. (hon.) Columbia, 1767, A.M., Oxford, 6 Apr. 1770; D.D., Oxford, 25 JFeb. 1778; schoolmaster in America, 1756; Ord. London, 1759; K.B. for Pa., 10 Jan. 1759; sett. Kent co. Delaware chhs., 1759-1765: Dover, Christ Chh., Smyrna, St. Peter's Chh., Mispillion, Christ Chh., and Milford, Christ Chh.; sett. N.Y., N.Y., Trinity Chh., 6 Dec. 1765-1783; 1st Bsp. of Nova Scotia, 12 Aug. 1787-1816; Ep.; d. Halifax, N.S., 24 Feb. 1816, a. 82.

name: John William Ingold
son of: the Rev. John William Ingold, senior
raw: JOHN WILLIAM INGOLD, b. Simmern, near Coblenz, Germany, 4 Oct. 1734, son of the Rev. John William Ingold, senior; matric. H^eidelberg, 4 Aug. 1754; Ord. Heidelberg, 10 May 1762; sett. London, Eng., 1774; arriv. Pa., 1774; sett. Lower Salford (Montgomery) Pa., Reiff's or Skippack Chh., 1774-1775; Whitpain (Montg.) Pa., Boehm's Chh., 7 Nov. 1774-13 Aug. 1775; Worcester (Montg.) Pa., Wentz's or Skippack Chh., 1774-1775; Greenwich (Warren) N.J., 1775-1785; Easton (Northampton) Pa., 1775-1785; Dryland (Northampton) Pa., 1776-1786; Lehigh (Northampton) Pa., St. Paul's Chh., 1776-1786; Plainfield (Northampton) Pa., St. Peter's Chh., 1776-1780; Upper Salford (Montgomery) Pa., Old Goshenhoppen Chh., 1780-1781; Reading (Berks) Pa., Nov. 1786-Apr. 1788; Rockhill (Bucks) Pa., Indianfield Chh., Apr. 1788-1790; Bedminster (Bucks) Pa., Tohickon Chh., Apr. 1788-1790; Milford (Bucks) Pa., Lower Milford Chh. at Trumbauersville, Apr. 1788-1790; Spier's Chh. (Berks) Pa., 1790-1793; Amity (Berks) Pa., 1791-1796; excluded, 1801; Germ. Ref.; d. after 1801.

name: John William Ingold
settled at: Lower Salford (Montgomery) Pa., Reiff's or Skippack Chh.

name: John William Ingold
settled at: Worcester (Montg.) Pa., Wentz's or Skippack Chh.

name: John William Ingold
settled at: Upper Salford (Montgomery) Pa., Old Goshenhoppen Chh.

name: John William Ingold
settled at: Milford (Bucks) Pa., Lower Milford Chh. at Trumbauersville, Apr.

name: Alexander Innis
raw: Dr. ALEXANDER INNIS, b. Aberdeenshire, Scotland; prob. grad. of the U. of Aberdeen, 1666/1683; arriv. N.J., 1686; Chaplain to the English chh. at the Fort, N.Y., N.Y., 20 Apr. 1686-20 Aug. 1689; sett. Middletown (Monmouth) N.J., Christ Chh., 28 Oct. 1700-1713; Perth Amboy (Middlesex) N.J., St. Peter's Chh., 1709-1713 ; Freehold (Monm.) N.J., 28 Oct. 1700-1713; Shrewsbury (Monm.) N.J., Christ Chh., 28 Oct. 1700-1713; called doctor, prob, a physician; will made 27 July 1713; Ep.; d. Perth Amboy, N.J., ca. i. Aug. 1713.

name: Nathaniel Irwin
degrees: A.B., Princeton, 1770, A.M.; A.M., William & Mary Coll., Va.
raw: NATHANIEL IRWIN, A.M., b. Fagg's Manor (Chester) Pa., 17 Oct. 1756; William & Mary Coll., Va.; A.B., Princeton, 1770, A.M.; Ord. Warwick (Bucks) Pa., Neshaminy Chh., 3 Nov. 1774-1812; moderator of the General Assembly, 1801; Presb.; d. Neshaminy, Pa., 3 Mar. 1812, a. 56.

name: Jesse Ives
raw: JESSE IVES, A.M., b. Meriden, Conn., 2 Apr. 1738, son of John and Hannah (Royce) Ivés; A.B., Y.C, 1758, A.M.; Ord. Sprague, Conn., Norwich, 8th Society, 1766; sett. Sprague, Conn., 1766-1770; inst. Southold, L.L, N.Y., 14 Oct. 1772-1773; inst. Monson, Mass., 23 June 1773; sett. Monson, 1773-1805; Cong.; d. Monson, Mass., 31 Dec. 1805, a. 68.

name: William Jackson
degrees: A.M., A.M., U. of Utrecht A.M., Columbia, 1761 A.M., Y.C, 1763 A.M., Princeton, 1771
raw: WILLIAM JACKSON, A.M., b. 1732; A.M., U. of Utrecht; A.M., Columbia, 1761; A.M., Y.C, 1763; A.M., Princeton, 1771; original trustee of Rutgers C; Ord. Amsterdam, Holland, 10 Sept. 1757; sett. Bergen, N.J., and Staten Island, N.Y., Chh. at Port Richmond, 1757- 10 Dec. 1789; and Staten Island, Richmond Chh. (Union of French, Dutch and English Reformed Chhs.), 1757-1776; emeritus, 1789-1813; Dutch Ref.; d. Bergen, N. J., 25 July 1813.

name: Thomas James Jr
son of: the Rev. Thomas and Elizabeth James
raw: THOMAS JAMES, JR., b. England, ca. 1620, son of the Rev. Thomas and Elizabeth James; sett. Easthampton, L.L, N.Y., 1651-1696; Cong.; d. Easthampton, L.L, N.Y., 1696.

name: Nathaniel Jenkins
raw: NATHANIEL JENKINS, b. Cardigan, Wales, 25 Mar. 1678; came to America, 1710; sett. Cape May (Cape May) N.J., I1712-1747; Cohansey (Salem) N.J., ist Bapt. Chh., 1730-1754; Bapt.; d. Cohansey, N.J., 2 Jan. 1754.

name: Nathaniel Jenkins Jr
son of: the Rev. Nathaniel and Esther (Jones) Jenkins
raw: NATHANIEL JENKINS, JR., b. Wales, 11 Apr. 1710, son of the Rev. Nathaniel and Esther (Jones) Jenkins; Ord. 1747; sett. Cape May, N.J., 1747-1769; Bapt.; d. Cape May, N.J., 1769.

name: Robert Jenney
son of: Archdeacon Henry Jenney, D.D., of Dromore
raw: Commissary ROBERT JENNEY, LL.D., b. Waneytown, co. Armagh, Ireland, 1687, son of Archdeacon Henry Jenney, D.D., of Dromore; pensioner. Trinity Coll., Dublin, 13 Oct. 1704, a. 16; A.B., 7 Mar. 1709/10; Ord. 8 June 1710; Chaplain, Royal Navy, 1710-1714; K.B. for Pa., 27 June 1714; Philadelphia, Pa., Christ Chh., 1714-June 1715; S.P.G. missionary to N.Y., 1715-1717; asst., N.Y., N.Y., Trinity Chh., appointed, 5 Mar. 1714/5; sett. Trinity Chh., 29 June 1715-1722; Chaplain at the Fort, N.Y., N.Y., 1715-1722; Rector, Rye, N.Y., Christ Chh., 17 June 1722-19 May 1726; Bedford (Westchester) N.Y., St. Matthew's Chh., 1722-1726; Greenwich, Conn., 1722-1725; Hempstead, L.L, N.Y., St. George's Chh., i July 1726-1742; Philadelphia, Pa., Christ Chh., 8 Nov. 1742-1762; Bishop's Commissary in Pa., 4 Jan. 1742/3-1762; Ep.; d. Philadelphia, Pa., 5 Jan. 1762, a. 75.

name: Rasmus Jensen
chaplain: of a Danish expedition from Denmark, which sailed for America, 9 May 1619
raw: RASMUS JENSEN, b. Denmark; Chaplain of a Danish expedition from Denmark, which sailed for America, 9 May 1619; ist Lutheran minister in America; d. 20 Feb. 1619/20, buried on American soil.

name: Jonathan Jerman
settled at: Warwick (Chester) Pa., at French Creek, church at East Nantmeal
raw: JONATHAN JERMAN, b. Cohansey, N.J., 20 Oct. 1740; Ord. Piscataway, N.J., 4 July 1772; sett. Warwick (Chester) Pa., at French Creek, chh. at East Nantmeal, 1772-1778; sett. Cohansey, N.J., 1778- 1789 ff.; 7th Day Bapt.; d. Cohansey, N.J., after 1789.

name: Jacob Joder
raw: JACOB JODER (or Yoder), lay preacher, sett. Oley (Berks) Pa., 1770ff.; Germ. Bapt.

name: Isaac Jogues
raw: ISAAC JOGUES, S.J., b. Orleans, France, 10 Jan. 1607; adm. S.J., 24 Oct. 1624; Prof, at Rouen; Ord. 1636; missionary to Canada, 1636; tried to establish a mission among the Mohawks, but was taken prisoner by them, 3 Aug. 1643 at Ossernenon (now Auriesville, Montgomery- co. N.Y.); escaped; rescued by the Dutch; to Albany, N.Y., where assisted by Dutch traders, he reached New Amsterdam (now New York City), and was sent by the Dutch to France, 1643 ; he returned to Canada, 1644; established near Fonda (Montgomery) N.Y., the "Mission of the Martyrs," among the Mohawks; then visited Canada; returning to his mission, he was captured, tortured and killed, the first of many martyrs; R.C; killed by the Indians at Auriesville on the Mohawk River, N.Y., 18 Oct. 1646.

name: Timothy Johnes
raw: TIMOTHY JOHNES, D.D., b. Southampton, L.L, N.Y., 24 May 1717, son of Deacon Samuel and Esther (Stephens) Johnes; A.B., Y.C., 1737, A.M., D.D., 1783; Trustee, Princeton, 1748-1788; Ord. Morristown (Morris) N.J., 9 Feb. 1742/3-1794; sett. Newburgh (Orange) N.Y., 1766-1767; New Windsor (Orange) N.Y., 1766-1767; Presb.; d. Morristown, N.J., 15 Sept. 1794, a. 78 (GS).

name: Jacob Johnson
ordained: Ledyard, Conn. (2nd Chh. in Groton), 10 June 1749-Oct. 1772
raw: JACOB JOHNSON, A.M., b. Wallingford, Conn., 7 Apr. 1713, son of Sgt. Jacob and Abigail (Hitchcock) Johnson; A.B., Y.C, 1740, A.M., 1763; Ord. Ledyard, Conn. (2nd Chh. in Groton), 10 June 1749-Oct. 1772; Indian missionary; sett. Wilkes-Barre (Luzerne) Pa., 11 Dec. 1772-1778, 1781-1797; Cong.; Presb.; d. Wilkes-Barre, Pa., 15 Mar. 1797. (See N.E.H.G. Register, 55: 370-371).

name: Nicholas Johnson
raw: NICHOLAS JOHNSON (Claus Jansen), b. 1658; came to Germantown, 1686; sett. Skippack (Montgomery) Pa., 1702-1745; Menn.; d. Skippack, Pa., 1745.

name: Samuel Johnson
ordained: West Haven, Conn. (Cong. Chh. at Orange), 20 Mar. 1719/20-1722 London, Eng., 31 Mar. 1723
degrees: D.D., A.B., Y.C, 1714, A.M. A.M., U. of Cambridge, 1723 A.M., U. of Oxford, 1723, D.D., 1743
raw: President SAMUEL JOHNSON, D.D., b. Guilford, Conn., 14 Oct. 1696, son of Deacon Samuel and Mary (Sage) Johnson; A.B., Y.C, 1714, A.M.; Tutor, 1715-1719; A.M., U. of Cambridge, 1723; A.M., U. of Oxford, 1723, D.D., 1743; Ord. West Haven, Conn. (Cong. Chh. at Orange), 20 Mar. 1719/20-1722; became an Ep.; Ord. London, Eng., 31 Mar. 1723; K.B. for N.E., 28 June 1723; sett. Stratford, Conn., Christ Chh., 1723-1754, 1764-1772; Huntington, Conn., Chh. at Ripton, 1740-1754; first President, Columbia U., 1754-1763; sett. N.Y'., N.Y., Trinity Chh., 1753-1763; Cong.; Ep.; d. Stratford, Conn., 6 Jan. 1772, a. 76.

name: Samuel Johnson
ordained: New Lebanon (Columbia) N.Y., Cong. Chh. of Christ, Nov. 1772-1776
raw: SAMUEL JOHNSON, A.M., b. near Durham, Conn., Sept. 1744; A.B., Y.C, 1769, A.M.; Ord. New Lebanon (Columbia) N.Y., Cong. Chh. of Christ, Nov. 1772-1776; sett. West Stockbridge, Mass., 177&- 1779; became a Shaker, 1780; Cong.; Shaker; d. New Lebanon, N.Y., 14 May 1835, a. 91.

name: William Johnson
degrees: A.M., A.B., Y.C, 1748, A.M. A.M., H.C, 1753 A.M., Oxford, 1756 A.M., Cambridge, 1756
raw: WILLIAM JOHNSON, A.M., b. Stratford, Conn., 9 Mar. 1730/1, son of the Rev. Samuel Johnson, D.D.; A.B., Y.C, 1748, A.M.; A.M., H.C, 1753; A.M., Oxford, 1756; A.M., Cambridge, 1756; Ord. London, Eng. (Bsp. of Carlisle), 25 Mar. 1756; K.B. for N.Y., 14 Apr. 1756; Ep.; d. London, England, 20 June 1756, a. 25.

name: David Jones
chaplain: 3rd regt. Pa. Continental Line, 1776-1781, and eligible officer of the Society of the Cincinnati in the state of Pa.
settled at: Tredyffryn (Chester) Pa., Great Valley Bapt. Church, Apr. lyy
ordained: Upper Freehold, N. J., Crosswicks Bapt. Chh., 12 Dec. 1766-1775
raw: DAVID JONES, A.M., b. White Clay Creek, Del., 12 May 1736, son of Morgan and Eleanor (Evans) Jones; ed. Hopewell School; A.M. (hon.) Brown, 1774; He. 1761; Ord. Upper Freehold, N. J., Crosswicks Bapt. Chh., 12 Dec. 1766-1775; sett. Tredyffryn (Chester) Pa., Great Valley Bapt. Chh., Apr. lyy^-iyyo, 1792-1820; Chaplain, 3rd regt. Pa. Continental Line, 1776-1781, and eligible officer of the Society of the Cincinnati in the state of Pa.; chaplain, 1794, and in the War of 1812; Bapt.; d. East Town (Chester) Pa., 5 Feb. 1820, a. 83.

name: Eliphalet Jones
son of: the Rev. John and Susannah Jones
raw: ELIPHALET JONES, b. Concord, Mass., 9 Jan. 1640, son of the Rev. John and Susannah Jones; H.C, but did not graduate; sett. Greenwich, Conn., 2 Feb. 1669/70-1672; Ord. Stamford, Conn., 1673; sett. Huntington, L.L, N.Y., Jan. 1676-1731; Cong.; d. Huntington, L.L, N.Y., 5 June 1731, a. 90.

name: Jenkin Jones
raw: JENKIN JONES, b. Llanfernach, Pembroke, Wales, 1690; came to America, 1710; sett. Welsh Tract, Del., 1724-1725; sett. Lower Dublin, Pa., Pennypack Bapt. Chh., 1725-1746; sett. Philadelphia, Pa., Bapt. Chh., 1725-1761; the Bapt. Chh. of Philadelphia was constituted 14 May 1746; Bapt.; d. Philadelphia, Pa., 16 July 1761.

name: Jenkin Jones
settled at: Lower Dublin, Pa., Pennypack Bapt. Church

name: Joshua Jones
raw: JOSHUA JONES, b. Newcastle, Pembroke, Wales, 1721; came to America, 1726; Ord. New Britain (Bucks) Pa., 1761-1795; resigned 1795; sett. Rockhill (Bucks) Pa., 1761-1795; Bapt.; d. New Britain, Pa., 26 Dec. 1802.

name: Malachi Jones
raw: MALACHI JONES, b. Wales, 1651; adm. Presbytery of Philadelphia, 9 Sept. 1714; Ord. Wales bef. Sept. 1714; inst. Bensalem (Bucks) Pa., and Northampton (Bucks) Pa., 22 Apr. 1719; sett. Bensalem (Bucks) Pa., Dutch Ref. Chh., 1714-1719, 1719-1723; Northampton (Bucks) Pa., D.R. Chh., 1714-1723; Southampton (Bucks) Pa., Neshaminy D.R. Chh. at Churchville, 1714-1721; Tredyffryn (Chester) Pa., Great Valley Chh., 1714-1720; Abingdon (Montgomery) Pa., Presb. Chh., 1714-1729; Norriton (Montgomery) Pa., Presb. Chh., 1714-1727; Germantown, Pa., D.R. Chh., 1714-1719; will proved I25 Mar. 1729; Dutch Ref. and Presb.; d. Abingdon, Pa., 25 Feb. 1729Î a. 79.

name: Morgan Jones
son of: John Davicl of Trethuen, CO. Monmouth, Wales, matric. Jesus Coll., Oxford, i June 1636, a. 16
raw: MORGAN JONES, A.B., b. 1618, son of John Davicl of Trethuen, CO. Monmouth, Wales, matric. Jesus Coll., Oxford, i June 1636, a. 16; A.B., 12 Dec. 1639; vicar in Undy, co. Monmouth, Wales, 1661; lived among the Indians on the Virginia coast, 1669; on 8 Apr. 1670, set sail for Port Royal, S.C., but eight months later started back for Virginia, but fell in with Maj. Gen. Richard Bennett of Nansemond co. Va., and served as his chaplain; was in Somerset co. Md., 1678, having been a member of Maj. Samuel Appleton's co.. King Philip's War, July 1676; sett. Staten Island, N.Y., 1676-1682; East Chester and ¡West Chester, N.Y., 1678-1688; sett. Newtown, L.L, N.Y., 17 Dec. 1678-1704, when he resigned; Presb.; living 1704.

name: Morgan Jones
edited_raw: lived among the Indians on the Virginia coast

name: Samuel Jones
ordained: Lower Dublin, Pa., Pennypack Bapt. Chh., 23 Oct. 1706
raw: SAMUEL JONES, b. Llanddewi, Radnor, Wales, 9 July 1657; came to America, 1686; called to the ministry, 1697; Ord. Lower Dublin, Pa., Pennypack Bapt. Chh., 23 Oct. 1706; sett. Lower Dublin, 1697-1722; sett. Philadelphia, Pa., Bapt. Chh., 1698-1722; Bapt.; d. Bristol, Pa., 16 Dec. 1722 (GS).

name: Samuel Jones
chaplain: of a Pa. regt, in the Rev. War
settled at: Lower Dublin, Pa., Pennypack Bapt. Church
degrees: D.D., came to America, 1737 A.B., U. Pa., 1762, A.M. D.D., Brown, 1786 D.D., U. of Pa., 1788;A.M. (hon.) Brown, 1769, a founder of Brown U.;
son of: the Rev. Thomas and Martha (Morris) Jones
raw: SAMUEL JONES, D.D., b. Cefyn-y-Gelli, Bettws Parish, Glamorgan, Wales, 14 Jan. 1735, son of the Rev. Thomas and Martha (Morris) Jones; came to America, 1737; A.B., U. Pa., 1762, A.M.; A.M. (hon.) Brown, 1769, D.D., Brown, 1786; D.D., U. of Pa., 1788; a founder of Brown U.; Ord. Philadelphia, Pa., 2 Jan. 1763; sett. Lower Dublin, Pa., Pennypack Bapt. Chh., 8 Jan. 1763-1814; Southampton (Bucks) Pa., 1763-1770; Chaplain of a Pa. regt, in the Rev. War; Bapt.; d. Philadelphia, Pa., 7 Feb. 1814.

name: Thomas Jones
raw: THOMAS JONES, b. Newton Notage, Glamorgan, Wales, 1701; arriv. in America, 22 July 1737; Ord. Cumru (Berks) Pa., Tulpehocken Chh. 1740; sett. Cumru, Pa., 1738-1774; Spring (Berks) Pa., Bapt. Chh. at Sinking Spring, 1740-1744; Bapt.; d. Great Valley, Pa., 22 Mar. 1788, a. 87 (GS).

name: William Jones
raw: WILLIAM JONES, asst. minister at Easthampton, L.L, N.Y.,1693- 1696; Cong.

name: John George Jung
raw: JOHN GEORGE JUNG, ed. at Halle; arriv. in America, 1768; sett. Heidelberg (Lehigh) Pa., 1768-1768; North Whitehall (Lehigh) Pa., Schlosser's Chh., 1769-1772; South Whitehall (Lehigh) Jordan Chh., 1769-1772; Chambersburg (Franklin) Pa., St. John's Chh., 1770-1783; Whitehall (Lehigh) Pa., Egypt Chh., 1771-1773; Guilford (Franklin) Pa., Grindstone Hill Chh., 1772-1783; Antietam (Washington) Md., 1773-1785; Hagerstown (Washington) Md., St. John's Chh., 1773-1793; Luth.; living 1793.

name: Michael Jung
edited_raw: Indian missionary to New Gnadenhuetten (Tuscarawas) Ohio
raw: MICHAEL JUNG, b. 5 Jan. 1743; came to America, 1751, and to Bethlehem (Northampton) Pa., 1767; sent as Indian missionary to New Gnadenhuetten (Tuscarawas) Ohio; Morav.; d. Lititz, Pa., 1828.

name: John George Jungman
raw: JOHN GEORGE JUNGMAN, b. Hoehenheim, Baden, Germany, 19 Apr. 1720, son of Johann Dietrieh Jungman; came as a boy to Oley (Berks) Pa., 1731; res. Bethlehem (Northampton) Pa., 1745; Indian missionary, 1770-1785; sett. Gnadenhuetten (Tuscarawas) Ohio, 1746— 1754; sett. Pachgatgoch (near Kent, Connecticut), 1754-1758; sett. Christiansbrunn, near Nazareth, Pa., Wyalusing (Bradford) Pa., and Lanuntutenmunk; and Schoenbrunn, Ohio, 1770-1777, 1781-1785; his wife, Anna Margaret (Bechtel) Buettner, was his assistant; Morav.; d. Bethlehem, Pa., 17 July 1808, a. 88.

name: Peter Kalm
raw: Professor PETER KALM, b. Finland, 1715; sett. Swedesborough (Gloucester) N.J., 1748-1749; Swedish botonist; author: "A Journey to North America."; Sw. Luth.; d. Abo, Finland, 16 Nov. 1779.

name: John William Kals
raw: JOHN WILLIAM KALS, b. 1700; came from Julich; matric. Leyden U., 25 Aug. 1745, a. 45; minister in Surinam; arriv. Philadelphia, 1756; stated supply, Philadelphia, Pa., 1756-1757; Amwell (Hunterdon) N.J., 1757-1759; Lebanon (Hunterdon) N.J., Rockaway Chh. at Clinton, 1757-1759; Fairmount (Hunterdon) Fox Hill, Tewksbury, Raritan Chh., 1757-1759; N.Y., N.Y., Germ. Ref. Chh., 1759-1760; Germ. Ref.; d. Reading, Pa., 1763.

name: Herman Kasdorf
raw: HERMAN KASDORF, came from Altona, Germany, 4 Mar. 1700; Ord. Germantown, Pa., 20 Apr. 1708; sett. Germantown, Pa., 1708- 1725; Menn.; d. Germantown, Pa., bef. 20 Apr. 1725.

name: George Kaske
raw: GEORGE KASKE, Ord. Bethlehem, Pa., 1747; missionary at Berbice. South America, 1745-175 2; sett. Bethlehem, 1742; returned to Pa.; Morav.; d. Nazareth, Pa., 1795.

name: Elias Keach
ordained: sett. Lower Dublin, Pa., Pennypack Bapt. Chh., 1688-1692
son of: the Rev. Benjamin Keach of London by Mr. Dungan
raw: ELIAS KEACH, b. 1667, son of the Rev. Benjamin Keach of London; came to America, 1686; Ord. by Mr. Dungan; sett. Lower Dublin, Pa., Pennypack Bapt. Chh., 1688-1692; Burlington, N.J., Bapt. Chh., 1690-1692; returned to England, 1692; sett. London, England, 1692- 1699; Bapt.; d. London, England, 1699.

name: Jacob Keagy
raw: JACOB KEAGY, sett. Heidelberg (York) Pa.; was a minister before 14 May 1775, as shown by a deed of that date; Menn.

name: George Keith
ordained: minister of the Chh. of Scotland, ca. 1663 returned to America as one of the first S.P.G. missionaries, 1702-1704
son of: the Rev. George Keith of Kecoughtan Parish, Va., ca. 1636), ed. U. of Aberdeen, ca. 1653-1657 by the Society of Friends, 1692 by the Bishop of London, as an Ep. priest, March 1702
raw: GEORGE KEITH, A.M., b. Peterhead, Aberdeenshire, Scotland, ca. 1638/9, (poss. a grandson of the Rev. George Keith of Kecoughtan Parish, Va., ca. 1636), ed. U. of Aberdeen, ca. 1653-1657; A.M.; Ord. minister of the Chh. of Scotland, ca. 1663; became a [member of the Society of Friends (Quakers), 1674; came to N.E., N.J., and other colonies, 1682, 1688, 1690; schoolmaster and preacher in Philadelphia, Pa., 1689, 1691; in 1692 he instigated a separatist faction among the Society of Friends called Christian Quakers, or Keithian or Anglican Quakers; and was disowned by the Society of Friends, 1692; returned to London, 1694; became an Ep.; Ord. by the Bishop of London, as an Ep. priest, March 1702; returned to America as one of the first S.P.G. missionaries, 1702-1704; preached at Perth Amboy, 3 Oct. 1702-2 Jan. 1704; Shrewsbury, 1702; Piscataway, 1702; Elizabethtown, 1703; Woodbridge, 1703-1703, all in N.J.; and at Kecoughtan Chh., Elizabeth River Parish, V^a., 1703; as well as at many other places in the colonies; his faction was of no permanent importance, except that it gave a strong impetus towards integration among the Society of Frierlds; returned to England; vicar of St. Andrew's Chh., Edburton, Sussex, England, 1705- 1711; Presb.; Friend; Ep.; d. Edburton, Sussex, England, 27 Mar. 1716.

name: George Keith
settled at: Kecoughtan Church, Elizabeth River Parish, V

name: George Keith
settled at: many other places in the colonies

name: George Keith
edited_raw: St. Andrew's Church, Edburton, Sussex, England

name: Erasmus Kelley
raw: ERASMUS KELLEY, A.M., b. Perkasie (Bucks) Pa:, 24 July 1748; A.B., U. of Pa., 1769, A.M., 1783 ; A.M., Brown, 1772; sett. Southampton (Bucks) Pa., 13 May 1770-Aug. 1771; Ord. Newport, R.I., 1st Bapt. Chh., 9 Oct. 1771; sett. Newport, R.I., 1771-1783; preached in Conn., Warren, R.I.; and Pa., 1783-1784; Bapt.; d. Newport, R.L, 7 Nov. 1784.

name: Johannes Kelpius
raw: JOHANNES KELPIUS, A.M., b. Halwegen, Segesvar, Transylvania, 1673, son of the Rev. George Kelp; A.M. (Ph.D.), U. of Altdorf, 1689; arriv. Philadelphia, Pa., 23 June 1694; sett. Theosophical Community, Wissahickon, Pa., 1694-1708; Pietist; d. bef. 1 Mar. 1708/9, a. 35.

name: Robert Kelsey
raw: ROBERT KELSEY, b. near Drummore, Ireland, 1711; arriv. in Md., 1734; came to Cohansey, N.J., 1738; lie. 1743; Ord. Cohansey (Salem) N.J., 1st Bapt. Chh., 1750; sett. Cohansey, 1756-1789; Bapt., d. Cohansey, N.J., 30 May 1789.

name: Samuel Kennedy
ordained: Baskmg Ridge (Somerset) N.J., at Bernard, 26 June 1751-1787
raw: SAMUEL KENNEDY, A.M., M.D., b. Scotland, 1720; ed. U. of Edinburgh; A.B., Princeton, 1754, A.M., 1760; lie. 1748; Ord. Baskmg Ridge (Somerset) N.J., at Bernard, 26 June 1751-1787; Amwell (Hunterdon) N.J., at Reaville, 1769-1787; Cumberiand (Adams) Pa., Upper Marsh Creek Chh., at Gettysburg, 1771-1772; physician and teacher; Presb.; d. Basking Ridge, N.J., 31 Aug. 1787, a. 67 (GS).

name: Kennipe
settled at: Canajoharie (Montgomery) N.Y., D.R. Church at Minden
raw: Domine KENNIPE, sett. Canajoharie (Montgomery) N.Y., D.R. Chh. at Minden, 1775-1779; Dutch Ref.

name: Elisha Kent
raw: ELISHA KENT, A.M., b. Suffield, Conn., 9 July 1704, son of John and Abigail (Dudley) Kent; A.B., Y.C, 1729, A.M.; Ord. Newtown, Conn., 27 Sept. 1732; sett. Newtown, 1732-1743; dism., 25 Feb. 1742/3; sett. Carmel (Putnam) N.Y., 1743-1749; sett. South East (Putnam) N.Y., Philippi Chh., 1743-1776; Cong.; d. South East, N.Y., 17 July 1776, a. 72 (GS).

name: Nathan Ker
raw: NATHAN KER, A.B., b. Basking Ridge, N.J., ca. 1735, of Scotch descent; A.B., Princeton, 1761; sett. Springfield (Union) N.J., 1763- 1765; sett. Goshen (Orange) N.Y., 1766-1804; Chaplain, Continental Army, Rev. War; Presb.; d. Goshen, N.Y., 14 Dec. 1804, a. 69 (GS).

name: John Michael Kern
son of: John Leonard and Anna Eva Kern
raw: JOHN MICHAEL KERN, b. Mannheim, Germany, 31 Aug. 1730, son of John Leonard and Anna Eva Kern; matric. Heidelberg, 21 Nov. 1753; sett. Heidelberg, Germany, 1763; arriv. N.Y., N.Y., Sept. 1763; sett. N.Y., N.Y., Germ. Ref. Chh., i763-inst.-27 Jan. 1764-1771; Montgomery (Orange) N.Y., D.R. Chh., 1771-1778; Hanover (Ulster) N.Y., 1775-1775; Halifax, Nova Scotia, 1778-1787; Rhinebeck (Dutchess) N.Y., G.R. Chh., 1787-1787; Bedminster (Bucks) Pa., Tohicon Chh., May 1787-1788; Rockhill (Bucks) Pa., Indianfield Chh., 1782- 1788; Germ. Ref.; d. Rockhill, Pa., 22 Mar. 1788.

name: John Michael Kern
settled at: N.Y., N.Y., Germ. Ref. Church, inst.

name: Abraham Ketteltas
degrees: A.M., (or Keteltas), A.B., Y.C, 1752, A.M. A.M., Princeton
raw: ABRAHAM KETTELTAS, A.M., (or Keteltas), b. N.Y., N.Y., 26 Dec. 1732, son of Abraham and Jane (Jacobs) Ketteltas; A.B., Y.C, 1752, A.M.; A.M., Princeton; Ord. Elizabethtown (Union) N.J., Presb. Chh., 14 Sept. 1757; sett. Elizabethtown, N.J., 1757-Sept. 1760; Hempstead, L.L, N.Y., Presb. Chh., 1760-1765; Jamaica, L.L, N.Y., D.R. Chh., 1760-1762; N.Y., N.Y., French Ref. Chh. of the Saint Esprit, Sept. 1766-Apr. 1776; Chairman, Committee of Correspondence, Dec. 1774; delegate to N.Y. State Congress, 1777; preached in English, Dutch and French; French Ref.; Presb.; d. Jamaica, L.L, N.Y., 30 Sept. 1798, a. 65 (GS).

name: Thomas Killingsworth
raw: THOMAS KILLINGSWORTH, b. (prob.) Norwich, England; Ord. in England; sett. Cohansey (Salem) N.J., ist Bapt. Chh., 1690-1708; Bapt.; Judge of the Salem Court; d. Cohansey, N.J., 1708, s.p.

name: Robert Killpatrick
raw: ROBERT KILLPATRICK, K.B. for Newfoundland, 25 June 1730; sett. Trinity Bay, Newfoundland, 1730-1731; sett. Newburgh (Orange) N.Y., St. George's Chh., 1731-1733; S.P.G. missionary at New Windsor (Orange) N.Y., 1731-1733; sett. Trinity Bay, Newfoundland, 1734- 1741; Ep.; d. Trinity Bay, Newfoundland, 19 Aug. 1741.

name: Johann Jacob Kimmel
raw: JOHANN JACOB KIMMEL, b. Gimsheim, Germany; arriv. Philadelphia, 14 Sept. 1751 ; adm. Ephrata (Lancaster) Pa., German Bapt. Chloister, Dec. 1751; sett. Latimore (Adams) Pa;, Bermudian Chh., 1752-1753; Ephrata Chloister, 1753-1784; Germ. Bapt.; d. Ephrata, Pa., 25 Nov. 1784.

name: Andrew King
raw: ANDREW KING, A.M., A.B., Princeton, 1773, A.M., 1786; inst. Montgomery (Orange) N.Y., Good Will Chh., 11 June 1777; sett. Montgomery, N.Y., 1776-1815; Presb.; d. Montgomery, N.Y., 16 Nov. 1815.

name: John King
ordained: Upper West Conococheague, now Mercersburg (Franklin) Pa., May 1769- 1809
degrees: D.D., A.B., U. of Pa., 1766 D.D., Dickinson Coll., 1792
raw: JOHN KING, D.D., b. Chestnut Level, Drumore (Lancaster) Pa., 5 Dec. 1740, son of Elder Robert King; A.B., U. of Pa., 1766; D.D., Dickinson Coll., 1792; taught school at West Conococheague, Pa., 1760-1763; sett. New London (Chester) Pa., 1762-1769; Ord. Upper West Conococheague, now Mercersburg (Franklin) Pa., May 1769- 1809; Montgomery, Hill Chh., at Mercersburg, 1769-1809; Presb.; d. Mercersburg, Pa., 5 July 1811, a. 70.

name: John King
raw: JOHN KING, came from London, 1769; itinerant minister in Del., N.J., Va., Md., and N.C, 1772-1800; preached. Eastern Shore of Md., 24 Dec. 1772; Frederick, Md., 1773; sett. Trenton, N.J., Green St. Chh., 1773-1775; Meth.; d. near Raleigh, N.C, ca. 1800.

name: John Kinkead
raw: JOHN KINKEAD, b. Ireland, lie. 1732; Ord. ca. 1753; sett. Norriton (Montgomery) Pa., 1752-1757; Tredyffryn (Chester) Pa., Great Valley Chh., 1752-1757; Middletown (Del.) Pa., 1757-1758; Windham, New Hampshire, Oct. 1760-Apr. 1765; a contemporary deed mentions the "Calfpasture" of 250 acres, "near the home of Rev. Mr. Kinkead" in 1762, at Beverly Manor (possibly in Beverly, Upper Darby (Del.) Pa.); Presb.; d. after 1769.

name: John Kinkead
settled at: Beverly Manor (possibly in Beverly, Upper Darby (Del.) Pa.)

name: Ebenezer Kinnersley
member of: APS;member of the first Bapt. Chh. in Philadelphia;member of the first Bapt. Chh. in Philadelphia
degrees: A.M., arriv. in America, 12 Sept. 1714 A.M., U. of Pa. (hon.) 1757
raw: EBENEZER KINNERSLEY, A.M., b. Gloucester, England, 30 Nov. 1711, son of the Rev. William Kinnersley; arriv. in America, 12 Sept. 1714; A.M., U. of Pa. (hon.) 1757; Ord. Philadelphia, Pa., 1743- 1754; preached but was never settled; member of the ist Bapt. Chh. in Philadelphia; experimenter in electricity with Benjamin Franklin; Prof, of English, U. of Pa., 11 July 1755-17 Oct. 1772; member. Am. Phil. Soc; Bapt.; d. Lower Dublin, Pa., 4 July 1778, a. 67.

name: William Kinnersley Co
settled at: Lower Dublin, Pa., Pennypack Bapt. Church
raw: WILLIAM KINNERSLEY, b. Lynch, near Leominster, Hereford CO. England, 1669; came to America, 12 Sept. 1714; lived in Lower Dublin; sett. Lower Dublin, Pa., Pennypack Bapt. Chh., 1714-1734; Bapt.; d. Lower Dublin, Pa., 13 Feb. 1734.

name: John Caspar Kirchner
raw: JOHN CASPAR KIRCHNER, sett. Baltimore, Md., 1762-1773; York (York) Pa., Christ Chh., 1763-1767; Springfield (York) Pa., Frieden Saal or Shuster's Chh., 1763-1767; Luth.; d. Baltimore, Md., 1773-

name: John Caspar Kirchner
settled at: Springfield (York) Pa., Frieden Saal or Shuster's Church

name: William Kirkpatrick
settled at: Amwell (Hunterdon) N.J., church at Reaville, June  inst. Aug.
raw: WILLIAM KIRKPATRICK, A.M., b. 1726; A.B., Princeton, 1757, A.M.; Trustee, Princeton, 1767-1769; lie. 15 Aug. 1758; Ord. Cranbury (Middlesex) N.J., 4 July 1759; supply, Trenton (Mercer) N.J., ist Presb. Chh., 28 Apr. 1761-1766; Hopewell (Mercer) N.J., Ewing Chh., 1760-1766; sett. Amwell (Hunterdon) N.J., chh. at Reaville, June 1766- inst. Aug. 1766-1769; Treasurer and Clerk of the Presbytery, 1769; Moderator of the Synod of Philadelphia, 1769; d. Amwell, N.J., 8 Sept. 1769, a. 43.

name: William Kirkpatrick
edited_raw: Treasurer and Clerk of the Presbytery

name: Samuel Kirkland
edited_raw: Indian missionary near Oneida Lake, N.Y.
son of: the Rev. Daniel and Hannah (Perkins) Kirtland
raw: SAMUEL KIRKLAND, A.M., b. Norwich, Conn., i Dec. 1741, son of the Rev. Daniel and Hannah (Perkins) Kirtland; A.B., Princeton, 1765; A.M., Y.C., 1768; Ord. Lebanon, Conn., 19 June 1766; Indian missionary near Oneida Lake, N.Y., 1766^1808; Chaplain, Continental Army, 1775-1783; an eligible member. Society of the Cincinnati; Cong.; d. Clinton, N.Y., 28 Feb. 1808.

name: John Rudolph Kittweiler
raw: JOHN RUDOLPH KITTWEILER (or Kidenweiler, Kindweiler), b. Basel, Switzerland, 26 May 1716, son of Hans Jacob and Catherine (Spoerin) Kittweiler; Ord. Switzerland; arriv. Philadelphia, 28 Sept. 1749; sett. Weisenberg (Lehigh) Pa., 1749-1761; Long Swamp (Berks) Pa., 1754-1763; Salisbury (L,ehigh) Pa., New Jerusalem Chh., 1759- 1764; Lower Milford (Lehigh) Pa., Great Swamp Chh., 1762-1764; Germ. Ref.; d. Long Swamp, Pa., 2 Oct. 1764, a. 47 y. 9 m. (GS).

name: George Kleine
raw: GEORGE KLEINE, b. Zweibruecken, France, 9 Oct. 1715; came to America, 1738; Ord. 1757; sett. Bern (Berks) Pa., Northkill Chh., 1750- 1770; Tulpehocken (Berks) Pa., Little Swatara Chh., 1757-1770; Oley (Berks) Pa., 1757-1770; Germ. Bapt.; d. after 1770.

name: Sebastian Henry Knauss
raw: SEBASTIAN HENRY KNAUSS, b. Tittelsheim, near Frankforton-the-Main, Germany, Oct. 1714, son of Louis and Ann Margaret (Goerlach) Knauss; came to Pa., 1732; Ord. deacon, Salisbury (Lehigh) Pa., 1747; sett. Salisbury, Macungie Chh., 1743-1747 ff.; Morav.

name: Ebenezer Knibloe
raw: EBENEZER KNIBLOE, b. Scotland; ed. Edinburgh; came to America, 1752; Ord. Carmel (Putnam) N.Y., 18 Feb. 1756-11 July 1759; sett. Amenia (Dutchess) N.Y., Smithfield Chh., 1760-1775; Cong.; d. Amenia, N. Y.

name: Michael Christian Knoll
raw: MICHAEL CHRISTIAN KNOLL, b. Holstein, 1696; Ord. London, England, 1732; sett. Newburgh (Orange) N.Y., Quassick Chh., 1733- 1748; N.Y., N.Y., Holy Trinity Chh., 1732-1748; Hackensack, N.J., 1734-1748; he also preached in the Berckenmeyer congregations at Coxsackie, Claverick, St. Thomas's Chh., and Athens, Loonenburgh Chh. in Greene co. N.Y.; Rhinebeck (Dutchess) N.Y.; and East Camp, Christ Chh., Kaatsbaan, West Camp at Saugerties, Four Mile Point and Rosendale, all in Ulster co. N.Y., 1732-1748; Luth.

name: Stephen Koch
raw: STEPHEN KOCH, Ord. Krefeld, Rhine, Germany, ca. 1715; sett. Krefeld, 1715-1719; came to Germantown, Pa., 1719; sett. Wissahickon, Pa., 1733-1739; Ephrata (Lane.) Pa., Germ. Bapt. Chloister, 1739- 1763; Germ. Bapt.; d. Ephrata, Pa., 7 July 1763.

name: Joshua Von Kockerthal
raw: JOSHUA VON KOCKERTHAL, b. near Bretton, Baden, 1669; sett. Landau, Palatinate, 1704; came to America, 1708, bringing with him many Palatine settlers; arriv. N.Y., N.Y., i Jan. 1707/8; returned to England; was Ep. ordained; K.B., N.Y., 28 Jan. 1709/10; arriv. N.Y., N.Y., 2nd time, 14 June 1710; sett. Newburgh (Orange) N.Y., Quassick Chh., 1708-1719; East Camp (Ulster) N.Y., Christ Chh., 1708-1719; Rhinebeek (Dutehess) N.Y., 1709-1719; West Camp (Ulster) N.Y., at Saugerties, 1710-1719; Kaatsbaan (Ulster) 1710-1719; Newtown (Ulster) N.Y., 1711-1719; Sehoharie (Sehoharie) N.Y., 1715-1719; Shawangunk (Ulster) N.Y., 1716-1719; Langen Raek (Ulster) N.Y., 1716-1719; Rosendale (Ulster) N.Y., 1716-1719; Tarbush, N.Y., 1716- 1719; Queensboro, N.Y., 1716-1719; Elizabethtown, N.J., bef. 1719; Luth.; d. West Camp, N.Y., 27 Dee. 1719.

name: Heinrich Bernhard Koester
son of: Burgomaster Ludolph and Ann Catherina (Blumen von Sehwalenberg) Koester
raw: HEINRICH BERNHARD KOESTER, b. Blumenberg, Lippe, Westphalia, Nov. 1662, son of Burgomaster Ludolph and Ann Catherina (Blumen von Sehwalenberg) Koester; ed. U. of Frankfort-on-the-Oder, 1681-1684; teaeher in Berlin, 1685-1692; was at first a Pietist, then a Lutheran preacher; sett. Germantown, Pa., 1694-1699; held the first Lutheran service in Pa., 1694; arriv. London, England, Jan. 1700; visited Stockholm, 1702; sett. Eingfleish, near Berlin, 1714-1724; Luth.; d. Hanover, Germany, 1749, a. 87.

name: Jacob Kohn
raw: JACOB KOHN, arriv. Bethlehem, Pa., Sept. 1742; sett. Oley (Berks) Pa., 1743-1744; sett. Mount Joy (Lancaster) Pa., Donegal Chh., May 1745-N0V. 1745; returned to Europe, Nov. 1745; Morav.

name: Jacob Kohn
settled at: Mount Joy (Lancaster) Pa., Donegal Church, May N

name: Dielman Kolb
raw: DIELMAN KOLB, b. Wolfsheim, Palatinate, Germany, 10 Nov. 1691, son of Dielman and (Schumacher) Kolb; minister at Mannheim, Germany, 27 Aug. 1710; arriv. Philadelphia, 10 Aug. 1717; sett. Lower Salford (Montgomery) Pa., 1718-1756; trustee at Salford, 1738; will proved 30 Apr. 1757; Menn.; d. Lower Salford, Pa., 29 Dec. 1756.

name: Dielman Kolb
raw: DIELMAN KOLB, b. 2 Mar. 1719 (prob, son of Dielman Kolb); Ord. Skippaek (Montg.) Pa., 1752-1779; Menn.; d. Skippaek, Pa., 19 Oet. 1779.

name: Henry Kolb
raw: HENRY KOLB, b. Wolfsheim, Palatinate, Germany, son of the Rev. Dielman Kolb; eame to Pa., 1707; sett. Germantown, Pa., 1707-1709; Skippaek (Montg.) Pa., 1709-1730; Menn.; d. Skippaek, Pa., 1730.

name: Henry Kolb
raw: HENRY KOLB, Jr., b. 1721; Ord. Skippaek (Montgomery) Pa., 1752; sett. Skippaek, Pa., 1753-1781; Menn.; d. Skippaek, Pa., 1783.

name: Isaac Kolb
son of: Dea. Jaeob and Sarah (Van Sintern) Kolb
raw: Bishop ISAAC KOLB, b. 28 Mar. 1711, son of Dea. Jaeob and Sarah (Van Sintern) Kolb; Ord. Roekhill (Bueks) Pa., 1744; Ord. Bishop, Franconia (Montgomery) Pa., 1761; sett. Franconia, Pa., Indian Creek Chh., 1744-1766; Rockhill, Pa., Bechtel's or Gehman's Chh., 1744- 1766; Hatfield (Montg.) Pa., ehh. at Lansdale, 1764-1766; Menn.; d. Gwynned (Montgomery) Pa., 1766.

name: Martin Kolb
raw: MARTIN KOLB, b. Wolfsheim, Palatinate, Germany, 1680; eame to Pa., 1707; Ord. Germantown, Pa., 20 Apr. 1708-1709; sett. Skippaek (Montg.) Pa., 1709-1761; Menn.; d. Skippaek, Pa., 23 Aug. 1761.

name: Peter Kolb
raw: PETER KOLB, b. Wolfsheim, Palatinate, Germany, son of Dielman Kolb; minister at Mannheim, Germany; eame from Mannheim, 1707; sett. Lower Salford (Montgomery) Pa., 1718-1757; Menn.; will proved 30 Apr. 1757; d. Salford, Pa., 1757.

name: John Valentine Kraft
raw: JOHN VALENTINE KRAFT, minister at Zweibrueeken, Palatinate, Germany; arriv. Philadelphia, 25 Aug. 1742; sett. Germantown, Pa., St. Miehael's Chh., 1742-1742; Philadelphia, Pa., St. Miehael's Chh., 1742-1742; Richmond (Berks) Pa., Zion or Moselem Chh., 20 Jan. 1742/3-1745; Mill Creek (Lebanon) Pa., Reed's or Old Tulpehocken Chh., 1742-1743; Marion (Berks) Pa., Zion or Rieth's Chh., the original Old Tulpehocken Chh. at Stouchsburg, 1742-1743; Lancaster (Lane.) Pa., Holy Trinity Chh., 1742-1743, May 1747-Mar. 1747/8; Hanover (York) Pa., St. Miehael's Chh., 1747-1749; living, not settled, in Frederiek, Md., 1749; Monoeaey (Frederiek) Md., 1750-1751; Luth.; d. Frederiek, Md., 1751, in extreme poverty.

name: John Valentine Kraft
edited_raw: Marion (Berks) Pa.(the original Old Tulpehocken Church), Dec

name: Samuel Krause
raw: SAMUEL KRAUSE, Ord. abroad before 1749; arriv. N.Y., N.Y., 12 May 1749; sett. Bethlehem (Northampton) Pa., 1749-1753; returned to Europe, 1753; Morav.

name: Christopher Kriebel
raw: CHRISTOPHER KRIEBEL, b. Harpersdorf, Silesia, 1724, son of Christopher and Maria (Heydrieh) Kriebel; eame to Pa., 1734; religious teaeher. Lower Salford (Montgomery) Pa., 1764-1797; minister, 1782- 1796; Sehwenkfelder; d. Lower Salford, Pa., 31 Dee. 1800.

name: Otto Christian Krogstrup
raw: OTTO CHRISTIAN KROGSTRUP, had a university edueation; arriv. N.Y., N.Y., 9 Sept. 1753; sett. Laneaster (Lane.) Pa., 1754-1755, 1773-1776; Philadelphia, Pa., 1756-1762; Warwiek (Lane.) Pa., St. James's Chh. at Lititz, 1762-1763; Graeeham (Frederiek) Md., 1764- 1767; York (York) Pa., 1767-1773; Morav.; d. Bethlehem, Pa., 1785.

name: John Andrew Krug
raw: JOHN ANDREW KRUG, b. Saxony, 19 Mar. 1732; taught at the Orphan House at Halle, at Wasserleben, and at Wernigerode; Ord. 1763; arriv. Philadelphia, i Apr. 1764; sett. Reading (Berks) Pa., Trinity Chh., 1764-1771; Exeter (Berks) Pa., Sehwartzwald Chh., 1764-1771; Muhlenberg (Berks) Pa., Alsaee Chh., 1764-1771; Perry (Berks) Pa., Zion's Chh., 1765-1771; Frederiek (Frederick) Md., 28 Apr. 1771-1796; Middletown (Fred.) Md., 1771-1779; Luth.; d. Frederick, Md., 30 Mar. 1796.

name: Daniel Kuhn
raw: DANIEL KUHN, son of Adam Simon Kuhn of Lancaster, Pa.; sett. Elizabeth (Lancaster) Pa., Emmanuel Chh., 1769-1770; Middletown, Pa., 1770 ff. (perhaps Lower Swatara (Dauphin) Pa., St. Peter's Chh. at Middletown, as an assistant); Luth.; d. ca. 1779.

name: John Christopher Kunze
edited_raw: Prof, of German, U. of Pa.
degrees: D.D., matric. U. of Leipzic, 21 Sept. 1763 A.B., Halle A.M., U. of Pa., 1780, D.D., 1783
raw: JOHN CHRISTOPHER KUNZE, D.D., b. Artern, Mansfield, Saxony, 5 Aug. 1744; matric. U. of Leipzic, 21 Sept. 1763; A.B., Halle; A.M., U. of Pa., 1780, D.D., 1783; sett. Closter Bergen and at the Orphan House at Greitz; Ord. Wernigerode, May 1770; arriv. N.Y., N.Y., 22 Sept. 1770; sett. Philadelphia, Pa., St. Michael's and Zion's Chhs., 8 Oct. 1770-1784; sett. N.Y., N.Y., Christ Chh., 1780-1784; Prof, of German, U. of Pa., 1780-1784; Prof, of Oriental Languages, Columbia U., 1784-1787, 1792-1799; Luth.; d. N.Y., N.Y., 24 July 1807, a. 64 (GS).

name: John Christopher Kunze
edited_raw: Prof, of Oriental Languages, Columbia U
settled at: Philadelphia, Pa., St. Michael's and Zion's Chhs.

name: John Nicholas Kurtz
settled at: New Hanover (Montgomery) Pa., Falkner's Swamp Chh., as assistant
ordained: 15 Aug. 1748, the first Lutheran minister to sett. New Hanover (Montgomery) Pa., Falkner's Swamp Chh., as assistant, 1745-1746
raw: JOHN NICHOLAS KURTZ, D.D., b. Luetzellinden, Nassau-Weilburg, Germany, Oct. 1722; ed. U. of Giessen and Halle; arriv. Philadelphia, 26 Jan. 1744/5; Ord. 15 Aug. 1748, the first Lutheran minister to be ordained in America; sett. New Hanover (Montgomery) Pa., Falkner's Swamp Chh., as assistant, 1745-1746; Lynn (Lehigh) Pa., Jerusalem Chh. at Allemaengel, 1745-1745; Mahwah (Bergen) N.J., Ramapo Chh., 1746-1748; Marion (Berks) Pa., Zion's, Rieth's, or Old Tulpehocken Chh., at Stouchsburg, 13 Sept. 1747-Apr. 1770; also Marion, Christ Chh. at Stouchsburg, Old Tulpehocken, 5 Sept. 1747- 1770; Mill Creek (Lebanon) Pa., Reed's or Old Tulpehocken Chh., 1747-1770 (these are offshoots of the original Old Tulpehocken, which is Rieth's noted above); Upper Saucon (Lehigh) Pa., St. Paul's, Blue or Organ Chh., 1749-1749; Heidelberg (Berks) Pa., St. Daniel's Chh., 1757-1770; Elizabeth (Lancaster) Pa., Emmanuel Chh., 1762-1769; Upper Dublin (Montgomery) Pa., Puff's Chh., 1763-1764; Lower Windsor (Berks) Pa., 1770-1789; York (York) Pa., Christ Chh., Apr. 1770- 1789; West Manchester (York) Pa., St. Paul's or Wolffs Chh., 1770- 1789; Baltimore, Md., 1772-1794; Luth.; brother of William Kurtz; d. Baltimore, Md., 12 May 1794, a. 72 (GS).

name: John Nicholas Kurtz
settled at: Lynn (Lehigh) Pa., Jerusalem Chh. at Allemaengel

name: John Nicholas Kurtz
settled at: Marion (Berks) Pa., Zion's, Rieth's, or Old Tulpehocken Chh., at Stouchsburg

name: John Nicholas Kurtz
settled at: also Marion, Christ Chh. at Stouchsburg, Old Tulpehocken

name: John Nicholas Kurtz
settled at: Mill Creek (Lebanon) Pa., Reed's or Old Tulpehocken Chh.

name: John Nicholas Kurtz
settled at: Upper Saucon (Lehigh) Pa., St. Paul's, Blue or Organ Chh.

name: John Nicholas Kurtz
settled at: West Manchester (York) Pa., St. Paul's or Wolffs Chh.

name: John William Kurtz
raw: JOHN WILLIAM KURTZ, b. prob, at Luetzellinden, Germany, son of John George Kurtz; ed. Halle, 15 yrs.; arriv. America, 1754; lie. 1760; Ord. Lancaster, Pa., May 1761; teacher at York, Pa., 1756; sett. Douglass (Berks) Pa., Oley Hill Chh., 1756-1758; Pike (Berks) Pa., St. John's or Hill Chh., 1756-1758; New Hanover (Montgomery) Pa., Falkner's Swamp Chh., 1757-1758; Upper Dublin (Montgomery) Pa., Puff's Chh., 1757-1758; Bedminster (Bucks) Pa., Keller's Chh., 1763-1781; Brecknock (Lancaster) Pa., Muddy Creek or East Cocalico Chh., 1763- 1781; Earl (Lane.) Pa., Chh. at New Holland, 1763-1779; Ephrata (Lane.) Pa., Bergstrasse Chh., 1763-1779; Lebanon (Lebanon) Pa., Salem or Kruppe's Chh., 1775-1794; Strasburg (Lane.) Pa., St. Michael's or Beaver Creek Chh., 1775-1779; Hummelstown (Dauphin) Pa., 1781- 1799; Jonestown (Lebanon) Pa., Zion's Chh., 1781-1799; Luth.; d. Jonestown, Pa., 27 May 1799.

name: Warmoldus Kuypers
raw: WARMOLDUS KUYPERS, b. Holland, 1732; ed. U. Gronigen, 1753; came to America from Curacoa, 1768; sett. Rhinebeck Flats (Dutchess) N.Y., 1769-1771; Upper Red Hook Landing (Dutchess) N.Y., 1769- 1771; Hackensack (Bergen) N.J., Second Chh., 1771-1797; Schraalenburg (Bergen) N.J., DuMont Chh., 1771-1797; Dutch Ref.; d. 1797.

name: Jacques Labourie
edited_raw: JACQUES (James) grad. U. Geneva, Switzerlandar. , in theology
raw: JACQUES (James) LABOURIE, b. Cardaillac, Lot, France; grad. U. Geneva, Switzerland, 12 Mar. 1688, in theology; Ord. Zurich (or Geneva) 30 Oct. 1688; sett. London, England, French Chh., 1688-1698; came to America; sett. Oxford, Mass., Huguenot Chh., 1699-1704; sett. N.Y., N.Y., French Ref. Chh. of the Saint Esprit, 15 Oct. 1704- 25 Aug. 1706; became an Ep.; practiced medicine and surgery; sett. Fairfield co. Conn., 1716, as a physician; Fr. Ref.; Ep.; d. Fairfield, Conn., ca. 1731.

name: Jacques Labourie
settled at: N.Y., N.Y., French Ref. Church of the Saint Esprit

name: Jacques Labourie
settled at: Fairfield co. Conn., , as a physician

name: Archibald Laidlie
raw: ARCHIBALD LAIDLIE, D.D., b. Kelso, co. Roxburgh, Scotland, 4 Dec. 1727; ed. U. of Edinburgh, 1730; S.T.D., Princeton, 1770; Ord. 1759; sett. Flushing, Holland, 1759-1763; arriv. N.Y., N.Y., 29 Mar. 1734; sett. N.Y., N.Y., ist or South Dutch Chh., 1764-1779; 2nd or Middle Dutch Chh. at Nassau Street, 1764-1779; 3rd or North Dutch Chh. at Fulton Street, inst., 14 Apr. 1764-1776; Presb.; Dutch Ref.; d. Red Hook, N.Y., 1779, a. 52.

name: Archibald Laidlie
settled at: N.Y., N.Y., first or South Dutch Church

name: Robert Laing
edited_raw: ROBERT LAING (or Lenig) (poss. son of the Rev. Henry Laing (Layng), Md.
degrees: D.D., of Wells, England A.B., Balliol Coll., 1716, A.M., 1719)
raw: ROBERT LAING (or Lenig) (poss. son of the Rev. Henry Laing (Layng), D.D., of Wells, England; b. 1697; matric. Trinity Coll., Oxford, 28 Mar. 1713, a. 16, A.B., Balliol Coll., 1716, A.M., 1719); came from Great Britain to Md., 1722; member of New Castle Presbytery, Del.; sett. Snow Hill, Md., 1722; Brandywine and White Clay Creek, Del., Mar. 1722-Aug. 1722; sett. Bensalem (Bucks) Pa. and Warwick (Bucks) Pa., Neshaminy Chh., 22 Dec. 1723-1726; Presb.; suspended'for bathing on Sunday, 19 Sept. 1724, and again 24 Sept. 1726; the Presbytery advised him to quit the ministry.

name: Joseph Lamb
ordained: Southold, L.L, N.Y., Mattituck Chh., 6 Dec. 1717-1734
raw: JOSEPH LAMB, A.M., b. Stonington, Conn., son of John Lamb, Jr.; A.B., Y.C, 1717, A.M.; Ord. Southold, L.L, N.Y., Mattituck Chh., 6 Dec. 1717-1734; sett. Hempstead, L.I., N.Y., 1717-1725; Guilford, Conn., 4th Chh., 1735-1741; New Providence (Union) N. J., Turkey Christian Chh., 1741-1743; Basking Ridge (Somerset) N.J., 25 July 1744-1749; Presb.; d. Basking Ridge, N.J., 28 July 1749, a. 60 (GS).

name: Joseph Lamson
raw: JOSEPH LAMSON, A.M., b. Stratford, Conn., 28 Mar. 1718, son of William and Elizabeth (Burch) Lamson; A.B., Y.C, 1741, A.M.; A.M. (hon.) Columbia, 1773; Ord. London, England, 1744/5; K.B. for N.Y., 3 July 1745; Bedford (Westchester) N.Y., St. Matthew's Chh., 18 June 1745-1747; New Castle (Westchester) N.Y., 1745-1747; Rye (Westchester) N.Y., 1745-1746; Fairfield, Conn., Trinity Chh., 1747-1773; Ridgefield, Conn., 1747-1773; Stratford, Conn., 1747-1773; Norwalk, Conn., 1747-1773; physician; Ep.; d. Fairfield, Conn., 1773, a. 55. (will made i June 1773; proved 7 Sept. 1773).

name: Abraham Landes
raw: ABRAHAM LANDES (or Landis), Ord. Bedminster (Bucks) Pa., Deep Run Chh., 1758-1773; Menn.

name: Benjamin Landis
settled at: East Lampeter (Lane.) Pa., at Mellingers meeting house
raw: BENJAMIN LANDIS, b. Switzerland, 1710, son of Jacob Landis; came from Switzerland, 1718; sett. East Lampeter (Lane.) Pa., at Mellingers meeting house, 1746-1781; was a minister there before 1746; Menn.; d. East Lampeter, Pa., 1791, a. 81.

name: Jacob Landis
raw: JACOB LANDIS, sett. Franconia (Montgomery) Pa., Indian Creek Chh., 1773-1778; Franconia circuit; Menn.

name: John Landis
raw: JOHN LANDIS, sett. Cocalico (Lane.) Pa., Conestoga Chh., 1770 ff.; lay preacher; Germ. Bapt.

name: James Lang
degrees: A.M., son of Patrick Lang of Lancaster co. Pa. A.B., U. of Pa., 1763, A.M. (hon.), 1765, Tutor, 1763
raw: JAMES LANG, A.M., son of Patrick Lang of Lancaster co. Pa.; A.B., U. of Pa., 1763, A.M. (hon.), 1765, Tutor, 1763; Ord. Guilford (Franklin) Pa., Falling Spring Chh., at CÎaambersburg, 1767-1794; Cumberland (Adams) Pa., Upper Marsh Creek Chh., at Gettysburg, 1767-1770; Antrim (Franklin) Pa., Old Red Chh., 1767-1794; Presb.

name: Andrew Langgard
raw: ANDREW LANGGARD, arriv. N.Y., N.Y., 19 Oct. 1761; sett. Lancaster (Lane.) Pa., 1766-1773; Salisbury- (Lehigh) Pa., Chh. at Emaus, I77'i-i777; his wife Maria was his assistant; Morav.; d. Emaus, Pa.

name: Daniel Langenecker
raw: Bishop DANIEL LANGENECKER, came from Switzerland to America, 1719/1722; sett. Washington (Berks) Pa., Manatant Chh., 1725-1756; Hereford (Berks) Pa., Hereford Chh., 1727-1756; East Vincent (Chester) Pa., 1727-1756; Upper Providence (Montgomery) Pa., 1742-1756, at Mingo near Royersford; trustee of Coventry, 1751; Menn.; d. ca. 1756.

name: David Langenecker
raw: DAVID LANGENECKER (Langanecker, Langanacre, Longaker, Longacre), prob, son of Bishop Daniel Langenecker; sett. East Coventry (Chester) Pa., 1750-1773; East Vincent (Chester) Pa., 1750-1773; Phoenixville (Chester) Pa., 1750-1773; Menn.

name: John Langenecker
raw: JOHN LANGENECKER, Ord. 1770; sett. East Coventry (Chester) Pa., 1770-1773; Phoenixville (Chester) Pa., 1772-1773; East Vincent (Chester) Pa., 1772-1773; Menn.

name: John Caspar Lapp
edited_raw: Dillenburg, Solms Hohenzollern and Niederweissel, Germany
raw: JOHN CASPAR LAPP, b. Windecken, near Hanau, 1724, son of Dr. Francis Lapp; matric. U. of Marburg, 16 Apr. 1744; Ord. Marburg, 20 Dec. 1744; sett. Neukirchen, 20 Dec. 1744-10 Jan. 1746; Dillenburg, Solms Hohenzollern and Niederweissel, Germany, 1746-1753; arriv. Philadelphia, 2 Oct. 1753; inst. Amwell (Hunterdon) NiJ., 1753-1756; Lebanon (Hunterdon) N.J., Rockaway Chh. at Clinton, 1755-1756; German Valley (Morris) N.J., 1755-1756; Germ. Ref.; d. Amwell, N. J., after i Apr. 1756.

name: James Latta
raw: JAMES LATTA, D.D., b. Ireland, 1732, son of James and Mary (Alison) Latta; A.B., U. of Pa., 1757, A.M., D.D., 1799; Tutor, 1756- 1759; Ord. 19 Feb. 1762; sett. Bedminster (Bucks) Pa., Deep Run Chh., 1762-12 Apr. 1770; John's Island (Charleston) S.C, 1768-1770; Drumore (Lane.) Pa., Chestnut Level Chh., Nov. 1771-1801; pvt. and chaplain. Pa. militia. Rev. War; Presb.; d. Chestnut Level, Pa., 29 Jan. 1801, a. 68.

name: Abraham Laush
raw: ABRAHAM LAUSHÉ, b. Crayfelt, Germany, 1732; sett. Amwell, N.J.; Germ. Bapt.

name: Andrew Anthony Lawatsch
raw: ANDREW ANTHONY LAWATSCH, arriv. in America, 17 May 1752; sett. Bethlehem (Northampton) Pa., 1752-1762, as warden; returned to Europe, i July 1762; Morav.

name: Daniel Lawrence Gs
ordained: Forks of the Delaware (Northampton) Pa., 2 Apr. 1747
raw: DANIEL LAWRENCE, b. Long Island, 1718; ed. Log Coll., Pa.; lie. Philadelphia, Pa., 28 May 1745; Ord. Forks of the Delaware (Northampton) Pa., 2 Apr. 1747; sett. Forks, 24 May 1746-1751; Upper Mount Bethel (Northampton) Pa., Forks North Chh., 1746-1751; Allen (Northampton) Pa., 1747-1752 (North: Hunter's at Lower Mt. Bethel; South: Craig's, now Bath); Cape May (Cape May) N.J., Cold Spring Chh., 1751-inst. 20 June 1754-1766; Presb.; d. Cape May, N.J., 11 Apr. 1766 (GS).

name: John Lawrence
raw: JOHN LAWRENCE, sett. Pawling (Dutehess) N.Y., 1770-1782; Phillips' Patent (Dutehess) N.Y., 1774-1782; Bapt.

name: Daniel Leatherman
raw: DANIEL LEATHERMAN, sett. Hanover (York) Pa., Little Conewago Chh., 1738-1770; Monoeasy (Frederiek) Md., 1738-1770; Germ. Bapt.

name: Daniel Leatherman Jr
raw: DANIEL LEATHERMAN, JR., sett. Reading (Adams) Pa., Great Conewago Chh., 1770-1789; Germ. Bapt.

name: Daniel Lehman
raw: DANIEL LEHMAN, b. Strasbourg, Alsace, France, 15 Apr. 1754; ed. at Halle U.; eame to Ameriea, 1773; lie. 1775; Ord. 1778; sett. Heidelberg (Lehigh) Pa., Heidelberg Chh., 1773-1778; Maxatawny (Berks) Pa., St. John's Chh. at Kutztown, 1773-1778; Weisenberg (Lehigh) Pa., Ziegel Chh., 1773-1778; Lynn (Lehigh) Pa., Jerusalem Chh. at Allemaengel, 1773-1810; Whitehall (Lehigh) Pa., Egypt Chh., 1774-1778; South Whitehall (Lehigh) Pa., Jordan Chh., 1775-1778; Reading (Berks) Pa., Trinity Chh., Oet. 1778-1780; Upper Maeungie- (Lehigh) Pa., St. Paul's Chh. at Trexlertown, 1778-1784; in 1793, ^^ served: Oley Hill in Douglass, Moselem in Riehmond, Bieber Creek in Roekland, St. John's Kutztown in Maxatawny, St. Paul's in Windsor, Hamburg, St. Miehael's in Bern, Braunschweig, Greenwich, and two eongregations in Albany; Luth., d. Riehmond, Pa., at Moselem, i Oet. 1810.

name: Daniel Lehman
edited_raw: Oley Hill in Douglass, Moselem in Riehmond, Bieber Creek in Roekland, St. John's Kutztown in Maxatawny, St. Paul's in Windsor, Hamburg, St. Miehael's in Bern, Braunschweig, Greenwich, and two eongregations in Albany

name: John Lehman
raw: Bishop JOHN LEHMAN, Ord. ca. 22 May 1745; Ord. Bishop, bef. 1775; sett. Rapho (Lancaster) Pa., Hernley's Chh., 1745-1790; East Hempfield (Lane.) Pa., Chh. at Landisville, 1745-1790; Menn.; d. Rapho, Pa., 1790.

name: Peter Lehman
raw: PETER LEHMAN, minister at Oberpfalz, Germany, 1699; eame to Pa., 1700; Menn.

name: John Leighton
raw: JOHN LEIGHTON, eame from Dundee, Seotland; schoolteacher and preacher; Morav.; d. Bethlehem, Pa., Aug. 1756.

name: Francis Christian Lembke
settled at: Warwiek (Laneaster) Pa., St. James's Church at Lititz
raw: FRANCIS CHRISTIAN LEMBKE, b. Bodensingen, Baden-Durlaeh, July 1704; grad. Jena, 1739; Prof, at Jena and Strasbourg; arriv. N.Y., N.Y., 15 Apr. 1754; sett. Warwiek (Laneaster) Pa., St. James's Chh. at Lititz, 1755-1756; Nazareth (Northampton) Pa., Forks of the Delaware, Jan. 1757-1784; resigned 1784; Morav.; d. Old Nazareth, Pa., July 1785-

name: Simon Le Moyne
raw: SIMON LE MOYNE, S.J., b. Beauvais, Franee, 1601; adm. S.J., 1622; eame to Canada, 1638; Huron-Iroquois missionary in N.Y. and Canada; sett. Syraeuse (Onondaga) N.Y., St. Mary's Mission to the Onondagas, July 1654; Fonda (Montgomery) N.Y., St. Peter's Mission to the Mohawks, Sept. 1656-1665; R.C; d. Cap de la Madeleine, near Three Rivers, 24 Nov. 1665.

name: Simon Le Moyne
edited_raw: Huron-Iroquois missionary in N.Y. and Canada

name: Silas Leonard
raw: SILAS LEONARD, A.M., b. Taunton, Mass., son of Judge Stephen Leonard; A.B., Y.C, 1736, A.M., 1740; Ord. Goshen (Orange) N.Y., 1738-1754; Presb.; will dated 27 Mar. 1764; d. Goshen, N.Y., 1764.

name: Caspar Leutbecker
ordained: Marion (Berks) Pa., Zion's or Rieth's Chh., the original Old Tulpehocken Chh., at Stouchsburg, 1734
raw: CASPAR LEUTBECKER, Ord. Marion (Berks) Pa., Zion's or Rieth's Chh., the original Old Tulpehocken Chh., at Stouchsburg, 1734; sett. Marion, 1733-1738; Luth.; d. Marion, Pa., 1738.

name: William Leverich Co
degrees: A.B., Emmanuel Coll., Camb., 1625/6, A.M., 1632;A.M. (Leverick or Leveridge), Rector of Great Livermere, Suffolk, 1631;
raw: WILLIAM LEVERICH, A.M. (Leverick or Leveridge), b. Drawlington, CO. Warwick, England, 1603, son of Saville Leverich; A.B., Emmanuel Coll., Camb., 1625/6, A.M., 1632; Ord. Peterborough, i Nov. 1627; Rector of Great Livermere, Suffolk, 1631; came to N.E. in the ship "Janies," 10 Oct. 1633; sett. Dover, N.H., 1633-1635; adm. ist Chh. in Boston, 9 Aug. 1635; Duxbury, Mass., 1637-1639; Sandwich, Mass., the first minister, 1639-1653; Oyster Bay, L.L, N.Y., 1653-1658; missionary to the Indians at Huntington, L.L, N.Y., 1658-1669; sett. Newtown, L.L, N.Y., 1669-1677; Greenwich, Conn., 1673-1677; Cong.; d. Newtown, L.L, N.Y., 1677.

name: Amzi Lewis
degrees: A.M., Ord. Blooming Grove (Orange) N.Y., 9 Apr. 1772, for Florida and Warwick, these two chhs. being 5 miles apart
son of: Deacon Samuel and Hannah (Rew) Lewis, A.B., Y.C, 1768, A.M.
raw: AMZI LEWIS, A.M., b. Waterbury, Conn., 29 Oct. 1746, son of Deacon Samuel and Hannah (Rew) Lewis, A.B., Y.C, 1768, A.M.; Ord. Blooming Grove (Orange) N.Y., 9 Apr. 1772, for Florida and Warwick, these two chhs. being 5 miles apart; sett. Warwick (Orange) N.Y., 1772- 1777; Florida (Orange) N.Y., 1772-Nov. 1787; North!Salem (Westchester) N.Y., 1787-June 1795; inst. Stamford, Conn., Presb. Chh., 26 Dec. 1795-1819; Cong.; Presb.; d. Stamford, Conn., 5 Apr. 1819, a. 72.

name: Ichabod Lewis
raw: ICHABOD LEWIS, A.M., b. Stratford, Conn., 4 Apr. 1744, son of Ichabod and Sarah (Beardslee) Lewis; A.B., Y.C, 1765, A.M.; lie. 29 Oct. 1766; supply, Southbury, Conn., 1767-1768; Ord.j White Plains (Westchester) N.Y., 11 Oet. 1769-1776; Rye and Sing Sing, N.Y., 1769- 1774; South East (Putnam) N.Y., Chh., at Philippi, 1777-17^0; Presb.; d. South East, N.Y., 8 Apr. 1793, a. 49.

name: Thomas Lewis
ordained: New Fairfield, Conn., (North Parish at Sherman), 28 Mar. 1744, as the ist minister
degrees: A.M., A.B., Y.C, 1741, A.M. A.M., Princeton, 1750
raw: THOMAS LEWIS, A.M., b. Waterbury, Conn., 6 Aug. 1716, son of Deaeon Joseph and Sarah (Andrews) Lewis; A.B., Y.C, 1741, A.M.; A.M., Princeton, 1750; Ord. New Fairfield, Conn., (North Parish at Sherman), 28 Mar. 1744, as the ist minister; sett. Sherman, 1744-7 Oct. 1746; Union (Hunterdon) N.J., Bethlehem Chh., 27 Oct. 1747-May 1761; Oxford, N.J., 27 Oct. 1747-1754; Alexandria (Hunterdon) N.J., Mt. Pleasant Chh., 1747-1754; Kingwood (Hunterdon) N.J., Mt. Bethel Chh., 1752-25 May 1756; Hopewell, N.J., 13 June 1758-20 May 1760; Smithtown, L.L, N.Y., 1763-1769; Mendham (Morris) N.J., 1769-1777; New Side Presb.; Cong.; d. Mendham, N.J., 20 Aug. 1777, a. 61.

name: Garret Leydekker
raw: GARRET (Gerhardus) LEYDEKKER, A.B., b. in the American colonies, 1729; A.B., Princeton, 1755; Ord. 1765; sett. Readington (Hunterdon) N.J., North Branch Chh., 1767-1767; English Neighborhood (Bergen) N.J., 1770-1776 (but note he must have served with Domine Cornelison); Tory; fled to N.Y., N.Y.; officiated at the Dutch Chh., during the Rev.; D.R.; d. Pentonville (Salem) N.J., May 1794, a. 65.

name: John Philip Leydich
settled at: New Hanover (Montgomery) Pa., Falkner's Swamp Chh.
raw: JOHN PHILIP LEYDICH, b. Girkhausen, Westphalia, Germany, 28 Apr. 1715, son of the Rev. Leonhard Leydich; arriv. Philadelphia, 15 Sept. 1748; sett. New Hanover (Montgomery) Pa., Falkner's Swamp Chh., 9 Oct. 1748-1765; Upper Providence (Montg.) Pa., St. Luke's Chh. at Trappe, 9 Oct. 1748-1780; Pottstown (Montg.) Pa., 1748-1760, 1770-1784; East Vincent (Chester) Pa., Zion's Chh., 1758-1765; Exeter (Berks) Pa., Schwartzwald Chh., 1762-1770; Muhlenberg (Berks) Pa., Alsace Chh., 1762-1770; Reading (Berks) Pa., Trinity Chh., 1762- 1766; Worcester (Montg.) Pa., Wentz's or Skippack Chh., 1762-1762; Upper Salford (Montg.) Pa., Old Goshenhoppen Chh., 1762-1763; Upper Milford (Lehigh) Pa., Zionsville Chh., 1762-1770; Upper Hanover (Montg.) Pa., New Goshenhoppen Chh., 1763-1764; Oley (Berks) Pa., 1766-1766; Salisbury (Lehigh) Pa., Jerusalem Chh., 1766-1771 (and poss. 1748-1771); East Coventry (Chester) Pa., 1769-1784, Brownback's Chh., 1769-1784; Germ. Ref.; d. Frederick, Pa., 14 Jan. 1784, a. 69 (GS).

name: John Philip Leydich
settled at: Upper Providence (Montg.) Pa., St. Luke's Chh. at Trappe

name: John Philip Leydich
settled at: Worcester (Montg.) Pa., Wentz's or Skippack Chh.

name: John Philip Leydich
settled at: Upper Salford (Montg.) Pa., Old Goshenhoppen Chh.

name: John Philip Leydich
settled at: Upper Hanover (Montg.) Pa., New Goshenhoppen Chh.

name: Johannes Leydt
raw: JOHANNES LEYDT, b. Holland, 1718; ed. by Frelinghuysen and Goetschius; Trustee, Princeton, 1760-1760; original Trustee, Rutgers, 1770-1783; Ord. N.J., 1748; sett. New Brunswick (Middlesex) N.J., 27 Sept. 1748-1783; Six Mile Run (Somerset) N.J., at Franklin, 27 Sept. 1748-1783; Hillsborough (Sussex) N.J., 1766-1774; Conewago (Adams) Pa., Chh. at Hunterstown, 1771-1771; Près., Gen. Synod, D.R. Chhs., 1778; Dutch Ref.; d. Three Mile Run, Franklin, N.J., 2 June 1783, a. 64 (GS).

name: John Abraham Lidenius
raw: JOHN ABRAHAM LIDENIUS, sett. Swedesborough (Gloucester) N.J., Trinity Chh. on Raccoon Creek, 1713-1724, 1751-1762; Pennsneck (Salem) N.J., St. George's Chh., 1713-1724, 1751-1762; Wilmington, Del., Old Swedes Chh., 1713-1724; Chester (Delaware) Pa., Sw. Luth. Chh., at Upland, 1713-1716; went to Sweden, 1724, returned ca. 1751 ; Molatton (Berks) Pa., St. Gabriel's Chh., Manathanim, 1752- 1755; Penn (Chester) Pa., St. John's Chh., 1755-1760; Marcus Hook (Del.) Pa., St. Martin's Chh., 1756-1759; Sw. Luth.

name: Jonas Lidman
settled at: Philadelphia, Pa., Gloria Dei or Wicacoa Church
raw: JONAS LIDMAN, came from West Gothland, Sweden; sett. Philadelphia, Pa., Gloria Dei or Wicacoa Chh., 1719-1729; Caernarvon (Lancaster) Pa., Bangor Chh., 1728-1729; Colesville (Colestown?) Sussex, N.j'., St. Mary's Chh., 1728-1728; Sw. Luth.; returned to Ekesjoe, Sweden, 1729.

name: Matthew Lind
edited_raw: Greencastle, Chambersburg, West Conococheague, and Great Cove, all in Franklin co. Pa.
raw: MATTHEW LIND, b. Antrim co. Ireland, 1732; ed. at Glasgow; sett. Coleraine, Ireland, 1760-1774; arriv. New Castle, Del., 1774; sett. Dauphin co.. Pa., 1774-1783; Greencastle, Chambersburg, West Conococheague, and Great Cove, all in Franklin co. Pa., 1783-1800; Associate Ref. Presb.; d. Franklin co. Pa., 21 Apr. 1800.

name: Henry Lindenmeyer
raw: HENRY LINDENMEYER, arriv. N.Y., N.Y., 21 June 1743; sett. York (York) Pa., 1760-1766, 1773-1778; Salisbury (Lehigh) Pa., Chh. at Emaus, 1766-1773; Bethlehem, Pa., 1778-1791; his wife Elizabeth was his helper; member. Board of External Supervision, 1791; Morav.

name: Robert Lindsay
raw: ROBERT LINDSAY, sett. Trenton (Mercer) N.J., Green Street Chh., 1776-1776; Meth.

name: William Lindsay
raw: WILLIAM LINDSAY, A.M., b. Ireland, of Scots parentage; A.M., Glasgow, 30 Apr. 1723; came to America, 3 Aug. 1733; returned to England, 14 Mar. 1734/5; Ord. 1735; arriv. Philadelphia, 28 May 1735; traveling missionary in Pa. and N.J., every 3rd Sunday; London Grove (Chester) Pa., 1735-1745; Concord (Chester) Pa., 1735-1745; S.P.G. missionary at Lancaster (Lane.) Pa., 1734-21 Feb. 1734/5; Bristol (Bucks) Pa., St. James the Greater Chh., 8 June 1734-1745; Mill Creek (New Castle) Del., St. James's Chh. at Stanton, 1735-1745; Penn (Chester) Pa., St. John's Chh., 1735-1745; White Clay Creek, Del., 1735-1735; Alexandria (Hunterdon) N.J., St. Thomas's Chh., 1735- 1745; Amwell (Hunterdon) N.J., St. Andrew's Chh., 1735-1735; Hopewell (Mercer) N.J., 1735-1735; Trenton (Mercer) N.J.,: St. Michael's Chh., 1735-1745; dism. by the S.P.G., 19 July 1745; Ep.; prob. d. in Philadelphia.

name: William Linn
chaplain: Penn. Battalion, Cont. Army, 1776| and Lieutenant, 3rd Regt., Conn. Continental Line, 1776-Npv. 1783|, U.S. Ho. of Rep., 1789- 1790
raw: WILLIAM LINN, D.D., b. near Shippensburgh, Pa., 27 Feb. 1752, son of William Linn; A.B., Princeton, 1772; D.D., Columbia, 1789; Regent, U.S.N.Y., 1787-1808; Trustee, Rutgers Coll., 1787-1808; Près., 1791-1794; Près., Washington Coll., Chestertown, Md., 1784-1787; lie. 1775; Chaplain, Penn. Battalion, Cont. Army, 1776; Chaplain and Lieutenant, 3rd Regt., Conn. Continental Line, 1776-Npv. 1783; sett. Newville, Pa., 1777-1784; N.Y., N.Y., Dutch Ref. Chh., 1785-1805; Elizabethtown, N.J., 1786-1787; Chaplain, U.S. Ho. of Rep., 1789- 1790; supply, Albany, N.Y., 1805-1806; an original niember of the Society of the Cincinnati; Presb.; d. Albany, N.Y., 8 Jan. 1808.

name: John Jacob Lischy Ny
ordained: as a Moravian, was sett, in the following Moravian chhs. in Pa.
raw: JOHN JACOB LISCHY, b. Mulhouse, Alsace, France, 28 May 1719; was a Moravian at Mulhouse and Basel, 1733-1742; arriv. N.Y., NY., 28 May 1742; according to his own diaries, he settled in Lancaster co. Pa., 1743; Ord. as a Moravian, by Bishop David Nitschmann, Jan. 1742/3; was sett, in the following Moravian chhs. in Pa.; Lancaster co.: East Cocalico, Muddy Creek Chh. at Reamstown, 1743-1747; Lancaster, 1743-1746; Mt. Joy, Donegal Chh., 1743-1745; Warwick, St. James's Chh. at Lititz, 1743-1744; York co.: Hellam, 1746-1747; York, 1744-1746; Lebanon co.: Bethel, 1743-1744; Mill Creek, Muehlbach Chh., 1743-1747; Swatara, Hebron Chh., South Lebanon, 1743-1745; Berks co.: Heidelberg, 1742-1743; left the Moravian communion, 1747; Ord. York, Pa., Germ. Ref. Chh., 29 Sept. 1747, and was sett, over the ff. chhs. in Pa. : Lancaster co.: Brecknock, Muddy Creek Chh., Mar. 1743- Oct. 1745; Penn, White Oak Chh., 1745-1746; Ephrata, Cocalico or Bethany Chh., 1743-1744; Mt. Joy, Donegal Chh., 1743-1746; Warwick, Kissel Hill Chh., 1743-1745; West Cocalico, Swamp or Little Cocalico Chh., 1743-1748; York co.: Codorus, St. Jacob's Chh., 1747-1761; Dover, Salem Chh., 1763-1781; Hellam, Kreutz Creek Chh., 1751- 1757; Latimore, Mt. Olivet Chh. at Long Green, Lower Bermudian, 1747-1761; Lower Windsor, 1764-1765; North Codorus, St. Peter's or Lischy's Chh., 1765-1775; Paradise, Holz Schwamm Chh., 1775-1781; West Manchester, St. Paul's or Wolf's Chh., 1763-1781; Lebanon co.: Jackson, Muhlbach or Millbach Chh., 1743-1744; Mill Creek, Tulpehocken or Trinity Chh., 1743-1744; Berks co.: Bern, Bern Chh., 1743- 1746; Chester co.: East Coventry, Brownback's Chh., 19 May 1743- 1744; and in Westminster, Maryland, St. Benjamin's or Kreiger's Chh., 1763-1773; he also preached at Earl (Lane.) Zeltenreich Chh., 1743- 1745; North Annville (Leb.) Hill or Quittopehilla Chh., 1743-1745; East Vincent (Chester) Zion Chh., 1743-1745; Berwick (Adams) 1743- 1744; and at Maiden Creek (Berks) 1743-1744; he was thus sett, over 10 Moravian and 25 Germ. Ref. chhs., 35 in all, and in several he preached from ten to twenty years; when challenged by chh. officials, he declared his connection with the Moravians, 21 Mar. 1744/5, ^"^ he took Christian Henry Rauch as his assistant in 1745; he was deposed as a Germ. Ref. minister in 1760, but continued to hold many of his congregations, and was accepted after a time; Swiss Ref.; Morav.; Germ. Ref.; Independent; d. North Codorus, Pa., Feb. 1781. (GS).

name: John Jacob Lischy Ny
settled at: Lancaster co.: Brecknock, Muddy Creek Church, Mar.  Oct.

name: John Jacob Lischy Ny
settled at: West Cocalico, Swamp or Little Cocalico Church

name: John Jacob Lischy Ny
settled at: York co.: Codorus, St. Jacob's Church

name: John Jacob Lischy Ny
settled at: North Codorus, St. Peter's or Lischy's Church

name: John Jacob Lischy Ny
settled at: West Manchester, St. Paul's or Wolf's Church

name: John Jacob Lischy Ny
settled at: Lebanon co.: Jackson, Muhlbach or Millbach Church

name: John Jacob Lischy Ny
settled at: Mill Creek, Tulpehocken or Trinity Church

name: John Jacob Lischy Ny
settled at: Chester co.: East Coventry, Brownback's Church

name: John Jacob Lischy Ny
settled at: and in Westminster, Maryland, St. Benjamin's or Kreiger's Church
