name: John Jacob Lischy Ny
settled at: North Annville (Leb.) Hill or Quittopehilla Church

name: John Henry Livingston
settled at: N.Y., N.Y., South, Middle and North Dutch Ref. Chhs.
son of: Henry and Susan (Conklin) Livingston by Gilbert Stuart
raw: President JOHN HENRY LIVINGSTON, D.D., b. Poughkeepsie, N.Y., 30 May 1746, son of Henry and Susan (Conklin) Livingston; A.B., Y.C., 1762, A.M.; U. of Utrecht, 1770; S.T.D., U. Utrecht, 1769; Trustee, Rutgers, 1784, 1809; Trustee, Columbia, 1787; Prof, of Theol. and Près., Rutgers, 1810-1825; Ord. Amsterdam, Holland, 2 Apr. 1770; arriv. N.Y., N.Y., 3 Sept. 1770; sett. N.Y., N.Y., South, Middle and North Dutch Ref. Chhs., 1770-1810; during the Rev. he was sett, at Kingston, 1776-1776; Albany, Nov. 1776-1779; Livingston Manor, 1779-1781; Poughkeepsie, 1781-1783; Red Hook, 1781-1783; his portrait was painted by Gilbert Stuart; Dutch Ref.; d. New Brunswick, N.J., 20 Jan. 1825, a. 78 (GS).

name: John Wolf Lizel
edited_raw: JOHN WOLF LIZEL (also called John Wolfgang Leitzel), prob.
raw: JOHN WOLF LIZEL (also called John Wolfgang Leitzel), b. 1723; came from Nuremberg, Germany; prob. Ord. by Andreae; arriv. Philadelphia, 24 Sept. 1753; schoolmaster, 1754; sett. Bedminster (Bucks) Pa., Tohickon Chh., 1760-1765; Tinicum (Bucks) Pa., Christ Church, 1760-1767; Rockhill (Bucks) Pa., Indianfield Chh., 1767-1769; Salisbury (Lehigh) Pa., 1769-1769; disappears, 1769; Luth.

name: Lars Lock
edited_raw: LARS LOCK (Lawrence Karlsson Lock or Lawrence Charles's son Lock), Del.
raw: LARS LOCK (Lawrence Karlsson Lock or Lawrence Charles's son Lock), b. Finland, son of Charles Lock; ed. U. of Upsala; sett. Wilmington, Del., Old Swedes' Chh., 1647-1688; Tinicum (Bucks) Pa., New Goeteborg Chh., 1647-1688; Chester (Del.) Pa., Chh. at Upland, 1647- 1669; Philadelphia, Pa., Gloria Dei or Wicacoa Chh., 1677-1688; Crane Hook (New Castle) Del., Chh. at Tran Hook, 1677-1688; for many years after 1650 he was the only clergyman in Pa.; preached both in Swedish and Dutch; Sw. Luth.; d. Wilmington, Del., 1688.

name: William Lock
ordained: Deacon, at Kingwood (Hunterdon) N.J., 16 Oet. 1762 (minister), Tuekahoe (Cape May) N.J., 20 July 1773-1779
raw: WILLIAM LOCK, b. Dublin; Ord. Deacon, at Kingwood (Hunterdon) N.J., 16 Oet. 1762; Ord. (minister), Tuekahoe (Cape May) N.J., 20 July 1773-1779; Bapt.

name: Richard Locke
raw: RICHARD LOCKE, is said to have had distinguished eonneetions in England; K.B. for Bermuda, 4 July 1743; sett, there 1743-1744; S.P.G. missionary in N.J. and Pa., 1744-1754; sett. Alexandria (H^unterdon) N.J., St. Thomas's Chh., 1744-1748; Amwell (Hunterdon) N.J., 1744- 1748; Lancaster (Lane.) Pa., St. James's Chh., 3 Oet. 1744-1749; Caernarvon (Lane.) Pa., Bangor Chh., 1744-1751; Pequea (Lane.) Pa., 1744-1748; went to England for a short visit, 1748; lie. for Va., 10 May 1749; Kingston Parish (Mathews) Va., 24 Oet. 1749-1750; Newtown (Del.) Pa., St. David's Chh. at Radnor, 1753-1753; returned to England, 1754, for a short visit; Lewes (Sussex) Del., St. Peter's Chh., 1754-1755; Ep.; d. Lewes, Del., bef. 28 July 1755.

name: John Jacob Loesch
raw: JOHN JACOB LOESCH, b. Sehoharie, N.Y., Ord. Tulpehocken, Pa., as a deacon, 1751; itinerant minister and husbandman; Morav.; d. Nazareth, Pa., Nov. 1782.

name: John Jacob Loeser
settled at: Lower Milford (Lehigh) Pa., Upper Milford Church
raw: JOHN JACOB LOESER, sett. Lower Milford (Lehigh) Pa., Upper Milford Chh., 1748-1748; schoolmaster; Luth.

name: John Heinrich Lohman
raw: JOHN HEINRICH LOHMAN (or Lowman), b. Gimbsheim, Germany, where he was a prominent merchant; arriv. Philadelphia, 14 Sept. 1751 ; entered the Ephrata Chloister, Dec. 1751; sett. Latimore (Adams) Pa., Bermudian Chh., 1758-1770; Germ. Bapt.; d. Ephrata, Pa., 24 Jan. 1782.

name: Lohrspach
raw: Domine LOHRSPACH, sett. Upper Saucon (Northampton) Pa., 1749-1750; Springfield (Bucks) Pa., Trinity Chh., 1751-1755; enlisted in the French and Indian Wars, 1755; Germ. Ref.

name: Christian Longanacre
raw: Bishop CHRISTIAN LONGANACRE (also see Langenecker), b. Rapho, Pa., 11 Nov. 1732; Ord. Bishop, 15 May 1769; sett. Warwiek (Lane.) Pa., White Oak Chh., 1769-4 May 1772; Coealico (Lane.) Pa., Conestoga Chh., 1769-1772; Germ. Bapt.

name: John Loretz
raw: JOHN LORETZ, eame from Europe to Bethlehem, Pa., 1770; sett. Bethlehem (Northampton) Pa., 16 Nov. 1770-6 May 1772; returned to Europe, 6 May 1772; Morav.

name: Henry Loveall
ordained: Pisektaway (Middlesex) N.J., Chh. at Stilton, Raritan, 1730
raw: HENRY LOVEALL, b. Cambridge, England, 1694 (his real name was Desolate Baker), sett. Newport, R.L, 1729-1730; Ord. Pisektaway (Middlesex) N.J., Chh. at Stilton, Raritan, 1730; sett. Piseataway, 1730-1739, poss. until 1742; Chestnut Ridge (Baltimore) Md., Sater's Bapt. Chh., Fall's Road, 1742-1772; Opequon (Berkeley) West Va., Mill Creek Chh., 1743-1751; General Bapt.; was living at Chestnut Ridge, Md., 1772, a. 78 years.

name: Wilhelmus Lupardus
raw: WILHELMUS LUPARDUS, ed. U. of Leyden 1684; eame to Ameriea, 1695; sett. Brooklyn, Bushwick, Flatbush, Flatlands, Gravesend, and New Utrecht, all on Long Island, N.Y., 1695-1702; Freehold (Monmouth) with Marlborough, N.J., 1699-1699; Middletown (Monmouth) with Holmdel, N.J., 1699-1699; Dutch Ref.; d. prob, on Long Island, N.Y., 1702.

name: Charles Lute
raw: CHARLES LUTE, sett. Upper Merion (Montgomery) Pa., Christ Chh., 1774-1777; Sw. Luth.; Ep.

name: Aegidius Luyck
raw: AEGIDIUS LUYCK, came to America, 1661 ; teacher of the grammar school, N.Y., N.Y., 1662-1672; supply. South Dutch or First Chh., 1671-1671; he afterwards became burgomaster; his classical school held a splendid reputation; Dutch Ref.

name: Johannes Lydius
raw: JOHANNES LYDIUS, son of the Rev. Henricus Lydius of Maesdam, South Holland; sett. Antwerp, Belgium, 1692-1700; eame to America, 1700; sett. Albany, N.Y., 1700-1709; Schenectady, N.Y., 1705-1709; missionary to the Mohawks, 1702-1709; Dutch Ref.; d. Albany, N.Y., I Mar. 1709.

name: James Lyon
SPG: missionary, Brookhaven, L.L, N.Y., Caroline Church,
degrees: A.M., son of Matthew Lyon of Warrington, Lancashire, England A.B., Princeton, 1759, A.M.
raw: JAMES LYON, A.M., son of Matthew Lyon of Warrington, Lancashire, England; K.B. to N.E., 28 Apr. 1743; sett. Derby, Conn., St. James's Chh., and Waterbury, Conn., 1743-1747; S.P.G. missionary, Brookhaven, L.L, N.Y., Caroline Chh., at Setauket, I74S-I7SS; A.B., Princeton, 1759, A.M.; Ord. Brunswick, N.J., 1764, as a Presb.; assistant minister perhaps at Bedminster, Lamington, Lebanon, Peapack in Lamington, Readington and Bethlehem in Somerset and Hunterdon

name: Cos
raw: COS. N.J., ca. 1760-1764; sett. Onslow, Nova Scotia, 1764-1770; Machias, Me., 1771-1794; Ep.; Presb.; d. Machias, Maine, 12 Oct. 1794.

name: Alexander Mack
raw: Bishop ALEXANDER MACK, b. Schreisheim, Palatinate, Germany, 1679/80; Ord. Schwartzenau, 1708; arriv. Philadelphia, Sept. 1729; sett. Germantown, at Beggarstown, 1729-1735; Cocalico (Lancaster) Pa., Conestoga Chh., 1729-1735; miller; pioneer of the Pennsylvania Tunkers; Germ. Bapt.; d. Germantown, Pa., 19 Feb. 1735, a. 56 (GS).

name: Alexander Mack
ordained: Elder, 7 June 1748 Bishop, at Germantown, Pa., 10 June 1753
son of: Bishop Alexander and Anna Margareta (Kling) Mack
raw: Bishop ALEXANDER MACK, Jr., b. Schwartzenau, Germany, 28 Jan. 1712, son of Bishop Alexander and Anna Margareta (Kling) Mack; arriv. Philadelphia, 15 Sept. 1729; Ord. Elder, 7 June 1748; Ord. Bishop, at Germantown, Pa., 10 June 1753; sett. Ephrata Chloister, 1739-1748; sett. Germantown, Pa., i June 1748-1803; left Ephrata Chloister, 4 Sept. 1745; sett. Mahanaim, Va., 1745-1748; returned to Ephrata, Pa., 1748; Tunker, Dunkard, or Germ. Bapt.; d. Germantown, Pa., 20 Mar. 1803, a. 91.

name: John Martin Mack
raw: Bishop JOHN MARTIN MACK, b. Leysingen, Wurtemberg, Germany, 13 Apr. 1715; arriv. Savannah, Ga., 20 Feb. 1735/6; Ord. 13 Nov. 1742; Indian missionary, 1736-1762; sett. Sunbury (Northampton) Pa., Shamokin Indian Chh., 1742-1761; Gnadenhuetten, Pa., Indian Chh., 1746-1755; Nain (Lehigh) Pa., Indian Chh., 1760-1762; consecrated Bishop, 18 Oct. 1770, at Bethlehem, Pa., the first Moravian Bishop to be consecrated in America; sett. St. Thomas, West Indies, 1762-1784; Morav.; d. St. Thomas, W.L, 9 June 1784.

name: Eneas Mackenzie
settled at: Staten Island, N.Y., St. Andrew's Church, , as S.P.G. missionary at Staten Island
raw: ENEAS MACKENZIE, b. 1675, ed. Aberdeen and Edinburgh; Chaplain to the Earl of Cromarty, 1700-1705; K.B. to N.J., 2 May 1705; sett. Staten Island, N.Y., St. Andrew's Chh., 1705-1722, as S.P.G. missionary at Staten Island; Ep.

name: George Macnish
raw: GEORGE MACNISH, ed. in Scotland; sett. Va., 1705; lie. 1706; sett. Princess Anne (Somerset) Md., Manokin Chh., 1710-1711; Salisbury (Wicomico) Md., Wicomico Chh., 1710-1711; Jamaica, L.L, N.Y., 25 Jan. 1712-1723; Father of Presbyterianism in America; d. Newtown, L.L, N.Y., 10 Mar. 1722/3.

name: George Macnish
raw: GEORGE MACNISH, Jr., A.B., b. Jamaica, L.L, N.Y., 1714, son of the Rev. George and (Smith) Macnish; A.B., Y.C, 1736; stated supply, Newtown, L.L, N.Y., 1744-1746; Presb.; d. Wallkill, N.Y., 1779.

name: Alexander Macwhorter
degrees: D.D., A.B., Princeton, 1757, A.M. D.D., Y.C, 1776
raw: ALEXANDER MACWHORTER, D.D., b. New Castle, Del., 15 July 1734, son of Hugh and Jane Macwhorter; A.B., Princeton, 1757, A.M.; Trustee, 1772-1807; D.D., Y.C, 1776; lie. to preach, 1758; Ord. Cranbury, N.J., 4 July 1759; sett. Newark, N.J., ist Presb. Chh., 1759- 1779, 1781-1807; Chaplain in the Army, Am. Rev., 1778-1779; Près., Charlotte Academy, N.C, 1779-1780; sett. Charlotte (Mecklenburg) N.C, 1779-1779; Abington (Montgomery) Pa., 1780-1780; Presb.; d. Newark, N.J., 20 July 1807, a. 73. (GS).

name: Daniel Calla
degrees: D.D., A.B., Princeton, 1766 D.D., U. of S.C, 1808
raw: DANIEL McCALLA, D.D., b. Neshaminy (Bucks) Pa., 1748; A.B., Princeton, 1766; D.D., U. of S.C, 1808; lie. 1772; Ord. Nov. 1772; sett. Lower Providence (Montgomery) Pa., 1774-1776; Norriton (Montgomery) Pa., 1774-1776; Charlestown (Chester) Pa., 1774-1776; Hanover (Hanover) Va., 1776-1788; Chaplain, Am. Rev., 1775-1776; sett, near Charieston, S.C, Cong. Chh., 1788-1809; Presb.; d. Christ Chh. Parish, S.C, May 1809.

name: John Calloh
raw: JOHN McCALLOH, sett. Mariborough (Ulster) N.Y., 25 Sept. 1773-N0V. 1774; Newburgh (Orange) N.Y., 1773-1773; New Windsor (Orange) N.Y., 1773-1773; Presb.

name: William Clanachan
ordained: (Cong.), Chelsea, Mass., ist Chh. in Revere, 21 Dec. 1748 (Ep.) London, Eng., 1755
raw: WILLIAM McCLANACHAN, A.B., b. Ireland, 1714; A.B., U. of Edinburgh, 1730; came to N.E. before 1734; inst. Georgetown, Me., 15 Nov. 1736-1738; inst. South Portland, Me., 2nd Chh., Presb., at Cape Elizabeth, 15 Nov. 1739-1742; inst. Blandford, Mass., 5 Oct. 1744- 1746; Chaplain, in the Army, 1745; Ord. (Cong.), Chelsea, Mass., ist Chh. in Revere, 21 Dec. 1748; sett. Chelsea, 1747-1754; dism. 18 Dec. 1754; Ord. (Ep.) London, Eng., 1755; K.B. for N.E., 4 Apr. 1755; Ep. missionary, 1754-1758; sett. Philadelphia, Pa., St. Paul's Chh. (Ep.), 1758-1765; Presb.; Cong.; Ep.; liv. 1765.

name: James Crea
settled at: Lamington (Somerset) N.J., Church at Bedminster, I Apr.
raw: JAMES McCREA, b. Ireland, 1711, son of Elder William McCrea; ed. at Log Coll.; lie. New Brunswick, 6 Nov. 1739; Ord. New Brunswick, N.J., 4 Aug. 1741 ; sett. Lamington (Somerset) N.J., Chh. at Bedminster, I Apr. 1740-11 Nov. 1755; inst. i May 1757-21 Oct. 1766; Lebanon (Hunterdon) N.J., 1740-1755, 1757-1766; Peapack (Somerset) N.J., 1740-1755; Readington (Hunterdon) N.J., White House Chh., 1740- 1766; Union (Hunterdon) N.J., Bethlehem Chh., 1740-1747; Amwell (ilunterdon) N.J., 2 Aug. 1742-28 May 1745; Presb.; d. Lamington, N.J., 10 May 1769, a. 58 (GS).

name: Alexander Dowall
ordained: 20 Oct. 1741, prob, preached at Peaked Mountain (Rockingham) Va., Peaked Mt. Chh., 1741
raw: ALEXANDER McDOWALL, b. Ireland; lie. 30 July 1740; Ord. 20 Oct. 1741, by the Donegal Presbytery, as an evangelist to Va.; prob, preached at Peaked Mountain (Rockingham) Va., Peaked Mt. Chh., 1741; sett. Nottingham (Chester) Pa., 1743-1744; principal of a school at Elk, Pa., and Newark, Del.; sett. Elk River (Cecil) Md., Rock Chh. at Lewisville, 1744-1760; Pencader (New Castle) Del., 1767-1773; Bethel (Harford) Md., Chh. at Upper Node Forest, 1774-1782; Presb.; d. Newark, Del., 12 Jan. 1792, unm.

name: Alexander Dowall
settled at: Elk River (Cecil) Md., Rock Church at Lewisville

name: Francis Henry
raw: FRANCIS McHENRY, came from Monaghan, Ireland, 1710; lie. 10 Nov. 1737; Ord. Neshaminy, Pa., 18 Sept. 1739; sett. Warwick (Bucks) Pa., 1738-1742, 1743-1757; West Nottingham (Chester) Pa., May 1742-1743; Neshaminy, Pa., 173 8-1742; Neshaminy (Bucks) Pa., 2nd Presb. Chh., 16 Mar. 1743-1757; Bedminster (Bucks) Pa., Deep Run Chh., 16 Mar. 1743-1757; Old Side; Presb.; d. Neshaminy, Pa., 23 Jan. 1757.

name: Robert Kean
degrees: A.M., A.M. (hon.) U. of Pa., 1760;A.M. (hon.) Columbia, 1763;
son of: William and Letitia (Finney) McKean by Bsp. of Chester
raw: ROBERT McKEAN, A.M., b. Pa., 13 July 1732, son of William and Letitia (Finney) McKean; A.M. (hon.) U. of Pa., 1760; A.M. (hon.) Columbia, 1763; Ord. by Bsp. of Chester; lie. 26 Apr. 1757; K.B. for N.J., 10 May 1757; sett. New Brunswick (Middlesex) N.J., Christ Chh., 16 Dec. 1757-1762; Piscataway, 1761-1763; Woodbridge (Middlesex) N.J., Trinity Chh., 1763-1767, 1/3 time; Perth Amboy (Middlesex) N.J., St. Peter's Chh., Feb. 1763-1767, 2/3 time; physician and S.P.G. missionary; Près., N.J. Medical Soc, 1766; Ep.; d. Raritan Landing, N.J., 17 Oct. 1767; (GS) at Perth Amboy.

name: Charles Mcknight
chaplain: Continental Army, and British prisoner of war, 1777
raw: CHARLES MCKNIGHT , b. Ireland, ca. 1720, son of Rev. Malcolm and Catherine McKnight; ed. Log Coll.; Trustee, Princeton, 1757- 1778; Ord. Basking Ridge (Somerset) N.J., 12 Oct. 1742; sett. Basking Ridge, 1742-1744; Staten Island, 1742-1744; inst. Cranbury (Middlesex) N.J., 16 Oct. 1744-Oct. 1756; inst. Allentown (Monmouth) N.J., 11 Oct. 1744-Oct. 1766; Bordentown (Burlington) N.J., 1758-1766; Shrewsbury (Monmouth) N.J., 12 Apr. 1767-1776; Middletown Point (Monmouth) N.J., at Matawan, 12 Apr. 1767-1776; Shark River (Monmouth) N.J., 12 Apr. 1767-1776; Chaplain, Continental Army, and British prisoner of war, 1777; Presb.; d. in prison, i Jan. 1778 (Memorial Stone, N.Y., N.Y.).

name: John Mcknight
raw: JOHN MCKNIGHT , D.D . (See Colonial Clergy of Virginia, p. 34) Presb.

name: John Mcmillan
trustee: Washington Academy, Washington (Washington) Pa., 1787|, Washington and Jefferson College, 1802
degrees: D.D., A.B., Princeton, 1772 A.M., Washington and Jefferson Coll., 1805, D.D., 1808
raw: JOHN MCMILLAN, D.D., b. Fagg's Manor (Chester) Pa., 11 Nov. 1752, son of William and Margaret (Rea) McMillan; A.B., Princeton, 1772; A.M., Washington and Jefferson Coll., 1805, D.D., 1808; lie. East Nottingham (Chester) Pa., 26 Oct. 1774; preached in New Castle and Donegal Presbyteries, 1774-1775; missionary to Va. and Pa., 1775- 1776; Ord. Chambersburg (Franklin) Pa., 19 June 1776; sett. Chartiers (Washington) Pa., 1775-1833; Pigeon Creek (Washington) Pa., 1775- 1800; founder and Trustee, Washington Academy, Washington (Washington) Pa., 1787; founder and Trustee, Washington and Jefferson College, 1802; Prof, of Divinity, 1802-183 3; Vice-president, 1805-183 3; Presb.; d. Canonsburg (Washington) Pa., 16 Nov. 1833; a. 81.

name: Robert Mordie
chaplain: Pa. Continental Brigade, Rev. War, served to June 1782
member of: original member. Society of the Cincinnati, 1783
ordained: Cumberland (Adams) Pa., Upper Marsh Creek Chh., Gettysburg, 1754-Jan. 1761
raw: ROBERT McMORDIE, Ord. Cumberland (Adams) Pa., Upper Marsh Creek Chh., Gettysburg, 1754-Jan. 1761; Hopewell (York) Pa., Shrewsbury Chh., Round Hill, 1754-Jan. 1761; East Hanover (Lebanon) Pa., 1762-1766; Baltimore, Md., 1774-1774; missionary to Va. and Carolina, 1772-1784; Chaplain, Pa. Continental Brigade, Rev. War, served to June 1782; original member. Society of the Cincinnati, 1783; Presb.; d. 22 May 1796.

name: Thomas Pherrin
raw: THOMAS McPHERRIN, A.M., A.B., Princeton, 1770, A.M., 1773; sett. Montgomery (Franklin) Pa., Welch Run Chh., 1774-1779; Presb.; d. 1802.

name: John Madowell
settled at: Philadelphia, Pa., first Presb. Church, Oct.Nov.
raw: JOHN MADOWELL, came from the Presbytery of Temple-Patrick, Ireland, 1736; sett. Philadelphia, Pa., ist Presb. Chh., Oct.-Nov. 1736; Presb.

name: Hugh Magill
raw: HUGH MAGILL, sett. Bedminster (Bucks) Pa., Deep Run Chh., ( Pb

name: Olaf Malander
settled at: Swedesborough (Gloucester) N.J., Trinity Church on Raccoon Creek
raw: OLAF MALANDER, sett. Swedesborough (Gloucester) N.J., Trinity Chh. on Raccoon Creek, 1725-1725; Sw. Luth.

name: George Wilhelmus Mancius
raw: GEORGE WILHELMUS MANCIUS, b. Duchy of Nassau, Germany, 1706; Herborn Theol. Sem., 1728-1730; Ord. Germany, 1730; came to America, 1730; sett. Kaatsbaan (Ulster) N.Y., Nov. 1730-1762; West Camp (Ulster) N.Y., Chh. at Saugerties, 1730-1762; K.ingsbury (Dutchess) N.Y., 1730-1762; Schraalenburg (Bergen) N.J., 19 Sept. 1731-1732; Paramus (Bergen) N.J., 1731-1732; Kingston (Ulster) N.Y., Chh. at Esopus, 16 May 1732-1762; Germantown (Columbia) N.Y., 1736-1762; Port Jervis (Orange) N.Y., Chh. at Deerpark, 1737- 1741; Lehman (Pike) Pa., Lower Wallpack Chh. at Bushkill, 1737-1741; Delaware (Pike) Pa., 1737-1741; Layton (Sussex) N.J., Upper Wallpack Chh., 1737-1741; Flatbrookville (Sussex) N.J., Wallpack Center Chh., 1737-1741; Minisink (Sussex) N.J., at Montague, 1737-1741; Smithfield (Monroe) Pa., Shawnee Chh. at Lower Smithfield, 1737-1741; Catskill (Greene) N.Y., 1738-1738; Rhinebeck (Dutchess) N.Y., Germ. Ref. Chh., 1732-1742, 1748-1755, 1759-1762; Rhinebeck Flatts (Dutchess) N.Y., Dutch Ref. Chh., 1732-1742, 1746-1750; Dutch Ref.; d. Kingston, N.Y., 6 Sept. 1762 (GS).

name: George Wilhelmus Mancius
settled at: West Camp (Ulster) N.Y., Chh. at Saugerties

name: George Wilhelmus Mancius
settled at: Port Jervis (Orange) N.Y., Chh. at Deerpark

name: George Wilhelmus Mancius
settled at: Lehman (Pike) Pa., Lower Wallpack Chh. at Bushkill

name: George Wilhelmus Mancius
settled at: Smithfield (Monroe) Pa., Shawnee Chh. at Lower Smithfield

name: George Wilhelmus Mancius
settled at: Rhinebeck Flatts (Dutchess) N.Y., Dutch Ref. Chh.

name: James Manning
degrees: D.D., A.B., Princeton, 1762, A.M., D.D., 1786 D.D., U. of Pa., 1785
raw: President JAMES MANNING, D.D., b. Elizabeth, N.J., 22 Oct. 1738, son of James and Christian Manning; A.B., Princeton, 1762, A.M., D.D., 1786; D.D., U. of Pa., 1785; Morristown (Morris) N.J., 1762- 1763; Ord. Warren, R.L, 15^Oct. 1764; sett. Warren, R.L, 1763-1770; inst. Providence, R.L, ist Bapt. Chh., 31 July 1771-1791; inst. Près., Brown U., 5 Sept. 1765-1791; member, Cont. Congress, 1785-1786; Bapt.; d. Providenee, R.L, 29 July 1791, s.p.

name: David Marinus
raw: DAVID MARINUS, ed. in Pa.; lie. 1752; sett. Passaic (Passaic) N.J., Chh. at Aequaekanonk, 1752-1773; Pompton Plains (Morris) N.J., Chh. at Pequannock, 1752-1773; Paterson (Passaic) N.J., Totowa Chh., 1756-1773; Fairfield (Cumberland) N.J., Chh. atHorseneck, 1756-1773; Montville (Morris) N.J., Parsippany or Boonton Chh., 1756-1768, supply; West New Hempstead (Roekland) N.Y., D.R. Chh. at Kakiat, Spring Valley, 1773-1778; Clarkstown (Rutland) N.Y., 1773-1778; Germ. Ref.; Duteh Ref.

name: William Marsh
raw: WILLIAM MARSH, b. Wrentham, Mass.; Ord. Mansfield, Conn.; sett. Dover (Dutehess) N.Y., Oblong Chh., I75S-I7S8; Wantage (Sussex) N.J., 1756-1763; Wilkes-Barre (Luzerne) Pa., 1762-1762, Cong. Chh., where he was murdered by the Indians in the Wyoming massaere, 3 July 1778; Bapt., perhaps later Cong.

name: William Marshall
ordained: Bedminster (Bueks) Pa., Deep Run Chh., at Dyertown, 30 Aug. 1765-1768
raw: WILLIAM MARSHALL, A.M., b. Abernethy, Fifeshire, Seotland, ea. 1740, son of Elder Marshall; arriv. Philadelphia, 1763; A.M. (hon.) Prineeton, 1780; Ord. Bedminster (Bueks) Pa., Deep Run Chh., at Dyertown, 30 Aug. 1765-1768; Philadelphia, Pa., inst. Associate Presb. Chh., 30 Apr. 1771; sett. Philadelphia, 1768-1802; Assoc. Presb.; d. Philadelphia, Pa., 17 Nov. 1802, a. 62 (GS).

name: Frederick Martin
raw: Bishop FREDERICK MARTIN, arriv. Philadelphia, 1740; sent out later as a missionary Bishop to the West Indies; Morav.; d. West Indies, bef. 1754.

name: George Adam Martin
raw: GEORGE ADAM MARTIN, b. Landstuhl, Germany, 1715; Ord. 1739; sett. Reading (Adams) Pa., Great Conewago Chh., 1741-1770; Latimore (Adams) Pa., Bermudian Chh., 1762-1770; Antietam, Md., 1763-1770; Brothertown (Somerset) Pa., Stony Creek Chh., 1770- 1776; Dunkard, Tunker, or Germ. Bapt.; d. Ephrata, Pa., 29 Apr. 1794.

name: Henry Martin
raw: HENRY MARTIN, A.M., A.B., Princeton, 1751, A.M.; Ord. Newtown (Bucks) Pa., 9 Apr. 1754-1764; Salisbury (Bucks) Pa., 1754- 1764; Presb.; d. Newtown, Pa., 11 Apr. 1764.

name: Henry Martin
ordained: West Earl (Laneaster) Pa., Groffdale Chh., 1770-1825 Bishop, 1809
raw: Bishop HENRY MARTIN, b. 1741, son of David Martin; Ord. West Earl (Laneaster) Pa., Groffdale Chh., 1770-1825; Ord. Bishop, 1809; sett. East Earl (Lancaster) Pa., Weaverland Chh., 1770-1825; Menn.; d. East Earl, Pa., 27 Apr. 1825, a. 84.

name: Nicholas Martin
raw: NICHOLAS MARTIN, sett. Conoeoeheague, Md., ea. 1770; Hanover (York) Pa., Little Conewago Chh., ea. 1770; Reading (Adams) Pa., Great Conewago Chh., ea. 1770; Germ. Bapt.

name: Thomas Martin
raw: THOMAS MARTIN, Ord. 12 Oet. 1697; sett. Upper Providenee (Montgomery) Pa., 1697-1700; Newtown (Del.) Pa., 1697-1701 ; Nottingham, Md., 1700; K.eithian or Seventh Day Bapt.

name: John Mason
chaplain: to Posts on the Hudson River, served until the close of the Rev. War
degrees: D.D., Asst. Prof, of Logic and Moral Philosophy, 1758 D.D., 1786
raw: JOHN MASON, D.D., b. near Mid-Calder, Linlithgow co. Scotland, 1734; Asst. Prof, of Logic and Moral Philosophy, 1758; Ord. Scotland, 1761; arriv. in America, 1761; sett. N.Y., N.Y., Scotch Presb. Chh., 1761-1792; Trustee, Princeton, 1779-1785; D.D., 1786; Chaplain to Posts on the Hudson River, served until the close of the Rev. War; eligible officer. Society of the Cincinnati; Associate Presb.; d. N.Y., N.Y., 19 Apr. 1792, a. 58 (GS).

name: Jacob Mast
settled at: Caernarvon (Lane.) Pa., Conestoga Church, near Morgantown
ordained: Bishop of Berks, Chester, and Lancaster counties
raw: Bishop JACOB MAST, b. 1738, came to Bucks co. 1750, aged 12 years; began preaching in 1765; Ord. Bishop of Berks, Chester, and Lancaster counties; sett. Caernarvon (Lane.) Pa., Conestoga Chh., near Morgantown, 1765-1808; Amish; d. Elverson, West Nantmeal (Chester) Pa., 1808, a. 70.

name: Nathaniel Mather
ordained: Lower Aquebogue, L.L, N.Y., Jonesport at Riverhead, 22 May 1728-1748
son of: the Rev. Samuel and Hannah (Treat) Mather
raw: NATHANIEL MATHER, A.B., b. Windsor, Conn., 30 May 1695, son of the Rev. Samuel and Hannah (Treat) Mather; A.B., Y.C, 1715; Ord. Lower Aquebogue, L.L, N.Y., Jonesport at Riverhead, 22 May 1728-1748; Presb.; d. Aquebogue, L.L, N.Y., 20 Mar. 1748, a. 53.

name: Warham Mather
son of: the Rev. Eleazer and Esther (Warham) Mather, A.B., H.C, 1685, A.M.
raw: WARHAM MATHER, A.M., b. Northampton, Mass.y 7 Sept. 1666, son of the Rev. Eleazer and Esther (Warham) Mather, A.B., H.C, 1685, A.M.; sett. East Chester (Westchester) N.Y., 1683-1684; Northfield, Mass., 1688-1690; Killingworth, Conn., 1691-1693; Farmington, Conn., 1704-1704; not ordained; Justice of the Peace and Quorum, Conn., 1710-1716; Judge of Probate, 1716-1727; Cong.; d. New Haven, Conn., 12 Aug. 1745, ^- 79-

name: John Conrad Matthaei
raw: JOHN CONRAD MATTHAEI, b. Bern, Switzerland; bailiff at Wangen, 1674-1680; came to Pa., 1704; Hermit of the Pietistic Community at Wissahickon, Pa., 1708-1748; Pietist; d. near Germantown, Pa., Aug. 1748 (buried i Sept. 1748).

name: Mayor
chaplain: of the French Hospital, London, for many years
raw: J. L. MAYOR, b. Nimes, France; arriv. N.Y., N.Y., 27 July 1754- sett. N.Y., N.Y., French Ref. Chh. of the Saint Esprit, 4 Aug. 1754- Apr. 1764; went to London; Chaplain of the French Hospital, London, for many years; Fr. Ref.

name: Abraham Mead
raw: ABRAHAM MEAD, A.B., b. Greenwich, Conn., 15 June 1721, son of Ebenezer and Hannah Mead; A.B., Y.C, 1739; lie. 3 Feb. 1741/2; sett. Easthampton, L.L, N.Y., 1742-1743; Presb.; d. East Hampton, L.L, N.Y., 1743, a. 22.

name: Solomon Mead
ordained: South Salem (Westchester) N.Y., Chh. at Lewisborough, 20 May 1752-1812
raw: SOLOMON MEAD, A.M., b. Greenwich, Conn., 2 Jan. 1726, son of Ebenezer and Hannah Mead; A.B., Y.C, 1748, A.M.; lie. 31 July 1750; Ord. South Salem (Westchester) N.Y., Chh. at Lewisborough, 20 May 1752-1812; Presb.; d. South Salem, N.Y., 4 Sept. 1812, a. 86.

name: Johannes Megapolensis
son of: the Rev. Johannes Megapolensis, minister at Coedych, Holland
raw: JOHANNES MEGAPOLENSIS, b. 1601, son of the Rev. Johannes Megapolensis, minister at Coedych, Holland; was a Roman Catholic; studied at Cologne U. 1624; converted to Protestantism, 1624; Ord. ca. 1629; sett. Wieringerweert, North Holland, 14 Aug. 1634-1638; sett. Schoorl and Bergen, 163 8-1642; came to America, 1642; contracted to preach for the patroon Van Rensselaer at Rensselaerwyck for six years. 1642-1648; sett. Albany, N.Y., then Fort Orange, 1642-1649; inst. N.Y., N.Y., D.R. or ist Chh. in N.Y., then New Amsterdam, 6 Aug. 1649- 1669; Flatbush and Flatlands, L.L, N.Y., 1664-1669; Dutch Ref.; d. N.Y., N.Y., 24 Jan. 1669/70.

name: Johannes Megapolensis
settled at: N.Y., N.Y., D.R. or first Church in N.Y., then New Amsterdam

name: Samuel Megapolensis
son of: the Rev. Johannes and Machteld (Willemsen) Megapolensis
raw: SAMUEL MEGAPOLENSIS, M.D., b. 1634, son of the Rev. Johannes and Machteld (Willemsen) Megapolensis; H!.C, 1653-1656; matric. U. of Utrecht, Sept. 1656; matric. Leyden, 14 Nov. 1661; M.D., Utrecht, 1663; Ord. Amsterdam, Holland, 3 Oct. 1662; left Holland, 20 Jan. 1663/4; se«- N.Y., N.Y., ist or South Dutch Chh., 1664-1668; St. Mark's in the Bowery, N.Y., N.Y., 1664-1668; Brooklyn, N.Y., 1664- 1668; returned to Holland; sett. Wernigerode, Holland, 1669-1677; Flushing, Holland, 1677-1685; Dordrecht, Holland, 1685-1700; preached at the English chhs. at Flushing and Dordrecht; Dutch Ref.; d. Dordrecht, Holland, 1706.

name: Samuel Megapolensis
edited_raw: St. Mark's in the Bowery, NY, N.Y.

name: Benjamin Meinema
raw: BENJAMIN MEINEMA, lie. 1727; sett. KoUum, Friesland, Holland, to 1745; came to America, 1745; sett. Fishkill (Dutchess) N.Y., 1745- 1756; Poughkeepsie (Dutchess) N.Y., 1745-1756; Dutch Ref.

name: Abraham Meinung
edited_raw: St. Thomas, Danish West Indies, Aug.
raw: ABRAHAM M. MEINUNG, arriv. N.Y., N.Y., 30 Nov. 1741; Ord. deacon, 1745; sett. Oley (Berks) Pa., 1744-1745; St. Thomas, Danish West Indies, Aug. 1746-1749; Morav.; d. St. Thomas, W.L, Oct. 1749.

name: Samuel Melyen
degrees: A.M., bapt. 7 Aug. 1677, son of Jacob Melyen A.B., H.C, 1696, A.M.
raw: SAMUEL MELYEN, A.M., b. N.Y., N.Y., 1675; bapt. 7 Aug. 1677, son of Jacob Melyen; A.B., H.C, 1696, A.M.; Ord. Elizabethtown (Union) N.J., 20 May 1704-1707; Presb.; d. Elizabethtown, N.J., between May and July 1711.

name: Ren Menard
raw: RENÉ MENARD, S.J., sett. Auburn (Cayuga) N.Y., St. Joseph's Mission to the Cayugas, 1656-1658; Ottawa mission, 15 Oct. 1660-1661; R.C; d. Ottawa mission, ca. 10 Aug. 1661.

name: Valentine Metzler
settled at: West Lampeter (Lane.) Pa., Willow Street Church
raw: Bishop VALENTINE METZLER, b. Switzeriand, 14 Feb. 1726; minister and bishop in Europe; came to America, 1738; sett. West Lampeter (Lane.) Pa., Willow Street Chh., 1738-1783; East Hempfield (Lane.) Pa., Chh. at Rohrerstown, 1738-1783; East Hempfield, Pa., Chh. at Millersville, 1757-1783; Menn.; d. Pequea District (Lane.) Pa., 24 July 1783, a. 57.

name: John Philip Meurer
raw: JOHN PHILIP MEURER (or Maurer), b. Alsace, France; arriv. Philadelphia, 7 Jan. 1741/2; Ord. Bethlehem, Pa., 9 Dec. 1742; sett. Marion (Berks) Pa., Chh. at Stouchsburg, Sept. 1742-Jan. 1747; Mount Joy (Lane.) Pa., Chh. at Donegal, Jan. 1746-1747; Bethlehem, Pa., Jan. 1747-1751 ; York (York) Pa., 1751-1753; also minister at Lebanon, Swatara, York, Macungie, Oley, and Allemaengel; kept a diary at Bethlehem, Pa.; his wife Christiana was also ordained and assisted him; Luth.; Morav.; d. Bethlehem, Pa., Apr. 1760.

name: Christian Meyer
raw: Bishop CHRISTIAN MEYER, b. ca. 1705, son of Christian and Magdalena Meyer; sett. Franconia (Montgomery) Pa., Indian Creek Chh., 1738-1787; Lower Salford (Montg.) Pa., 1738-1787; Bishop; Treasurer, 1756; Menn.; d. 1787.

name: Hermann Meyer
degrees: D.D., matric. Groningen, Holland, 6 Sept. 1747, in theol. D.D., Rutgers, 1789
raw: HERMANN MEYER, D.D., b. Bremen, Germany, 27 July 1733, son of Jacob and Rebecca (Schlichting) Meyer; matric. Groningen, Holland, 6 Sept. 1747, in theol.; Ord. Groningen, Holland, 31 Mar. 1763; arriv. America, Oct. 1763; D.D., Rutgers, 1789; Prof, of Divinity, R.utgers, 1789-1791; Fellow of the German Soc, of Bremen; sett. Kingston (Ulster) N.Y., Chh. at Esopus, 2 Nov. 1763-Nov. 1772; Paterson (Passaic) N.J., Totowa Chh., 1772-1791; Fairfield (Cumberland) N.J., Chh. at Horseneck, 1772-1785; Pompton Plains (Morris) N.J., Chh. at Pequannock, 1772-1791; Montville (Morris) N.J., Parsippany or Boonton Chh., 1772-1791; all these chhs. were Dutch Ref.; Germ. Ref.; d. Pompton Plains, N.J., 27 Oct. 1791.

name: Jacob Meyer
raw: Bishop JACOB MEYER, b. Switzerland, 1721; came to America, 1741; Ord. minister, 1752; Ord. Bishop, 1763; sett. Upper Saucon (Lehigh) Pa., near Coopersburg, 1752-1790; Milford (Bucks) Pa., Great Swamp Chh., 1752-1790; Milford, Pa., East Swamp Chh., 1771-1790; Menn.; d. Upper Saucon, Pa., 4 May 1790.

name: Jacob Meyer
ordained: Hilltown (Bucks) Pa., Perkasie or Blooming Glen Chh., 1758-1778
raw: JACOB MEYER, b. 28 Jan. 1730, brother of Christian Meyer; Ord. Hilltown (Bucks) Pa., Perkasie or Blooming Glen Chh., 1758-1778; Menn.; d. 1778, of yellow fever.

name: John Adolph Meyer
raw: Dr. JOHN ADOLPH MEYER, son of Dr. Meyer; physician at Bethlehem, Pa., and in the Lehigh Valley; Ord. Bethlehem, Pa., 1748; Nazareth (Northampton) Pa., ist warden, 1744-1749; Frederick (Montgomery) Pa., Falkner's Swamp Chh., 1746-1749; physician later at Philadelphia and Lititz, Pa.; Morav.; d. Lititz, Pa.

name: Peter Meyer
raw: PETER MEYER, b. Switzerland, ca. 1723; brother of Bishop Jacob Meyer; came to America, ca. 1741; Ord. Swamp District (Milford, Bucks CO.), Pa., 1773; sett. Springfield (Bucks) Pa., 1773 ff.; Menn.

name: Samuel Meyer
raw: SAMUEL MEYER, b. 10 June 1734; Ord. Bedminster (Bucks) Pa., Deep Run Chh., 1769; sett. Bedminster (Bucks) Pa., 1769 ff.; Hilltown (Bucks) Pa., Perkasie or Blooming Glen Chh., 1769 ff. ; Menn.

name: Jan Meyle
raw: JAN MEYLE (or Johannes Meyle), b. Germany, 1701; was an Anabaptist, Dec. 1723; rebaptized as a Dunkard or Gerrn. Bapt., Dec. 1728; sett. Lower Frederick (Montgomery) Pa., Falkner's Swamp Chh., as an assistant, 1729—1735; sett. Ephrata (Lane.) Pa., as a member of the German Baptist Chloister at Ephrata, 1753-1783; deeded 180 acres of land to the Eckerling brothers for a Chloister, 13 Aug. 1739; Germ. Bapt.; d. Ephrata, Pa., 6 Aug. 1783, a. 82.

name: Philip Jacob Michael
raw: PHILIP JACOB MICHAEL, b. in Europe, 1716; arriv. Philadelphia, 14 Oct. 1731; not ordained; began to preach in Berks co. Pa., 1750; sett. Heidelberg (Lehigh) Pa., 1750-1770; Weisenberg (Lehigh) Pa., Ziegel Chh., 29 June 1750-1760; Lynn (Lehigh) Pa., Jacob's Chh., 1750- 1770; Long Swamp (Berks) Pa., 1752-1753, 1762-1774, 1781-1786; Reading (Berks) Pa., 1753-1754; Maxatawny (Berks) Pa., De Long Chh., 1759-1770; Maxatawny, St. John's Chh. at Kutztown, 1759- 1770; Lynn (Lehigh) Pa., Ebenezer or Organ Chh., 1760-1770; Upper Hanover (Montgomery) Pa., New Goshenhoppen Chh., 1763-1764; Upper Salford (Montg.) Pa., Old Goshenhoppen Chh., 1763-1764; Weisenberg (Lehigh) Pa., Weisenberg Chh., 1761-1775; Lynn (Lehigh) Pa., Tresbacker Chh., 1766-1770; Lowhill (Lehigh) Pa., 1769-1770; Upper Bern (Berks) Pa., St. Michael's Chh., 1769-1770; Perry (Berks) Pa., Zion's Chh., 1771-1786; founder of Ziegel's and Jacob's Chhs., noted above; weaver; Chaplain, Am. Rev. War, 17 May 1777 ff.; Germ. Ref.; d. Rockland (Berks) Pa., June 1786 (will dated 6 May 1786; proved 17 June 1786).

name: Philip Jacob Michael
settled at: Maxatawny, St. John's Chh. at Kutztown

name: Philip Jacob Michael
settled at: Lynn (Lehigh) Pa., Ebenezer or Organ Chh.

name: Philip Jacob Michael
settled at: Upper Hanover (Montgomery) Pa., New Goshenhoppen Chh.

name: Philip Jacob Michael
settled at: Upper Salford (Montg.) Pa., Old Goshenhoppen Chh.

name: Philip Jacob Michael
settled at: Upper Bern (Berks) Pa., St. Michael's Chh.

name: Jonas Johannes Michaelius
raw: JONAS JOHANNES MICHAELIUS, b. Hoorn, Netherlands, 1577, son of Johannes Michaelius (U. Leyden, 1583); matric. U. Leyden, 6 Sept. 1600, a. 23; minister at Nieuwbokswoude, 1612-1614; Hem, St. Luke's Chh., 1614-1624; Naval Chaplain at San Salvador and Brazil, 1624-1625; Fort St. George d'Elmina, Guinea, 1626-1627; returned to Netherlands, 1627; arriv. N.Y., N.Y., then called Niew Amsterdam, 1628; sett. N.Y., N.Y. (Niew Amsterdam), South Dutch Ref. Chh., Jan. 1628-1631, as the first minister of the first church in N.Y. State; sett. French Ref. Chh., N.Y., N.Y., 1628-1631; returned to Holland, 1637-1638; Dutch Chh., Yarmouth, England, 1641; sett. Zealand; Dutch Ref.

name: John Wolfgang Michler
raw: JOHN WOLFGANG MICHLER, b. Wuertemberg; arriv. N.Y., N.Y., 26 Nov. 1743; sett. Nazareth (Northampton) Pa., 1743-1745; Oley (Berks) Pa., 1745-1748, 1752-1753; Salisbury (Lehigh) Pa., Chh. at Emaus, 1750-1751; Ord. Deacon, 1762; minister in rural chhs. and at St. Thomas, West Indies; shoemaker; his wife Rosina was also ordained; Morav.

name: Michael Miksch
edited_raw: Indian missionary among the Samoydes, Arctic Ocean
raw: MICHAEL MIKSCH, came from Kunwald, Moravia; missionary among the Samoydes, Arctic Ocean, 1737; sett. Bethlehem, Pa., 1742 ff.; Indian missionary at Gnadenhuetten, Nazareth and Grandenthal; Morav.; d. Gnadenthal, Pa., June 1792.

name: Peter Milet
edited_raw: Rome (Oneida) N.Y. Francis Xavier's mission to the Oneidas
settled at: Auburn (Cayuga) N.Y., St. John's Mission to the Cayugas
raw: PETER MILET, sett. Auburn (Cayuga) N.Y., St. John's Mission to the Cayugas, 1668-1671; Rome (Oneida) N.Y., St. Francis Xavier's mission to the Oneidas, 1671-Oct. 1694; R.C

name: Alexander Miller
raw: ALEXANDER MILLER, A.M., A.B., Princeton, 1764, A.M., 1768; Trustee, 1785-1795; lie. 1767; Ord. N.Y., 1770; sett. Schenectady, N.Y., 1770-1781; Princetown (Schenectady) N.Y., Chh. at Currie's Bush, 1770-1781; Remsen's Bush, N.Y., 1770-1781; Presb.; d. after 1795.

name: Benjamin Miller
ordained: Scotch Plains (Union) N.J., Chh. at Fanwood, 13 Feb. 1748-1781
raw: BENJAMIN MILLER, b. Scotch Plains, N.J., 1716; Ord. Scotch Plains (Union) N.J., Chh. at Fanwood, 13 Feb. 1748-1781; sett. Jersey Settlements (Davidson) N.C, 1754-1756; Bapt.; d. Fanwood, N.J., 14 Nov. 1781, a. 65 (GS).

name: Frederick Casimir Miller
settled at: Upper Salford (Montgomery) Pa., Old Goshenhoppen Chh.
raw: FREDERICK CASIMIR MILLER (or Mueller), came from Steticheim, near Mayence; schoolteacher at Mayence; arriv. Philadelphia, 20 Oct. 1744; sett. Upper Salford (Montgomery) Pa., Old Goshenhoppen Chh., 1745-1748; Upper Hanover (Montg.) Pa., New Goshenhoppen Chh., 1745-1748; Lower Milford (Lehigh) Pa., Great Swamp Chh., 1745-1748; sett. Bern (Berks) Pa., Bern Chh., 1746-1752; Oley (Berks) Pa., Manatawny Chh., 1748-1768; Oley, Pa., Germ. Ref. Chh., 1746- 1768; Long Swamp (Berks) Pa., 1748-1752; Breeknoek (Lane.) Pa., Muddy Creek Chh., 29 May 1751-Aug. 1752-1754; East Coventry (Chester) Brownbaek's Chh., 1751-Nov. 1761 (ehh. reeords); Heidelberg (Berks) Pa., Hain's or Caeusi Chh., 1762-1762; Lebanon (Lebanon) Pa., Tabor Chh., 1762-1766; Swatara (Lebanon) Pa., Little Swatara Chh., 1762-1768; Swatara, Pa., Swatara Chh., 1762-1765; North Annville (Lebanon) Pa., Hill or Quitopehilla Chh., 1762-1765; Tinicum (Bucks) Pa., Christ Chh., 1762-1768; Ephrata (Lane.) Pa., Bethany Chh., 1763-1765; Germ. Ref.; d. Lebanon, Pa., after 3 July 1768.

name: Frederick Casimir Miller
settled at: Upper Hanover (Montg.) Pa., New Goshenhoppen Chh.

name: Frederick Casimir Miller
settled at: Lower Milford (Lehigh) Pa., Great Swamp Chh.

name: Frederick Casimir Miller
settled at: East Coventry (Chester) Brownbaek's Chh., Nov.  (ehh. reeords)

name: Frederick Casimir Miller
settled at: Heidelberg (Berks) Pa., Hain's or Caeusi Chh.

name: Frederick Casimir Miller
settled at: North Annville (Lebanon) Pa., Hill or Quitopehilla Chh.

name: George Miller
settled at: Mount Joy (Lane.) Pa., Great Swatara Church
raw: GEORGE MILLER, Ord. ea. 1770; sett. Mount Joy (Lane.) Pa., Great Swatara Chh., 1756-1770; Germ. Bapt.

name: John Miller
chaplain: in the Fort, N.Y., N.Y., 1689 ff.
raw: JOHN MILLER, Chaplain in the Fort, N.Y., N.Y., 1689 ff.; K.B. for N.Y., 1692; Ep.

name: John Peter Miller
raw: JOHN PETER MILLER (or Mueller), b. Zweikirchen, near Kaiserslauten, Palatinate, Germany, 25 Dec. 1709, son of the Rev. John Miller; matric. Heidelberg, 29 Dee. 1725; lie. 1725; arriv. Philadeíphia, 29 Aug. 1730, on the "Thistle," of Glasgow; Ord. Philadelphia, Pa., 20 Nov. 1730 (Germ. Ref. ministry): Germantown, Pa., 1730-1731; Philadelphia, 1730-1731, 1733-1735; Worcester (Montgomery) Pa., Wentz's or Skippack Chh., 1730-1731 ; Lower Milford (Lehigh) Pa., Great Swamp Chh., 1730-1734; North Annville (Lebanon) Pa., Hill or Quittopehilla Chh., 1730-1735; Brecknock (Lane.) Pa., Muddy Creek Chh., 1731-1734; Ephrata (Lane.) Pa., Bethany Chh., 1731-1734; Penn (Lane.) Pa., Reyer's Chh. at White Oak, 1731-1734; Earl (Lane.) Pa., Zeltenreieh Chh., 1731-1734; Laneaster (Lane.) Pa., 1730-1735; Upper Leaeoek (Lane.) Pa., Heller's, Hill, Conestoga, or Salem Chh. (variously named at different times but the same ehh.), 1731-1734; Mill Creek (Lebanon) Pa., Tulpehoeken or Trinity Chh., 1730-1735; Upper Hahover (Montgomery) Pa., New Goshenhoppen Chh., July 1731-July 1734; Upper Salford (Montg.) Pa., Old Tulpehoeken Chh., July 1731-July 1734; beeame a 7th Day Bapt., Tunker or German Bapt., May I1735; as sueh called Brother Jabez; Ord. Ephrata, Pa., Aug. 1740 (German Bapt. ministry): Oley (Bucks) Pa., Germ. Bapt. Chh., 1732-1735; sett. Ephrata, Pa., Germ. Bapt. Chloister, 1735-1796, prior, 23 Mar. 1746- 1768; head of Ephrata, 6 July 1766-1780; sett. Latimore (Adams) Pa., Bermudian Chh., 1758-1762; member. Am. Phil. Soe.; Germ. Ref.; Germ Bapt.; d. Ephrata, Pa., 25 Sept. 1796, a. 86 y. 9 m. (GS).

name: John Peter Miller
settled at: Worcester (Montgomery) Pa., Wentz's or Skippack Church

name: John Peter Miller
settled at: Lower Milford (Lehigh) Pa., Great Swamp Church

name: John Peter Miller
settled at: North Annville (Lebanon) Pa., Hill or Quittopehilla Church

name: John Peter Miller
settled at: Upper Leaeoek (Lane.) Pa., Heller's, Hill, Conestoga, or Salem Church (variously named

name: John Peter Miller
settled at: Mill Creek (Lebanon) Pa., Tulpehoeken or Trinity Church

name: John Peter Miller
settled at: Upper Hahover (Montgomery) Pa., New Goshenhoppen Church, July July

name: John Peter Miller
settled at: Upper Salford (Montg.) Pa., Old Tulpehoeken Church, July July

name: John Peter Miller
raw: JOHN PETER MILLER, sett. Weisenberg (Lehigh) Pa., Ziegel's Chh., 1760-1772; Heidelberg (Lehigh) Pa., ea. 1770; Lynn (Lehigh) Pa., Ebenezer Chh. at New Tripoli, 1774-1778; Lynn, Pa., Allemaengel Chh. at Tripoli, 1774-1778;Lynn, Pa., Jaeob's Chh., 1774-1778; Germ. Ref.; d. New Tripoli, Lynn, Pa., in or after 1778.

name: Samuel Mills
son of: the Rev. Jedediah and Abigail (Treat) Mills
raw: SAMUEL MILLS, A.M., b. Huntington, Conn., son of the Rev. Jedediah and Abigail (Treat) Mills; A.B., Y.C, 1765, A.M.; lie. (Cong.), 31 May 1768; Ord. Bedford (Westchester) N.Y., 13 Dec. 1769; sett. Bedford, N.Y., 1769-2 July 1779; sett. Patterson, N.Y., 1783-1789; became a Baptist; sett. Livingston co., N.Y., as an itinerant; Cong.; Presb.; Bapt.; d. Sparta, N.Y., bef. 7 Oct. 1806.

name: Samuel Mills
settled at: Livingston co., N.Y., as an itinerant

name: William Mills
raw: WILLIAM MILLS, A.M., b. Smithtown, L.L, N.Y., 13 Mar. 1739; A.B., Princeton, 1756, A.M.; A.M. (hon.), Y.C, 1771; sett. Jamaica, L.L, N.Y., 1762-1774; Presb.; d. Jamaica, L.L, N.Y., 18 Mar. 1774.

name: John Milne
SPG: missionary in Monmouth co. N.J., 1736-1745| missionary, 20 Apr. 1744
raw: JOHN MILNE, K.B., for N.Y., 26 Sept. 1727; sett. Albany, N.Y., St. Peter's Chh., 9 Dec. 1727-1736; also served as an Indian missionary; Schenectady, N.Y., St. George's Chh., 1727-1736; S.P.G. missionary in Monmouth co. N.J., 1736-1745; preached at: Freehold, St. Peter's Chh., 1736-1745; Shrewsbury, Christ Chh., 1736-1745; Middletown, Christ Chh., 1738-1745; discharged as a S.P.G. missionary, 20 Apr. 1744; separated, 25 Mar. 1744/5; Ep.

name: John Milner
raw: JOHN MILNER, A.B., b. Westchester co., N.Y., 1738, son of Nathaniel Milner; A.B., Princeton, 1758; Ord. England, 1760; lie. for N.Y., 25 Feb. 1761; K.B. for N.Y., 5 Mar. 1761; induct. Rector, Westchester (Westchester) N.Y., St. Peter's Chh., 12 June 1761-1766; East Chester (Westchester) N.Y., St. Paul's Chh., 1761-1766; Yonkers (Westchester) N.Y., St. John's Chh., 1761-1764; sett. Warwisqueake Parish (Isle of Wight) Va., 1766-1775; Ep.; d. Newport Parish, Va., 1775.

name: Peter Mischler
settled at: Windsor (Berks) Pa., Lebanon Church at the Blue Mountains, now St. Paul's Church
raw: PETER MISCHLER, sett. Windsor (Berks) Pa., Lebanon Chh. at the Blue Mountains, now St. Paul's Chh., 1765-1767; Upper Bern (Berks) Pa., St. Michael's Chh., 1769-1770; Luth.

name: Alexander Mitchell
raw: ALEXANDER MITCHELL, A.B., b. 1731; A.B., Princeton, 1765; lie. 1767; Ord. Tinicum (Bucks) Pa., 1769; sett. Tinicum, Pa., 1768- 1785; Plumstead (Bucks) Pa., 1768-1785; Octoraro (Chester) Pa., 1785-1808; Doe Run (Chester) Pa., 1785-1808; Presb.; d. 1812.

name: Henry Moeller
raw: HENRY MOELLER, A.M. (Miller or Moller), b. Hamburg, Germany, 1749, son of John and Barbara Moeller; ed. Halle; arriv. Philadelphia, 1764; A.M. (hon.) Columbia, 1790; Trustee of Hartwig Seminary; lie. 1774; sett, over the following chhs. in Berks co. Pa.: Reading, Trinity Chh., Aug. 1775-Aug. 1777; Muhlenberg, Alsace Chh., 1775- 1777; Exeter, Schwartzwald Chh., 1775-1777; Perry, Zion's Chh., 1775- 1777; Upper Bern, St. Michael's Chh., 1775-1777; Windsor, Lebanon Chh. at the Blue Mountains, now St. Paul's Chh., 1775-1777; sett. Albany, N.Y., 1777-1789, 1802-1808; New Holland, Pa., 1789-1795; Harrisburg, Pa., 1795-1802; Sharon, N.Y., and New Rhinebeck (Schoharie CO.) N.Y., 1808-1823; Luth.; d. Sharon, N.Y., 16 Sept. 1829, a. 79.

name: John Henry Moeller
raw: JOHN HENRY MOELLER, sett. Lynn (Lehigh) Pa., 1754-1754; Morav.

name: John Moffat
raw: JOHN MOFFAT, A.B., b. Ireland; A.B., Princeton, 1749; Ord. Montgomery (Orange) N.Y., Good Will Chh., 1751-1765; teacher; Presb.; d. Little Britain (Orange) N.Y., 22 Apr. 1788.

name: Peter Moll
settled at: Washington (Berks) Pa., chhs. at Hereford and Manatant
raw: PETER MOLL, landed at Philadelphia, 19 Aug. 1729; sett. Washington (Berks) Pa., chhs. at Hereford and Manatant, 1729-1759; Menn., d. Hereford, Pa., 19 Mar. 1759.

name: Richard Molyneux
settled at: Lancaster (Lane.) Pa., St. John Nepomucene Church
raw: RICHARD MOLYNEUX, b. London, England, 26 Mar. 1696; arriv. Maryland, 1733; sett. Lancaster (Lane.) Pa., St. John Nepomucene Chh., 1740-1749; returned to England, 1749; Superior in Md., 1736, 1743; R.C; d. Bonham, England, 18 May 1766. :

name: Robert Molyneaux
settled at: Philadelphia, Pa., St. Joseph's Church, June
raw: ROBERT MOLYNEAUX, sett. Philadelphia, Pa., St. Joseph's Chh., June 1772-1786; R.C; d. Philadelphia, Pa., after 1786.

name: John Montaigne
raw: JOHN MONTAIGNE, came to America, 1696; sett. Fordham, N.Y., 1696 ff.;Fr. Ref.

name: Benjamin Moore
raw: Bishop BENJAMIN MOORE, D.D., b. Newtown, L.L, N.Y., 5 Oct. 1748, son of Samuel and Sarah (Fish) Moore; A.M., Columbia, 1768, D.D., 1789; Près., pro temp., 1775-1784; Prof., 1786-1800; Trustee, 1802-1813; President, 1801-1811; Regent, U. of State of N.Y., 1784- 1787; Ord. London, 25 June 1774; K.B., N.Y., 6 July 1774; sett. N.Y., N.Y., Trinity Chh., 1774-1801; Ep. Bishop of N.Y., 1801-1816; Ep.; d. Greenwich, 27 Feb. 1816, a. 68.

name: Benjamin Moore
edited_raw: Regent, U. of State of N.Y.

name: John Moore
raw: JOHN MOORE, may have been at H.C, 1646; came to Southampton, L.I., N.Y., 1641; sett. Newtown, L.L, N.Y., 1651-1661; Cong.; d. Newtown, L.L, N.Y., 17 June 1661.

name: John Moore
raw: JOHN MOORE, A.B., perhaps b. Windsor, Conn.; A.B., Y.C, 1741; schoolteacher at Jamaica, L.L, N.Y., 1742; prob. Ord. 1745; Ep.; d. perhaps in 1799.

name: Thoroughgood Moore
degrees: A.M., matric. Magdalene Coll. Cambridge, 1692 A.B., 1694/5, A.M., 1698
raw: THOROUGHGOOD MOORE, A.M., b. Biggleswade, co. Beford, England, 1672, son of John Moore; matric. Magdalene Coll. Cambridge, 1692; A.B., 1694/5, A.M., 1698; incorp., 9 July 1700; Ord. (Bsp. of London), 25 Feb. 1703/4; K.B. for America, 19 Feb. 1703/4; arriv. N.Y., N.Y., autumn, 1704; sett. Albany, N.Y., 1704-Oct. 1705, and Indian missionary, 1705-1705; S.P.G. missionary in N.J.: Burlington (Burlington) N.J., St. Mary's Chh., 1705-1706; Hopewell (Mercer) N.J., 1705-1706; Trenton, N.J., 1705-1706; Ep.; set sail for England, but the ship sank with all on board, 1707.

name: James Morehead
settled at: West Jersey and New Castle co. Del., ca.
raw: JAMES MOREHEAD, sett. West Jersey and New Castle co. Del., ca. 1735; not received by the Presbytery; Presb.

name: Abel Morgan
settled at: Lower Dublin, Pa., Pennypack Bapt. Church
raw: ABEL MORGAN, Senior, b. Alltgoch, Llanwenog, Cardigan, South Wales, 1637, son of the Rev. Morgan Ryddarch; Ord. Blaenegwent, col Monmouth, Wales, 1656; arriv. in America, 14 Feb. 1711; sett. Lower Dublin, Pa., Pennypack Bapt. Chh., 1711-1722; sett. Philadelphia, Pa., 1st Bapt. Chh., 1711-1722; Bapt.; d. Philadelphia, Pa., 16 Dec. 1722, a. 85.

name: Abel Morgan
raw: ABEL MORGAN, Jr., A.M., b. Welsh Tract, Newark, Del., 18 Apr. 1713, son of the Rev. Enoch Morgan; bapt. 31 Mar. 1733; A.M. (hon.) Brown, 1769; Ord. Welsh Tract (Newark) Del., 1734; sett. Middletown (Monmouth) N.J., 1738-1785; Bapt.; d. Middletown, N.J., 24 Nov. 1785, unm.

name: Ev An Morgan
ordained: Lower Dublin, Pa., Pennypack Bapt. Chh., 23 Oct. 1706
raw: EV'AN MORGAN, came from Wales; was called to the ministry, 1702; Ord. Lower Dublin, Pa., Pennypack Bapt. Chh., 23 Oct. 1706; sett. Lower Dublin, Pa., 1702-1709; Philadelphia, Pa., ist Bapt. Chh., 1702-1709; Bapt.; d. Lower Dublin, Pa., 16 Feb. 1709.

name: Joseph Morgan
raw: JOSEPH MORGAN, A.M., b. Preston, Conn., 6 Nov. 1671, son of Lieut. Joseph and Dorothy (Parke) Morgan; A.B., Y.C, 1702, A.M., 1720; Ord. Fairfield, Conn., ca. 12 June 1700; sett. Greenwich, Conn., 1st Chh., 1697-1700, 2nd Chh. at Horseneck, 1705-17 Oct. 1708; sett. Bedford (Westchester) N.Y., 26 Dec. 1699-1704; sett. Mt. Vernon, East Chester (Westchester) N.Y., 1702-1704; Presb. chhs.: Middletown (Monmouth) N.J., Chh. at Middletown Point, 1709-1731; Tennent (Monmouth) N.J., at Freehold, 19 Oct. 1708-1729; Freehold, N.J., Dutch Ref. Chh., 1709-1729; Holmdel (Monmouth) N.J., at Middletown, Dutch Ref. Chh., 1709-1729; Marlborough (Monmouth) N.J., Chhs. at Freehold and Middletown, both Dutch Ref., 19 Oct. 1709- 1729; Presb. Chhs.: Hopewell (Mercer) Chh. at Ewing, 1728-1736; Hopewell (Mercer) N.J., Pennington Chh., 1728-1738; Lawrenceville (Mercer) N.J., Maidenhead Chh., 1728-1738; Presb.; may also have preached at Trenton, N.J., 1728-1738, as given by some authorities.

name: Joseph Morgan
settled at: Freehold and Middletown, both Dutch Ref.

name: Joseph Morgan
settled at: Trenton, N.J., , as given by some authorities.

name: Evander Morrison
raw: EVANDER MORRISON, came from Scotland; supply. East Hartford, Conn., 1748-1749; supply, Bedminster (Bucks) Pa., Tohickon Chh., and Forks of the Delaware, Pa., Sept. 1752-1753 ; sett. Bart (Lane.) Pa., Middle Octoraro Chh., 1753-1756; Peach Bottom (York) Pa., Slate Ridge Chh., 1753-1756; Presb.

name: John Morse
raw: JOHN MORSE, A.M., b. Dedham, Mass., 31 Mar. 1674, son of Ezra and Joanna (Hoare) Morse; A.B., H.C, 1692, A.M.; sett. Newtown, L.L, N.Y., 15 Sept. 1694-1700; Cong.; d. Newtown, L.L, N.Y., Oct. 1700.

name: Andrew Morton
settled at: Amwell (Hunterdon) N.J., St. Andrew's Church, June
raw: ANDREW MORTON (or Moretón), lie. for N.J., 17 Mar. 1760; K.B. for N.J., 18 Mar. 1760; S.P.G. missionary in N.J. and N.C; sett. Amwell (Hunterdon) N.J., now Lambertville, St. Andrew's Chh., June 1760- 1765; Alexandria (Hunterdon) N.J., St. Thomas's Chh., June 1760- 1765; St. George's Parish (Northampton) N.C, 1766-1766, and Mecklenburg CO. N.C, 1766-1766; left in 1766 on account of ill health; sett. Drysdale Parish (Caroline) Va., bef. 20 Apr. 1774-1775; King and Queen co. Va., 1774-1775; dismissed, 1775; Ep.

name: Andrew Morton
edited_raw: St. George's Parish (Northampton) N.C, , and Mecklenburg CO. N.C

name: Ebenezer Moseley
ordained: Sept. 1767, as an Indian missionary for the New England Company for Propagating the Gospel Among the Indians, at Onohoquaga on the Susquehanna near Binghamton, N.Y., 1767-1772
son of: the Rev. Samuel and Bethia (Otis) Moseley
raw: EBENEZER MOSELEY, A.M., b. Hampton, Conn., 19 Feb. 1740/1, son of the Rev. Samuel and Bethia (Otis) Moseley; A.B., Y.C, 1763, A.M., 1768; lie. 19 June 1765; sett. Brookfield, Mass., 1765-1767; Ord. Sept. 1767, as an Indian missionary for the New England Company for Propagating the Gospel Among the Indians, at Onohoquaga on the Susquehanna near Binghamton, N.Y., 1767-1772; Capt., Am. Rev., l Col. 1791; Repres., 1776-1806, for 20 sessions; Deacon, 1788; Town Clerk, 1797 ff. for many years; Cong.; d. Hampton, Conn., 20 Mar. 1825, a. 84.

name: Ebenezer Moseley
edited_raw: Town Clerk, ff. for many years

name: Richard Moseley
raw: RICHARD MOSELEY, Chaplain of the man-of-war «Salisbury"; S.P.G. missionary, Brooklyn, Conn., 1771-1772; Litchfield, Conn., 1771-1772; Johnstown (Fulton) N.Y., 1772-1773; Ep.

name: Edmond Mott
chaplain: in the Fort, N.Y., N.Y., 1696 ff
raw: EDMOND MOTT, Chaplain in the Fort, N.Y., N.Y., 1696 ff; K.B. for N.Y., 10 Feb. 1701/2; Ep.

name: Jacob Moyer
raw: JACOB MOYER, sett. Hanover (York) Little Conewago Chh., ca. 1770; Coopersburg (Lehigh) Pa., at Upper Saucon; lay preacher; Germ. Bapt.

name: Jean Joseph Brumauld Moulinars
settled at: N.Y., N.Y., French Church of the Saint Esprit
raw: JEAN JOSEPH BRUMAULD MOULINARS, arriv. in America, 1718; sett. N.Y., N.Y., French Chh. of the Saint Esprit, 12 Nov. 1718- 1726; New Rochelle (Westchester) N.Y., French Chh., 1726-1741; French Ref.; d. New Rochelle, N.Y., Oct. 1741.

name: John Jacob Mueller
raw: JOHN JACOB MUELLER, came from Nuremberg, Germany; Ord. 1760; joined the Moravian Chh., 1740; Secretary to David Zeisberger, 1740-1742; portrait painter; Morav.; d. Niskey, Prussia, 1781.

name: Frederickgustusnrad Muhlenberg Jt
member of: member. Continental Congress, for Pa., 1779, 1780; Speaker, 1780-1783
son of: the Rev. Dr. Henry Melchior and Anna Maria (Weiser) Muhlenberg
raw: FREDERICK AUGUSTUS CONRAD MUHLENBERG, b. Trappe, Pa., I Jan. 1750, son of the Rev. Dr. Henry Melchior and Anna Maria (Weiser) Muhlenberg; ed. Halle, 1763-1768; arriv. N.Y., N.Y., 22 Sept. 1770; Ord. Reading (Berks) Pa., 26 Oct. 1770; sett. Douglas (Berks) Pa., Oley Hill Chh., 1770-1775; Elizabeth (Lane.) Pa., Emmanuel Chh., ijjo-iJTi; Manheim (Lane.) Pa., 1770-1775; New Hanover (Montgomery) Pa., Falkner's Swamp Chh., 1770-1775; Schoefferstown (Lebanon) Pa., 1770-1771; Exeter (Berks) Pa., Schwartzwald Chh., 1772-1775; Muhlenberg (Berks) Pa., Alsace Chh., 1772-1775; Pike (Berks) St. John's or Hill Chh., 1772-1775; Reading (Berks) Pa., Trinity Chh., 1772-1775; Marion (Berks) Pa., Christ Chh. at Stouchsburg, Old Tulpehocken Chh., 1772-1775; Lebanon (Lebanon) Pa., Salem or Kruppe Chh., I773-I77S; N.Y., N.Y., Holy Trinity Chh., I77S-I77S; N.Y., N.Y., Old Swamp Chh., 1775-1775; member. Continental Congress, for Pa., 1779, 1780; Speaker, 1780-1783; Registrar and Recorder, Montgomery co.; Judge, 1784; Congressman, 1787-1793, Speaker; Luth.; d. Lancaster, Pa., 4 June 1801.

name: Frederickgustusnrad Muhlenberg Jt
settled at: New Hanover (Montgomery) Pa., Falkner's Swamp Chh.

name: Frederickgustusnrad Muhlenberg Jt
settled at: Pike (Berks) St. John's or Hill Chh.

name: Frederickgustusnrad Muhlenberg Jt
settled at: Marion (Berks) Pa., Christ Chh. at Stouchsburg, Old Tulpehocken Chh.

name: Frederickgustusnrad Muhlenberg Jt
settled at: Lebanon (Lebanon) Pa., Salem or Kruppe Chh., I

name: Frederickgustusnrad Muhlenberg Jt
settled at: N.Y., N.Y., Holy Trinity Chh., I

name: Gotthilf Henry Ernst Muhlenberg
degrees: D.D., student at Halle, 1763-1768 A.M., U. of Pa., 1780, D.D.
son of: the Rev. Dr. Henry Melchior and Anna Maria (Weiser) Muhlenberg
raw: GOTTHILF HENRY ERNST MUHLENBERG, D.D., b. Trappe, Pa., 17 Nov. 1753, son of the Rev. Dr. Henry Melchior and Anna Maria (Weiser) Muhlenberg; student at Halle, 1763-1768; matric. Halle, 1769; A.M., U. of Pa., 1780, D.D.; arriv. N.Y., N.Y., 22 Sept. 1770; Ord. Reading (Berks) Pa., 25 Oct. 1770-4 Apr. 1774; Philadelphia, Pa., 1770-Apr. 1779, asst. min.; Bedminster (Somerset) N.J., St. Paul's Chh., 1770-1774; German Valley (Morris) N.J., Fox Hill Chh., at Fairmount, Tewksbury, 1770-1774; German Valley (Morris) N.J., Chh. at Washington, 1770-1774; New Germantown (Morris) N.J., Zion Chh., Tewksbury, 1770-1774; Philadelphia, Pa., Zion's Chh., 1770-1779; Pluckemin (Somerset) N.J., 1770-1774; Potterstown (Hunterdon) N.J., Roekaway Chh., 1770-1774; Raritan (Somerset) N.J., Raritan Chh., 1770-1774; Whitehouse (Hunterdon) N.J., Chh. at Leslyland, 1770- 1774; Laneaster (Lane.) Pa., Trinity Chh., 1780-1815; member. Am. Phil. Soe.; first Près, of Franklin Coll., 1787; Luth.; d. Lancaster, Pa., 23 May 1815.

name: Henry Melchior Muehlenberg
degrees: D.D., matrie. U. of Goettingen, Mar. 1735, a. 24 D.D., U. of Pa., 1784
son of: the Hon. Nieholaus Melehior and Anna Maria (K.leinsehmied) Muehlenberg
raw: HENRY MELCHIOR MUEHLENBERG, D.D., b. Einbeek, Hanover, Germany, 6 Sept. 1711, son of the Hon. Nieholaus Melehior and Anna Maria (K.leinsehmied) Muehlenberg; matrie. U. of Goettingen, Mar. 1735, a. 24; matrie. in theol., 1737; grad. 1738; taught at Halle, 1738; D.D., U. of Pa., 1784; Ord. Leipzig, Germany, 24 Aug. 1739, sett, as asst. minister, Gross-Hennersdorf, Upper Lusatia, July 1739-1741; arriv. in Ameriea, 22 Sept. 1742; sett. ; arriv. Philadelphia, 12 Nov. 1742; he was qualified to preaeh in German, Duteh, Swedish, English, Freneh and Latin, and did so as frequently as neeessary; he preached at Swede's Chh., Oley, Hill, Alsace, Longswamp, Albany, Hain's at Heidelberg, Northkill and Tulpehoeken Chhs., as well as at his regular settled parishes: New Hanover (Montgomery) Pa., Falkner's Swamp Chh., Nov. 1742-Oct. 1762; Upper Providence (Montg.) Pa., Augustus Chh. at Trappe, 1742-1787; Lynn (Lehigh) Pa., Jerusalem Chh., at Allemaengel, 1742-1742; Douglass (Berks) Pa., Oley Hill Chh., 1742-1762; Philadelphia, Pa., St. Michael's Chh., 1743-1787; Germantown, Pa., St. Michael's Chh., 1743-1744; Lower Milford (Lehigh) Pa., Upper Milford Chh., 1745-1748; Cohansey (Cumberland) N.J., 1745-1746; Upper Saueon (Lehigh) Pa., St. Paul's, Blue or Organ Chh., 1749-1750; N.V., N.Y., May-Aug. 1751, May-Aug. 1752; Amity (Berks) Pa., St. Paul's Chh., 1753-1753; Bedminster (Somerset) N.J., St. Paul's Chh., 1757- 1769; German Valley (Morris) N.J., Fox Hill Chh., Fairmount, Tewksbury, 1757-1759; German Valley (Morris) N.J., Chh. at Washington, 1757-1759; New Germantown (Morris) N.J., Zion Chh., Tewksbury, 1757-1759; Pluekemin (Somerset) N.J., near Bedminster, 1757-1759; Potterstown (Hunterdon) N.J., at Roekaway, 1757-1759; Raritan (Somerset) N.J., 1757-1759; Upper Dublin (Philadelphia) Pa., Puff's Chh., 1757-1758; Whitehouse (Hunterdon) N.J., Chh. at Leslyland, 1757-1759; Whitemarsh (Montgomery) Pa., St. Peter's Chh., Barren Hill, 1761-1777; Philadelphia, Pa., Zion's Chh., 1769-1787; Strasburg (Lane.) Pa., St. Miehael's or Beaver Creek Chh., 1767-1769; Lynn (Lehigh) Ebenezer or Organ Chh., 1770-1780; Luth.; d. Trappe, New Providenee, Pa., 7 Oct. 1787.

name: Henry Melchior Muehlenberg
settled at: New Hanover (Montgomery) Pa., Falkner's Swamp Chh., Nov. Oct.

name: Henry Melchior Muehlenberg
settled at: Upper Providence (Montg.) Pa., Augustus Chh. at Trappe

name: Henry Melchior Muehlenberg
settled at: Lynn (Lehigh) Pa., Jerusalem Chh., at Allemaengel

name: Henry Melchior Muehlenberg
settled at: Lower Milford (Lehigh) Pa., Upper Milford Chh.

name: Henry Melchior Muehlenberg
settled at: Upper Saueon (Lehigh) Pa., St. Paul's, Blue or Organ Chh.

name: Henry Melchior Muehlenberg
settled at: German Valley (Morris) N.J., Fox Hill Chh., Fairmount, Tewksbury

name: Henry Melchior Muehlenberg
settled at: German Valley (Morris) N.J., Chh. at Washington

name: Henry Melchior Muehlenberg
settled at: New Germantown (Morris) N.J., Zion Chh., Tewksbury

name: Henry Melchior Muehlenberg
settled at: Whitemarsh (Montgomery) Pa., St. Peter's Chh., Barren Hill

name: Henry Melchior Muehlenberg
settled at: Strasburg (Lane.) Pa., St. Miehael's or Beaver Creek Chh.

name: John Peter Gabriel Muhlenberg
son of: the Rev. Dr. Henry Melehior and Anna Maria (Weiser) Muhlenberg
raw: Major-General JOHN PETER GABRIEL MUHLENBERG, b. Trappe, Pa., i Oct. 1746, son of the Rev. Dr. Henry Melehior and Anna Maria (Weiser) Muhlenberg; U. of Pa., 1763; U. of Halle, 1763; soldier in colonial wars, 1764-1767; Ord. Lutheran, 1768: sett. New Germantown (Morris) Pa., Zion's Chh., 12 May 1768-1772; Bedminster (Somerset) N.J., St. Paul's Chh., 12 May 1768-1772; Greenwich (Warren) N.J., St. James's Chh., 1769-1772; German Valley (Morris) N.J., at Washington, 1768-1772; German Valley, N.J., Fox Hill Chh. at Fairmount, Tewksbury, (Hunterdon co.), 1768-1772; Pluckemin (Somerset) N.J., 1768-1772; Raritan (Somerset) N.J., 1768-1772; Potterstown (Hunterdon) N.J., Chh. at Rockaway, 1768-1772; Whitehouse (Hunterdon) N.J., Chh. at Leslyland, 1768-1772; Ord. Ep. (Bsp. of London), 23 Apr. 1772; K.B; for Va., 7 May 1772; sett. Beckford Parish (Shenandoah) Va., Ep., 1772-1775; Madison (Madison) Va., Old Hebron Luth. Chh., 1772-1775; Woodstock (Shenandoah) Va., Luth. Chh., 1772- 1775; member. Va. House of Burgesses, 1774; at the Battle of Sullivan's Island, June 1776; Brig.-Gen., 21 Feb. 1777; in command at the Battles of Brandywine, Monmouth, Stony Point, and Yorktown; Maj.-Gen., 1800-1807; member of Congress, 1789-1801; U.S. Senator, 1802; Collector of the Port of Philadelphia, 1802-1807; an original member of the Society of the Cincinnati; Luth.; Ep.; d. Philadelphia, Pa., i Oct. 1807, a. 60.

name: John Peter Gabriel Muhlenberg
settled at: German Valley, N.J., Fox Hill Chh. at Fairmount, Tewksbury, (Hunterdon co.)

name: John Peter Gabriel Muhlenberg
settled at: Madison (Madison) Va., Old Hebron Luth. Chh.

name: John Muenster
raw: JOHN MUENSTER, sett. Lynn (Lehigh) Pa., Allemaengel Chh., 1747-1747; Morav.

name: Paul Muenster
raw: PAUL MUENSTER, arriv. N.Y., N.Y., 19 Oct. 1761; sett. Bethlehem, Pa., 1761-1792; warden; member of the General Executive Board; and Asst. Pastor, 1776-1792; Morav.; d. Bethlehem, Pa., 15 Oct. 1792.

name: George Muirson
raw: GEORGE MUIRSON, b. Scotland, ca. 1675; schoolmaster at Albany, N.Y., 1703; Ord. London, by Bishop Compton, 1705; S.P.G. missionary; sett. Rye (Westchester) N.Y., Christ Chh., 31 July 1705-1708; Bedford (Westchester) N.Y., St. Mary's Chh., 1705-1708; Greenwich, Conn., 1705-1707; Stratford, Conn., Christ Chh., organized, Apr. 1707, sett. 1706-1707; Ep.; d. Rye, N.Y., 12 Oct. 1708.

name: Harry Munro
chaplain: 12 Jan. 1757-1764|, Ft. Hunter, Albany, N.Y., 20 July 1770-1777| in the Am. Rev.
degrees: D.D., A.B., St. Andrews, A.M., D.D., 13 Jan. 1782;A.M. (hon.) Columbia, 1773;
son of: Dr. Robert and Anne (Munro) Munro, of Dingwall, Scotland
raw: HARRY MUNRO, D.D., b. Scotland, 1730, son of Dr. Robert and Anne (Munro) Munro, of Dingwall, Scotland; A.B., St. Andrews, A.M., D.D., 13 Jan. 1782; Edinburgh; A.M. (hon.) Columbia, 1773; Ord. (Presb.), 1757; Chaplain, 12 Jan. 1757-1764: ist Highland Battalion of Foot, at South Carolina, Fort Duquesne, Ticonderoga, Crown Point, Montreal, and Bahamas, resigned, 1764; Ord. (Ep.), London, 10 Feb. 1765; lie. for N.Y., 11 Feb. 1765; K.B. for N.Y., 20 Feb. 1765; sett. Yonkers (Westchester) N.Y., St. John's Chh., 11 Feb. 1765-1768; Albany, N.Y., St. Peter's Chh., 20 July 1770-1777; Chaplain, Ft. Hunter, Albany, N.Y., 20 July 1770-1777; became a British Chaplain in the Am. Rev.; returned to England; Presb.; Ep.; d. 1801.

name: Harry Munro
settled at: South Carolina, Fort Duquesne, Ticonderoga, Crown Point, Montreal, and Bahamas, resigned

name: Jonathan Murdock
raw: JONATHAN MURDOCK, A.M., b. Westbrook, Conn., 7 Apr. 1745, son of John and Frances (Conkling) Murdock; A.B., Y.C, 1766, A.M.; sett. Guilford, Conn., 4th Chh., 1768-1769; Ord. Rye, N.Y., bef. 21 Jan. 1771; sett. Rye, 1771-1774; inst. Greenwich, Conn., 2nd Chh., 20 Oct. 1774-1785; Bozrah, Conn., 12 Oct. 1786-1813; Cong.; Presb.; d. Bozrah, Conn., 17 Jan. 1813, a. 67.

name: Alexander Murray
raw: ALEXANDER MURRAY, K.B. for Pa., 16 June 1762; arriv. Molatton, Pa., 9 Apr. 1763; S.P.G. missionary; sett. Reading (Berks) Pa., St. Mary's Chh., 1762-1778; Molatton, or Amity (Berks) Pa., St. Gabriel's Chh., Manathanim, at Douglassville, Pa., 1763-1778; 1790-1792; refugee to England, 1778; Ep.

name: Alexander Murray
settled at: Molatton, or Amity (Berks) Pa., St. Gabriel's Church, Manathanim, Douglassvile PA

name: Alexander Murray
settled at: Molatton, or Amity (Berks) Pa., St. Gabriel's Church, Manathanim, Douglassvile PA

name: John Murray
raw: JOHN MURRAY, b. Alton, Hampshire, England, 10 Dec. 1741; arriv. in New Jersey, 28 Sept. 1770; sett. Goodluck, N.J., at Potter's Farm, 1770-1772; Philadelphia, Pa., Meth. Chh., 1770-1771; itinerant preacher in N.E., 1772-1774; Chaplain to R.L regts., i77S-'^777'^ Ord. Gloucester, Mass., Jan. 1779; re-Ord. 25 Dec. 1788; sett. Gloucester, Mass., Universalist Chh., 1779-1793; Boston, Mass., 1793-1809; Universalist; d. Boston, 3 Sept. 1815.

name: John Murray
degrees: A.M., A.B., U. of Edinburgh, 1761, A.M.
raw: JOHN MURRAY, A.M., b. Antrim, Ireland, 22 May 1742; A.B., U. of Edinburgh, 1761, A.M.; arriv. in N.E., 1763; sett. Boothbay, Maine, 1763, 1766-1779; dism. from Boothbay, Maine, June 1781; Ord. Philadelphia, Pa., 2nd Presb. Chh., May 1765; sett. Philadelphia, 1765- 1766; inst. Newburyport, Mass., 4 June 1781-1793; delegate from Boothbay, Me., to the Provincial Congress, 1775; Presb.; d. Newburyport, 13 Mar. 1793, a. 51.

name: Jacob Musselman
settled at: Milford (Bucks) Pa., Great Swamp Church,  f
raw: JACOB MUSSELMAN, came from Germany, 1743; prob, had been ordained there; sett. Milford (Bucks) Pa., Great Swamp Chh., 1743 fï.; Menn.

name: Michael Musselman
raw: MICHAEL MUSSELMAN, son of the Rev. Jacob Musselman; Ord. prior to 1773; sett. Milford (Bucks) Pa., Great Swamp Chh., 1771- 1773; Milford (Bucks) Pa., East Swamp Chh., 1771-1773; Menn.

name: Frederick Muzelius
settled at: Tappan (Rockland) N.Y., Dutch Ref. Church at Orangetown
raw: FREDERICK MUZELIUS, b. Germany, 5 Jan. 1704; came to America, 1726; sett. Tappan (Rockland) N.Y., Dutch Ref. Chh. at Orangetown, 1726-1749; Tappan, N.Y., 2nd Dutch Ref. Chh., 1767- 1778; Germ. Ref.; d. Tappan, N.Y., 7 Apr. 1782, a. 78 (GS).

name: Jeremiah Naass
raw: JEREMIAH NAASS, sett. Amwell (Hunterdon) N.J., 1738 ff.; Germ. Bapt.

name: Johann Naass
raw: JOHANN NAASS, b. Norten, near Cassel, Germany, ca. 1671; Ord. ca. 1715; sett. Marienborn and Crefeld, Germany, 1715-1717; member of the Crefeld community, 1729-1733; sett. Amwell (Hunterdon) N.J., 1733-1741; sett. Lower Frederick (Montgomery) Pa., Falkner's Swamp Chh., 1733-1741; Germ. Bapt.; d. Amwell, N.J., 1741.

name: Johann Naass
settled at: Lower Frederick (Montgomery) Pa., Falkner's Swamp Church

name: Hans Rudolph Naegele
raw: HANS RUDOLPH NAEGELE, son of Rudolph Naegele; sett. West Earl (Lane.) Pa., Grofïdale Mennonite Chh., 1717-9 Nov. 1724; became a German Bapt. and entered the Ephrata Chloister, 1725-1749; Menn.; Germ. Bapt.; d. Ephrata, Pa., 29 Jan. 1749.

name: Gabriel Naesman
raw: GABRIEL NAESMAN, Ord. Upsala, Sweden, May 1742; sett. Philadelphia, Pa., Gloria Dei Chh., 1743-1750; Sw. Luth.

name: Henry Neale
raw: HENRY NEALE, S.J., arriv. in Maryland, 21 Apr. 1741; sett. Philadelphia, Pa., St. Joseph's Chh., 1741-1748; Lancaster (Lane.) Pa., St. John Nepomucene's Chh., 1748-1748; Conewago (Adams) Pa., Sacred Heart Chh., 1748-1748; R.C; d. Philadelphia, Pa., 5 May 1748.

name: Frederick Neimayer
raw: G. FREDERICK NEIMAYER (Neimeier or Naymeyer); sett. Upper Hanover (Montgomery) Pa., New Goshenhoppen Chh., 1764- 1771; Upper Salford (Montg.) Pa., Old Goshenhoppen Chh., 1771- 1771; Franconia (Montg.) Pa., Indian Creek or Zion's Chh., 1771-1771; Rockhill (Bucks) Pa., Indianfield Chh., 1771-1771; Luth.

name: Henry Neff
raw: HENRY NEFF, Ord. ca. 1770; sett. Codorus (York) Pa., 1770- 1776; Germ. Bapt.; living in 1789.

name: Jacob Neff
raw: JACOB NEFF, son of Dr. John Henry Neff; sett. Providence (Lane.) Pa., Black Horse Chh., 1764-1814; Menn.; d. Providence, Pa., 16 Feb. 1814.

name: Hugh Neill
raw: HUGH NEILL, A.M., A.M. (hon.) Columbia, 1767; sett. N.J. as a Presb.; became an Ep.; Ord. London, 1749; lie. 26 Mar. 1750; K.B. for Pa., 2 May 1750; sett. Dover (Kent) Del., Christ Chh., 1749-1756; Milford (Kent) Del., Christ Chh., 1749-1757; Mispillion (Kent) Del., Christ Chh., 1749-1757; Smyrna (Kent) Del., St. Peter's Chh., 1749- 1757; Whitemarsh (Montgomery) Pa., St. Thomas's Chh., 1758-1766; Oxford (Chester) Pa., Trinity Chh., 1758-1765; St. Paul's Parish (Queen Annes) Md., 1765-1781; Presb.; Ep.; d. Oxford, Pa., 1781.

name: George Neisser
raw: GEORGE NEISSER, b. Sehlen, Moravia, 11 Apr. 1715; arriv. Savannah, Ga., 16 Feb. 1735/6; arriv. Philadelphia, Feb. 1737; arriv. Bethlehem (Northampton) Pa., 25 June 1742, where he was the first schoolmaster, diarist, clerk, post-master, lawyer and musician; sett. N.Y., N.Y., 1742-1748, 1765-1777; Ord. 1748; sett. Graceham (Frederick) Md., 1748-1748; Lancaster (Lane.) Pa., 1751-1753; York (York) Pa., 1756-1757; Warwick (Lane.) Pa., St. James's Chh. at Lititz, 1757- 1759; Philadelphia, Pa., 1762-1774; Morav.; d. Philadelphia, Pa., Nov. 1784.

name: Joseph Neisser
raw: JOSEPH NEISSER, Ord. in Europe; arriv. Bethlehem, Pa., 28 Nov. 1765; sett. Graceham (Frederick) Md., 1771-1775; Hope (Warren) N.J., 1775-1776; Morav.

name: Matthias Nertunius
settled at: Chester (Del.) Pa., Church at Upland,  ff.
raw: MATTHIAS NERTUNIUS, was stranded near Puerto Rico, 1649; sett. Chester (Del.) Pa., Chh. at Upland, 1654 ff.; Sw. Luth.

name: Daniel Neubert
raw: DANIEL NEUBERT (or Neibert), b. Koenigswalde, Saxony; had been an active preacher in Holstein and Holland; arriv. Bethlehem, Pa., Sept. 1742; Philadelphia, Pa., 1743-1747; Ord. Dec. 1754; sett. Heidelberg (Berks) Pa., 9 Apr. 1745-1745, 1748-1752; Warwick (Lane.) Pa., St. James's Chh. at Lititz, 1745-1747, 1756-1757; Salisbury (Lehigh) Pa., Chh. at Emaus, 1753-1755, 1760-1762; Lynn (Lehigh) Pa., Allemaengel Chh., 1751-1753; miller; minister in rural chhs.; his wife Hannah (or Christianna) was also ordained; Morav.; d. Bethlehem, Pa., Jan. 1785.

name: Hans Neuss
raw: HANS NEUSS (Nice or Neiss), came from Crefeld, Germany, to Germantown, 1698; Ord. Germantown, Pa., 8 Oct. 1702-1702; withdrew; silversmith; Menn.; d. Frederick (Montgomery) Pa., 19 ]uly 1736.

name: John Wesley Gilbert Nevelling
raw: JOHN WESLEY GILBERT NEVELLING, b. Westphalia, Germany, 1750; he was a relative of the Weybergs; Ord. Lancaster, Pa., 17 June 1772; sett. Amwell (Hunterdon) N.J., 1770-1783; Reading (Berks) Pa., 1783-1783; by an accident to his throat his speech was permanently affected, 1783; Germ. Ref.; d. Philadelphia, Pa., 18 Jan. 1844, a. 94 years.

name: Henry Nicols Ii
raw: HENRY NICOLS, A.M. (Nichols or Nicholls), b. i Apr. 1678, son of Jonathan Niçois, of Cowbridge, Glamorgan; matric. Jesus Coll., Oxford, II Mar. 1696/7, a. 16; A.B., 1701, A.M., 28 Mar. 1715; Fellow; K.B., 5 May 1703; S.P.G. missionary; sett. Concord (Del.) Pa., St. John's Chh., 1703-1708; Marcus Hook (Del.) Pa., St. Martin's Chh., 1703-1708; Chester (Del.) Pa., St. Paul's Chh., 1704-1708; Newtown (Del.) Pa., St. David's Chh. at Radnor, 1704-1708; St. Michael's Parish (Talbot) Md., 1708-1749; the first resident S.P.G. missionary in Pa.; Ep.; d. St. Michael's Parish, Talbot, Md., 12 Feb. 1749.

name: George Nieke
ordained: Oley, Pa., as deacon, i Mar. 1744
raw: GEORGE NIEKE, came from Herrnhut, Moravia; arriv. N.Y., N.Y., 26 Nov. 1743; Ord. Oley, Pa., as deacon, i Mar. 1744; sett. Graceham (Frederick) Md., 1746-1748; Monocacy, Md., 1746-1748; minister in rural districts; Morav.

name: David Nitschmann
raw: DAVID NITSCHMANN, Senior, b. Zauchtenthal, Moravia, 29 Sept. 1676; sett. Herrnhut, Moravia, 1725; Island of St. Croix, 1734; arriv. Philadelphia, 18 Dec. 1739; sett. Bethlehem, Pa., 1740-1758; naturalized as a citizen of Pa., Oct. 1750; Trustee of the Moravian Estates; called "Father David"; wheelwright and joiner; Moravian; d. Bethlehem, Pa., 14 Apr. 1758, a. 82.

name: David Nitschmann
raw: Bishop DAVID NITSCHMANN, b. Zauchtenthal, Moravia, 27 Dec. 1696, nephew of David Nitschmann, Senior; sett. St. Thomas, West Indies, 21 Aug. 1731; St. Croix, 1734; Ord. Berlin, Germany, 13 Mar. 1735; arriv. Savannah, Georgia, 20 Feb. 1736; in Pa., Apr. 1736- June 1736; in Europe, 1736-1740; returned to America, 15 Dec. 174.0; sett. Bethlehem, Pa., 1740-1772; absent in Europe, 1744-1751; missionary Bishop, 1751-1772; arriv. N.Y., N.Y., again, 15 Apr. 1754; sett. Warwick (Lane.) Pa., 1756-1761; took at least 50 sea voyages; his official labors extended over various parts of Germany, Denmark, Sweden, Norway, Livonia, England, Wales, Danish West Indies, Savannah, Ga., Pa., N.Y., and N.C; he was the first Moravian missionary to the heathen; sett. Herrnhut, Saxony, 1722-1732; 1st American Moravian Bishop and a founder of Bethlehem; d. Bethlehem, Pa., 8 Oct. 1772.

name: David Nitschmann
edited_raw: his official labors extended over various parts of Germany, Denmark, Sweden, Norway, Livonia, England, Wales, Danish West Indies, Savannah, N.Y.

name: David Nitschmann
raw: Bishop DAVID NITSCHMANN, Jr., son of the Rev. David and Rosina Nitschmann; Ord. Bishop, 1746; came to America, 1765; arriv. Bethlehem, Pa., 28 Nov. 1765; sett. Bethlehem, Pa., 1765-1766; returned to Europe, 15 Sept. 1766; called the "Syndic"; Morav.

name: Immanuel Nitschmann
raw: IMMANUEL NITSCHMANN, son of Bishop John and Anna (Haberland) Nitschmann; arriv. N.Y., N.Y., 19 Oct. 1761; sett. Bethlehem, Pa., 1761-1790; kept the records at Bethlehem; Morav.; d. Bethlehem, Pa., 1790.

name: John Nitschmann
raw: Bishop JOHN NITSCHMANN, Senior, went to Lapland, 24 Feb. 1734; Ord. Bishop, 1741; arriv. Bethlehem, Pa., 21 May 1749; sett. Bethlehem, 1749-1751; sueeeeded Bishop Spangenberg, 1749; left for Europe, 4 Dee. 1751; Morav.

name: John Nixdorf
raw: JOHN G. NIXDORF, b. Silesia; sett. Lancaster (Lane.) Pa., 1745- 1745; Ord. deaeon, 1758; minister, preaeher and teaeher in rural districts; sett. Lynn (Lehigh) Pa., Allemaengel Chh., I746r-i746; Morav.; d. Bethlehem, Pa., Sept. 1775.

name: Abel Noble
son of: William and Frances Noble from Bristol, England
raw: ABEL NOBLE, b. Bristol, R.L, son of William and Frances Noble from Bristol, England; brought up as a Quaker; eanie to Pa., ea. 1684, as a Friend; beeame a 7th Day Bapt. or Keithian Bapt., 1691; only 7th Day Bapt. minister in Pa., ca. 1700; sett. Newtown, Pa., 1697-1701; Nottingham, Md., 1697-1700; he served for many years; 7th Day Bapt.

name: John Petrus Nucella
raw: JOHN PETRUS NUCELLA, Ord. Amsterdam, Holland, 13 Apr. 1^4; came to America, 1695; arriv. Kingston, N.Y., 15 Dec. 1695; sett. Kingston (Ulster) N.Y., Chh. at Esopus, 1695-1704; resigned 7 Mar. 1704; sett. Hurley (Ulster) N.Y., 1695-1704; Marbletown (Ulster) N.Y., 1685-1704; Rochester (Ulster) N.Y., 1695-1704; supply at Albany, N.Y., 1698-1700; in 1704, he went to London, England, to take charge of Queen Anne's Dutch Chapel there; Dutch Ref.; d. Jan. 1722.

name: John Nutman
raw: JOHN NUTMAN, A.M., b. Newark, N.J., 1703, son of James and Hannah (Prudden) Nutman; A.B., Y.C., 1727, A.M.; Ord. Hanover (Morris) N.J., Whippany Chh., 1730-1745; teacher at Newark, N.J.; Presb.; d. Newark, N.J., i Sept. 1751, a. 48. (GS).

name: Lawrence Thorstansea Nyberg
raw: LAWRENCE (Lorenz or Laurentius) THORSTANSEA NYBERG, ed. at Upsala; Ord. Sweden, 1743; excluded from the S\vedish Lutheran ministry; preaehed in Lutheran chhs. as ff: Hanover (York) Pa., St. Michael's Chh., 1744-1746; Warwick (Lane.) Pa., St. James's Chh., 1744-1746; Laneaster (Lane.) Pa., Holy Trinity Chh., 1744-1746; York (York) Pa., Christ Chh., 1744-1748; Monoeaey (Frederick) Md., 1745-1746; Conewago (Adams) Pa., 1744-1748; had been preaehing in Moravian ehhs., and on 13 Aug. 1748, he beeame a Moravian; preaehed in Moravian ehhs. as ff: Warwick, Pa., 1744-1745; Graceham, Md., 1745-1745; York, Pa., 1744-1748; Swatara, Pa., South Lebanon Chh., Mar. 1745-1750; Lancaster, Pa., 1746-1748; Oldmans Creek (Gloucester) N.J., at Pilesgrove, Woolwich, 1747-1749; returned to England, 1750; Ord. England, 1754; Sw. Luth.; Luth.; Morav.

name: Lawrence Thorstansea Nyberg
settled at: Swatara, Pa., South Lebanon Chh., Mar.

name: Lawrence Thorstansea Nyberg
settled at: Oldmans Creek (Gloucester) N.J., at Pilesgrove, Woolwich

name: Jacob Oberholtzer
raw: JACOB OBERHOLTZER, sett. Hatfield (Montgomery) Pa., Chh. at Landsdale, 1774-1813; Franeonia (Montgomery) Pa., Indian Creek Chh., 1775-1813; supply, Germantown, Pa., 23 Apr. 1797; Menn.; d. Franconia, Pa., 13 Dec. 1813.

name: Jonathan Odell
settled at: Mount Holly (Burlington) N.J., St. Andrew's Church
raw: JONATHAN ODELL, A.M., M.D., b. Newark, N.J., 25 Sept. 1737; A.B., Princeton, 1754, A.M., 1759; M.D.; studied medicine; Ord. by Bishop of London, Jan. 1767; K.B. for N.J., 23 Jan. 1767; sett. Mount Holly (Burlington) N.J., St. Andrew's Chh., 25 July 1767-1774; Burling- ton (Burl.) N.J., St. Anne's, now St. Mary's Chh., 26 July 1767-1777; Bristol (Bucks) Pa., St. James the Greater Chh., 1768-1777; elected member, N.J. Medical Soc, 8 Nov. 1774; member. Am. Phil. Soc; surgeon, British Army, 1776; refugee and Br. Army Chaplain, 1777; to England, 1783; New Brunswick, Canada, 1784; Councillor and Secretary of the Province of New Brunswick, 1785-1818; Ep.; d. Frederickton, N.B., 25 Nov. 1818, a. 8i.

name: John Jacob Oehl
raw: JOHN JACOB OEHL (Oel or Ehlig), Ord. London (Bsp. of London), 1722; K.B. for N.Y., 5 Oct. 1722; came to America with a company of Germans, 1722; sett. Kaatsbaan (Ulster) N.Y., 1722-1724; East Camp (Ulster) N.Y., 1722-1724; Kinderhook (Columbia) N.Y., 1722-1727; Schoharie (Schoharie) N.Y., D.R. Chh. at Huntersfield, 1724-1730; West Camp (Ulster) N.Y., Chh. at Saugerties, 1722-1730; asst. missionary to the Mohawk Indians, 1750-1776; Albany, N.Y., Germ. Ref. Chh., 1770-1772; Germ. Ref.; Ep.; d. N.Y., ca. 1780.

name: Uzal Ogden
raw: UZAL OGDEN, Jr., b. Newark, N.J., 1744, son of Uzal and Charlotte (Thébaut) Ogden; Ord. (Bsp. of London) 1773; K.B. for N.J., 25 Sept. 1773; sett. Sussex, Morris, and Bergen counties, N.J., 1769-1783, stations not given; S.P.G. catechist in Sussex co. 1770-1772; Newtown (Sussex) N.J., Christ Chh., 1773-1776; refugee to N.Y., 1776; returned Jan. 1777; perhaps at Newtown, 1777-1784; Elizabethtown, N.J., 1784- 1788; Rector, Newark, N.J., Trinity Chh., 1788-1805; asst., N.Y., N.Y., 1784-18 Aug. 1788; Bishop elect of N.J., 16 Aug. 1798, and Oct. 1799, but not consecrated; he joined the Presb. Chh., 16 Oct. 1805; Ep.; Presb.; d. 4 Nov. 1822.

name: John Ogilvie
degrees: D.D., A.B., Y.C, 1748 D.D., Aberdeen, 1770 A.M., Columbia, 1767, D.D., 1770
raw: JOHN OGILVIE, D.D., b. N.Y., N.Y., 1724, of Scottish parents; A.B., Y.C, 1748; D.D., Aberdeen, 1770; A.M., Columbia, 1767, D.D., 1770; sett. Norwalk, Conn., 1748-1749; Ord. London, England, 24 June 1749; K.B. forN.Y., 12 July 1749; S.P.G. missionary to the Indians; sett. Albany, N.Y., St. Peter's Chh., i Mar. 1749/50-1760; Schenectady, N.Y., St. George's Chh., 1750-1760; Fort Hunter, Albany, N.Y., Queen Anne's Chapel, 1749-1762; Chaplain in Canada, 1759-1763 ; N.Y., N.Y., Trinity Chh., Aug. 1764-1774; Peekskill (Westchester) N.Y., St. Peter's Chh. in the Manor of Cortlandt, 1767-1771; Ep. ; d. N.Y., N.Y., 26 Nov. 1774, a. 50.

name: John Ogilvie
settled at: Albany, N.Y., St. Peter's Church, i Mar.

name: John Ogilvie
settled at: Fort Hunter, Albany, N.Y., Queen Anne's Chapel

name: John Ogilvie
settled at: Peekskill (Westchester) N.Y., St. Peter's Church in the Manor of Cortlandt

name: John George Ohneberg
settled at: Nazareth (Northampton) Pa., chhs. at Ephrata, Gnadenthal, Christianspring and Friedenthal
raw: JOHN GEORGE A. OHNEBERG, b. Hildersheim, Germany, 1721; theol. student at Lindheim, 1744, a. 23; arriv. N.Y., N.Y., 26 Nov. 1743; sett. Nazareth (Northampton) Pa., chhs. at Ephrata, Gnadenthal, Christianspring and Friedenthal, 1747-1750; missionary at Santa Cruz, 1750-1758; sett. Bethlehem, Pa., 1758-1759; glazier; Morav.; d. Bethlehem, Pa., Apr. 1760.

name: John Okely
raw: JOHN OKELY, came from Bedford, England; Ord. deacon, 1751; sett. Southampton (Bucks) Pa., Neshaminy Chh., 1746-1747; Philadelphia, Pa., 1743-1747; missionary in Bucks and Philadelphia counties; Justice of the Peace, 1774; asst. Commissary, Continental Army, Rev. War, Aug. 1780; Morav.; d. Lancaster, Pa., 1792.

name: John Okely
edited_raw: missionary in Bucks and Philadelphia counties

name: Christian George Andrew Oldendorp
raw: CHRISTIAN GEORGE ANDREW OLDENDORP, arriv. Bethleheni. Pa., 26 Nov. 1768; sett. Bethlehem, 1768-1769; sett. Danish West Indies, 1766-1768; Morav.; sailed to Europe, 17 Apr. 1769.

name: James Orem
raw: JAMES OREM (or Overn), K.B. to N.E., 19 Oct. 1721; N.Y., N.Y., Chaplain in the Fort, 1723; Ep.

name: Robert Orr
raw: ROBERT ORR, b. British Isles; Ord. Lawrenceville (Mercer), N.J., 20 Oct. 1715; sett. Lawrenceville, 1715-1719; Amwell (Hunterdon) N.J., Chh. at Reaville, 1715-1719; Hopewell (Mercer) N.J., at Ewing, 1715- 1719; Trenton (Mercer) N.J., ist Chh., 1715-1719; Titusville (Mercer) N.J., 1715-1719; Pennington, 1715-1719; Presb.

name: Andrew Ostrom
settled at: Bethlehem (Northampton) Pa., Brodhead Settlement at Dansbury
raw: ANDREW OSTROM, sett. Bethlehem (Northampton) Pa., Brodhead Settlement at Dansbury, 1748-1749; Wallpack (Sussex) N.J., 1748-1748; Paulin's Kill (Warren) N.J., 1748-1749; Morav.

name: Philip Wilhelm Otterbein
ordained: Ockersdorf, Germany, 13 June 1749, where he was sett, as a Germ. Ref. vicar
son of: the Rev. John Daniel and Wilhelmina Henrietta (Hoerlen) Otterbein
raw: Bishop PHILIP WILHELM OTTERBEIN, b. Dillenburg, Nassau, Germany, 3 June 1726, son of the Rev. John Daniel and Wilhelmina Henrietta (Hoerlen) Otterbein; ed. Herborn Seminary, 1742; Ord. Ockersdorf, Germany, 13 June 1749, where he was sett, as a Germ. Ref. vicar; arriv. N.Y., N.Y., 28 July 1752; sett. Lancaster (Lane.) Pa., Aug. 1752-1758; Pequea (Lane.)
