Pa., 1752-1758; Mill Creek (Lebanon) Pa., Tulpehoeken or Trinity Chh., 1758-1760; Tulpehoeken (Berks) Pa., Host Chh., 1758-1760; Conococheague (Washington) Md., St. Paul's Chh., 1760-1765; Frederick (Frederick) Md., 1760-Nov. 1765; Middletown (Fredk.) Md., Zion or Kittatinny Mountain Chh., 1760-1765; Conewago (York) Pa., Zion's or Quickel's Chh., 1765-1774; Hellam (York) Pa., Kreutz Chh., 1765-1770; Lower Windsor (York) Pa., 1765- 1774; Paradise (York) Pa., Holz Schwamm Chh., 1765-1774; Union (Adams) Pa., 1765-1774; York (York) Pa., Nov. 1765-1774; Hopewell (York) Pa., 1767-1774; Antietam (Washington) Md., 1774-1783; Baltimore, Md., 2nd Chh., 1774-1813; founder of the United Brethren in Christ; Germ. Ref.; d. Baltimore, Md., 17 Oct. 1813, a. 87.

name: Philip Wilhelm Otterbein
settled at: Mill Creek (Lebanon) Pa., Tulpehoeken or Trinity Chh.

name: Philip Wilhelm Otterbein
settled at: Middletown (Fredk.) Md., Zion or Kittatinny Mountain Chh.

name: Philip Wilhelm Otterbein
settled at: Conewago (York) Pa., Zion's or Quickel's Chh.

name: Bernard Page
raw: BERNARD PAGE, Ord. (Bsp. of London) 24 Aug: 1772; lie. for Wyoming, Pa., 24 Aug. 1772; K.B. for Pa., 11 Sept. 1772; sett. Wyoming, Pa. (now Wilkes-Barre), 1772-1775; Phillipstown (Putnam) N.Y., St. Philip's Chh. in the Highlands, 1775-1776; Peekskill (Westchester) N.Y., St. Peter's Chh. in the Manor of Cortlandt, 1775-1776; Fairfax Parish (Fairfax) Va., 1786-1792; Norbourne Parish (Berkeley) W.Va., 1792-1795; resided at Mount Eagle, near Hunting Creek Bridge; Ep.; d. lower Va., soon after 1795.

name: Elisha Paine
raw: ELISHA PAINE, b. Eastham, Mass., 29 Dec. 1693, son of Elisha and Rebecca (Doane) Paine; imprisoned in Conn., for preaching without authority; Bapt. minister; Bridgehampton, L.L, N.Y., 1758 ff; Riverhead, L.L, N.Y., Separatist Chh. of Southold, 26 May 1758 ff.; Bapt.; d. Southold, L.L, N.Y., 26 Aug. 1775.

name: John Paine
raw: JOHN PAINE, sett. Bridgehampton, L.L, N.Y., 2nd or Separatist Chh., 1749-1753; Bapt.; d. Southold, L.L, N.Y., Apr. 1753; shot!

name: Thomas Paine
ordained: Southold, L.L, N.Y., Chh. at Cutchogue, 24 Oct. 1750- 1766
raw: THOMAS PAINE, A.M., b. Canterbury, Conn., 1724, son of Abraham and Ruth (Adams) Paine; A.B., Y.C, 1748, A.M., 1754; lie. 20 Dec. 1748; Ord. Southold, L.L, N.Y., Chh. at Cutchogue, 24 Oct. 1750- 1766; Cong.; d. Southold, L.L, N.Y., 15 Oct. 1766, a. 42 (GS).

name: Solomon Palmer
ordained: Huntington, L.L, N.Y., 1735-1741 London, England, Oct. 1765
raw: SOLOMON PALMER, A.M., b. Branford, Conn., 6 Apr. 1709, son of Daniel and Elizabeth Palmer; A.B., Y.C, 1729, A.M.; lie, 27 May 1735; Ord. Huntington, L.L, N.Y., 1735-1741; inst. Cornwall, Conn., 19 Aug. 1741-Mar. 1754; became an Ep.; Ord. London, England, Oct. 1765; sett. New Milford, Conn., Ep. Chh., 1755-1760,1766-1771; Litchfield, Conn., St. Michael's Ep. Chh., 1755-1760, 1766-1771; Great Barrington, Mass., St. James's Chh., 1763-1766; Goshen, Conn., 1667- 1771; S.P.G. missionary; Perth Amboy, N.J., St. Peter's Chh., 1760- 1762; Cong.; Ep.; d. Litchfield, Conn., 2 Nov. 1771, a. 63.

name: Henry Pannebecker
raw: HENRY PANNEBECKER (Pennypacker), b. 1719; sett. Skippack (Montgomery) Pa., 1775-1792; Menn.; d. Skippack, Pa., 1792.

name: George Panton
chaplain: Prince of Wales American Regt., 18 Jan. 1778-13 Oct. 1783
raw: GEORGE PANTON, A.M., b. in America of Scots parentage; A.B., Aberdeen, A.M.; A.M. (hon.) Columbia, 1774; Ord. by the Bishop of Down and Connor, in Ireland, 1770; returned to America, I77°j sett. Trenton, N.J., St. Michael's Chh., 11 Apr. 1774-7 July 1776; Lawrenceville, N.J., Maidenhead Chh., 1774-1776; Princeton, N.J., 1774-1776; refugee to N.Y., N.Y.; sett. Phillipstown, Yonkers (Westchester) N.Y., St. Philip's Chh. in the Highlands, Dec. 1777-1783; Chaplain, Prince of Wales American Regt., 18 Jan. 1778-13 Oct. 1783; S.P.G., Yarmouth, Nova Scotia, 1785-1786; Ep.; d. in England, after 1786.

name: George Panton
settled at: Phillipstown, Yonkers (Westchester) N.Y., St. Philip's Church in the Highlands, Dec.

name: Joseph Park
raw: JOSEPH PARK, A.M., b. Newton, Mass., 12 Mar. 1705, son of John and Elizabeth (Miller) Park; A.B., H.C, 1724, A.M.; Ord. Westerly, R.L, 13 Aug. 1742; Cong, minister and Indian missionary; sett. Westerly, R.L, 1742-1752, 1756-1777; inst. Southold, L.L, N.Y., Mattituck Chh., 10 June 1752-11 Feb. 1756; Lower Aquebogue, L.L, N.Y., 1752-11 Feb. 1756; Presb. at L.L; d. Westerly, R.L, i Mar. 1772, a. 72.

name: Samuel Parkhurst
raw: SAMUEL PARKHURST, A.M., A.B., Princeton, 1757, A.M.; sett. Florida (Orange) N.Y., 1762-1768; Warwick (Orange) N.Y., 1762- 1768; Presb.; d. Orange co., N.Y., 1768.

name: Olof Parlin
settled at: Philadelphia, Pa., Gloria Dei Church, July
raw: Provost OLOF PARLIN, sett. Philadelphia, Pa., Gloria Dei Chh., July 1750-1757; Provost of the Sw. Luth. chhs. in America, 1756-1757; Sw. Luth.; d. Philadelphia, Pa., 22 Dec. 1757.

name: Noyes Parris
chaplain: Castle Island, Boston Harbor, for a time
son of: the Rev. Samuel and Dorothy (Noyes) Parris
raw: NOYES PARRIS, A.M., b. Newton, Mass., 22 Aug. 1699, son of the Rev. Samuel and Dorothy (Noyes) Parris; A.B., H.C, 1721, A.M.; sett. Cohansey, now Fairfield (Cumberland) N.J., 1724-1729; returned to N.E., Sept. 1729; Chaplain, Castle Island, Boston Harbor, for a time; d. perhaps in Sudbury, Mass., ca. 1748.

name: John Paul
settled at: Lower West Nottingham (Cecil) Md., Lower Octoraro Church, Oct.
raw: JOHN PAUL, b. Ireland, 1706; lie. 10 Dec. 1735; inst. Lower West Nottingham (Cecil) Md., Lower Octoraro Chh., Oct. 1736-1739; Presb.; d. Lower West Nottingham, Pa., 1739, a. 33.

name: Abraham Payn
raw: ABRAHAM PAYN, sett. Nine Partners (Dutchess) N.Y., ca. 1752; Cong.

name: Jasper Payne
raw: JASPER PAYNE, b. Twickenham, Middlesex, England, son of Elizabeth (Bannister) Payne; arriv. Staten Island, N.Y., 26 Nov. 1743; Ord. deacon, 1753; sett. Bethlehem, Pa., 1745-1748; steward, 1752; schoolmaster; L.I., N.Y., 1750-1752; Staten Island, N.Y., 1754-1754; Brodhead Settlement at Dansbury, Pa., 1754-1755; Paulin's Kill (Warren) N.J., 1754-1755; Wallpack (Sussex) N.J., 1754-1755; Philadelphia, Pa., 1760; innkeeper, Aug. 1762-1766; minister in rural churches; Morav.; d. Lititz, Warwick, Pa.

name: Thomas Payton
raw: THOMAS PAYTON, S.J., sett. Md., 1658-1659; S.J., R.C, d. N.Y., N.Y., 12 Jan. 1660.

name: Jeremiah Peck
raw: JEREMIAH PECK, b. London, England, 1628, son of William and Elizabeth Peck; came to Boston, 1637; H.C, 1653-1656, non-grad.; teacher at Guilford, Conn., 1656-1660; Ord. Old Saybrook, Conn., 25 Sept. 1661-30 Jan. 1665/6; sett. Newark, N.J., 1666/7-1 Oct. 1667; Elizabethtown, N.J., 1674-1678, as the first minister; West Greenwich, Conn., 3 Sept. 1678-1689; inst. Waterbury, Conn., 1690-1699; Cong.; Presb.; d. Waterbury, Conn., 7 June 1699, a. 71.

name: Pierre Peiret
raw: PIERRE PEIRET, b. 1645, came from Foix, southern France; sett. London, England, 1687; came to America, 1687; sett. N.Y., N.Y., Fr. Ref. Chh. of the Saint Esprit, 1687-1704; Fr. Ref.; d. N.Y., N.Y., i Sept. 1704.

name: Pierre Peiret
settled at: N.Y., N.Y., Fr. Ref. Church of the Saint Esprit

name: James Pellentz
settled at: Lancaster (Lane.) Pa., St. John Nepomucene's Church
raw: JAMES PELLENTZ, sett. Lancaster (Lane.) Pa., St. John Nepomucene's Chh., 1758-1800; Conewago (Adams) Pa., Chh. of the Sacred Heart, 1758-1800; Paradise (York) Pa., St. Mary's Chh., 1761-1800; Fredericktown (Frederick) Md., St. Stanislaus's Chh., 1768-1800; vicar-general to Bishop Carroll; R.C; d. Conewago, Pa., 13 Mar. 1800.

name: Ebenezer Pemberton
settled at: N.Y., N.Y., first Presb. Church, Oct.
degrees: D.D., A.B., H.C, 1721, A.M. D.D., Princeton, 1770
son of: the Rev. Ebenezer and Mary (Clark) Pembertpn
raw: EBENEZER PEMBERTON, D.D., b. Boston, Mass., 6 Feb. 1704/5, son of the Rev. Ebenezer and Mary (Clark) Pembertpn; A.B., H.C, 1721, A.M.; D.D., Princeton, 1770; sett. N.Y., N.Y., ist Presb. Chh., 1727-Oct. 1753; inst. Boston, Mass., New Brick Chh., 6 Mar. 1754- 1777; Artillery Election Sermon, 1756; Election Sermon, 1757; Convention Sermon, 1759; Dudleian Lecture, 1766; Fellow, Am. Acad. of Arts and Sciences; Presb.; Cong.; d. Boston, Mass., 9 Sept. 1777, a. 73.

name: Francis Peppard
raw: FRANCIS PEPPARD, A.B., A.B., Princeton, 1762; lie. 1764; Ord. 1764; sett. Mendham (Morris) N.J., 1764-1769; New Windsor (Orange) N.Y., 1769-1773; Newburgh (Orange) N.Y., 1769-1773; Cornwall (Orange) N.Y., Bethlehem Chh., 1769-1773; Frelinghuysen (Warren) N.J., Yellow Frame Chh., Apr. 1773-May 1783; Knowlton (Warren) N.J., 27 Apr. 1773-1775; Hackettstown (Warren) N.J., Apr. 1773-May 1783; sett. Allen, Pa., 1781-inst. Aug. 1783-May 1795; Presb.; d. Hardwick, Yellow Frame, N.J., 30 Mar. 1797.

name: John Frederick Peter
raw: JOHN FREDERICK PETER, Senior, sett. Hernndyck, Holland, 1746-1760; arriv. N.Y., N.Y., 19 Oct. 1761; sett. Bethlehem, Pa., 1761- 1784; as principal pastor, Bethlehem, Pa., Oct. 1784-1813; Morav.; d. Bethlehem, Pa., ca. 1813.

name: John Frederick Peter
settled at: Bethlehem, Pa., , as accountant, secretary and organizer
son of: the Rev. John Frederick and Susanna Peter
raw: JOHN FREDERICK PETER, Jr., b. Hernndyck, Holland, 19 May 1746, son of the Rev. John Frederick and Susanna Peter; ed. Gros Hennersdorf, Barby, and Niesky; arriv. in America, 1769; teacher at Nazareth, Pa., 1769-1770; sett. Bethlehem, Pa., 1770-1785, as accountant, secretary and organizer; sett. Hope, N.J., Lititz, Pa., Graceham, Md., and Salem, N.C, 1786-1793; sett. Bethlehem, Pa., 1793-1813; noted composer and musieian; Morav.; d. Bethlehem, Pa., 19 July 1813.

name: John Frederick Peter
settled at: Hope, N.J., Lititz, Pa., Graceham, Md., and Salem, N.C

name: Richard Peters
degrees: D.D., matrie. Wadham Coll., Oxford, 8 Apr. 1731, a. 20 D.D., Oxford, 2 May 1770
son of: Ralph Peter, Town Clerk of Liverpool
raw: RICHARD PETERS, D.D., b. Liverpool, Laneashire, England, 1704, son of Ralph Peter, Town Clerk of Liverpool; matrie. Wadham Coll., Oxford, 8 Apr. 1731, a. 20; D.D., Oxford, 2 May 1770; Trustee of the U. of Pa., 1749-1776; Ord. Chelsea, England, 1731; arriv. in Penna., 1735; sett. Philadelphia, Pa., Christ Chh., I735-Julyi737; Philadelphia, United Chhs., Christ Chh. and St. Peter's Chh., 6 Dee. 1762-23 Sept. 1775; Clerk of the Provineial Couneil, 14 Feb. 1743-1762; Seeretary of the Pennsylvania Land Offiee, 1737 ff.; member of the Council, 1749; Ep.; d. Philadelphia, Pa., 10 July 1776, a. 72.

name: Richard Peters
edited_raw: Seeretary of the Pennsylvania Land Offiee, ff.

name: John Gottlieb Pezold
settled at: Salisbury (Lehigh) Pa., Church at Emaus, , founder of Emaus
raw: JOHN GOTTLIEB PEZOLD, b. Bisehofswerda, Saxony; was at Bethlehem, Pa., 1742; Ord. Deaeon, 1748; sett. Salisbury (Lehigh) Pa., Chh. at Emaus, 1742-1748, founder of Emaus; General Superintendent of the work of the single men in Ameriea; sett. Maeungie (Lehigh) Pa.; returned to Europe, 1753-1754; Chaplain at Bethlehem, 1754 ff.; "one of the most devoted and valuable Moravians of his time"; Morav.; d. Lititz, Pa., I Apr. 1762.

name: Michael Pffautz
raw: Bishop MICHAEL PFFAUTZ, b. Germany, 1709; came to America, 1727; Ord. minister, 1735; Ord. Bishop, 1747; sett. Warwick (Lane.) Pa., White Oak Chh., 1736-1769; Coealieo (Lane.) Pa., Conestoga Chh., 1748-1769; Bern (Berks) Pa., Northkill Chh., 1748-1769; Mount Joy (Lane.) Pa., Great Swatara Chh., 1756-1769; German Bapt.; d. Lancaster CO. Pa., 21 May 1769, a. 60.

name: Francis Phillips
raw: FRANCIS PHILLIPS (or Philips), ed. St. John's Coll., Camb.; no matriculation or degrees found; Ord. deacon, London, England, 4 Mar. 1704/5; Chaplain, British Navy, 1711-1712; K.B. for Md., 10 Dec. 1711 ; inst. Stratford, Conn., 1712-1713; sett. Philadelphia, Pa., Christ Chh., 1714-1715; unfrocked; Ep.

name: George Phillips
ordained: Brookhaven, L.L, N.Y., Chh. at Setauket, 13 Apr. 1702
son of: the Rev. Samuel and Sarah (Appleton) Phillips
raw: GEORGE PHILLIPS, A.M., b. Rowley, Mass., 3 June 1664, son of the Rev. Samuel and Sarah (Appleton) Phillips; A.B., H.C, 1686, A.M.; sett. SufReld, Conn., 1690-1692; Jamaica, L.L, N.Y., 1693-1697; Ord. Brookhaven, L.L, N.Y., Chh. at Setauket, 13 Apr. 1702; sett. Setauket, L.L, N.Y., 1697-1739; he was a founder of the Long Island Presbytery, 1717; Cong.; Presb.; d. Setauket, L.L, N.Y., 3 Apr. 1739, a. 75.

name: James Phillips
raw: JAMES PHILLIPS, sett. Philips' Patent (Dutchess) N.Y., 1773-1774; Fishkill (Dutchess) N.Y., 1774-1793; Bapt.; d. Fishkill, N.Y., 3 Feb. 1793-

name: Jean Pierron
raw: JEAN PIERRON, b. Dun-sur-Meuse, France, 28 Sept. 1631; Jesuit nov! at Nancy, France, 21 Nov. 1650; ed. Pont-a-Mousson; instructor at Rheims, Verdun and Metz, 1665-1667; arriv. in Canada, June 1667; sett, among the Mohawks where he replaced Father Fremin, 7 Oct. 1668; Iroquois Mission of Sainte Marie, 1667-1677 (also called the Mission of the Martyrs and the Mohawk Mission of St. Peter's at Fonda, N.Y.); travelled through Acadia, N.E., Md. and Va.; returned to France, 1677; R.C; date and place of death unknown.

name: Jean Pierron
edited_raw: Iroquois Mission of Sainte Marie, (also called the Mission of the Martyrs and the Mohawk Mission of St. Peter's

name: Abraham Pierson
ordained: in England, where he was minister at Newark, co. Nottingham
raw: ABRAHAM PIERSON, A.B., b. Yorkshire, England, ca. 1608; A.B., Trinity Coll., Camb., 1632; Ord. in England, where he was minister at Newark, co. Nottingham; came to N.E., 1639; sett. Lynn, Mass., Nov.- Dec 1640; Southampton, L.L, N.Y., Dec. 1640-1644; Branford, Conn., 7 Mar. 1644-1666; Newark, N.J., June 1667-1678; Chaplain, 1654; Cong.; d. Newark, N.J., 9 Aug. 1678.

name: Abraham Pierson Ii
raw: President ABRAHAM PIERSON, A.B., b. prob, at Branford, Conn., ca. 1645; A.B., H.C, 1668; Ord. Newark, N.J., 4 Mar. 1672; sett, (asst.) Newark, N.J., 1669-1678; sett. Newark, N.J., 9 Aug. 1678-1692; Greenwich, Conn., 1692-1694; inst. Killingworth, Conn, (now Clinton, Conn.), 1694-1707; Trustee and founder, Y.C, 1700; induct. Y:C., ist Près., II Nov. 1701-1707; Cong.; d. Killingworth, Conn., 5 May 1707, a. 61.

name: John Pierson
son of: the Rev. Abraham and Abigail (Clark) Pierson
raw: JOHN PIERSON, A.M., b. Newark, N.J., 1689, son of the Rev. Abraham and Abigail (Clark) Pierson; A.B., Y.C, 1711, A.M.; Trustee, Princeton, 1746-1765; Ord. Woodbridge, N.J., 29 Apr. 1717; sett. Woodbridge, N.J., 1714-1752; Mendham, N.J., 1753-1762; Presb.; d. Hanover, N.J., 23 Aug. 1770, a. 80.

name: John Pierson
raw: JOHN PIERSON, A.M., b. Newark, N.J., son of Abraham and Hannah Pierson; A.B., Y.C, 1729, A.M.; Ord. London, England, 1733; K.B. for N.J., I Sept. 1733; arriv. N.J., 30 Jan. 1733/4; s^"- Salem (Salem) N.J., St. John's Chh., 30 Jan. 1733/4-1747; S.P.G. missionary in N.J., at Greenwich in Cohansey (Cumberland) N.J., St. Stephen's Chh., 1734-1747; sett. Maurice River (Cumb.) N.J., 1734-1747; Ep.; d. Salem, N.J., 1747.

name: John Pierson
settled at: Greenwich in Cohansey (Cumberland) N.J., St. Stephen's Church

name: Joseph Pilmore
degrees: D.D., arriv. Gloucester Point, N.J., 24 Oct. 1769, as a Methodist preacher D.D., U. of Pa., 1807
raw: JOSEPH PILMORE, D.D., b. Tadmouth, Yorkshire, England, 1734; arriv. Gloucester Point, N.J., 24 Oct. 1769, as a Methodist preacher; D.D., U. of Pa., 1807; Ord. Conn., 27 Dec. 1785; itinerant preacher in the Colonies, 1769-1785; sett. Philadelphia, Pa., St. George's Chh., 1769-1785; United Chhs.: Oxford, Pa., Trinity Chh.; Lower Dublin, Pa., All Saints Chh.; Whitmarsh, Pa., St. Thomas's Chh., 1785-1789; became an Ep.; sett. Philadelphia, Pa., St. Paul's Chh., 1789-1794, 1804-1825; N.Y., N.Y., Christ Chh., 1794-1804; Meth.; Ep.; d. Philadelphia, Pa., 24 July 1825, a. 91.

name: John Pine
raw: JOHN PINE, not ordained; preached at N.Y., N.Y., 1745-1750; Bapt.; d. N.Y., N.Y., 1750.

name: Francis Piquet
raw: Abbe FRANCIS PIQUET, b. Bresse, France, 6 Dec. 1708; sett. Ogdensburg (St. Lawrence) N.Y., Mission of Our Lady; Sulpician; R.C; d. Verjon, France, 15 July 1781, a. 73.

name: George Pitschmann
raw: GEORGE PITSCHMANN, sett. Salisbury (Lehigh) Pa., Chh. at Emaus, 1762-1763; his wife, Maria, was his helper; Morav.

name: Johannes Theodorus Polhemus
raw: JOHANNES THEODORUS POLHEMUS, b. Switzeriand, 1598; ed. Switzerland; sett. Palatinate, Germany, 1625-1628; Meppel, Overyssel, Netherlands, 1628-1630; Palatinate, 1630-1635; Olinda, Brazil, 1637- 1645; Itamacus, Brazil, 1645-1654; arriv. in America, 1654; sett. Flatlands, L.L, N.Y., at Midwout, 1655-1676; Brooklyn, 1655-1660, 1664- 1676; Flatlands, at Niew Amersfoordt, 1655-1676; Bushwick, 1655- 1676; Gravesend, L.L, N.Y., 1655-1676; Dutch Ref.; d. Brooklyn, L.L, N.Y., 8 June 1676.

name: Samuel Pomeroy
raw: SAMUEL POMEROY, A.B., b. Northampton, Mass., 16 Sept. 1687, son of Deacon Medad and Abigail (Strong) Pomeroy; A.B., Y.C, 1705; Ord. Northampton, Mass., 30 Nov. 1709; sett. Newtown, L.L, N.Y., July 1708-1744; Cong.; Presb.; d. Newtown, L.L, N.Y., 30 June 1744, a. 57-

name: John Nicholas Pomp
settled at: New Hanover (Montgomery) Pa., Falkner's Swamp Church
raw: JOHN NICHOLAS POMP, b. Mambaechel, Zweibruecken, Germany, 20 Jan. 1734, son of Peter and Anna Elizabeth (Thomser) Pomp; matric. Marburg, 25 Apr. 1757; Ord. Cassel, Germany; arriv. Philadelphia, 5 Dec. 1765; sett. New Hanover (Montgomery) Pa., Falkner's Swamp Chh., 1765-1783; Pottstown (Montgomery) Pa., Zion's Chh., 1765- 1783; East Vincent (Chester) Pa., Zion Chh., 1765-1783; Baltimore, Md., I Sept. 1783-15 Nov. 1789; Upper Salford (Montgomery) Pa., Old Goshenhoppen Chh.,1790-1791; Upper Hanover (Montgomery) Pa., New Goshenhoppen Chh., 1790-1791; Franconia (Montgomery) Pa., Indian Creek Chh., 1789-1796; Whitpain (Montgomery) Pa., Boehm's Chh., 1794-1797; Worcester (Montgomery) Pa., Wentz's or Skippack Chh., 1794-1797; lived at Skippack; Germ. Ref.; d. Easton, Pa., I Sept. 1819, a. 85 y.

name: Edward Portlock
raw: EDWARD PORTLOCK (or Perthuck), Ord. Deacon, 11 May 1691; Ord. Priest, 3 Apr. 1698; came to America, 1698; sett. Perth Amboy (Middlesex) N.J., St. Peter's Chh., 22 Feb. 1698-1700; Elizabethtown (Union) N.J., St. John's Chh., 1698-1700; Buriington (Burlington) N.J., met in the Town House, 1698-1700; Piscataway (Middlesex) N.J., 1698-1700; Woodbridge (Middlesex) N.J., Trinity Chh., 1698-1700; Philadelphia, Pa., Christ Chh., 29 Nov. 1699-1700; sett. StrattonMajor Parish (King and Queen) Va., 1701-1705 and prob, to 1715; Ep.; d. ca. 1715 (bef. 1719).

name: Edward Portlock
settled at: Stratton Major Parish (King and Queen) Va.

name: Frederick Christian Post
edited_raw: Indian missionary in N.Y. and Conn.
raw: FREDERICK CHRISTIAN POST, b. Conitz, Polish Prussia, 1710; arriv. Bethlehem, Pa., 25 June 1742; not ordained; Indian missionary in N.Y. and Conn., 1743-1749; went to Europe, 1751-1754; arriv. N.Y., N.Y., 15 Apr. 1754; sett. Labrador, 1752; Wyoming Valley, Pa., 1754; his important services to the Government of Pennsylvania in treating with the western Indians, 1758, made his name celebrated in the history of Pa.; sett. Tuscarawas Valley, Stark co., Ohio, as missionary, Sept. 1761-1764; Moskito Coast, 1764-1784; carpenter; returned to Germantown, 1784; Morav.; d. Germantown, Pa., Apr. 1785.

name: Elam Potter
ordained: Shelter Island, L.L, N.Y., Cong. Chh., 12 June 1766
son of: Dea. Daniel, Jr. and Martha (Ives) Potter
raw: ELAM POTTER, A.M., b. New Haven, Conn., i Jan. 1741/2, son of Dea. Daniel, Jr. and Martha (Ives) Potter; A.B., Y.C, 1765, A.M.; Ord. Shelter Island, L.L, N.Y., Cong. Chh., 12 June 1766; sett. Shelter Island, 1766-1767; inst. Enfield, Conn., ist Cong. Chh., i Mar. 1769-17 Apr. 1776; sett. Southold, L.L, N.Y., Nov. 1792-1794; Cong.; Presb.; d. Southold, L.L, N.Y., 5 Jan. 1794, a. 52.

name: Elam Potter
settled at: Enfield, Conn., first Cong. Church, i Mar.

name: Joshua Potts
raw: JOSHUA POTTS, b. Mansfield, N.J., 4 Jan. 1719; Ord. 29 May 1746; sett. Southampton (Bucks) Pa., 1746-1761; Bapt.; d. Southampton, Pa., 18 June 1761.

name: Howell Powell
ordained: Fairfield (Cumberland) N.J., Cohansey Presb. Chh., 15 Oct. 1714-1717
raw: HOWELL POWELL (Howell ap Howell). came from Wales; Ord. Fairfield (Cumberland) N.J., Cohansey Presb. Chh., 15 Oct. 1714-1717; Presb.; d. Cohansey, N.J., bef. Sept. 1717.

name: Joseph Powell
raw: JOSEPH POWELL, b. Pennypack, Pa., 6 Mar. 1734; ed. Hopewell, N.J., Ord. 1764; sett. Konolowa (Cumberland) Pa., Bapt. Chh., 1764- i77i;Bapt.

name: Joseph Powell
raw: JOSEPH POWELL, came from Whitechurch, Shropshire, England; arriv. Philadelphia, 7 June 1742; sett. Bethlehem, Pa., 1742; Bethlehem, Broadhead Settlement at Dansbury, 1755-1756; Wallpack (Sussex) N.J., 1755-1755; chh. burned by the Indians, 1755; Paulin's K.Í11 (Warren) N.J., I7SS~I7SS; Neshaminy (Bucks) Pa., Sunbury (Northampton) Pa., Indian Chh. at Shamokin, 1745; Staten Island; Carroll's Manor, Md.; Amenia Union (Dutchess) N.Y., Indian mission at "The Oblong"; Ord. Deacon, 1756; sett. Jamaica, West Indies, 1759-1765; Maryland, 1765- 1772; Graceham, Md., 1770-1770; Sichem, North East Center (Dutchess) N.Y., 1772-1774; Sharon, Conn., Gnadensee Mission at Wequodnoc; Mr. Powell was the last missionary here; at his death the mission was discontinued; Morav.; d. Sichem, North East Center, N.Y., Sept. 1774.

name: James Power Co
degrees: D.D., A.B., Princeton, 1766 D.D., Jefferson Coll., 1808
raw: JAMES POWER, D.D., b. Nottingham (Chester) Pa., 1746; A.B., Princeton, 1766; D.D., Jefferson Coll., 1808; lie. 24 June 1772; sett. Mill Creek (Lebanon) Pa., June 1772-23 Dec. 1772; missionary in Botetourt CO., Va., 1773, and in western Pa., 1774; sett. West Nottingham (Chester) Pa., 1774-1776; Ord. 23 May 1776; Dunlap's Creek (Fayette) Pa., near Brownsville, 1776-1779; Mt. Pleasant (Westmoreland) Pa. and Sewickley (Allegheny) Pa., 1779-22 Apr. 1B17; Presb.; d. Mt. Pleasant, Pa., 5 Aug. 1830, a. 85.

name: Thomas Poyer
licensed: lied Trinity Church, N.Y., N.Y., 1714, during the absence of Mr. Vesey
settled at: Flushing, L.L, N.Y., St. George's Church
son of: Thomas Poyer of Haverfordwest, CO. Pembroke, Wales
raw: THOMAS POYER, b. 1685, son of Thomas Poyer of Haverfordwest, CO. Pembroke, Wales; matric. Brasenose Coll., Oxford, 6 Apr. 1704, a. 19; Ord. (Bsp. of St. David's) 1706; curate, Haverfordwest, and Chaplain, H.M.S. "Antelope"; K.B. for N.Y., 28 Dec. 1709; sett. Flushing, L.L, N.Y., St. George's Chh., 1710-1731; induct. Jamaica, L.L, N.Y., Grace Chh., 18 July 1710-1732; supplied Trinity Chh., N.Y., N.Y., 1714, during the absence of Mr. Vesey; Ep.; d. Jamaica, L.L, N.Y., Jan. 1732.

name: William Preston
degrees: A.B., matric. Balliol Coll., Oxford, 26 Aug. 1735, a. 17 A.B., 1739
son of: George Preston, baronet, of Edinburgh, Scotland by the Rev. War
raw: WILLIAM PRESTON, A.B., b. 1718, son of George Preston, baronet, of Edinburgh, Scotland; matric. Balliol Coll., Oxford, 26 Aug. 1735, a. 17; A.B., 1739; Chaplain, 26th Regt., 23 Feb. 1741-1781; S.P.G. missionary at Woodbridge (Middlesex) N.J., Trinity Chh., 1767-1774; Perth Amboy (Middlesex) N.J., St. Peter's Chh., Dec. 1768-1777; mission broken up by the Rev. War; rejoined his regt, as Chaplain; Ep.; d. Shrewsbury, N.J., 7 Mar. 1781.

name: Jacob Price
edited_raw: JACOB PRICE (or Preus), had been a missionary in Germany
raw: JACOB PRICE (or Preus), came from Wittgenstein, 1719; had been a missionary in Germany; arriv. at Lower Salford, Pa., 1721; sett. Lower Salford (Montgomery) Pa., 1723-1734; Germ. Bapt.

name: Ebenezer Prime
raw: EBENEZER PRIME, A.M., b. Milford, Conn., 21 July 1700; A.B., Y.C, 1718, A.M.; Ord. Huntington, L.L, N.Y., 5 June 1723; sett. Huntington, 1719-1779; Presb.; d. Huntington, L.L, N.Y., 25 Sept. 1779, a. 79.

name: Thomas Pritchard
degrees: A.B., matric. Jesus Coll., Camb., 2 Mar. 1698/9, a. 22 A.B., 1702
raw: THOMAS PRITCHARD, A.B., b. Machynlleth, co. Montgomery, Wales, 1677, son of Edward Pritchard; matric. Jesus Coll., Camb., 2 Mar. 1698/9, a. 22; A.B., 1702; K.B. for N.Y., 30 Nov. 1703; arriv. N.Y., N.Y., Apr. 1704; S.P.G. missionary; Rye (Westchester) N.Y., Christ's Chh., 1704-1705; Bedford (Westchester) N.Y., St. Matthew's Chh., 1704-1705; Greenwich, Conn., Apr. 1704-1705; Ep.; d. Rye, N.Y., Mar./Apr. 1705.

name: James Proudfit
settled at: Brandywine Manor (Chester) Pa., Forks of the Brandywine
raw: JAMES PROUDFIT, A.M. (or Proudfoot), b. Perth, Scotland, 1732; Ord. Scotland, July 1754; arriv. Boston, Mass., Sept. 1754; A.M. (hon.) Columbia, 1790; sett. Brandywine Manor (Chester) Pa., Forks of the Brandywine, 1757-1783; Pequea (Lane.) Pa., 1757-1783; Salem, Cambridge, Hebron and Argyle (all in Washington co.) N.Y., 1783-1799; Associate Presb.; d. Salem, N.Y., 22 Oct. 1802, a. 69.

name: James Proudfit
edited_raw: Salem, Cambridge, Hebron and Argyle (all in Washington co.) N.Y.

name: Samuel Provoost
degrees: D.D., A.B., Columbia, 1758, A.M., Trustee, 1787-1801 D.D., U. of Pa., 1786
raw: Bishop SAMUEL PROVOOST, D.D., b. N.Y., N.Y., 26 Feb. 1742, son of John and Eve (Rutgers) Provoost; A.B., Columbia, 1758, A.M., Trustee, 1787-1801; chairman of the board, 1795-1801; St. Peter's Coll., Camb.; D.D., U. of Pa., 1786; Regent, U. of State of N.Y., 1784-1787; Ord. London, 25 Mar. 1766; sett. N.Y., N.Y., Trinity Chh., Dec. 1766- 1768; Rector, 1784-8 Sept. 1800; St. George's Chapel, 1766-1800; St. Paul's Chapel, 1766-1768; Bishop of N.Y., 4 Feb. 1786-1815; Chaplain, U.S. Senate, 1789-3 Sept. 1801; Ep.; d. N.Y., N.Y., 6 Sept. ,1815, a. 73.

name: Samuel Provoost
edited_raw: Regent, U. of State of N.Y.

name: Job Prudden
raw: JOB PRUDDEN, A.M. (See Colonial Clergy of New England, p. 170), Ord. Newark, N.J., 19 May 1747; Presb.

name: John Prudden
son of: the Rev. John and Joanna Prudden
raw: JOHN PRUDDEN, A.B., b. Milford, Conn., 9 Nov. 1645, son of the Rev. John and Joanna Prudden; A.B., H.C, 1668; sett. Jamaica, L.L, N.Y., 8 Mar. 1670-Jan. 1674, 19 June 1676-1691; Rye, N.Y., 1675- 1676; Newark, N.J., 23 Aug. 1692-9 June 1699; taught school, 1706 ff.; not known to have been ordained; Presb.; d. Newark, N.J., 11 Dec. 1725, a. 80 (GS).

name: Ebenezer Punderson
ordained: Ledyard, Conn. (2nd Cong. Chh. in Groton) 25 Dec. 1729- 5 Feb. 1733/4 London, England, 1734
raw: EBENEZER PUNDERSON, A.M., b. New Haven, Conn., 12 Sept. 1705, son of Thomas and Lydia (Bradley) Punderson; A.B., Y.C, 1726, A.M.; Ord. Ledyard, Conn. (2nd Cong. Chh. in Groton) 25 Dec. 1729- 5 Feb. 1733/4; became an Ep.; Ord. London, England, 1734; sett. Ledyard, Conn., Ep. Chh., I734-I7S3; Norwich, Conn., Christ Chh., 1736; Hebron, Conn., 1746-1752; New Haven, Conn., Trinity Chh., 1753-1762; Rye (Westchester) N.Y., Christ's Chh., 1762-1764; Bedford (Westchester) N.Y., St. Matthew's Chh., 1762-1764; Ep.; d. Rye, N.Y., 22 Sept. 1764, a. 59.

name: John Christopher Pyrlaeus
raw: JOHN CHRISTOPHER PYRLAEUS, b. Pausa, Voigtland, 1713; ed. U. of Leipsic, 1733-1738; arriv. Bethlehem, Pa., 19 Qct. 1740; Ord. Oley, Pa., n Feb. 1742; sett. Bethlehem, 1742-1742; Philadelphia, Pa., 1742-1743 ; commenced the study of the Mohawk language, Jan. 1743/4, under Conrad Weiser; taught the Indian School at Freehold, N.J., 4 Feb. 1744-N0V. 1751; was also itinerant preacher at Burlington, Cranbury, Lawrence, Middletown, Princeton, Swedish Settlements, and Trenton, all in N.J.; at Dover, Duck Creek and Lewes in Del.; and at Durham (Bucks), Lower Salford (Montgomery), Manatawny (Berks), Southampton (Bucks) and Upper Providence (Montgomery) at Trappe, all in Pa., 1743-1749; returned to England, where he remained, 1751-1770, and to Germany, 1771; student and teacher of the Indian languages, especially the Mohawk and Mohiean dialeets; Morav.; d. Herrnhut, Germany, 28 May 1785.

name: John William Pythan
raw: JOHN WILLIAM PYTHAN, b. Oberingelheim, Palatinate, Germany, 3 May 1740, son of Lieutenant John Pythan; matrie. Heidelberg, 30 Jan. 1759; was a minister in the Palatinate; arriv. Philadelphia, i Sept. 1769; took oath of allegiance, Philadelphia, 1 Sept. 1769; sett. Dryland, Easton, Lehigh, St. Paul's Chh., Plainfield, St. Peter's Chh., all in Northampton co.. Pa., 1769-1774; Greenwich (Warren) N.J., 1769-1774; and Greenwich (Berks) Pa., Dunkel Chh., 1769-1770, where he is said to have been deposed, 1770; sett. Lower Saucon (Northampton) Pa., 8 Aug. 1773-1779; Springfield (Bucks) Pa., 2 May 1773- 1779, either in conjunction with or opposition to Caspar Waek, who was also sett, over these last two ehhs.; went to North Carolina, 1780; Germ. Ref.; d. Briek Chureh, N.C, 1789.

name: Raffeix
raw: Father RAFFEIX, S.J., sett. Fonda (Montgomery) N.Y., St. Mary's Mission to the Mohawks, 1667-1671; Auburn (Cayuga) N.Y., Mission of St. Joseph to the Cayugas, 1671-1671; Vietor (Ontario) N.Y., Mission of the Coneeption to the Sénecas, 1671-1675; R. C.

name: Raffeix
edited_raw: Vietor (Ontario) NY, Mission of the Coneeption to the Sénecas

name: William Ramsey
ordained: Fairfield (Cumberland) N.J., Cohansey Chh., i Dee. 1756-1771
raw: WILLIAM RAMSEY, A.M., b. Laneaster eo.. Pa., 1732, son of James Ramsey; A.B., Prineeton, 1754, A.M., 1765; Ord. Fairfield (Cumberland) N.J., Cohansey Chh., i Dee. 1756-1771; Presb.; d. Fairfield, N.J., 5 Nov. 1771, a. 39 (GS).

name: Thomas Rankin
edited_raw: Methodist preaeher appointed to the Shefiield eireuit
raw: THOMAS RANKIN, b. Dunbar, Seotland, ca. 1738; Methodist preaeher appointed to the Shefiield eireuit, 1762; Devonshire, 1763; Cornwall, 1764; Epworth, 1766-1767; West Cornwall, 1768; London and Sussex, 1769; Cornwall, 1771; arriv. Philadelphia, i June 1773; sett. Philadelphia Conferenee, 1773-1778; returned to England, arriv. London, June 1778; Meth.; d. London, England, 17 May 1810, a. 72.

name: Philip Henry Rapp
settled at: Lower Macungie (Lehigh) Pa., Holy Trinity or Zion Church
raw: PHILIP HENRY RAPP, merchant; Ord. by the Notoria Andrea; came to Pa., 1750; sett. Lower Macungie (Lehigh) Pa., Holy Trinity or Zion Chh., 1750-18 Dec. 1751; called to Christ Chh., N.Y., 29 Oct. 1751; sett. N.Y., N.Y., Christ Chh. or Old Swamp Chh., 1751-1753; Germantown, Pa., St. Michael's Chh., i Jan. 1754-1762; Bedminster (Bucks) Pa., Tohickon Chh., 22 Oct. 1765-1774; Milford (Bucks) Pa., St. John's or Schuetz's Chh., 1769-1774; Milford, Lower Milford Chh. at Trumbauersville, 1769-1774; Nockamixon (Bucks) Pa., 1774-1779; Luth.; d. Nockamixon, Pa., 10 Nov. 1779 (suicide); will made 12 July 1779; prob. 18 Nov. 1779.

name: Philip Henry Rapp
settled at: N.Y., N.Y., Christ Church or Old Swamp Church

name: Job Rathbone
son of: the Rev. Joshua and Mary (Wightman) Rathbone
raw: JOB RATHBONE (or Rathbun), b. Stonington, Conn., 2 Jan. 1735/6, son of the Rev. Joshua and Mary (Wightman) Rathbone; sett. Canaan, Conn.; sett. Lowville (Lewis) N.Y., ca. 1765; Rev. soldier; Bapt.

name: Christian Henry Rauch
raw: CHRISTIAN HENRY RAUCH, b. Bernberg-Anhalt, Germany, 5 July 1718; arriv. N.Y., N.Y., 21 July 1740; Germ. Ref. ministry: Oley (Berks) Pa., 1740-1742; Elizabethtown (Lane) Pa., 1746-1749; Lancaster (Lane.) Pa., 1746-1749; Warwick (Lane.) Pa., Kissel Hill Chh., 1746-1749; West Cocalico (Lane.) Pa., Swamp or Little Cocalico Chh., 1748-1749; Mount Joy (Lane.) Pa., Miller's Chh., 1746-1749; Jackson (Lebanon) Pa., Millback Chh., 1746-1749; Lower Salford (Montgomery) Pa., ReifT's or Skippack Chh., 1746-1749; Moravian ministry: Ord. Oley (Berks) Pa., 11 Feb. 1742; Indian missionary in Conn., 1740- 1745; Shekomeko (Dutchess) N.Y., 2nd Indian Chh., 1740-1744; Bethel (Lebanon) Pa., 1743-1744; York (York) Pa., 1746-1749; Codorus (York) Pa., 1746-1749; Conewago (York) Pa., Zion's or Quickel's Chh., 1746-1748; Hellam (York) Pa., 1746-1747; Swatara (Lebanon) Pa., 1746-1749; East Cocalico (Lane.) Pa., Chh. at Reamstown, 1748-1749; Penn (Lane.) Pa., White Oakes Chh., 1746-1749; Lancaster (Lane.) Pa., 1753-1754; East Coventry (Chester) Pa., Brownback's Chh., 1746-1748; Warwick (Lane) Pa., St. James's Chh. at Lititz, 9 Sept. 1749-20 Dec. 1753; South Lebanon (Lebanon) Pa., Hebron Chh., 1750- 1753 ; sett. Bethabara, North Carolina, 1755-1756; Jamaica, West Indies, 1756-1763; Germ. Ref.; Morav.; d. Jamaica, West Indies, 11 Nov. 1763.

name: Christian Henry Rauch
settled at: West Cocalico (Lane.) Pa., Swamp or Little Cocalico Church

name: Christian Henry Rauch
settled at: Lower Salford (Montgomery) Pa., ReifT's or Skippack Church

name: Christian Henry Rauch
settled at: Conewago (York) Pa., Zion's or Quickel's Church

name: Lucas Raus
settled at: Oley (Berks) Pa., Christ or Hill Church
raw: Dr. LUCAS RAUS, Cronstadt, Transylvania, 18 Oct. 1724, son of the Rev. Lucas and Justina Raus; ed. Jena, 1749; Leipsic, 1747-1749; arriv. in America, 1750; Germantown, Pa., asst., 1750-1753; Ord. New^ Providence, Pa., 5 Nov. 1752; sett. Oley (Berks) Pa., Christ or Hill Chh., 1750-1758; Upper Salford (Montgomery) Pa., Old Goshenhoppen Chh., 1751-1753; Franconia (Montg.) Pa., Indian Creek or Zion's Chh., 1751- 1752; Bedminster (Bucks) Pa., Keller's Chh., 1751-1755; Rockhill (Bucks) Pa., Indianfield Chh., 1751-1752; Douglass (Berks) Pa., Oley Hill Chh., 1752-1756; Pike (Berks) Pa., St. John's or Hill Chh., 1754- 1754; York (York) Pa., Christ Chh., 1758-1763; Latimore (Adams) Pa., Christ or Lower Bermudian Chh., 1758-1762; Hellam (York) Kreutz Creek Chh., 1760-1763; Dover (York) Pa., Salem or Strayer's Chh., 1763-1776; Springfield (York) Pa., Frieden Saal or Shuster's Chh., 1770-1787; Conewago (York) Pa., Zion's Chh., 1770-1787; physician; Luth.; d. York, Pa., 11 July 1788, a. 64.

name: Lucas Raus
settled at: Upper Salford (Montgomery) Pa., Old Goshenhoppen Church

name: Lucas Raus
settled at: Franconia (Montg.) Pa., Indian Creek or Zion's Church

name: Lucas Raus
settled at: Pike (Berks) Pa., St. John's or Hill Church

name: Lucas Raus
settled at: Latimore (Adams) Pa., Christ or Lower Bermudian Church

name: Lucas Raus
settled at: Dover (York) Pa., Salem or Strayer's Church

name: Lucas Raus
settled at: Springfield (York) Pa., Frieden Saal or Shuster's Church

name: Jacob Rauss
raw: JACOB RAUSS, came to America, 1753; sett. Rhinebeck (Dutchess) N.Y., 1753-1759; Luth.

name: Israel Read
raw: ISRAEL READ, A.M., b. 1718; A.B., Princeton, 1748, A.M.; Trustee, 1761-1793; Ord. Bound Brook (Somerset) N.J., 7 Mar. 1750-1793; sett. Hillsborough (Monmouth) N.J., Millstone Chh., 1759-1769; New Brunswick (Middlesex) N.J., Apr. 1768-1786; Presb.; d. Bound Brook, N.J., 28 Nov. 1793, a. 75.

name: James Reak
settled at: Mann (Bedford) Pa., Piney Creek Church,  ff.
raw: JAMES REAK, sett. Mann (Bedford) Pa., Piney Creek Chh., 1774 ff.; Presb.

name: Abner Reeve
settled at: Smithtown, L.L, N.Y., Nissequag (or Nissequoque) Church
raw: ABNER REEVE, A.M., b. Southold, L.L, N.Y., 21 Feb. 1707/8, son of Thomas and Bethia (Horton) Reeve; A.B., Y.(¿., 1731, A.M., 1735; sett. Smithtown, L.L, N.Y., Nissequag (or Nissequoque) Chh., 1735-1748; Ord. Brookhaven, L.L, N.Y., 6 Nov. 1755; sett. Brookhaven, Westhampton, Little Quogue or Moriches Chh., 1754-1764; Brookhaven, South Haven or Fire Place Chh., 1754-1763; Blooming Grove (Orange) N.Y., 1764-1768; inst. Brattleborough, Vt., 5 July 1770; sett. Brattleborough, 1768-3 Oct. 1792; Presb.; Cong.; d. Brattleborough, Vt., 16 May 1798, a. 90.

name: Abner Reeve
settled at: Brookhaven, Westhampton, Little Quogue or Moriches Church

name: Ezra Reeve
ordained: Brookhaven, L.L, N.Y., Mt. Sinai Chh., 10 Oct. 1759-25 Oct. 1763
son of: the Rev. Abner and Mary Reeve
raw: EZRA REEVE, A.B., b. Southold, L.L, N.Y., 27 Jan. 1733/4, son of the Rev. Abner and Mary Reeve; A.B., Y.C, 1757; Ord. Brookhaven, L.L, N.Y., Mt. Sinai Chh., 10 Oct. 1759-25 Oct. 1763; Wales, Mass., 13 Sept. 1765-1818; Cong.; Presb.; d. Wales, Mass., 28 Apr. 1818, a. 85.

name: Abraham Reincke
raw: ABRAHAM REINCKE, b. Stockholm, Sweden, 17 Apr. 1712, son of Peter and Margaret (Peterson) Reincke; ed. U. of Jena, 1738; sett. St. Petersburg, Russia, 1740-1741; London and Yorkshire, Eng., 1741- 1744; arriv. N.Y., N.Y., 25 Oct. 1744; arriv. Bethlehem, 9 Nov. 1744; Ord. priest, Feb. 1745; sett. Nazareth (Northampton) Pa., Forks of the Delaware, Nov. 1745-25 June 1747; Philadelphia, Pa., June 1747-Feb. 1749, 1751-1753; Warwick (Lane.) Pa., St. James's Chh. at Lititz, 1749-1753; Lancaster (Lane.) Pa., Feb. 1749-Nov. 1750; Amenia Union (Dutchess) N.Y., Oblong Chh., 1753-1755; Paulin's Kill (Warren) N.J., 1753-1755; Lynn (Lehigh) Pa., Allemaengel Chh., I755-I755; New York, N.Y., 1754-1755; Walpack (Sussex) N.J., 1753-1755; Bethel (Sullivan) N.Y., Nine Partners at Round Top, 1753-1755; Livingston Manor (Sullivan) N.Y., 1753-1755; he also served as an itinerant preacher at the following chhs. (i 744-1749 and in some cases ^° 1755)= Bridgeton, Burlington, Cape May, Cranbury, Great Egg Harbor, Lawrence, Little Egg Harbor, Maurice River, Middletown, Pennsneck, Princeton, Swedesborough, and Trenton, all in N.J.; Dover, Duck Creek, and Lewes, in Del.; and Ammasland (Del. co.), Bethlehem at Dansbury, Calkoen's Hook, Durham, Lower Salford, Manatawny, Neshaminy, and Trappe, all in Pa.; Morav.; d. Bethlehem, Pa., 7 Apr. 1760.

name: Peter Reinhart
raw: PETER REINHART, b. 1733; sett. Coventry (Chester) Pa., 1770- 1806; Germ. Bapt.; d. Coventry, Pa., 1806.

name: Johann Conrad Reissman
raw: JOHANN CONRAD REISSMAN, became a Dunkard in Germany; joined Ephrata Community, 1738; Ord. Ephrata Chloister, 1768; sett. Ephrata (Lane.) Pa., 1738-1786; Germ. Bapt.; d. Ephrata, Pa., 20 Mar. 1786.

name: Matthew Reutz
raw: MATTHEW REUTZ, b. Denmark; arriv. N.Y., N.Y., 26 Nov. 1743; sett. Bethlehem, Pa., 1743-1748; Ord. 1748; sett. Graceham, Md., 1751-1751; Oldmans Creek, N.J., 1751-1753; also an itinerant preacher in the following places: Philadelphia, 1743-1747; 1743-1749: Burlington, Cranbury, Middletown, Trenton, and Princeton, in N.J., Dover, Duck Creek, and Lewes in Del., and Durham, Lower Salford, Manatawny, Neshaminy, and Trappe, in Pa.; 1745-1753: Bridgeton, Cape May, Little Egg Harbor, Maurice River, and Pennsneck in N.J., Ammasland, Calkoen's Hook, Pa., and 1743-1753= Great Egg Harbor, N.J.; 1745-1749: Swedesborough, N.J.; Morav.; d. Oldmans Creek, N.J., 7 Oct. 1753.

name: Joseph Rhea
settled at: Cumberland (Adams) Pa., Upper Marsh Creek Church, at Gettysburg
raw: JOSEPH RHEA, b. Ireland, ca. 1715; sett. Cumberland (Adams) Pa., Upper Marsh Creek Chh., at Gettysburg, 1770-1771; Taneytown, Md., Piney Creek Chh., 1771-11 Apr. 1776; Presb.; d. Virginia, 20 Sept. 1777, a. ca. 62.

name: William Rhodes
raw: WILLIAM RHODES, b. Chichester, England; sett. Exeter, R.L; Oyster Bay, L.L, N.Y., 1700-1724; lay preacher; Bapt.; d. Oyster Bay, L.L, N.Y., 1724.

name: Owen Rice
ordained: deacon, 1748, preached in English at Philadelphia and Bethlehem
raw: OWEN RICE, came from Haverfordwest, Wales, to Bethlehem, Pa., 1742; Ord. deacon, 1748, preached in English at Philadelphia and Bethlehem; sett. Southampton (Bucks) Pa., Neshaminy Chh., 1742-1744; Philadelphia, Pa., 1749-1751; N.Y., N.Y., 1751-1754; Staten Island, N.Y., 1751-1752; also itinerant preacher in English at the following places: 1743-1749, Burlington, Cranbury, Lawrence, Middletown, Princeton, and Trenton, N.J., Dover, Duck Creek, and Lewes, Del., and Durham, Lower Salford, Manatawny, and Trappe, Pa.: 1745-1754, Bridgeton, Cape May, Little Egg Harbor, Maurice River, Pennsneck and Swedesborough, N.J., and Ammasland, and Calkoen's Hook, Pa.; he returned to Europe and served congregations in England and Ireland, 1754-1785; physician, surgeon, Moravian; d. Gomersal, co. York, England, 1785.

name: Owen Rice
edited_raw: Trappe: , Bridgeton, Cape May, Little Egg Harbor, Maurice River, Pennsneck

name: Aaron Richards
raw: AARON RICHARDS, A.M., b. Newark, N.J., 1718, son of John, Jr. and Jane (Crane) Richards; A.B., Y.C, 1743, A.M., 1747; Ord. Rahway (Union) N.J., 15 Nov. 1748; sett. Rahway, 1748-3 May 1791; Presb.; d. Rahway, N.J., 16 May 1793, a. 75.

name: John Richards
degrees: A.M., A.B., Y.C, 1745, A.M. A.M., Dart. Coll., 1782
raw: JOHN RICHARDS, A.M., b. Waterbury, Conn., 23 June 1726, son of Lieut. Thomas and Susanna (Turner) (Reynolds) Richards; A.B., Y.C, 1745, A.M.; A.M., Dart. Coll., 1782; Ord. North Guilford, Conn., 2 Nov. 1748-24 Dec. 1765; Chatham, N.Y., Christ Chh., Cong., 1771- 1773; Piermont, N.H., 5 Feb. 1776-1802; Cong.; d. Weybridge, Vt., 1814, a. 88.

name: John Christian Richter
raw: JOHN CHRISTIAN RICHTER, arriv. N.Y., N.Y., 12 May 1749; sett. Graceham, Md., 1755-1757; Moravian.

name: Archibald Riddell
raw: ARCHIBALD RIDDELL, had been imprisoned in France and in Scotland, 1680-1684, for religious principles; came to N.J., Dec. 1685; sett. Woodbridge (Middlesex) N.J., 1686-1689; Presb.

name: John Bartholomew Rieger Ii
son of: John Adam and Anna Magdalena Rieger
raw: Dr. JOHN BARTHOLOMEW RIEGER, b. Oberingelheim, Palatinate, Germany, 10 Jan. 1707, son of John Adam and Anna Magdalena Rieger; matric. Heidelberg, 24 Feb. 1723/4, in philosophy; matric. Basel, 20 Apr. 1724; matric. Leyden, Holland, 22 Mar. 1744, in medicine; arriv. Philadelphia, 21 Sept. 1731; sett. Philadelphia, Pa., 1731-1734; Germantown, Pa., 1731-1734; Worcester (Montgomery) Pa., Wentz's or Skippack Chh., 1731-1734; Mill Creek (Lebanon) Pa., Tulpehocken or Trinity Chh., 1731-1734; Amwell (Hunterdon) N.J., 27 Feb. 1734/5- 1739; Raritan, N.J., 1734-1739; Somerville (Somerset) N.J., 2nd Dutch Ref. Chh., 1734-1739; Lancaster (Lane.) Pa., Apr. 1736-23 Feb. 1743/4; Brecknock (Lane.) Pa., Muddy Creek Chh., 1739-1743; Ephrata (Lane.) Pa., Bethany Chh., 1739-1743; returned to Holland, 1743/4, to study medicine at Leyden; ret. to America, Mar. 1745; Heidelberg (Lebanon) Pa., Schaeffer's Chh., 1746-1769; Earl (Lane.) Pa., Zeltenreich Chh., 1747-1749, i76o-;-i762; Oley (Berks) Pa., dates not given, but prob. 1760-1762; physician; Germ. Ref.; d. Lancaster, Pa., II Mar. 1769, a. 62.

name: John Bartholomew Rieger Ii
settled at: Worcester (Montgomery) Pa., Wentz's or Skippack Chh.

name: John Bartholomew Rieger Ii
settled at: Mill Creek (Lebanon) Pa., Tulpehocken or Trinity Chh.

name: John Frederick Ries
raw: JOHN FREDERICK RIES (or Reis), sett. N.Y, N.Y., Old Swamp Chh., 1750-1751; Stone Arabia (Montgomery) N.Y., 1751-1760; Little Falls (Herkimer) N.Y., 1751-1760; Canajoharie (Montgomery) N.Y., 1751-1760; Upper Hanover (Montgomery) Pa., New Goshenhoppen Chh., 1757-1760; East Camp, N.Y., Christ Chh., 1760-1775; Wurtemburg in Hyde Park (Dutchess) N.Y., 1760-1785; Rhinebeck (Dutchess) N.Y., 1760-1785; Claverack (Columbia) N.Y., 1760-1791; Livingston (Columbia) N.Y., St. John's Chh., 1764-1791; Luth.; d. Claverack, N.Y., 1791.

name: John Jacob Riess
raw: JOHN JACOB RIESS (or Reis, Riesz), b. Germany, 10 Apr. 1706; arriv. Philadelphia, 24 Sept. 1742; sett. Rockhill (Bucks) Pa., Indianfield Chh., 29 Aug. 1749-Mar. 1756; Bedminster (Bucks) Pa., Tohickon Chh., 1750-1756; Lower Saucon (Northampton) Pa., 1750-1756; Franconia (Montgomery) Pa., Indian Creek Chh., 3 June 1753-11 Aug. 1766; Springfield (Bucks) Pa., Trinity Chh., 24 Apr. 1760-1763; Upper Hanover (Montgomery) Pa., New Goshenhoppen Chh., 1765-1766; Upper Salford (Montgomery) Pa., Old Goshenhoppen Chh., 1765-1766; shoemaker; Germ. Ref.; d. Rockhill, Pa., 23 Dec. 1774, a. 68 y. 7 m. 23 d. (GS).

name: Peter Risser
raw: Bishop PETER RISSER, b. Europe, 1713; arriv. in Pa., 1737; sett. Mount Joy (Lane.) Pa., Risser's Chh., 1737-1804; Swatara (Dauphin) Pa., Stauffer's Chh., 1775-1804; Menn.; d. Mt. Joy, Pa., Feb. 1804, a. 91.

name: Nicholas Rittenhouse
raw: NICHOLAS RITTENHOUSE (or Cleas Rittinghuysen), b. 15 June 1666, son of the Rev. William Rittenhouse; eame to Germantown, 1688; Ord. Germantown, Pa., ea. 1710; sett. Germantown, Pa., 1710-1734; Menn.; d. Germantown, Pa., 1734, a. 68.

name: William Rittenhouse
ordained: Germantown, Pa., 1690 (or 1698), as the first Mennonite minister ordained in Ameriea
raw: WILLIAM RITTENHOUSE (or Rittinghuysen), b. Broieh, Westphalia, 1644; made a eitizen at Amsterdam, Holland, 23 June 1678; arriv. Germantown, Pa., 1688; Ord. Germantown, Pa., 1690 (or 1698), as the first Mennonite minister ordained in Ameriea; sett. Germantown, Pa., 1688-1708; built the first paper mill in Ameriea, 1690; Menn.; d. Germantown, Pa., 18 Feb. 1708, a. 64.

name: Johannes Ritzema
raw: JOHANNES RITZEMA, b. 1710; original Trustee of Columbia, 1754; Ord. Amsterdam, Holland, 20 July 1744; eame to Ameriea, 1744; N.Y., N.Y., 1st or South Dutch Chh., 1744-1784 (absent during the Rev. War); Middle Duteh Chh., 1744-1784; North Duteh Chh., 1765- 1784; Harlem, N.Y., 1744-1765; Tarrytown (Westchester) N.Y., Sleepy Hollow Chh., 1744-1776; Fordham, N.Y., French Ref. Chh.; 1744-1770; Montrose, Cortlandttown (Westchester) N.Y., 1764-1776; Kinderhook (Columbia) N.Y., 1778-1788; Dutch Ref.; d. N.Y., N.Y., 10 Apr. 1796.

name: John Roan
raw: JOHN ROAN, b. Greenshaw, Ireland, 30 Apr. 1717; arriv. in Ameriea, 3 Sept. 1739; ed. Log Coll., Pa.; lie. 27 J^une 1744; Ord. 16 Aug. 1745; sett. Swatara (Dauphin) Pa., Paxtang Chh., 1745-1775; Derry (Dauphin) Pa., 1745-1775; Mount Joy (Adams) Pa., Conewago Chh., 1745- 1775; New Side Presb.; d. Derry, Pa., 3 Oet. 1775, a. 50 (GS).

name: John Rodger
raw: JOHN RODGER, sett. Newville (Cumberland) Pa., Big Spring Chh., 1772-1781; Montgomery (Franklin) Pa., Conoeoeheague or Slate Hill Chh. at Mereersburg, 1772-1781; Associate Presb.

name: John Rodgers
edited_raw: Viee-Chaneellor, U. of the State of N.Y.
chaplain: of a N.Y. Regt., 1776- 1777|, N.Y. Legislature, 1776-1777
ordained: St. George's (New Castle) Del., 16 Mar. 1748/9-18 May 1765
degrees: D.D., grad. Academy at Fagg's Manor, 1743 A.M., Princeton, 1760 A.M., U. of Pa., 1763 D.D., Edinburgh, 1768
raw: JOHN RODGERS, D.D., b. Boston, Mass., 5 Aug. 1727, son of Thomas and Elizabeth (Baxter) Rodgers; grad. Academy at Fagg's Manor, 1743; A.M., Princeton, 1760; A.M., U. of Pa., 1763; D.D., Edinburgh, 1768; Trustee, Princeton, 1765-1807; Viee-Chaneellor, U. of the State of N.Y., 1787-1811; lie. New Castle Presbytery, 14 Oet. 1747; Ord. St. George's (New Castle) Del., 16 Mar. 1748/9-18 May 1765; sett. Appoquinimink (New Castle) Del., 1748-1765; Middletown (N.C.) Del., Forest Chh., 1749-1765; Taylor's Bridge (N.C) Del., 1750-1765; inst. N.Y., N.Y., ist Presb. Chh., 4 Sept. 1765-1811; N.Y., N.Y., 2nd Presb. Chh., 1767-1810; Chaplain of a N.Y. Regt., 1776- 1777; Chaplain, N.Y. Legislature, 1776-1777; Moderator, Presb. General Assembly, 1789; Presb.; d. N.Y., N.Y., 7 May 1811, a. 83.

name: Azel Roe
raw: AZEL ROE, D.D., b. Setauket, L.L, N.Y., 20 Feb. 1738; A.B., Princeton, 1756; Trustee, 1778-1807; D.D., Y.C, 1800; Ord. 1761; sett. Woodbridge (Middlesex) N.J., 1763-1815; Meteucken (Mx.) N.J., 1763-1793 ; prisoner in "Sugar House Prison", N.Y., Rev. War; Moderator, Presb. General Assembly, 1802; Presb.; d. Woodbridge, N.J., 2 De c 1815.

name: Conrad Sebastian Roeller
settled at: Upper Hanover (Montgomery) Pa., New Goshenhoppen Church
raw: CONRAD SEBASTIAN ROELLER, b. Germany; ed. U. of Erlangen; arriv. in Pa., 1770; sett. Upper Hanover (Montgomery) Pa., New Goshenhoppen Chh., 1771-1775; Upper Salford (Montgomery) Pa., Old Goshenhoppen Chh., 16 Feb. 1772-1799; Franconia (Montgomery) Pa., Indian Creek or Zion's Chh., 20 Apr. 1772-1795; Rockhill (Bucks) Pa., Indianfield Chh., 1772-1795; Bedminster (Bucks) Pa., Tohickon Chh., Mar. 1774-1795; Luth.; d. Indianfield, Pa., June 1799.

name: Godfrey Roesler
raw: GODFREY ROESLER, arriv. N.Y., N.Y., 22 June I7;49; missionary; escaped from the Indians at Shamokin, 1755; sett. Warwick (Lane) Pa., St. James's Chh. at Lititz, 1760-1762, 1774-1776; Morav.

name: Jacob Rogers
raw: JACOB ROGERS, arriv. America, 17 May 1752; sett. Philadelphia, Pa., 1753-1754, 1756-1762; Staten Island, N.Y., 1756-1756; Bethabara, N.C., 22 July 1758-1762; English minister at Dobb's Parish; Morav.; returned to Europe, i July 1762.

name: William Rogers
chaplain: and Brigade , 3rd. Pa. Continental Brigade, Mar. 1776-16 Jan. 1781
member of: member. Pa. Legislature, 1816-1817; original member. Society of the Cincinnati, 1783
degrees: D.D., A.B., Brown, 1769, A.M. A.M., U. of Pa., 1773, D.D., 1790 A.M., Y.C, 1780 A.M., Princeton, 1786
raw: WILLIAM ROGERS, D.D., b. Newport, R.L, 22 July 1751, son of William and Sarah Rogers; A.B., Brown, 1769, A.M.; A.M., U. of Pa., 1773, D.D., 1790; A.M., Y.C, 1780; A.M., Princeton, 1786; Principal of the Academy at Newport, R.L, 1769-1772; lie. to preach, 1771; sett. Newport, R.L, 2nd Bapt. Chh., Aug. 1771-1772; Ord. Philadelphia, Pa., 31 May 1773; sett. Philadelphia, ist Bapt. Chh., 1772-Mar. 1775, and as stated supply, 1781-1789; Prof, of English and Oratory, U. of Pa., 1789-1812; member. Pa. Legislature, 1816-1817; V.P., Religious Hist. Soc. of Philadelphia, 1819; Chaplain and Brigade Chaplain, 3rd. Pa. Continental Brigade, Mar. 1776-16 Jan. 1781; original member. Society of the Cincinnati, 1783; Bapt.; d. Philadelphia, Pa., 7 Apr. 1824, a. 73.

name: Isaac Rollins
raw: ISAAC ROLLINS, sett. Eastern Shore of Maryland, 24 De c 1772; Chester Circuit (Preaching stations at Marlborough, Thomas Ellis's, Woodward's, Brandywine, West Chester, Samuel Hooper's, Gorham, Uwchlan, and Coventry, all in Pa.); Meth. '

name: Isaac Rollins
settled at: Marlborough, Thomas Ellis's, Woodward's, Brandywine, West Chester, Samuel Hooper's, Gorham, Uwchlan, and Coventry, all in Pa.)

name: Romain
settled at: Bound Brook (Somerset) N.J., Church at Bridgewater, ()
raw: Domine ROMAIN, sett. Bound Brook (Somerset) N.J., Chh. at Bridgewater, (i725)-i742; Presb.; d. Bound Brook, N.J., 1742.

name: Dirck Romeyn
degrees: D.D., A.B., Princeton, 1765 D.D., Rutgers, 1789, Trustee, Rutgers, 1785-1804
raw: DIRCK ROMEYN, D.D., b. Hackensack, N.J., 12 Jan. 1744, son of Nicholas and Rachel (Vreelandt) Romeyn; A.B., Princeton, 1765; D.D., Rutgers, 1789, Trustee, Rutgers, 1785-1804; Lector in Theology, 1792- 1797; Prof, of Theology, 1797-1804; sett. Marbletown (Ulster) N.Y., May 1766-1775; Rochester (Ulster) N.Y., 1766-1775; Warwarsing (Ulster) N.Y., 1766-1775; Red Hook Landing (Dutchess) N.Y., 1773- 1775; Rhinebeck Flats (Dutchess) N.Y., 1773-1775; Hackensack (Bergen) N.J., Chh. at New Barbadoes, May 1775-1784; Schraalenburg (Bergen) N.J., 1775-1784; Dutch Ref.; d. Schraalenburg, N.J., 16 Apr. 1804, a. 60 (GS).

name: Thomas Romeyn
settled at: Success, L.L, N.Y., Success Pond Church at North Hempstead
raw: THOMAS ROMEYN, A.M., b. Pompton, N.J., 29 Mar. 1729, son of Nicholas and Rachel (Vreelandt) Romeyn; A.M. (hon.) Princeton, 1765; Ord. Amsterdam, Holland, 3 Sept. 1752; sett. Success, L.L, N.Y., Success Pond Chh. at North Hempstead, 1753-1760; Newtown, L.L, 1753-1760; Oyster Bay, L.L, Wolver Hollow Chh., 1753-1760; Jamaica, L.L, 1753-1760; Port Jervis (Orange) N.Y., Chh. at Deerpark, 6 Sept. 1760-1772; Lehman (Pike) Pa., Lower Wallpack Chh. at Bushkill, 1760-1772; Delaware (Pike) Pa., Chh. at Dingman's Ferry, 1760-1772; Smithfield (Monroe) Pa., Shawnee Chh. at Lower Smithfield, 1760- 1772; Flatbrookville (Sussex) N.J., Middle Wallpack Chh., 1760-1772; Layton (Sussex) N.J., Wallpack Chh., 1760-1772; Wallpack (Sussex) N.J., 1760-1772; The Minisinks (Sussex) N.J., Chh. at Montague, 1760-1772; Fonda (Montgomery) N.Y., 1772-1794; Caughnawaga (Montgomery) N.Y., 1772-1794; Dutch Ref.; d. Fonda, N.Y., 22 Oct. 1794.

name: John Reinhold Ronner
edited_raw: Tulpehoeken, Muddy Creek, The Minisinks, Paulin's Kill (Warren) N.J.
raw: JOHN REINHOLD RONNER, Ord. deacon, Bethlehem, Pa., 1743; sett. Dansbury, Pa., 1748-1749; Tulpehoeken, Muddy Creek, The Minisinks, Paulin's Kill (Warren) N.J., 1748-1749; Warwick, Pa., 1743- 1750; St. Thomas, West Indies, 1750-1755; Bethlehem, Pa., 1755-1756; he also preached as an itinerant in the following places, 1743-1749: Dover, Duck Creek, and Lewes, Del.; Burlington, Cranbury, Lawrence, Middletown, Princeton, Swedish Settlements, and Trenton, N.J.; and Durham, Lower Salford, Manatawny, Southampton, and Upper Providence, Pa., and Philadelphia, Pa., 1743-1747; Moravian; d. Bethlehem, Pa., July 1756.

name: John Reinhold Ronner
edited_raw: Burlington, Cranbury, Lawrence, Middletown, Princeton, Swedish Settlements, and Trenton, N.J.

name: John Rosburgh
raw: JOHN ROSBURGH, A.B. (or Rosbrugh), b. Ireland, 1722, of Scotch parents; came to America, 1735; A.B., Princeton, 1761; lie. 1764; Ord. Greenwich (Warren) N.J., 11 Dec. 1764-18 Apr. 1769; Oxford (Warren) N.J., 1764-1769; Washington Borough (Warren) N.J., MansfieldWoodhouse Chh., 1764-1769; Knowlton (Warren) N.J., 1775-1777; Hardwick (Warren) N.J., 1764-1769; inst. Allen (Northampton) Pa., Forks West Chh., 28 Oct. 1772; sett. Allen, Pa., 1769-1777; Upper Mount Bethel (Northampton) Pa., Forks North Chh., 1769-1777; Mount Bethel (Lehigh) Pa., Hunter's Chh., 1768-1774, as stated supply; private. Continental Army, 1776; Chaplain, Rev. War., 1776-1777; Presb.; killed by the British, at Assunpink, Trenton, N.J., 2 Jan. 1777.

name: David Rose
settled at: Brookhaven, Church at Moriches, on the South Side of L.L
raw: DAVID ROSE, A.M., b. Branford, Conn., 11 Dec. 1736, son of David and Hannah (Barker) Rose; A.B., Y.C, 1760, A.M.; lie. 28 May 1765; Ord. Brookhaven, L.L, N.Y., 4 Dec. 1765; sett. Brookhaven, Chh. at Moriches, on the South Side of L.L, 1765-1799; Brookhaven, Fireplace Chh., 1765-1799; Brookhaven, Middle Island Chh., 1766-1799; physician; Presb.; d. South Haven, L.L, N.Y., i Jan. 1799, a. 62.

name: Sven Roseen
raw: SVEN ROSEEN, b. Torpa, West Gothland, Sweden, 1708; ed. at Upsala and Jena; theol. stud, at Upsala, and at Lindhein, 1744, a. 36; arriv. Bethlehem, Pa., 12 Jan. 1748/9; Ord. deacon, 1748; sett. Graceham, Md., 1749-1750; Bethlehem, Pa., Brodhead Settlement at Dansbury, 1749-1750; Lynn (Lehigh) Pa., Allemaengel Chh., 1748-1750; Paulin's Kill (Warren) N.J., 1749-1750; Wallpack (Sussex) N.J., 1749- 1750; and as an itinerant preacher, 1745-1750; Ammasland on Darby Creek, Pa., and Calkoen's Hook, near Chester, Pa.; arid the ff. chhs. in N.J.: Bridgeton, Cape May, Great and Little Egg Harbor, Maurice River, Pennsneck, Swedesborough and Swedish Settlements; Morav.; d. Macungie, Pa., 15 Dec. 1750.

name: Sven Roseen
edited_raw: and the ff. chhs. in N.J.: Bridgeton, Cape May, Great and Little Egg Harbor, Maurice River, Pennsneck, Swedesborough and Swedish Settlements

name: Abraham Rosencrantz
raw: ABRAHAM ROSENCRANTZ, grad. of a German U.; came to America, 1750; sett. Canajoharie (Montgomery) N.Y., Sand Hill Chh. at Minden (D.R.), 1750-1758, 1765-1796; N.Y., N.Y., ist Germ. Ref. Chh., 1758-1759; Schoharie (Schoharie) N.Y., D.R. Chh. at Huntersfield, 1760-1763; Stone Arabia (Montgomery) N.Y., G.R. Chh. at Palatine, 1759-1769; German Flats (Herkimer) N.Y., Luth Chh., 1763-1796; Herkimer (Herkimer) N.Y., G.R. Chh., 1765-1796; Germ. Ref., but also served in Dutch Ref. and Luth, chhs.; d. Little Falls, N.Y., 1796.

name: Rosencrantz
raw: Domine ROSENCRANTZ (brother of Abraham), sett. Fort Herkimer (Herkimer) N.Y., Chh. at German Flats, 1758-1767; Dutch Ref.

name: Aeneas Ross
settled at: Bristol (Bucks) Pa., Church of St. James the Greater
raw: AENEAS ROSS, son of the Rev. George Ross (q.v.); Ord. London, 1739; K.B. for Pa., 26 Feb. 1740/1; sett. Bristol (Bucks) Pa., Chh. of St. James the Greater, 1740-1741; Philadelphia, Pa., Christ Chh., June 1741-June 1743; Oxford (Chester) Pa., Trinity Chh., 1743-1758; Whitemarsh (Montgomery) Pa., St. Thomas's Chh., 1742-1758; New Castle (New Castle) Del., Immanuel Chh., 1758-1782; Ep.; d. New Castle, Del., ca. 1782. I

name: George Ross
raw: GEORGE ROSS, A.M., b. Balblair, Scotland, 1679,1 son of David Ross; A.B., Edinburgh, 1700, A.M.; Ord. London, 1700; K.B. for N.J., 2 May 1705; arriv. Philadelphia, 23 Aug. 1705; sett. New Castle (New Castle) Del., Immanuel Chh., 1705-1708, 1713-1753; Chester (Del.) Pa., St. Paul's Chh., 1708-1714; Concord (Del.) Pa., St. John's Chh., 1708-1712; Chichester, Pa., 1708-1712; North Elk Parish (Cecil) Md., 1731-1733; Marlborough (Chester) Pa., 1715-1753, as stated supply; White Clay Creek, Del., St. James's Chh., 1714-1753; Marcus Hook (Del.) Pa., St. Martin's Chh., 1713-1724; prisoner in France, 1711; S.P.G. missionary; Ep.; d. New Castle, Del., 1753, a. 72.

name: George Ross
settled at: White Clay Creek, Del., St. James's Church

name: George Ross
settled at: Marcus Hook (Del.) Pa., St. Martin's Church

name: Johannes Roth
raw: JOHANNES ROTH, b. Prussia, 1726; ed. a R.C; became a Moravian, 1748; came to America, 1756; sett. Bradford co.. Pa., as an Indian missionary, 1759-1772; Ohio, 1772-1774; returned to Pa., 1774; York, Pa., twice, dates not given; Mount Joy (Lane.) Pa., Donegal Chh., 1774- 1774; Salisbury (Lehigh) Pa.; Chh. at Emaus, 1790-1791; his wife Maria was his helper in his work; Morav.; d. York, Pa., 22 July 1791.

name: John Roth Co
raw: JOHN ROTH, sett. Heidelberg (Lehigh) Pa., 1770-1770; sett. Lehigh CO., Pa., 1770-1787; sett. Lynn (Lehigh) Pa., Ebenezer or Organ Chh. and Jacob's Chh., ca. 1780-1787; Germ. Ref.; d. Lynn, Pa., as minister of Ebenezer Chh., ca. 1787.

name: John Roth Co
settled at: Lynn (Lehigh) Pa., Ebenezer or Organ Church and Jacob's Church, ca.

name: John Joseph Roth
edited_raw: Roman Catholic theol. stud, from Siegen, Westphalia, Germany
raw: JOHN JOSEPH ROTH, Roman Catholic theol. stud, from Siegen, Westphalia, Germany; arriv. Philadelphia, 22 Sept. 1752; Ord. deacon, 17 Aug. 1755; lie. 17 Oct. 1763; sett. Bedminster (Bucks) Pa., Tohickon Chh., Aug. 1755-15 Apr. 1758; Upper Salford (Montgomery) Pa., Old Goshenhoppen Chh., 1759-1764; Upper Milford (Lehigh) Pa., Zionsville Chh., 1761-1764; inst. Upper Saucon (Lehigh) Pa., St. Paul's, Blue or Organ Chh., 17 Oct. 1763-1764; AUentown (Lehigh) Pa., St. Paul's Chh., 17 Oct. 1763-1764; Franconia (Montgomery) Pa., Indian Creek or Zion's Chh., 1763-1764; Rockhill (Bucks) Pa., Indianfield Chh., 1763- 1764; Luth.; d. Upper Saucon, Pa., 13 May 1764.

name: John Joseph Roth
settled at: Upper Saucon (Lehigh) Pa., St. Paul's, Blue or Organ Church

name: Frederick Rothenbuehler
raw: FREDERICK ROTHENBUEHLER (or Rothenbergler), b. Bern, Switzerland, 29 July 1726; ed. U. of Bern; Ord. Bern, Switzerland, 28 Feb. 1752; sett. The Hague and Amsterdam, Holland, 1759-1760; London, England, Germ. Ref. Chh., 1760-1761; came to America, 1761; sett. N.Y, N.Y., 1761-1762; Philadelphia, Pa., ist Germ. Ref. Chh., 30 July 1762-1766; Germ. Ref.; d. Philadelphia, Pa., 7 Aug. 1766, a. 40.

name: Louis Rou
settled at: N.Y., N.Y., French Ref. Church of the St. Esprit
raw: LOUIS ROU, b. Holland, 1683; Ord. Terholen, Holland, 31 Aug. 1701; arriv. in America, 1710; sett. N.Y., N.Y., French Ref. Chh. of the St. Esprit, 1710-1750; New Rochelle (Westchester) N.Y., 1710-1750; Fr. Ref.; d. N.Y., N.Y., 25 Dec. 1750.

name: Gideon Rouser
raw: GIDEON ROUSER, sett. Amwell (Hunterdon) N.J., 1738 ff.; Germ. Bapt.

name: John Rowland
ordained: as an evangelist, Reaville, N.J., 11 Oct. 1739
raw: JOHN ROWLAND, b. Wales, came to America when young; ed. Log Coll.; lie. 7 Sept. 1738; Ord. as an evangelist, Reaville, N.J., 11 Oct. 1739; sett. Amwell (Hunterdon) N.J., chh. at Reaville, 1738-1742; Lawrence (Mercer) N.J., Maidenhead Chh., 1738-1742; Hopewell (Mercer) N.J., chh. at Pennington, 1738-1742; Tredyffryn (Chester) Pa., Great Valley Chh., 1741-1742; Norriton (Montgomery) Pa., 1741-1745; Charlestown (Chester) Pa., 1742-1747; Lower Providence (Montgomery) Pa., 1742-1747; New Side Presb.; d. New Providence, Pa., 1747-

name: Johannes Casperus Rubel
raw: JOHANNES CASPERUS RUBEL, b. Wald, Duchy of Berg, 6 Mar. 1719; matric. Marburg, 20 May 1737; came to America, 1752; sett. Philadelphia, Pa., Germ. Ref. Chh., 1751/2-1755; Red Hook (Dutchess) N.Y., 1755-1759; Rhinebeck (Dutchess) N.Y., 1755-1759; Kingsbury (Dutchess) N.Y., 1755-1759; Germantown (Columbia) N.Y., 1755-1759; sett. Brooklyn, Bushwick, Flatbush, Flatlands, and New Utrecht, all on L.L, N.Y., 1759-1783; Cortlandt Manor (Westchester) N.Y., 1768; Clarkstown, N.Y., 1770; a violent Tory; deposed 1784; Germ. Ref. and Dutch Ref.; d. 19 Mar. 1797.

name: Andrew Rudman
raw: ANDREW RUDMAN, Ph.M., b. Gevalia, Gestrickland, Sweden, 1668; ed. Upsala; Ord. Upsala; arriv. in Philadelphia from Gestricia (Norrland) Sweden, 30 June 1697; sett. Philadelphia, Pa., Gloria Dei Chh., 1697-1702; Philadelphia, Christ Chh., as supply, 1707-1708; N.Y., N.Y., Holy Trinity, Luth. Chh., July 1702-Nov. 1703; Albany, N.Y., Luth. Chh., 1702-1703; Oxford (Chester) Pa., Trinity Chh., 1705-1708; Frankford, Pa., 1705-1708; Lower Providence (Montgomery) Pa., St. James's Chh. at Evansburg, 1707-1708; S.P.G. missionary; Sw. Luth.; d. Philadelphia, Pa., 17 Sept. 1708, a. 40 (GS).

name: Andrew Rudman
edited_raw: NY, NY, Holy Trinity, July Nov.

name: Carl Rudolph
raw: CARL RUDOLPH, Prince of Wurtemberg; sett. Hanover (York) Pa., St. Michael's Chh., 1746-1747; also in N.J. and N.C; Luth.; a disreputable man.

name: Daniel Ruff
edited_raw: Chester Circuit, Chester co. Pa. (see Isaac Rollins)
raw: DANIEL RUFF, sett. Chester (Del.) Pa., Madison St. Chh., 1774- 1774; Chester Circuit: for preaching stations, see under Isaac R.ollins; Trenton (Mereer) N.J., Green Street Chh., 1775-1775; Meth.

name: Charles Godfrey Rundt
raw: CHARLES GODFREY RUNDT, arriv. Bethlehem' Pa., 10 Dec. 1751; sett. Laneaster (Lane.) Pa., 1757-1759; Morav.

name: Reun Runyon
edited_raw: REUNÉ b. Piseataway, N.J.ar. , son of Reuné Runyon, Esq.
raw: REUNÉ RUNYON, b. Piseataway, N.J., 29 Mar. 1741, son of Reuné Runyon, Esq.; ealled to the ministry, 10 Mar. 1771; Ord. Morristown (Morris) N.J., 18 Mar. 1772-13 Apr. 1780; Schooley's Mountain (Morris) N.J., 1772-1780; Piseataway (Middlesex) N.J., 1783-1811; Bapt.; d. Piseataway, N.J., 21 Nov. 1811.

name: Abraham Rusmeyer
raw: ABRAHAM L. RUSMEYER, sett. Philadelphia, Pa., 1753-1754; Warwiek (Lane.) Pa., St. James's Chh. at Lititz, 1760-1760; Morav.

name: Christian Rusmeyer
raw: CHRISTIAN RUSMEYER, sett. Laneaster (Lane.) Pa., 1756-1757, 1762-1766; Morav.

name: David Ruth
raw: Bishop DAVID RUTH, sett. Hatfield (Montgomery) Pa., Chh. at Lansdale, 1774-1796; New Britain (Bueks) Pa., Line Lexington Chh., 1774-1796; Bishop, 1796; Menn.

name: Thomas Rutter
ordained: Philadelphia, Pa., Keithian Bapt. Chh., 12 June 1698-1707
raw: THOMAS RUTTER, Ord. Philadelphia, Pa., Keithian Bapt. Chh., 12 June 1698-1707; Lower Dublin, Pa., 7th Day Bapt. Chh., 1707-1716; resided in Philadelphia, 1707-1716; resided at Pottstown, Pa., 1716- 1729, where he built a forge and began the manufaeture of iron, the first that was made in Pa.; Keithian Bapt.; 7th Day Bapt.; d. near Pottstown, Pa., 1729.

name: Isaac Rysdyck
raw: ISAAC RYSDYCK, b. Holland, 1720; matric. Groningen, 14 Sept. 1751; most learned theologian in the Dutch Chh. in his day; came to America, 1765; sett. Hopewell (Dutchess) N.Y., Sept. 1765-1789; New Haekensaek (Dutehess) N.Y., 1765-1789; Poughkeepsie (Dutehess) N.Y., 1765-1772; Clove (Dutehess) N.Y., 1769-1789; Marbletown (Ulster) N.Y., 1765-1772; Fishkill (Dutehess) N.Y., 1772-1789; Duteh Ref.; d. New Haekensaek, N.Y., 2 Nov. 1790.

name: Richard Sackett
raw: RICHARD SACKETT, A.M., b. Newtown, L.L, N.Y., son of Captain Joseph and Elizabeth (Betts) Saekett; A.B., Y.C, 1709, A.M.; sett. Hopewell (Mereer) N.J., Pennington Chh., 1711-1712; Lawrenee (Mercer) N.J., Maidenhead Chh., 1711-1712; Greenwich, Conn., ist Parish, 1714-1716; Ord. West Greenwich, Conn., 27 Nov. 1717; sett. West Greenwich, Conn., 1716-1727; Cong.; d. Greenwich, Conn., 8 May 1727.

name: Samuel Sackett
raw: SAMUEL SACKETT, b. Newtown, L.L, N.Y., Ord. New Brunswick Presbytery, 13 Oct. 1741; sett. Phillipstown (Putnam) N.Y., Highlands Chh., May 1742-1743; White Plains (Westchester) N.Y., May 1742- 1743; Yorktown (Westchester) N.Y., Cronpond Chh., May 1742-1743, 19 May 1747-Dec. 1749, 1761-1784; Peekskill (Westchester) N.Y., Cortlandt Manor, May 1742-1743, 1747-1749; inst. Bedford (Westchester) N.Y., 12 Oct. 1743-4 Apr. 1753; Salem (in North Salem, Westchester) N.Y., 1747-1749; Hanover (Westchester) N.Y., Cortlandt Manor, 4 Apr. 1753-1 Apr. 1760; Carmel (Putnam) N.Y., Red Mills Chh., 1761-1784; Presb.; d. Yorktown, N.Y., 5 June 1784 (GS).

name: Andrew Sandel
settled at: Philadelphia, Pa., Gloria Dei Church, inst.
raw: Provost ANDREW SANDEL, ed. Upsala; Ord. Sweden, 18 July 1701; sett. Philadelphia, Pa., Gloria Dei Chh., inst. 29 Mar. 1702-1719; Molatton (Berks) Pa., St. Gabriel's Chh., Manathanim, Douglassville, 1702-1719; Provost; Sw. Luth.; returned to Hedmore, Sweden, 25 June 1719.

name: John Sandin
raw: Provost JOHN SANDIN, sett. Pennsneck, N.J., 1748-1748; Swedesborough, N.J., 1748-1748; Provost; Sw. Luth.; d. Swedesborough, N.J., Aug. 1748.

name: Richard Sankey
ordained: East Hanover (Dauphin) Pa., Hanover Chh. on Manada Creek, 31 Aug. 1738
raw: RICHARD SANKEY, b. Ireland, son of Jacob and Abigail Sankey; lie. 13 Oct. 1736; Ord. East Hanover (Dauphin) Pa., Hanover Chh. on Manada Creek, 31 Aug. 1738; sett. East Hanover, Pa., 1737-1760; Carlisle (Cumberland) Pa., Old Stone Chh., 1738-1755; Buffalo Creek (Prince Edward) Va., 1760-1790; Walker's Chh. (Prince Edward) Va., 1760-1790; Presb.; d. Prince Edward co.. Va., 1790.

name: Christopher Sauer
ordained: deacon. May 1747 elder, 7 June 1748 Germantown, Pa., IO June 1753-1784
raw: CHRISTOPHER SAUER, Jr., b. Laasphe, Wittgenstein, Germany, 26 Sept. 1721, son of Christopher and Maria Christina Sauer; came to America, 1724; Ord. deacon. May 1747; Ord. elder, 7 June 1748; Ord. Germantown, Pa., IO June 1753-1784; Germ. Bapt.; d. Germantown, Pa., 26 Aug. 1784.

name: Richard Saunderlands
settled at: Concord (Del.) Pa., St. John's Church, ca.
raw: RICHARD SAUNDERLANDS, sett. Concord (Del.) Pa., St. John's Chh., ca. 1700-1700; Ep.; bur. St. John's Churchyard, Concord, Pa.

name: John Sayre
raw: JOHN SAYRE, A.B., b. N.Y., N.Y., 4 June 1738, son of John and Esther (Stillwell) Sayre; ed. Columbia; K.B. for America, 11 Oct. 1768; sett. Newburgh (Orange) N.Y., St. George's Chh., 1767-1773; Waiden (Orange) N.Y., St. Andrew's Chh., 1767-1773; Hamptonburgh (Orange) N.Y., St. David's Chh., 1767-1773; Fairfield, Conn., Ep. Chh., 1774- 1779; Tory refugee to N.Y., 1779, and to New Brunswick, 1783; Ep.; d. Maugerville, N.B., 5 Aug. 1784.

name: John Martin Schaefer
raw: JOHN MARTIN SCHAEFER (or Schaeffer), b. Germany; prob. Ord. by Andreae; arriv. in America, 1750; sett. Bedminster (Bucks) Pa., Tohickon Chh., June 1750-Dec. 1753; Upper Milford (Lehigh) Pa., Zionsville Chh., 1757-1758; N.Y., N.Y., (Old Swamp Chh., Luth.), 1758-1761; Waldoborough, Maine, 1761-1794; physician; Luth.; d. Waldoborough, Me., 1794.

name: Peter Schaeffer
raw: PETER SCHAEFFER, A.M., b. Finland; A.M., U. of Abo; sett. Sweden; Halle; came to Pa., 1699; missionary to the Indians in the Conestoga; mystic; schoolmaster at Wicacoa, Pa., 1700; Pennsneck, N.J.; returned to Europe; Pietist; d. Gefle, Finland.

name: Peter Schaeffer
edited_raw: missionary to the Indians in the Conestoga

name: Gideon Schaets
ordained: called as minister to Rensselaerwyck, 6 May 1652
raw: GIDEON SCHAETS, b. Leerdam, Holland, 1607; schoolmaster at Beest and candidate in theology; Ord. by the Classis at Amsterdam, Holland, 1652; called as minister to Rensselaerwyck, 6 May 1652; came to New Netherlands in the ship "Flower of Guelder," 1652; missionary to the Indians; teacher of the catechism and schoolmaster, 1652-1657; sett. Albany, N.Y. (then called Fort Orange) and Beverwyck, N.Y., 1652-1694; Schenectady, N.Y., 1662-1680; received the Rev. Nicholas Van Rensselaer as colleague, 1675; Dutch Ref.; d. Albany, N.Y., 27 Feb. 1694.

name: John Helfrich Schaum
raw: JOHN HELFRICH SCHAUM, b. Giessen, Hesse-Darmstadt, Germany, son of John Philip H. Schaum; ed. Halle; arriv. Philadelphia, 26 Jan. 1744/5; arriv. York, Pa., 17 May 1748; Ord. Lancaster, Pa., 4 June 1749; sett. Cohansey and Somerset, N.J., 1746-^-1747; Raritan (Somerset) N.J., 1747-1748; York (York) Pa., Christ Chh., 17 May 1748-Apr. 1755; Latimore (Adams) Pa., Christ Chh. or Lower Bermudian Chh., 1748-1755; Hanover (York) Pa., St. Michael's Chh., 1748-1752; Frederick, Md., 1752-1755; Bedminster (Bucks) Pa., Keller's Chh., Apr. 1755-1759; Upper Dublin, Pa., Puff's Chh., 1758-1762; New Hanover (Montgomery) Pa., Falkner's Swamp Chh., 1759-1762; Douglass (Berks) Pa., Oley Hill Chh., 1759-1762; Oley (Berks) Pa., Christ or Hill Chh., 1759-1778; Pike (Berks) Pa., St. John's or Hill Chh., I759~i778; Upper Providence (Montgomery) Pa., Augustus Chh. at Trappe, 1759-1778; Amity (Berks) Pa., St. Paul's Chh., 1761-1767; Richmond (Berks) Pa., Zion or Moselem Chh., 1761-1778; North Whitehall (Lehigh) Pa., Schlosser's Chh., 1762-1769; Rockland (Berks) Pa., Bieber Creek Chh., 1759-1778; Luth.; d. Rockland, Pa., 26 j^an. 1778.

name: John Helfrich Schaum
settled at: Latimore (Adams) Pa., Christ Church or Lower Bermudian Church

name: John Helfrich Schaum
settled at: New Hanover (Montgomery) Pa., Falkner's Swamp Church

name: John Helfrich Schaum
settled at: Oley (Berks) Pa., Christ or Hill Church

name: John Helfrich Schaum
settled at: Pike (Berks) Pa., St. John's or Hill Church, I

name: John Helfrich Schaum
settled at: Richmond (Berks) Pa., Zion or Moselem Church

name: John Joseph Schebosh
raw: JOHN JOSEPH SCHEBOSH (Running Water), b. Skippack (Montgomery) Pa., 27 May 1721; Indian missionary with David Zeisberger, 1742-1788; sett. Nain (Lehigh) Pa., Moravian Indian Chh., 1760-1765; his real name was John Joseph Bull (Running Water) ; Morav. ; d. New Salem, Ohio, 4 Sept. 1788.

name: Herman Jacob Shellhard
raw: HERMAN JACOB SHELLHARD, sett. Weisenberg (Lehigh) Pa., Weisenberg Chh., 1770-1780; Luth.

name: William Schenck
raw: WILLIAM SCHENCK, A.B., b. near Mariborough (Monmouth) N.J., 13 Oct. 1740; A.B., Princeton, 1767; sett. AUentown (Monmouth) N.J., Presb. Chh., 1771-1777; Cranbury (Middlesex) N.J., Presb. Chh., 1771-1777; Northampton (Bucks) Pa., Dutch Ref. Chh., 3 Mar. 1777- 1780;Southampton (Bucks) Pa., Dutch Ref. Chh., 3 Mar. i777-i78o;Pilesgrove, N.J., Presb. Chh., 3 May 1780-1786; Ballston, N.Y., Presb. Chh., 1786-1793; Huntington, L.L, N.Y., Presb. Chh., 1793-1817; Franklin CO., Ohio, 1817-1827; Chaplain, Rev. War; Dutch Ref.; Presb.; d. Franklin co., Ohio, i Sept. 1827.

name: Jacob Frederick Schertlein
settled at: Zeil and Altbach, near Esslingen, Wurtemberg
raw: JACOB FREDERICK SCHERTLEIN, A.M., b. Hornberg, Baden, Germany; A.M., Tuebingen, 1717; sett. Zeil and Altbach, near Esslingen, Wurtemberg, 1733-1748; arriv. Philadelphia, 27 Sept. 1752; sett. South Whitehall (Lehigh) Pa., Jordan Chh., 1752-1767; Lower Macungie (Lehigh) Pa., Holy Trinity or Zion Chh., 1753-1765; Bedminster (Bucks) Pa., Tohickon Chh., 1754-1755; Heidelberg (Lehigh) Pa., Heidelberg Chh., 1754-1755; Weisenberg (Lehigh) Pa., Ziegel Chh., 1754-1763; Upper Milford (Lehigh) Pa., Zionsville Chh., 1758-1760; Salisbury (Lehigh) Pa., 1764-1765; Luth.; d. (South Whitehall) Pa., Nov. 1768.

name: Michael Schlatter
chaplain: Louisburg and Fort Duquesne, 1757-1759| 2nd Pa. Battalion, 1764
raw: MICHAEL SCHLATTER, b. St. Gall, Switzerland, 14 July 1716, son of Paulus and Magdalena (Zollikofer) Schlatter; ed. St. Gall; matric. Leyden, 27 Dec. 1736, and Helmstedt, Brunswick, Germany; Ord. St. Gall, Switzerland, 10 Apr. 1739; Rector, Wigoldingen, Switzerland, 1744-1745; Linzebuehl near St. Gall, 19 Aug. 1745-Jan. 1746; agent to the' German chhs. in Pa., 1746; arriv. Boston, Mass., i Aug. 1746; arriv. Philadelphia, 6 Sept. 1746; sett. Lancaster, Pa., 1746-1746; Northampton (Bucks) Pa., Dutch Ref. Chh., 1746-1750 and Neshaminy Germ. Ref. Chh., 1748-1750; Southampton (Bucks) Pa., Dutch Ref. Chh. at Churchville, 1746-1752 and North and Southampton Germ. Ref. Chh., 1748-1750; Upper Providence (Montgomery) Pa., St. Luke's Chh. at Trappe, 1746-1746; Penn (Lane.) Pa., Chh. at Unionville, 1747- 1747; Frederick, Md., 1747-1748; Union (Adams) Pa., 1747-1747; Lebanon (Hunterdon) N.J., Rockaway Chh. at Clinton, 1747-1750; Philadelphia, Pa., 1747-1751, 1752-1757; Germantown, Pa., 1747- 1751; Whitpain (Montgomery) Pa., Boehm's Chh., 1749-1756; Reading (Berks) Pa., 1754-1754; Whitemarsh (Montgomery) Pa., St. Peter's Chh., Barren Hill, 1759-1777; went to Holland, 5 Feb. 1751-12 May 1752; to Europe, 28 Nov. 1753-28 Sept. 1754; Supt. of Charity Schools in the colonies, 1754-1757; Chaplain, appointed 25 Mar. 1757, at Louisburg and Fort Duquesne, 1757-1759; Chaplain, 2nd Pa. Battalion, 1764; Germ. Ref.; d. Philadelphia, Pa., 31 Oct. 1790.

name: Michael Schlatter
settled at: Upper Providence (Montgomery) Pa., St. Luke's Chh. at Trappe

name: Michael Schlatter
settled at: Lebanon (Hunterdon) N.J., Rockaway Chh. at Clinton

name: Michael Schlatter
settled at: Whitemarsh (Montgomery) Pa., St. Peter's Chh., Barren Hill

name: John Frederick Schlegel
raw: JOHN FREDERICK SCHLEGEL, arriv. N.Y., N.Y., 12 May 1749; sett. Bethel (Lebanon) Pa., 1756-1763; York (York) Pa., 1757-1758; Bethlehem (Northampton) Pa., Sept. 1784-Apr. 1785; Morav.

name: Schmelzer
settled at: Swatara (Lebanon) Pa., Zion's Church at Jonestown, time not given, perhaps some time between  and
raw: Domine SCHMELZER, sett. Swatara (Lebanon) Pa., Zion's Chh. at Jonestown, time not given, perhaps some time between 1734 and 1764; Luth.

name: John Jacob Schmick
settled at: Shamokin Indian Church, at Sun bury (Northumberland) Pa.
raw: JOHN JACOB SCHMICK, b. 1714; ed. at Jena; Ord. in Europe; arriv. N.Y., N.Y., 24 Sept. 1751; sett. Shamokin Indian Chh., at Sun- bury (Northumberland) Pa., 1755-1756; Indian missionary at New Gnadenhuetten, Ohio, 1756-1756; Nain (Lehigh) Pa.^ Indian Chh., 1760-1765; Hope (Warren) N.J., 1771-1772; Morav.; d. 1778.

name: Frederick Schmidt
raw: FREDERICK SCHMIDT, sett. Newport, R.L, 1763-1763; Oldmans Creek (Gloucester) N.J., chhs. at Pilesgrove and Woolwich, 1769-1783; Morav.

name: John Schmidt
raw: JOHN SCHMIDT, sett. Mount Joy (Lane.) Pa., Donegal Chh., 1752- 1753; Morav.

name: John Frederick Schmidt
degrees: D.D., matric. Halle, 1765 D.D., U. of Pa.
raw: JOHN FREDERICK SCHMIDT, D.D., b. Frohse, Aschersleben, Halberstadt, Germany, 9 Jan. 1746; matric. Halle, 1765; D.D., U. of Pa.; Ord. Wernigerode, Germany, 1768; arriv. Philadelphia, 2 Apr. 1769; sett. Germantown, Pa., St. Michael's Chh., 1769-1786; Upper Dublin, Pa., Puff's Chh., 1769-1785; Whitemarsh (Montgomery) Pa., St. Peter's Chh., Barren Hill, June 1769-1785; Frankford, Pa., 1769-1786; Whitpain (Montgomery) Pa., St. John's Chh. at Center Square, 1769-1786; Lower Gwynedd (Montgomery) Pa., St. Peter's Chh. at North Wales, 1775-1785; Philadelphia, Pa., St. Michael's and Zion's Chhs., 1785- 1812; Luth.; d. Philadelphia, Pa., 16 May 1812, a. 66.

name: John George Schmidt
settled at: New Hanover (Montgomery) Pa., Falkner's Swamp Church
raw: JOHN GEORGE SCHMIDT, sett. New Hanover (Montgomery) Pa., Falkner's Swamp Chh., 1736-1742; South Whitehall (Lehigh) Pa., Jordan Chh., 1736-1739; Tulpehocken (Berks) Pa., Little Tulpehocken Chh., 1739-1740; Oley Hills (Berks) Pa., Hill Chh. at Colebrookdale, 1736-1741; Pike (Berks) Pa., St. John's Chh., 1739-1740; the New Hanover and Hill Chh. at Oley Hills had the same minister for the first 125 years; Luth.

name: Melchior Schmidt
raw: MELCHIOR SCHMIDT, arriv. N.Y., N.Y., 12 May 1749; sett. Lynn (Lehigh) Pa., AUemaengel Chh., 1755-1756; Morav.

name: George Schneider Au
raw: GEORGE SCHNEIDER, came from Zauchtenthal, Moravia; sett. Lynn (Lehigh) Pa., AUemaengel Chh., 1742-1742; Salisbury (Lehigh) Pa., Chh. at Emaus, 1755-1756; carpenter; his wife Gertrude was also ordained; Morav.; d. Bethlehem, Pa., Oct. 1773.

name: John Schneider
raw: JOHN SCHNEIDER, arriv. N.Y., N.Y., 12 May 1749; sett. Oley (Berks) Pa., 1753-1755; this chh. was broken up by the Indian Wars; Morav.

name: Theodore Schneider Au
raw: THEODORE SCHNEIDER, S.J., b. Geinsheim, Speyer, Germany, 7 Apr. 1703; Prof, of Philosophy and Theology in Liege, Belgium; arriv. in Pa., 1741; sett. Tulpehocken (Berks) Pa., 1741-1764; AUentown (Lehigh) Pa., 1741-1764; Maxatawny (Berks) Pa., 1741-1764; Lancaster (Lane.) Pa., St. John Nepomucene's Chh., 1741-1764; Philadelphia, Pa., St. Joseph's Chh., 1741-1764; Washington (Berks) Pa., St. Paul's Chapel at Bally, 1742-1743, and Chh. of the Blessed Sacrament, 1734-1764; Haycock (Bucks) Pa., St. John's Chh., 1743-1764; Alloway (Salem) N.J., at Glass House, 1743-1758; Bound Brook (Somerset) N.J., 1743-1758; Frankford, Pa., 1744-1764; Concord (Chester) Pa., Chh. at Ivy Mills, 1757-1764; physician; R.C; d. Washington, Pa., 10 July 1764, a. 62.

name: Leonard Schnell
raw: LEONARD SCHNELL, sett. Bethlehem, Pa., 25 June 1742-1748; was at Germantown, Va., 22 Nov. 1743; and took a missionary tour afoot in Georgia, 1743 ; sett. Laneaster, Pa., 1748-1748; Warwiek (Lane.) Pa., St. James's Chh. at Lititz, 1747-1748; Salisbury (Lehigh) Pa., Chh. at Emaus, 1742-1747; Lynn (ilehigh) Pa., Allemaengel Chh., 1742- 1743; Ord. Priest, 1748; left the Moravian Chh., 1751; beeame a Lutheran; sett. "Maguntsehe," i.e. Maeungie, prob. sett. Lower Maeungie (Lehigh) Pa., Luth. Holy Trinity or Zion Chh., perhaps, 1748-1749; he also preaehed at Muddy Creek, Heidelberg, Saueon, Tulpehoeken, Lebanon, Donegal, and beyond the Susquehannah; Morav.; Luth.

name: Leonard Schnell
settled at: Lower Maeungie (Lehigh) Pa., Luth. Holy Trinity or Zion Church, perhaps

name: Casper Ludwig Schnorr
settled at: Lancaster (Lane.) Pa., Germ. Ref. Church, Nov. Mar.
raw: CASPER LUDWIG SCHNORR (or Sehnoor), prob. b. Ludinghusan's monastery, near Munster, Westphalia; matric. Marburg, 12 July 1735; minister at Zweibruecken, Germany; appeared in Pa., 10 Mar. 1744; sett. Lancaster (Lane.) Pa., Germ. Ref. Chh., Nov. 1744-Mar. 1746; Tulpehoeken, 1744-1746; Germantown (Columbia) N.Y., Duteh Ref. Chh., 1746-1748; Catskill (Greene) N.Y., Duteh Ref. Chh., 1747-1748; Rhinebeek (Dutehess) N.Y., Germ. Ref., 1746-1748; Kingsbury (Dutchess) N.Y., Dutch Ref., 1746-1748; Dutch Ref. and Germ. Ref.; "an eeelesiastieal vagabond!"; last mentioned, 16 June 1750.

name: Henricus Schoonmaker
raw: HENRICUS SCHOONMAKER, b. Rochester (Ulster) N.Y., 18 July 1739; Ord. in America, 1763; sett. Poughkeepsie (Dutchess) N.Y., 1763-1774; Fishkill (Dutchess) N.Y., 1763-1774; Passaie (Passaie) N.J., Duteh Ref. Chh. at Aequaekanonk, 1774-1816; Bellville, N.J., 1789-1794; Paterson, N.J., 1799-1816; Duteh Ref.; d. Jamaiea, L.L, N.Y., 19 Jan. 1820, a. 80.

name: Martinus Schoonmaker
raw: MARTINUS SCHOONMAKER, b. Roehester (Ulster) N.Y., 1737; read the elassies under Goetsehius, 1753-1756; studied theology under Marinus; Ord. in Ameriea, 1765; sett, the following ehhs., all exeept Harlem, on L.L, N.Y.: Gravesend, 1765-1824; Harlem, 1765-1784; Flatbush, 1784-1824; Brooklyn, 1784-1824; New Utrecht, 1784-1824; Flatlands, 1784-1824; Bushwick, 1784-1824; Dutch Ref.; d. ca. 1824.

name: Ludolph Heinrich Schrenck
settled at: Upper Saucon, Pa., St. Paul's, Blue or Organ Church
raw: LUDOLPH HEINRICH SCHRENCK, came from Lueneberg, Germany, Mar. 1749; Ord. Upper Saucon (Lehigh) Pa., 5 Nov. 1752; sett. Upper Saucon, Pa., St. Paul's, Blue or Organ Chh., 1749-1754; Lower Milford (Lehigh) Pa., Upper Milford Chh., 1749-1753; Easton (Northampton) Pa., St. John's Chh., 1749-1754; Williams (Northampton) Pa., at Cedarville, 1749-1756; New Germantown, N.J'., Zion Chh., Tewksbury, 1753-1756; Pluckemin (Somerset) N.J., at Bedminster, 1753-1756; Fairmount, Fox Hill Chh. at Tewksbury, N.J., 1753-1756; Whitehouse (Hunterdon) N.J., at Leslyland, 1753-1756; Bedminster (Somerset) N.J., St. Paul's Chh., 1753-1756; Raritan (Somerset) N.J., 1753-1756; Potterstown (Hunterdon) N.J., at Rockaway, 1753-1756; German V^alley (Morris) N.J., at Washington, 1753- 1756; Luth.; went to Ireland.

name: Daniel Schroeder
settled at: Whitemarsh (Montgomery) Pa., St. Peter's Church, Barren Hill, ca.
raw: DANIEL SCHROEDER, sett. Whitemarsh (Montgomery) Pa., St. Peter's Chh., Barren Hill, ca. 1760; Luth. 3

name: Matthew Schropp
