raw: MATTHEW SCHROPP, came from Kaufbeuren, Swabia; arriv. N.Y., N.Y., 26 Nov. 1743; Ord. deacon, 1748; sett. Nazareth, 25 June 1747 ff.; Bethabara, North Carolina, 1766-1767; glover; Morav.; d. Bethabara, N.C, 1767.

name: Christopher Schultz
son of: Melchior and Susanna (Kriebel) Scholtze by the Rev. George Weiss (q.v.)
raw: CHRISTOPHER SCHULTZ, b. Harpersdorf, Silesia, 26 Mar. 1718, son of Melchior and Susanna (Kriebel) Scholtze; ed. by the Rev. George Weiss (q.v.); sett. Lower Salford (Montgomery) Pa., Schwenkfelders Chh., 1762-1789; Sehwenkfelder; d. Washington, Pa., 9 May 1789.

name: Christopher Emanuel Schulze
settled at: Philadelphia, Pa., St. Michael's Church, , and Zion's Church
raw: CHRISTOPHER EMANUEL SCHULZE, b. Probstzell, Saxony, 25 Dec. 1740, son of John Andrew and Amelia Schultze; ed. Frederick Coll., Halle; Ord. Wernigerode, Germany, 1765; arriv. Philadelphia, 24 Oct. 1765; sett. Philadelphia, Pa., St. Michael's Chh., 1765-1770, and Zion's Chh., 1769-1770; Heidelberg (Lebanon) Pa., chh. at Schaeffertown, 1765-1809; Strasburg (Lane) Pa., St. Michael's or Beaver Creek Chh., 1767-1769; Marion (Berks) Pa., Zion or Rieth's Chh. (the original Old Tulpehocken Chh.), Dec 1770-1809, and Christ Chh. at Stouchsburg (Old Tulpehocken Chh.), 1770-1809; Mill Creek (Lebanon) Pa., Reed's or Old Tulpehocken Chh. (i.e. 3 divisions of the original Old Tulpehocken Chh.), 1770-1809; Tulpehocken (Berks) Pa., Christ or Rehrersburg Chh., 1770-1809; son-in-law of Dr. Muhlenberg, and father of the Rev. John Andrew Schultze who was also Governor of Pa.; Luth.; d. Marion, Pa., 9 Mar. 1809.

name: Christopher Emanuel Schulze
edited_raw: Marion (Berks) Pa.(the original Old Tulpehocken Church), Dec

name: Frederick Schulze
settled at: New Hanover (Montgomery) Pa., Falkner's Swamp Church, as assistant
raw: FREDERICK SCHULZE, b. Koenigsberg, Prussia; ed. at Halle; Ord. Wernigerode, Germany, 11 July 1751; arriv. Philadelphia, i Dec. 1751; sett. New Hanover (Montgomery) Pa., Falkner's Swamp Chh., as assistant, 1752-1754; Upper Hanover (Montgomery) Pa., New Goshenhoppen Chh., 1752-1756; Rockland (Bucks) Pa., Indianfield Chh., 1752-1763; Upper Salford (Montg.) Pa., Old Goshenhoppen Chh., 1753- 1759; Franconia (Montg.) Pa., Indian Creek or Zion's Chh., 1752-1763; Lunenberg, Nova Scotia, 1772-1782; physician; Luth.; d. 1809.

name: Johann Christian Schultze
settled at: New Hanover (Montgomery) Pa., Falkner's Swamp Church
son of: the Rev. John Valentine and Anna Juliana Schultze
raw: JOHANN CHRISTIAN SCHULTZE, b. Schainbach, Wertemberg, Germany, 11 June 1701, son of the Rev. John Valentine and Anna Juliana Schultze; arriv. in Pa., 25 Sept. 1732; sett. New Hanover (Montgomery) Pa., Falkner's Swamp Chh., 1732-1733; Upper Providence (Montgomery) Pa., Augustus Chh. at Trappe, 1732-1733; Lancaster (^Lanc) Pa., 1733-1733; Brecknock (Lane.) Pa., Muddy Creek Chh., 1733-1733; Philadelphia, Pa., St. Michael's Chh., I733-I734; became blind; Luth.; returned to Germany, 1734.

name: Daniel Schumacher
raw: DANIEL SCHUMACHER, sett. ; Luth.; d. Weisenberg, Pa., ca. 1769.

name: Daniel Schumacher
settled at: Lynn (Lehigh) Pa., Jerusalem Chh. at Allemaengel, i

name: Daniel Schumacher
settled at: Weisenberg (Lehigh) Pa., Ziegel Chh., , and Weisenberg Chh.

name: Daniel Schumacher
settled at: Windsor (Berks) Pa., Lebanon Chh. at the Blue Mountains, now St. Paul's Chh.

name: Daniel Schumacher
settled at: Upper Tulpehoeken (Berks) Pa., Blue Mountain or North Kill Chh.

name: Daniel Schumacher
settled at: Salisbury (Lehigh) Pa., New Jerusalem Chh., East Salisbury, , and Jerusalem Chh., West Salisbury

name: Daniel Schumacher
settled at: Upper Bern (Berks) Pa., St. Michael's Chh.

name: Jacob Schumacher
raw: JACOB SCHUMACHER, b. Palatinate, 31 Mar. 1708; came to America, 1737; Ord. Skippack (Montgomery) Pa., 1746-1793; Menn.; d. Skippack, Pa., 28 June 1793.

name: Johannes Schuneman
raw: JOHANNES SCHUNEMAN, b. East Camp, N.Y., 18 Aug. 1712, son of Capt.Hermann and Elizabeth (Muller) Schuneman; Ord. Amsterdam, Holland, 9 Jan. 1753; sett. Shawangunk (Ulster) N.Y., Chh. at Bruynswick, 1753-1754; New Paltz (Ulster) N.Y., 1753-1754; Catskill (Greene) N.Y., 1753-1794; Coxsackie (Greene) N.Y., I753-I794; Leeds (Greene) N.Y., Old Catskill Chh., 1753-1794; Kaatsbaan (Ulster) N.Y., 1762- 1775; Dutch Ref.; d. Coxsackie, N.Y., 16 May 1794, a. 81.

name: Johannes Schuyler
raw: JOHANNES SCHUYLER, Ord. Schoharie (Schoharie) N.Y., 18 Apr. 1738; sett. Schoharie, N.Y., 1736-1755,1766-1769; Haekensaek (Bergen) N.J., 2nd Chh., 1755-1766; Schraalenburg (Bergen) N.J., 2nd or Du Mont Chh., 1755-1766; Cobleskill (Schoharie) N.Y., 1766-1769; Beaverdam (Albany) N.Y., 1767-1777; Middleburg (Schoharie) N.Y., Upper Schoharie Chh., 173 6-1775; preached occasionally at Stone Arabia, N.Y.; Dutch Ref.; d. (Schoharie, N.Y.), 1779.

name: Johannes Schwarzbach
raw: JOHANNES SCHWARZBACH, b. 8 Mar. 1719; sett. Elizabeth (Lancaster) Pa., Emmanuel Chh., 1775-1776; Upper Hanover (Montgomery) Pa., New Goshenhoppen Chh., 1775-1776; Madison (Madison) Va., Old Hebron Chh., 1775-1776; Luth.; d. Bensalem, Pa., 31 Aug. 1800.

name: Johannes Schweishaupt
raw: JOHANNES SCHWEISHAUPT (Schweisshaupt or Schweitzhaupt), arriv. N.Y., N.Y., 12 May 1749; sett. Salisbury (Lehigh) Pa., Chh. at Emaus, 1758-1760; Mount Joy (Lane.) Pa., Donegal Chh., 1763-1774; Graceham, Md., 1775-1784; York, Pa.; Moravian; his wife, Magdalena, was also ordained.

name: John William Samuel Schwerdtfeger
born: Neustadt on the Aisel, Mittelfranken, Bavaria
raw: JOHN WILLIAM SAMUEL SCHWERDTFEGER, b. near Neustadt on the Aisel, Mittelfranken, Bavaria, 1722; an orphan; stud, theol. and law at Erlangen U.; came to Md., 1753/4; Ord. York (York) Pa., Christ Chh., 1755-1756; Brecknock (Lane.) Pa., Muddy Creek Chh., 1758-1763; Earl (Lane.) Pa., Chh. at New Holland, 1758-1763; Ephrata (Lane.) Pa., Bergstrasse Chh., 1758-1763; Frederick, Md., 1763-1768; Antietam, Md., 1763-1768; Brunswick (R.ensselaer) N.Y., Gilead Chh., 1768-1788; Luth.; d. 1788.

name: Samuel Seabury
settled at: New London, Conn., St. James's Church (org.
raw: SAMUEL SEABURY, A.M., b. Groton, Conn., 8 July 1706, son of Dea. John and Elizabeth (Alden) Seabury; A.B., H.C, 1724, A.M.; preached in Salem, Conn., 1727-1727; North Yarmouth, Me., 1729- 1729; became an Ep.; appointed S.P.G. Missionary at New London, Conn., 21 Aug. 1730; K.B. for N.E., 20 Oct. 1730; Ord. London, 1731; sett. New London, Conn., St. James's Chh. (org. 10 Apr. 1732), Mar. 1730/1-1743; Hebron, Conn., 1739; Hempstead, L.L, N.Y., St. George's Chh., Aug. 1743-1764; Huntington, L.L, N.Y., St. John's Chh., 1750- 1764; Ep.; d. Hempstead, L.L, N.Y., 15 June 1764, a. 58 (GS).

name: Samuel Seabury
settled at: Burlington (Burlington) N.J., St. Anne's, now St. Mary's Church
degrees: D.D., A.B., Y.C, 1748, A.M. A.M., Columbia, 1761
son of: the Rev. Samuel and Abigail (Mumford) Seabury by Bsp. of Carlisle, 23 Dec. 1753
raw: Bishop SAMUEL SEABURY, D.D., b. Ledyard, Conn., 30 Nov. 1729, son of the Rev. Samuel and Abigail (Mumford) Seabury; A.B., Y.C, 1748, A.M.; M.D.; A.M., Columbia, 1761; D.D.; Oxford, 1777; Ord. by Bsp. of Carlisle, 23 Dec. 1753; K.B. for N.J., 16 Jan. 1754; catechist, Huntington, L.L, N.Y., 1748-1752; sett. Burlington (Burlington) N.J., St. Anne's, now St. Mary's Chh., 25 May 1754-1757; New Brunswick (Middlesex) N.J., Christ Chh., 25 May 1754-13 Jan. 1757; Jamaica, L.L, N.Y., Grace Chh., 12 Jan. 1757-1765; Newtown, L.L, N.Y., 1757-1765; Flushing, L.L, N.Y., St. George's Chh., 1757-1765; Westchester (Westchester) N.Y., St. Peter's Chh., 3 Dec. 1766-1776; Eastchester (Westchester) N.Y., St. Paul's Chh., 1766-Í776; Chaplain, British Army, 1776; Staten Island, N.Y., St. Andrew:'s Chh., 1778- 1782; New London, Conn., St. James's Chh., 1785-1796; chosen Bsp. of Conn., 25 Mar. 1783; consecrated at Aberdeen, Scotland^ 14 Nov. 1784; Bishop of R.L, 1790-1796; Ep.; d. New London, Conn., 25 Feb. 1796, a. 68 (GS).

name: Johann Gottfried Seelig
raw: JOHANN GOTTFRIED SEELIG, b. Lemgo, Lippe-Detmold, Germany, 1668; came to Pa., 1694; sett. Pietistic Community at Wissahickon, Pa., 1709-1710; bookbinder, teacher; preacher; resided at Roxborough; Pietist; d. Roxborough, Pa., 26 Apr. 1745, a. 77.

name: Nathaniel Seidel
raw: Bishop NATHANIEL SEIDEL, b. Laubau, Prussian Silesia, 1718; came to Bethlehem, Pa., 15 June 1742; Indian missionary, 1742-1758; Ord. priest, 1748; Ord. Bishop, 12 May 1758; arriv. Bethlehem, second visit, 21 Oct. 1761; successor to Bishop Spangenberg at Bethlehem, Pa., 1762-1782; Trustee of the Moravian Estates in North America; Moravian; d. Bethlehem, Pa., 12 May 1782.

name: Anton Seiffert
raw: ANTON SEIFFERT, b. Thrulichen, Bohemia; went to Herrnhut, then to Georgia; arriv. Savannah, Ga., 22 Mar. 1734/5; Ord. Savannah, Ga., 28 Feb. 1735/6; sett. Savannah, Ga., 1736-1739; Bethlehem, Pa., 25 June 1742-1745; returned to Europe, 8 Apr. 1745; served chhs. in England, Ireland, and Holland; first person ord. by a Moravian Bishop in America; Moravian; d. Zeist, Holland, 19 Juné 1785.

name: Henricus Selyns
raw: HENRICUS SELYNS, b. Amsterdam, Holland, 1636, son of Jan and Agneta (Kock) Selyns; U. of Utrecht, 1654; matric. Leyden, 19 Mar. 1657, a. 21, in theology; lie. 2 Oct. 1657; Ord. Amsterdam, 16 Feb. 1660; came to America, 1660; inducted, Brooklyn, N.Y., 3 Sept. 1660-July 1664; sett. Bushwyck, N.Y., 7 Sept. 1660-1664; Gravesend, N.Y., 1660-1664; N.Y., N.Y., St. Mark's in the Bowery, 1660-1664; Staten Island, N.Y., Dutch Ref. Chh., 1660-1664, French Ref. Chh., South Side, 1660-1664, Fr. Ref. Chh., Fresh Kills, 1660-1664; Bergen (Bergen) N.J., supply, 1660-1664; Harlem, N.Y., supply, 1660-1664; returned to Holland, where he was a Chaplain in the Dutch Army, 1675; sett. Waverveen, Holland, 1666-1682; returned to N.Y., 1682; sett. N.Y., N.Y., ist Dutch Ref. or South Dutch Chh., 1682-1701; an accomplished scholar; Dutch Ref.; d. N.Y., N.Y., Sept. 1701, a. 64.

name: Henricus Selyns
settled at: N.Y., N.Y., first Dutch Ref. or South Dutch Church

name: Henricus Selyns
edited_raw: St. Mark's in the Bowery, NY, N.Y.

name: Gottlob Sensemann
edited_raw: Indian missionary in the Susquehannah Valley and in western New York
son of: the Rev. Henry Joachim and Anna Catherine (Ludwig) Sensemann
raw: GOTTLOB SENSEMANN, b. 9 Oct. 1745, son of the Rev. Henry Joachim and Anna Catherine (Ludwig) Sensemann; Indian missionary in the Susquehannah Valley and in western New York, 1768-1781; taken captive to Schenectady, 1781; sett. New Salem, Ohio, 17 May 1785- 9 Nov. 1790; Moravian; d. Fairfield, Canada, 4 Jan. 1800.

name: Henry Joachim Sensemann
raw: HENRY JOACHIM SENSEMANN, came from Hesse-Cassel; at Bethlehem, Pa., 1743; Ord. deacon, 1749; Indian missionary, 1743-1755; sett. Gnadenhuetten, Indian Chh., 1775-1775; Nain (Lehigh) Pa., Indian Chh., 1760-1765; missionary at Jamaica, West Indies, 1766- 1774; baker and bellringer; Moravian; d. Carmel, Jamaica, 1774.

name: John Christian Seyfert
settled at: Lower Milford, Pa., Great Swamp Church
raw: JOHN CHRISTIAN SEYFERT, sett. Lower Milford, Pa., Great Swamp Chh., 1739-1741; Germ. Ref.; liv. 1747.

name: Israel Seymour
edited_raw: Broad River Bapt. Church, in St. Mark's Parish (Craven) S.C.
raw: Captain ISRAEL SEYMOUR, b. New Castle co., Del.; Ord. Ephrata, Pa., 1746; sett. French Creek (Chester) Pa., 1746-1747; Broad River Bapt. Chh., in St. Mark's Parish (Craven) S.C., 1757-1759; sea captain; 7th Day Bapt.; Germ. Bapt.; d. S.C after 1783.

name: John Sharpe
chaplain: in the Fort, 1704-1717| to Lord Cornbury, Governor of the Jerseys, 1702-1717
raw: JOHN SHARPE, D.D., matric. Edinburgh, 1694, A.M., D.D., 1694; missionary to the Leeward Islands, West Indies, 27 Feb. 1700/1; N.Y., N.Y., Chaplain in the Fort, 1704-1717; Chaplain to Lord Cornbury, Governor of the Jerseys, 1702-1717; preached at Burlington, N.J., 1704; Maidenhead, N.J., 1704; Hopewell (Mercer) N.J., 1704-1705; Perth Amboy, N.J., 1704; Elizabethtown, N.J., 1704; Staten Island, N.Y., 1704; Cheesequake (Middlesex) N.J., 1704; K.B. for N.Y., 1710; Woodbridge, N.J., 1704; Trenton, N.J., 1704; returned to London, 1717; Ep.

name: Christian Shaub
raw: CHRISTIAN SHAUB, sett. Strasburg (Lane.) Pa.; assistant to Bishop Jacob Neff, in the New Providence district; dates not given; Menn.

name: Joseph Shaw
settled at: Shekomeko (Dutchess) N.Y., teacher among the Indians
raw: JOSEPH SHAW, b. Little Ryder, near St. James, London; designed for the Chh. of England; came to America in the ship "Catharine"; arriv. Bethlehem, Pa., 21 June 1742; sett. Shekomeko (Dutchess) N.Y., teacher among the Indians, 1742-1745; Wallpack (Sussex) N.J., 1745- 1747; Paulin's Kill (Warren) N.J., 1745-1747; Bethlehem (Northampton) Pa., Brodhead Settlement at Dansbury, 1745-1747; Ord. Aug. 1747; started for St. Thomas, West Indies, 1747; Moravian; d. at sea en route to St. Thomas, West Indies, Oct. 1747.

name: John Shenk
raw: JOHN SHENK, sett. Heidelberg (York) Pa., Bairs Chh., 1775 ff.; was already a minister on 14 May 1775, as shown by a deed of that date at Manheim, York co.. Pa.; Menn.

name: Samuel Shepard
degrees: A.B., bapt. Rowley, Mass., 25 Aug. 1667, son of the Rev. Samuel and Dorothy (Flint) Shepard A.B., H.C, 1685
raw: SAMUEL SHEPARD, A.B., bapt. Rowley, Mass., 25 Aug. 1667, son of the Rev. Samuel and Dorothy (Flint) Shepard; A.B., H.C, 1685; sett. Woodbridge (Middlesex) N.J., Oet. 1695-1703; J.P., N.J., 1706; Cong.; d. Woodbridge, N.J., 1722/3, a. 55 (inventory, 17 Mar. 1722/3).

name: David Sheppard
raw: DAVID SHEPPARD, sett. Dividing Creek (Cumberland) N.J., 1764 ff.; Bapt.

name: Job Sheppard
raw: JOB SHEPPARD, b. 1707; called to the ministry, 1742; Ord. 1750; sett. Salem (Salem) N.J., Bapt. Chh., 17 May I7S5-I7S7; Bapt.; d. Salem, N.J., 2 Mar. 1757, a. 50.

name: Ewald Gustavus Shewkirk
raw: Bishop EWALD GUSTAVUS SHEWKIRK, b. Stettin, Prussia, 28 Feb. 1725; came to Ameriea, 1774; sett. N.Y., N.Y., Moravian Chh., 1775-1776; Ord. Bishop, 1785; missionary Bishop to the West Indies; strong Tory in the Rev. War; Moravian; d. Herrnhut, Saxony, 1805.

name: Peter Shirk
settled at: East Earl, Pa., Church at Weaverland
raw: PETER SHIRK, Ord. East Earl (Lane.) Pa., 1750; sett. East Earl, Pa., Chh. at Weaverland, 1750-1770; Menn.; d. East Earl, Pa., Feb. 1770; will made 7 Feb. 1770; proved 12 Mar. 1770.

name: Joseph Showalter
raw: JOSEPH SHOWALTER, Ord. before 1773; sett. East Vineent (Chester) Pa., 1773-1802; East Coventry (Chester) Pa., 1773-1802; Phoenixville (Chester) Pa., 1773-1802; bought land in Charlestown township, Chester eo., 1771; Menn.; d. Chester eo. Pa., 1802 (will proved that year).

name: Thomas Simmons
raw: THOMAS SIMMONS, b. England; Ord. Philadelphia, Pa.; sett. Hopewell (Mereer) N.J., ea. 1715-1725; Charleston, S.C, Bapt. Chh., 20 Mar. 1725-1749; Bapt.; d. Charleston, S.C, 31 Jan. 1749.

name: John Simonton
raw: JOHN SIMONTON, b. Ireland; Ord. Tredyffryn (Chester) Pa., 16 Apr. 1761; sett. Tredyffryn, Pa., Great Valley Chh., 1761-1791; Presb.; d. Tredyffryn, Pa., Oet. 1791.

name: David Simpson
raw: DAVID SIMPSON, minister at Killean, Seotland; imprisoned; liberated, 17 Mar. 1685 ; eame to New Jersey; not known to have been settled here; Presb.; d. New Jersey.

name: Maligus Sims
settled at: Bensalem (Bueks) Pa., Duteh Ref. Church, Apr.  ff.
raw: MALIGUS SIMS, sett. Bensalem (Bueks) Pa., Duteh Ref. Chh., Apr. 1719 ff.; Duteh Ref.

name: Dugald Simson
raw: DUGALD SIMSON, b. Scotland; sett. Brookhaven, L.L, N.Y., Setauket Chh., 1685-1691; Presb.; returned to Seotland, 1691, where he was a member of the Lochmaben Presbytery.

name: Matthew Sittensperger
edited_raw: MATTHEW SITTENSPERGER (changed his name to Manners)
raw: MATTHEW SITTENSPERGER (changed his name to Manners), b. Germany; sett. Lancaster (Lane.) Pa., St. John Nepomucene's Chh., 1748-1752; Conewago (Adams) Pa., Sacred Heart Chh., 1758-1758; Mill Creek (New Castle) Del., St. Mary's Chapel at Coffee Run, Jan. 1772-1786, and St. John's Chh., at Mt. Cuba or Cuba Rock, Jan. 1772- 1786; R.C.

name: Isaac Skillman
degrees: D.D., A.B., Princeton, 1766, A.M. A.M., Brown, 1774, D.D., 1798
raw: ISAAC SKILLMAN, D.D., b. New Jersey, 1740; A.B., Princeton, 1766, A.M.; A.M., Brown, 1774, D.D., 1798; Ord. N.Y., N.Y., ist Bapt. Chh., 1773; sett. Boston, Mass., 2nd Bapt. Chh., Sept. 1773-7 Oct. 1787; Salem (Salem) N.J., 1790-1799; Bapt.; d. Salem, N.J., 8 June 1799, a. 59.

name: William Skinner
settled at: Perth Amboy (Middlesex) N.J., St. Peter's Church
raw: WILLIAM SKINNER, b. Scotland, ca. 1687; Ord. London, Autumn of 1722; fought in the battle of Preston-Pans, Scotland, 1715; K.B. to Philadelphia, Pa., 10 June 1718; schoolmaster at Philadelphia^, 1718- 1722; occasional preacher at Freehold (Mercer) N.J., St. Peter's Chh., 1718-1733; sett. Perth Amboy (Middlesex) N.J., St. Peter's Chh., 22 Nov. 1722-1758; S.P.G. missionary; Piscataway (Middlesex) N.J., St. James's Chh. 1722-1758; Shrewsbury (Monmouth) N.J., Christ Chh., 1722-1725; Woodbridge (Middlesex) N.J., Trinity Chh., 1722- 1752; New Brunswick (Middlesex) N.J., Christ Chh., 1742-1749; Spotswood (Middlesex) N.J., St. Peter's Chh. at East Brunswick, 1756- 1758; Mr. Skinner built the chh. at Spotswood; a Rev. William Macgregor Skinner, perhaps a descendant, was matriculated in the Lyon Register of Arms, 1810; Ep.; d. Perth Amboy, N.J., 1758, a. 70.

name: John Slemons
settled at: Highland, Pa., Lower Marsh Creek Church
raw: JOHN SLEMONS, A.M., b. Chester co.. Pa., 1735, of Irish parentage; A.B., Princeton, 1760, A.M.; lie 1762-1763; Ord. Highland (Adams) Pa., 23 May 1765; sett. Highland, Pa., Lower Marsh Creek Chh., 1764- 1774; Taneytown (Carroll) Md., 1764-1770; Lower Chanceford (York) Pa., 1774-1799; Slate Ridge, Pa., 1781-Sept. 1791; Presb.; bur. Piney Creek, Md., June 1814, a. 79.

name: John Smart
raw: JOHN SMART, arriv. in America, 1761; preached for a time here, then returned to Scotland; Associate Presb.

name: Caleb Smith
son of: Major William Henry and Hannah (Sears) Smith
raw: CALEB SMITH, A.M., b. Brookhaven, L.L, N.Y., 29 Dec. 1723, son of Major William Henry and Hannah (Sears) Smith; A.B., Y.C, 1743, A.M.; Trustee, Princeton, 1750-1762; Près., pro temp.; Ord. Orange (Essex) N.J., 30 Nov. 1748; sett. Orange, at Newark Mountain, N.J., 1748-1762; first Tutor of Princeton Coll., 1746; Presb.; d. Newark, N.J., 22 Oct. 1762, a. 39 (GS).

name: David Smith
raw: DAVID SMITH, b. Cape May, N.J., 1730; Ord. Cape May (Cape May) N.J., Mar. 1776; sett. Cape May, N.J., 1776-1784; Bapt.; d. Cape May, N.J., Feb. 1784, a. 54.

name: Deliverance Smith
settled at: Pleasant Valley (Dutchess) N.Y., Pittsburgh Church at Washington Hollow
raw: DELIVERANCE SMITH, A.M., (prob. b. Roxbury, Conn.), A.B., Y.C, 1749, A.M.; lie 28 May 1751; sett. Pleasant Valley (Dutchess) N.Y., Pittsburgh Chh. at Washington Hollow, 1747-1765; Ord. Hillsdale (Columbia) N.Y., 11 Dec. 1765; sett. Hillsdale, N.Y., 1765 ff.; Presb.; d. Woodbury, Conn., Sept. 1785.

name: John Smith
degrees: A.M., came to N.Y., N.Y., 1715 A.B., Y.C, 1727, A.M.
raw: JOHN SMITH, A.M., b. Newport Pagnel, Bucks, England, 5 May 1702, son of Thomas and Susanna (Odell) Smith; came to N.Y., N.Y., 1715; A.B., Y.C, 1727, A.M.; Ord. Rye (Westchester) N.Y., 15 May 1729; sett. Rye, N.Y., 1729-1771; White Plains, N.Y., 1729-1771; Sing Sing, N.Y., 1763-1771; physician; Presb.; d. Rye, N.Y., 26 Feb. 1771, a. 69.

name: John Smith
raw: JOHN SMITH (A.B., Princeton, 1770), sett. Bart (Lane) Pa., Middle Octoraro Chh., 1772-1794; Mt. Nebo (Lane.) Pa., near Pequea, 1772-1794; Associate Ref. Presb.; d. (1820).

name: Joseph Smith
ordained: Fairfield (Cumberland) N.J., Chh. at Cohansey, 10 May 1709
son of: Lieut. Dea. Philip and Rebecca (Foote) Smith
raw: JOSEPH SMITH, A.B., b. Hadley, 1674, son of Lieut. Dea. Philip and Rebecca (Foote) Smith; A.B., H.C, 1695; sett. Brookfield, Mass., 1702-1705; Ord. Fairfield (Cumberland) N.J., Chh. at Cohansey, 10 May 1709; sett. Cohansey, N.J., 1708-1713; inst. Middletown, Conn., 2nd Chh. at Cromwell, 5 Jan. 1714/5, as the first minister; sett. Cromwell, Conn., 1715-1736; Cong.; Presb.; d. Middletown, Conn., 8 Sept. 1736.

name: Joseph Smith
raw: JOSEPH SMITH, A.B., b. Nottingham, Pa., 1736; A.B., Princeton, 1764; lie. 5 Aug. 1767; Ord. Lower Brandywine (New Castle) Del., 19 Apr. 1769; sett. Lower Brandywine, 1769-22 Aug. 1772; Brandywine, 1769-Apr. 1778; Wilmington,Del., 2nd Presb. Chh., 27 Oct. 1774-29 Apr. 1778; Buffalo (Washington) Pa., and Cross Creek (Washington) Pa., 21 June 1779-1792; fdr. Jefferson Coll., 1791; Presb.; d. Buffalo, Washington CO., Pa., 19 Apr. 1792.

name: Robert Smith
degrees: D.D., came to America, 1730 D.D., 1786;A.M. (hon.) Princeton, 1760;
raw: ROBERT SMITH, D.D., b. Londonderry, Ireland, 1723; came to America, 1730; ed. Fagg's Manor Academy; A.M. (hon.) Princeton, 1760; D.D., 1786; Trustee, 1772-1793; lie. 27 Dec. 1749; called to Pequea, I Oct. 1750; Ord. Pequea, Pa., 25 Mar. 1750/1; sett. Salisbury (Lane.) Pa., Pequea Chh., 1751-1793; Leacock (Lane.) Pa., 1751-9 Oct. 1759; East Earl (Lane.) Pa., Cedar Grove Chh., 1775-1785; Principal, Dr. Robert Smith's Academy, Pequea, Pa. ; New Side Presb. ; Moderator of the General Assembly, 1790; d. Rockville, Chester co.. Pa., 15 Apr. 1793, a. 71.

name: Robert Smith
edited_raw: Principal, Dr. Robert Smith's Academy, Pequea, Pa.

name: Sampson Smith
settled at: Chestnut Level (Lane.) Pa., church at Drumore
raw: SAMPSON SMITH, came from Ireland; member, Donegal Presbytery, 3 Apr. 1753; Ord. 1752; sett. Chestnut Level (Lane.) Pa., chh. at Drumore, 1752-1771; Hopewell (York) Pa., Shrewsbury Chh., 1761- 1771; missionary at the South Branch of the Potomac River, Va., 1772,— 1774; suspended, 1774; teacher; Presb.; killed by lightning; time not given.

name: Sampson Smith
settled at: the South Branch of the Potomac River, Va.

name: Simon Smith
son of: Simon Smith of Corscombe, Devon, matric. Magdalen Hall, Oxford, 30 Mar. 1688, a. 19)
raw: SIMON SMITH (prob. b. 1669, son of Simon Smith of Corscombe, Devon, matric. Magdalen Hall, Oxford, 30 Mar. 1688, a. 19); N.Y., N.Y., Chaplain in the Fort, 1699 ff.; K.B. for Jamaica, 7 Jan. 1694; Ep.

name: Thomas Smith
raw: THOMAS SMITH, A.M., A.B., Princeton, 1758, A.M.; inst. Cranbury (Middlesex) N.J., 1762-1789; Penns Neck (Mercer) N.J., near Princeton, 1762-1789; St. George's (New Castle) Del., 1769-1774; Presb.; d. Cranbury, N.J., 23 Dec. 1789.

name: Titus Smith
ordained: N.Y. State, 24 Apr. 1765, as an Indian missionary
raw: TITUS SMITH, A.B., b. South Hadley, Mass., 4 June 1734, son of Dea. John and Elizabeth (Smith) Smith; A.B., Y.C, 1764; Ord. N.Y. State, 24 Apr. 1765, as an Indian missionary; preached occasionally; became a Sandemanian, 1772; re-Ord. in Boston; Cong.; Sandemanian; d. Halifax, Nova Scotia, 15 Sept. 1807, a. 73.

name: William Smith
degrees: D.D., A.B., Aberdeen, 1747, K.M., D.D., 1759 D.D., Oxford, 27 Mar. 1759 D.D., Trinity Coll., Dublin, Ireland
raw: President WILLIAM SMITH, D.D., b. Aberdeen, Scotland, 7 Sept. 1727; A.B., Aberdeen, 1747, K.M., D.D., 1759; D.D., Oxford, 27 Mar. 1759; D.D., Trinity Coll., Dublin, Ireland; Ord. London, by Bsp. of Carlisle, Dec. 1753; K.B. for Pa., 16 Jan. 1754; Près., U. of Pa., May 1754-N0V. 1779, 1789-1803; Près., Washington Coll., Md., 1782-1786; sett. Oxford (Chester) Pa., Trinity Chh., 1766-1777; Whitemarsh (Montgomery) Pa., St. Thomas's Chh., 1766-1779, 1784-1796; Lower Dublin, Pa., All Saints Chh., 1772-1779; Rector, Chester Parish, Chestertown (Kent) Md., 1779-1782; St. Paul's Chh. (Kent) Md., 1783-1785; elected ist Bishop of Maryland, 1783, but was not consecrated; Ep.; d. Philadelphia, Pa., 14 May 1803, a. 76.

name: George Soelle
raw: GEORGE SOELLE, had a collegiate ed.; arriv. N.Y., N.Y., 9 Sept. 1753; sett. York (York) Pa., I7S6-I7S7; Staten Island, N.Y., 1761- 1762; Amelia (Orangeburg) N.C, I773-I773; Moravian.

name: Hans Peter Somey
settled at: West Earl (Lane.) Pa., Groffdale Church,  ff.
raw: HANS PETER SOMEY, an exiled Palatinate minister; arriv. Philadelphia, 28 Sept. 1733; sett. West Earl (Lane.) Pa., Groffdale Chh., 1733 ff.;Menn.

name: Peter Nicholas Sommer
raw: PETER NICHOLAS SOMMER (or Sommers), b. Hamburg, Germany, 9 Jan. 1709; Ord. 1742; left Germany, 24 Oct. 1742; arriv. N.Y., N.Y., 21 Apr. 1743; sett. Schoharie (Schoharie) N.Y., 25 May 1743" 1795; Canajoharie (Montgomery) N.Y., 1743-1751; Little Falls (Herkimer) N.Y., 1743-1751; Stone Arabia (Montgomery) N.Y., 1743-1751; Knox (Albany) N.Y., Zion's Chh., 1745-179S; Helderberg (Albany) N.Y., Dutch Ref. Chh. at Guilderland, 1745 ff.; Albany, N.Y., 1751- 1791; Claverack (Columbia) N.Y., St. Thomas's Chh., 1751-1760; Cobleskill (Schoharie) N.Y., 1758-1768; Seward (Schoharie) N.Y., St. Peter's Chh. at New Rhinebeck, now Lawtersville, 1760-1775; Beaverdam (Albany) N.Y., Dutch Ref. Chh., 1765-1767; Hoosick (Rensselaer) N.Y., ca. 1767; Palatine Bridge (Montgomery) N.Y., 1770 ff.; Sharon (Schoharie) N.Y., St. John's Chh., 1775-179S; blind after 1768; retired to Sharon (Schoharie) N.Y., 1788; Luth.; d. Sharon, N.Y., 27 Oct. 1795, a. 86.

name: Peter Nicholas Sommer
settled at: Helderberg (Albany) N.Y., Dutch Ref. Chh. at Guilderland,  ff.

name: Peter Nicholas Sommer
settled at: Seward (Schoharie) N.Y., St. Peter's Chh. at New Rhinebeck, now Lawtersville

name: Jacob Sonday
raw: JACOB SONDAY, b. Germany, 1700; came to America, 1735; Ord. 1763; sett. Cocalico (Lane.) Pa., Conestoga Chh., 1763-1770; Germ. Bapt.

name: John Spaller
raw: JOHN SPALLER, sett. Rhinebeck (Dutchess) N.Y., 1709-1709; Luth.

name: Augustus Gottlieb Spangenberg
son of: the Lutheran minister of that place
raw: Bishop AUGUSTUS GOTTLIEB SPANGENBERG, A.M., b. Klettenberg, Hohenstein, Saxony, 15 July 1704, son of the Lutheran minister of that place; A.B., Jena, A.M.; Prof, at Jena; Prof, at Halle, Saxony; became a Moravian, 1733; arriv. Savannah, Ga., 22 Mar. 1734/5; sett. Savannah, Ga., 1738-1739; Pa., Apr. 1736-1738; returned to Europe, 1739; sett. Oley (Berks) Pa., 1742-1744; Bethlehem, Pa., 1744-1748; 1751-1762; Bishop of the Moravians in America, 1745- 1751, 1754-1762; consecrated Bishop at Herrnhag, 15 June 1744; Vicar General in America, 1744-1748; returned to America, 10 Dec. 1751; left for Europe, i July 1762; Moravian; d. Berthelsdorf, Germany, 18 Sept. 1792, a. 88.

name: Elihu Spencer
ordained: Boston, Mass., 14 Sept. 1748, as a missionary to the Oneidas
raw: ELIHU SPENCER, D.D., b. Millington Parish, East Haddam, Conn., 21 Feb. 1721/2, son of Dea. Isaac and Mary (Seiden) Spencer; A.B., Y.C, 1746, A.M.; D.D., U. of Pa., 1782; Trustee of Princeton, 1752-1784; Ord. Boston, Mass., 14 Sept. 1748, as a missionary to the Oneidas; inst. Elizabethtown (Union) N.J., ist Chh., Cong.-Presb., 7 Feb. 1749/50-1756; Jamaica, L.L, N.Y., 1756-1758; Shrewsbury (Monmouth) N.J., Nov. 1759-1764; Middletown (Monmouth) N.J., Chh. at Middletown Point, 1759-1764; Shark River (Monmouth) N.J., 1759-1764; Perth Amboy (Middlesex) N.J., 1759-1764; St. George's (New Castle) Del., inst. 17 Apr. 1766; sett. St. George's, Del., 1764- 1769; Middletown (New Castle) Del., Forest Chh., 1764-19 Oct. 1769; Appoquinimink (New Castle) Del., 1764-1767; inst. Trenton (Mercer) N.J., ist Presb. Chh., 18 Nov. 1769-1784; Hopewell, N.J., Ewing Chh., 1769-1784; Lawrenceville, N.J., Maidenhead Chh., 1769-1784; Chaplain, 1758, 1777; Presb.; d. Trenton, N.J., 27 Dec. 1784, a. 63 (GS).

name: George Spencer
settled at: Spotswood (Middlesex) N.J., St. Peter's Church at East Brunswick
raw: GEORGE SPENCER, Ord. London, 1767; lie. 19 Jan. 1767, for New Jersey; S.P.G., 19 Dec. 1766; K.B. for N.J., 23 Jan. 1767; sett. Spotswood (Middlesex) N.J., St. Peter's Chh. at East Brunswick, 1767-1767; Freehold (Monmouth) N.J., St. Peter's Chh., 1767-1767; recalled; disreputable; went to North Carolina; Ep.

name: Samuel Spring
degrees: D.D., A.B., Princeton, 1771, A.M. A.M., Dartmouth, 1789, D.D., Williams, 1806
son of: Col. and Dea. John and Sarah (Read) Spring
raw: SAMUEL SPRING, D.D., b. Northbridge, Mass., 27 Feb. 1745/6, son of Col. and Dea. John and Sarah (Read) Spring; A.B., Princeton, 1771, A.M.; A.M., Dartmouth, 1789, D.D., Williams, 1806; Chaplain, Canadian Expedition, 1775-1776; sett. Newburyport, Mass., 1780-1819; Cong.; d. Newburyport, Mass., 4 Mar. 1819.

name: James Sproat
ordained: Guilford, Conn., 4th Cong. Chh., 23 Aug. 1743-18 Oct. 1767
degrees: D.D., A.B., Y.C, 1741, A.M., 1757 D.D., Princeton, 1780
raw: JAMES SPROAT, D.D., b. Middleborough, Mass., 11 Apr. 1722, son of Lieut. Ebenezer and Experience Sproat; A.B., Y.C, 1741, A.M., 1757; D.D., Princeton, 1780; Ord. Guilford, Conn., 4th Cong. Chh., 23 Aug. 1743-18 Oct. 1767; inst. Philadelphia, Pa., 2nd Presb. Chh., 30 Mar. 1769-1793; New Side Presb.; Cong.; Presb.; d. Philadelphia, Pa., 18 Oct. 1793, a. 71 (GS). (Died of yellow fever.)

name: John Christian Stahlschmidt
raw: JOHN CHRISTIAN STAHLSCHMIDT, b. Freudenberg, NassauSiegen, Germany, 3 Mar. 1740, son of Landhauptman Stahlschmidt; sailor; arriv. Batavia, West Indies, 3 June 1760; to Canton, China, and on to Amsterdam, June 1761; to Bengal, India, 1764/5; home July 1765; arriv. Philadelphia, Aug. 1770; sett. Frankford, Pa., 1773-1774; Tulpehocken, Pa., 1774; Conewago (York) Pa., Quickel's or Zion's Chh., 1775-1779; also at Freyen, Bleymayer's, Schierster's, and three other congregations near York, Pa.; returned to Germany; Germ. Ref.; d. Muelheim, Germany, i June 1826, a. 86.

name: John Christian Stahlschmidt
edited_raw: Canton, China, and on to Amsterdam, June

name: Jacob Stall
raw: JACOB STALL, b. 1730; sett. Cocalico (Lane.) Pa., Conestoga Chh., 1772-1822; Tunker or Germ. Bapt.; d. (Cocalico) Pa., 1822, a. 92 y.

name: Thomas Standard
raw: THOMAS STANDARD, A.M., (M.D.), b. Taunton, co. Somerset, England; K.B. for Va., 7 May 1723; S.P.G. missionary at Brookhaven, L.L, N.Y., Caroline Chh., Setauket, arriv. 5 Oct. 1725; sett. 1725- 1725; Yonkers (Westchester) N.Y., St. John's Chh., 1726-1760; Westchester (Westchester) N.Y., St. Peter's Chh., 8 July 1727-1760; East Chester (Westchester) N.Y., St. Paul's Chh., 1727-1760; physician; Ep.; d. Westchester, N.Y., before i Aug. 1760.

name: Thomas Standard
settled at: Brookhaven, L.L, N.Y., Caroline Church, Setauket

name: William Standforth
raw: WILLIAM STANDFORTH (perhaps pensioner. Trinity Coll., Dublin, 4 June 1760); K.B. to N.Y., 22 July 1775; Ep.

name: Caspar Michael Stapel
raw: CASPAR MICHAEL STAPEL, Ph.D., M.D., b. Germany, 1721; Herborn Seminary; a former Lutheran minister at Mecklenburg, Germany; arriv. in America, 1761; sett. Amwell (Hunterdon) N.J., 12 July 1762-1766; Lebanon (Hunterdon) N.J., Rockaway Chh. at Clinton, 1762-1766; Fairmount (Hunterdon) Fox Hill Chh. at Tewksbury, 1762-1766; Alexandria (Hunterdon) N.J., 1763-1766; physician; Germ. Ref.; d. Amwell, N.J., 17 Mar. 1766.

name: John Steel Ss
settled at: New London (Chester) Pa., Old Side Church
raw: JOHN STEEL, b. Ireland, 1716; came from the Londonderry Presbytery; sett. New London (Chester) Pa., Old Side Chh., 1744-1752; Montgomery (Franklin) Pa., Hill Chh. at Mereersburg, I7S2-I7SS; broken up by the Indian Wars; Antrim (Franklin) Pa., Old Red. Chh., 1754-1755; Carlisle (Cumberland) Pa., Old Sehool Chh., inst. June 1759-1779; Silver Spring (Cumberland) Pa., Chh. at Lower Pennsborough, June 1759-1779; Captain, 1755, in the Indian Wars; Old Side Presb.; d. Carlisle, Pa., Aug. 1779.

name: Johnnrad Steiner
son of: the Hon. Jaeob and Ursula (Sutzer) Steiner
raw: JOHN CONRAD STEINER, Senior, b. Winterthur, Switzerland, I Jan. 1707, son of the Hon. Jaeob and Ursula (Sutzer) Steiner; viear, Mettmenstetten, Switzerland, 1726-1728, I733-I73S; minister, St. Peterzell, 1735-1747; also sett, at St. Gall, Hemburg, and St. George, near Winterthur; arriv. Philadelphia, 25 Sept. 1749; sett. Philadelphia, Pa., 1749-1751, 1759-1762; Germantown, Pa., 1749-1756; Whitpain (Montgomery) Pa., Boehm's Chh., 1752-1756; Reading (Berks) Pa., 1756-1757; Union (Adams) Pa., 1756-1759; Conewago (York) Pa., Zion's or Quiekel's Chh., 1756-1759; Winehester (Frederiek) Va., 1756- 1759; and the following six ehhs. in Md.: 1756-1759: Antietam (Washington) Md., Frederiek, Md., Glade (Garrett) Md., near Oakland, Middletown (Frederiek) Md., Zion or Kittatinny Mountain Chh., Pipe Creek (Frederiek) Md., and Turkey, Md.; Germ. Ref.; d. Philadelphia, Pa., 6 July 1762, a. 55 years (GS).

name: Johnnrad Steiner
edited_raw: Antietam (Washington) Md.; Frederiek, Glade (Garrett) Md.; Middletown (Frederiek) Md.; Pipe Creek (Frederiek) Md.

name: John Conrad Steiner
raw: JOHN CONRAD STEINER, Jr., b. Peterzell, Switzerland, 8 May 1737, son of the Rev^ John Conrad and Regula (Hegner) Steiner; Ord. Lancaster, Pa., 17 June 1772; sett. Salisbury (Lehigh) Pa., Jerusalem Chh., 1770-1771; Albany (Berks) Pa., Frieden's Chh., 1771-1774; Greenwich (Berks) Pa., Dunkel Chh., 1771-1775; Oley (Berks) Pa., 1771-1774; Heidelberg (Lehigh) Pa., 1771-1772; Lowhill (Lehigh) Pa., 1771-1772; Lynn (Lehigh) Pa., Ebenezer or Organ Chh., 1771-1774, Jacob's Chh., 1771-1774, Tresbacker Chh., 1771-1776; Lehigh (Northampton) Pa., Driesbaeh Chh., 1771-1781; Moore (Northampton) Pa., Union Chh., 1771-1781, Emmanuel Chh., 1774-1781; Allen & Lehigh (Northampton) Pa., 1774-1781; Germ. Ref.; d. Allentown, Pa., 14 Nov. 1781.

name: Ferdinand Steinmeyer
edited_raw: S.J. (also called Ferdinand Farmer), adm. S.J.
licensed: lies in a house in N.Y., N.Y., just prior to 1775
raw: FERDINAND STEINMEYER, S.J. (also called Ferdinand Farmer), b. Swabia, Germany, 13 Oct. 1720; adm. S.J., at Landsberg, 26 Sept. 1743; arriv. in America, 20 June 1752; Trustee, U. of Pa., 1779; sett. Lancaster (Lane.) Pa., 1752-1758; in Berks co.. Pa., 1757; Philadelphia, Pa., St. Joseph's Chh., 1758-1786; Concord (Chester) Pa., at Ivy Mills, 1759-1786; Alloway (Salem) N.J., at Glass House, 1759-1786; Bound Brook (Somerset) N.J., 1759-1786; Macopin (Passaic) N.J., at Echo Lake, 1759-1786; he was the priest who visited Roman Catholic families in a house in N.Y., N.Y., just prior to 1775; R.C; d. Philadelphia, Pa., 17 Aug. 1786.

name: Benjamin Stelle
raw: BENJAMIN STELLE, b. New Rochelle, N.Y., 1683, son of Poncet Stelle, a Huguenot; Ord. Piscataway Chh., at Stelton, 1739; sett. Piscataway (Middlesex) N.J., 1739-1759; other authorities give 1704-1759; magistrate; Bapt.; d. Piscataway, N.J., Jan. 1759, a. 75.

name: Isaac Stelle
raw: ISAAC STELLE, b. Piscataway, N.J., 6 Feb. 1718/9, son of the Rev. Benjamin Stelle; Ord. Piscataway (Middlesex) N.J., Chh. at Stelton, 1752; sett. Piscataway, N.J., 1752-1781; Bapt.; d. Piscataway, N.J., 9 Oct. 1781, a. 62.

name: John Stephens
ordained: Oyster Bay, L.L, N.Y., 1st Bapt. Chh., 1747
raw: JOHN STEPHENS, b. Staten Island. N.Y.; Ord. Oyster Bay, L.L, N.Y., 1st Bapt. Chh., 1747; sett. Horseneck Chh., Greenwich, Conn., 1747-1750; sett. N.Y., N.Y., ist Bapt. Chh., 1747-1750; sett. Ashby River, South Carolina, 22 June 1750-1769; left because of drunkenness; Bapt.; d. Black River, S.C, 1785.

name: Andrew Sterling
ordained: Sadsbury (Chester) Pa., 2nd or Upper Octoraro Chh., 1747
raw: ANDREW STERLING, Ord. Sadsbury (Chester) Pa., 2nd or Upper Octoraro Chh., 1747; sett. Sadsbury, Pa., 1747-24 Apr. 1765; East Fallowfield (Chester) Pa., Doe Run Chh., 1747-1765; Presb.; New Side; d. Sadsbury, Pa., Oct. 1765.

name: Hugh Stevenson
raw: HUGH STEVENSON, came from Ireland to America, 1726; lie 13 Sept. 1726; sett. New Castle (New Castle) Del., 1727-1728; Nottingham (Chester) Pa., 1727-1728; Lewes (Sussex) Del., 1727-1728; Ord. Snow Hill (Worcester) Md., 1728 (before June 1729); sett. Snow Hill, Md., 1728-1733; Potomac Chh. (Northumberland) Va., 1733-1733; teacher at Philadelphia, Pa., 1739-1744; Presb.; d. Philadelphia, Pa., May 1744.

name: Samuel Stillman
raw: SAMUEL STILLMAN, D.D., b. Philadelphia, Pa., 27 Feb. 1737; A.M. (hon.) U. of Pa., 1761; A.M. (hon.) H.C, 1761; A.M., Brown, 1769, D.D., 1788; Trustee and Fellow, Brown U., 1764-1807; Ord. Charleston, S.C., 26 Feb. 1759; sett. James Island, S.C, 1759-1761; Bordentown (Burlington) N.jf., 1762-1763; Boston, 2nd Bapt. Chh., 1764-1764; inst. Boston, ist Bapt. Chh., 9 Jan. 1765-1807; member. Am. Phil. Soc, 1768; Artillery Election Sermon, 1770; Election Sermon, 1779; Bapt.; d. Boston, Mass., 12 Mar. 1807, a. 70.

name: John Caspar Stoever
settled at: Philadelphia, Pa., St. Michael's Chh., Sept.
raw: JOHN CASPAR STOEVER, Senior, b. Frankenberg, Hesse, 1685, son of Dietrich and Magdalena (Eberwein) Stoever; arriv. in Pa., 11 Sept. 1728; sett. Philadelphia, Pa., St. Michael's Chh., Sept. 1728-1733; Madison (Madison) Va., Old Hebron Chh., White Oak Run, 1728-1733; Winchester (Frederick) Va., Strasburg Chh., 1728-1734; Woodstock (Shenandoah) Va., 1730-1734; Frederick, Md., 1730-1734; Mill Creek (Lebanon) Pa., Reed's or Old Tulpehoeken Chh., 1729-1729; Elizabeth (Lancaster) Pa., Emmanuel Chh., 1730-1734; Wissahickon, Pa., 1730; Oley (Berks) Pa., Christ or Hill Chh., 1731-1734; Marion (Berks) Pa., Zion's or Rieth's Chh., the original Old Tulpehoeken Chh., 1733-1734; he originated or preached to the following Lutheran churches: Oley, Colebrookdale, Hosensack, Melancthon, Manatawny, Coventry, Chestnut Hill, Moselem, Elizabeth, French Creek, Codorus, South Mountain, North Kill, Monocacy, Quittopehilla, Swatara, Conestoga, Shepherdstown, Opequon, Fredericksburg, and others; went to Germany in 1734 to obtain funds, and resided there, 1734-1738; Luth.; d. at sea en route to Virginia, 1738/9.

name: John Caspar Stoever
settled at: Madison (Madison) Va., Old Hebron Chh., White Oak Run

name: John Caspar Stoever
settled at: Mill Creek (Lebanon) Pa., Reed's or Old Tulpehoeken Chh.

name: John Caspar Stoever
settled at: Oley (Berks) Pa., Christ or Hill Chh.

name: John Caspar Stoever
settled at: Marion (Berks) Pa., Zion's or Rieth's Chh., the original Old Tulpehoeken Chh.

name: John Caspar Stoever
son of: the Rev. John Caspar and Gertrude Stoever
raw: JOHN CASPAR STOEVER, Jr., b. Luedorff, Unter Pfaltz, Germany, 21 Dec. 1707, son of the Rev. John Caspar and Gertrude Stoever; arriv. Philadelphia, 11 Sept. 1728; Ord. in Montgomery co.. Pa., 8 Apr. 1733; he organized or ministered to the following 39 Lutheran churches in Pa.: Berks co.:  ff.; Luth.; 42 churches in all; d. North Annville, Pa., 13 May 1779, a. 71 years.

name: John Caspar Stoever
settled at: Marion, Zion's or Rieth's Chh., the original Old Tulpehoeken Chh., at Stouchsburg

name: John Caspar Stoever
settled at: Penn, St. John's or North Kill at Bernville

name: John Caspar Stoever
settled at: Pike, St. John's or Hill Chh., Manatawny

name: John Caspar Stoever
settled at: Strasburg, St. Michael's or Beaver Creek Chh.

name: John Caspar Stoever
settled at: Lebanon co.: Bethel, St. John's Chh.

name: John Caspar Stoever
settled at: Mill Creek, Reed's or Old Tulpehoeken Chh.

name: John Caspar Stoever
settled at: North Annville, Berg Chh. or Hill Chh.

name: John Caspar Stoever
settled at: Lehigh CO.: Lower Macungie, Holy Trinity or Zion Chh., I

name: John Caspar Stoever
settled at: Lower Milford, Upper Milford or Hosensack Chh.

name: John Caspar Stoever
settled at: Northampton co.: Williams, Chh. at Cedarville

name: John Caspar Stoever
settled at: Montgomery co.: New H^anover, Falkner's Swamp Chh.

name: John Caspar Stoever
settled at: Upper Providence, Augustus Chh. at Trappe

name: Christian Stoltzfus
settled at: Maiden Creek Congregation, near Leesport and Shillington (Berks) Pa.
raw: CHRISTIAN STOLTZFUS, b. 1748; sett. Maiden Creek Congregation, near Leesport and Shillington (Berks) Pa., 1775-1832; Amish; d. Maiden Creek, Pa., 1832.

name: John Storrs
chaplain: in the Regt, of Col. Fisher Gay, 1776-1778|in the Regt, of Col. Fisher Gay, 1787-1796
ordained: Southold, L.L, N.Y., ist Chh., 15 Aug. 1763-1776, June 1782-13 Apr. 1787
degrees: A.M., A.B., Y.C, 1756, A.M., Tutor, 1761-1762 A.M., Dartmouth, 1792
raw: JOHN STORRS, A.M., b. Mansfield, Conn., i Dec. 1735, son of John and Esther (Gurley) Storrs; A.B., Y.C, 1756, A.M., Tutor, 1761-1762; A.M., Dartmouth, 1792; Ord. Southold, L.L, N.Y., ist Chh., 15 Aug. 1763-1776, June 1782-13 Apr. 1787; Chaplain in the Regt, of Col. Fisher Gay, 1776-1778; 1787-1796; Cong.; d. Mansfield, Conn., 9 Oct. 1799, a. 63.

name: Henry William Stoy
raw: Dr. HENRY WILLIAM STOY, b. Herborn, Westphalia, Germany, 14 Mar. 1726, son of John George Stoy; ed. in theology, U. of Herborn, 1761; in medicine, 1763; lie. 15 Sept. 1749; studied medicine at Leyden, 1763-1767; Ord. Amsterdam, íloUand, 14 Mar. 1752; arriv. Philadelphia, 28 July 1752; sett. Center (Berks) Pa., 1752-1755; Tulpehocken (Berks) Pa., Host Chh., 1752-1755; Jackson (Lebanon) Pa., Millbach Chh., 1752-1755; Mill Creek (Lebanon) Tulpehocken or Trinity Chh., 1752- 1755; Tolpehil (Lebanon) Pa., 1752-1755; Mount Joy (Lancaster) Pa., Chh. at Miller's, 1752-1763; Germantown, Pa., 1756-1757; Lancaster, Pa., Oct. 1758-Jan. 1763; Philadelphia, Pa., 1756-1758; Pequea (Lane.) Pa., 1758-1763; Lebanon (Lebanon) Tabor Chh., 1760-1763; Lebanon (Lebanon) Pa., Chh. at Steitztown, 1763-1814; he withdrew from the Coetus, 1772; elected to the Pa. legislature, 1784; physician; Germ. Ref.; d. Jonestown, Pa., 14 Sept. 1801 (GS) a. 75 years 6 months.

name: Pierre Stouppe
ordained: London, England, as an Ep., 25 Dec. 1723
raw: PIERRE STOUPPE, A.M., b. France, 1690; A.B., Geneva, Switzerland, A.M.; sett. Charleston, S.C, Huguenot Chh., 1722-1723; Ord. London, England, as an Ep., 25 Dec. 1723 ; K.B. for N.Y., 15 Feb. 1723/4; sett. New Rochelle (Westchester) N.Y., Trinity Chh., Episcopal, 20 July 1724-1760; French Ref.; Ep.; d. New Rochelle, N.Y., July 1760.

name: Pierre Stouppe
settled at: New Rochelle (Westchester) N.Y., Trinity Church, Episcopal

name: John Strain
raw: JOHN STRAIN, A.B., b. ca. 1731; A.B., Princeton, 1757; lie. 1759; Ord. 29 May 1759; sett. Lower Chanceford (York) Pa., 17 Dec. 176Óinst. 17 Nov. 1762-1774; Peach Bottom (York) Pa., Slate Ridge Chh., 1760-1774; Presb.; d. Peach Bottom, co. York, Pa., 12 Apr. 1774, a. 43 (GS).

name: John William Straub
raw: JOHN WILLIAM STRÄUB, b. Europe, 1688; not ordained; schoolteacher at Gronau, Palatinate; arriv. Philadelphia, 21 Sept. 1732, ae. 44 years, in the "Pink Plaisance"; sett. Salisbury (Lehigh) Pa., Jerusalem Chh., 1741-1743; Worcester (Montgomery) Pa., Wentz's or Skippack Chh., 1741-1744 (Good gives 1739-1741, and also places him at Franconia, Indian Creek Chh., 20 Oct. 1746); Germ. Ref.

name: Christian Streit
raw: CHRISTIAN STREIT, A.M., b. New Jersey, of Swiss parents, 7 June 1749; ed. Halle; A.M., U. of Pa., 1768; lie. 1769; Ord. Reading, Pa., Oct. 1770; sett. Easton (Northampton) Pa., St. John's Chh., 1769-1779; Lehigh (Northampton) Pa., St. Paul's Chh. at Cherryville, 1769-1779; Upper Saucon (Lehigh) Pa., St. Paul's, Blue or Organ Chh., 1769-1778; Williams (Northampton) Pa., Chh. at Cedarville, 1770-1783; Moore (Northampton) Pa., 1772-1779; Greenwich (Warren) N.J., St. James's Chh., 1773-1777; Charleston, South Carolina, St. John's Chh., 1779- 1782; New Hanover (Montgomery) Pa., Falkner's Swamp Chh., 1783- 1785; Winchester, Virginia, Strasburg Chh., 19 July 1785-1812; Chaplain, Rev. War, 8th Va., Regt., 1776-1777; Luth.; d. Winchester, Va., 10 Mar. 1812.

name: William Stringer
settled at: Philadelphia, Pa., St. Paul's Church, Oct.
raw: WILLIAM STRINGER, pens. Trinity Coll., Dublin, i Nov. 1767- 1770; K.B. for Philadelphia, 12 Mar. 1773; sett. Philadelphia, Pa., St. Paul's Chh., 1773-Oct. 1777; resigned; Ep.

name: Alexander Stuart
raw: ALEXANDER STUART, A.M., K.B. for N.Y., 17 Apr. 1703; appointed to St. Matthew's Chh., Bedford (Westchester) N.Y., 1704; perhaps never sett, there; Ep.

name: John Stuart
settled at: Fort Hunter, N.Y., Queen Anne's Chapel
raw: JOHN STUART, D.D., b. Harrisburg, Pa., 24 Feb. 1740, son of Andrew Stuart; A.B., U. of Pa., 1763, A.M., 1770, D.D., 1779; A.M. (hon.) Columbia, 1773; Ord. London, 1770; K.B. for N.Y., 3 Sept. 1770; sett. Fort Hunter, N.Y., Queen Anne's Chapel, 1770-1778; Tory prisoner at Schenectady, N.Y., 1778-1780; sett. Kingston, Canada, 1780- 1811; Montreal, Canada, 1780-1785; Ep.; Kingston, Upper Canada, 15 Aug. 1811, a. 75.

name: Robert Sturgeon
raw: ROBERT STURGEON, came from Ireland or Scotland; sett. Watertown, Mass., Independent Chh., 1721-1 May 1722; Wilton, Conn., ist Cong. Chh., 20 July 1726-1732; Bedford (Westchester) N.Y., ist Presb. Chh., 1732-1743; member of N.Y. Presbytery, 1745; not mentioned after 1750; Presb.

name: William Sturgeon
settled at: Philadelphia, Pa., assistant (United Chhs.), Christ Church
raw: WILLIAM STURGEON, A.M., b. 1722, son of the Rev. Robert Sturgeon; A.B., Y.C, 1745, A.M.; Ord. London, May 1747; appointed, 30 May 1747, S.P.G. missionary and school-master, 1747-1766; K.B. for Pa., I Dec. 1747;,sett. Philadelphia, Pa., assistant (United Chhs.), Christ Chh., 1757-1766; St. Peter's, 1757-31 July 1766; Ep.; d. Philadelphia, Pa., 3 Nov. 1770.

name: Abner Sutton
ordained: Mount Bethel (Warren) N.J., Bapt. Chh., Jan. 1775-1791
raw: ABNER SUTTON, b. Basking Ridge, N.J., 8 May 1741; Ord. Mount Bethel (Warren) N.J., Bapt. Chh., Jan. 1775-1791; Bapt.; d. Mt. Bethel, N.J., Mar. 1791.

name: Isaac Sutton
raw: ISAAC SUTTON, lie. 8 Nov. 1770; sett. Uniontown (Fayette) Pa., Great Bethel Chh., 1770-1773; Robinson (Washington) Pa., Laurel Hill Chh., 1775 ff.; Bapt.

name: James Sutton
raw: JAMES SUTTON, sett. Tuckahoe (Cape May) N.J., 1771-1772; Cowmarsh, Del., 1771-1772; Amwell (Washington) Pa., Chh. at Ten Mile, 1773-1775; Uniontown (Fayette) Pa., Redstone Settlement, at Goshen, 1773-1775; Bapt.

name: John Sutton
raw: JOHN SUTTON, b. Basking Ridge, N.J., 12 Feb. I733; ed. at Hopewell; Ord. Scotch Plains, N.J., 1763; sett. Salem (Salem) N.J., 1761- 1766; Cape May, N.J., i Apr. 1764-6 May 1766; Pencader Hundred (New Castle) Del., Welsh Traet Bapt. Chh., 3 Nov. 1770-1777; Kenton Hundred (Kent) Del., Old Duteh or Bryn Zion Chh., 1770-1777; Simpson's Creek, Va., 1777-1788; went to Kentueky, 1788; Bapt.; d. Kentueky, ea. 1800.

name: Abraham Swartz
settled at: Bedminster (Bueks) Pa., Deep Run Church, , as the first minister
raw: Bishop ABRAHAM SWARTZ, Ord. minister, 1738; Ord. Bishop, 1756; sett. Bedminster (Bueks) Pa., Deep Run Chh., 1738-1778, as the first minister; Hilltown (Bueks) Pa., Perkasie or Blooming Grove Chh., 1753-1778; Menn.; beeame blind.

name: Samuel Sweazey
raw: SAMUEL SWEAZEY, sett. Chester (Morris) N.J., Cong. Chh., 1750-1770; removed to Mississippi; Cong.

name: Job Swift
degrees: D.D., A.B., Y.C, 1765, A.M.;A.M. (hon.) Dartmouth, 1790, Trustee, 1788-1801
raw: JOB SWIFT, D.D., b. Sandwieh, Mass., 17 June 1743, son of Josiah and Abigail Swift; A.B., Y.C, 1765, A.M.; A.M. (hon.) Dartmouth, 1790, Trustee, 1788-1801; S.T.D., Williams, 1803, Trustee, 1794-1802; Ord. Riehmond (Berkshire eo.) Mass., 14 Oet. 1767-27 Dee. 1774; Amenia (Dutehess) N.Y., Smithfield Chh., 1775-1783; Manehester, Vt., 1783-1786; inst. Bennington, Vt., 31 May 1786-7 June 1801; Chaplain, Rev. War; d. Enosburg, Vt., 20 Oet. 1804, a. 60.

name: John Daniel Sydrick
raw: JOHN DANIEL SYDRICK, b. 1727; arriv. N.Y., N.Y., ist time, 22 June 1749; 2nd time, 15 Apr. 1754; sett. Philadelphia, Pa., 1774-1784; Graeeham, Md.; Hope (Warren) N.J., 1774-1775; Moravian; d. 1790.

name: Timothy Symmes
settled at: Riverhead, L.L, N.Y., Church at Lower Aquebogue
ordained: Millington in East Haddam, Conn., 2 Dec. 1736-1743
raw: TIMOTHY SYMMES, A.M., b. Scituate, Mass., 27 May 1714, son of Timothy and Elizabeth (Collamore) (Rose) Symmes; A.B., H.C, 1733, A.M.; Ord. Millington in East Haddam, Conn., 2 Dec. 1736-1743; sett. Riverhead, L.L, N.Y., Chh. at Lower Aquebogue, 1740-1744; in West Jersey, 1744-1746; Springfield (Union) N.J., inst. 16 Oct. 1746-26 Dee. 1750; New Providenee (Union) N.J., Turkey Christian Chh., 1746-1750; Ipswieh, Mass., ist Parish, 1752-1756; Cong.; Presb.; d. Ipswieh, Mass., 6 Apr. 1756, a. 41.

name: John Talbot
degrees: A.M., bapt. Wymondham, Norfolk eo., England, 6 Nov. 1645, son of Thomas and Jane (Mede) Talbot A.B., 1663/4 A.M., 1671
raw: JOHN TALBOT, A.M., bapt. Wymondham, Norfolk eo., England, 6 Nov. 1645, son of Thomas and Jane (Mede) Talbot; sizar, Christ's Coll., Cambridge, 17 Feb. 1659/60; A.B., 1663/4; Fellow of Peterhouse, 1664; A.M., 1671; Reetor, Ieklingham St. James, eo. Suffolk, 1673-1689; sett, over a ehh. in Virginia, ea. 1690-1695; Reetor of Fretheme, eo. Gloucester, England, 1695-1701; Chaplain, H.M.S. "Centurion", 1702; eame again to Ameriea, 24 Apr. 1702; ist resident S.P.G. missionary in N.J., 1702-1704; sett. Albany, N.Y., 1704-1704; Burlington, N.J., St. Mary's Chh., 1704-1705, 1706-1724; Woodbridge, N.J., 1704-1705, 1707-1709; Perth Amboy, N.J., 1702-1704; Hopewell, N.J., 1705-1723; Elizabeth, N.J., 1707-1709; Bristol (Bueks) Pa., Chh. of St. James the Greater, 1712-1727; Philadelphia, Pa., Christ Chh., 1715-1715 supply, June 1724-1727, stated supply; non-juror, eonseerated Bishop with Dr. Robert Welton; Ep.; d. Burlington, N.J., 29 Nov. 1727.

name: John Talbot
edited_raw: Reetor, Ieklingham St. James, eo. Suffolk

name: John Talbot
edited_raw: Reetor of Fretheme, eo. Gloucester, England

name: John Talbot
settled at: Bristol (Bueks) Pa., Chh. of St. James the Greater

name: Benjamin Tallmadge
ordained: Setauket Chh., Brookhaven, L.L, N.Y., 23 Oet. 1754
raw: BENJAMIN TALLMADGE, A.M., b. New Haven, Conn., 31 Dee. 1725, son of Capt. James and Hannah (Harrison) Tallmadge; A.B., Y.C, 1747, A.M.; Ord. Setauket Chh., Brookhaven, L.L, N.Y., 23 Oet. 1754; sett. Setauket, 1752-15 June 1785; Presb.; d. Setauket, L.L, N.Y., 5 Feb. 1785, a. 61.

name: Jacob Tanner
raw: JACOB TANNER, son of Michael Danner or Donner; sett. Codorus (York) Pa., 1758-1770; Monocacy (Frederick) Md., 1770-1789; Germ. Bapt.; living 1789.

name: Joseph Tate
settled at: Cumberland (Adams) Pa., Marsh Creek Church at Gettysburg
raw: JOSEPH TÄTE, b. 1711, Ord. East Donegal (Lancaster) Pa., 23 Nov. 1748; sett. Cumberland (Adams) Pa., Marsh Creek Chh. at Gettysburg, 1748-1754; Silver Spring (Cumberland) Pa., Chh. at Lower Pennsborough, 1748-1758; East Donegal, Pa., 1748-1770; Highland (Adams) Pa., 1748-1768; sett. Wilmington (New Hanover) North Carolina, 1770-1774; visited Fairforest, S.C, 1754; kept a classical school at Wilmington; Old Side Presb.; d. Wilmington, N.C, 11 Oct. 1774, a. 63.

name: Daniel Taylor
settled at: Smithtown, L.L, N.Y., Church at Nissequag (Nissequoque)
raw: DANIEL TAYLOR, A.M., b. Saybrook, Conn., 15 Jan. 1684, son of Justice Daniel Taylor; A.B., Y.C, 1707, A.M.; sett. Smithtown, L.L, N.Y., Chh. at Nissequag (Nissequoque), 1713-1717; Orange (Essex) N.J., at Newark Mountain, 1721-1748; Presb.; d. Orange, N.J., 8 Jan. 1747/8, a. 64 (GS).

name: John Taylor
raw: JOHN TAYLOR, A.B., b. New Haven, Conn., 5 Oct. 1678, son of the Rev. Joseph Taylor; A.B., H.C, 1699; sett. Southampton, L.L, N.Y., 1700-1701; Cong.; Presb.; d. Southampton, L.L, N.Y., 10 Aug. 1701, a. 23 (GS).

name: Joseph Taylor
raw: JOSEPH TAYLOR, A.M., b. Cambridge, Mass., 1651, son of John and Katherine Taylor; A.B., H.C, 1669, A.M.; sett. New Haven, Conn., 1674-1679; Ord. Southampton, L.L, N.Y., Mar. 1680; sett. Southampton, L.L, N.Y., 1679-1682; Cong.; d. Southampton, L.L, N.Y., 14 Apr. 1682, a. 31 (GS).

name: David Telfair
raw: DAVID TELFAIR, b. 1720; arriv. in America, 1766; settlement not known; Associate Presb.; d. 11 Apr. 1789, a. 69.

name: John Conrad Templeman
raw: JOHN CONRAD TEMPLEMAN, bapt. Weinheim, Palatinate, 22 Mar. 1692, son of Henry and Anna Maria (Linck) Templeman; tailor at Heidelberg, Germany; came to America, between 1721 and 1725; resided in the Conestoga valley, 1725, and in the Lebanon valley, 1735; Ord. Lancaster (Lane) Pa., 21 Sept. 1752; Ephrata (Lane) Pa., Bethany Chh., 1725-1727; sett. Conestoga (Lane) Pa., 1727-1760; Penn (Lane) Pa., White Oaks Chh., 1727-17^2; Mount Joy (Lane.) Pa., Miller's Chh., 1727-1760; Upper Leacock (Lane) Pa., Hellers' Hill, Conestoga or Salem Chh., 1727-1760; Swatara (Lebanon) Pa., 1727-1760; also Little Swatara Chh., 1754-1760; Brecknock (Lane) Pa., Muddy Creek Chh., 1734-1739, Dec. 1745-1748; North Annville (Leb.) Pa., Hill or Quittopehilla Chh., 1735-1760; Jonestown (Leb.) Pa., 1745-1760; Elizabethtown (Lane) Pa., 1750-1760; Lebanon (Leb.) Pa., Tabor Chh., 1750-1760; R.apho (Lane) Pa., 1753-1760; North Lebanon (Leb.) Pa., St. Jacob's or Kimmerling Chh., 1754-1761; Earl (Lane) Pa., Zeltenreieh Chh., 1756-1760; (Good adds: Heidelberg, Pa., Muehlbach Chh., 1751-1754; and West Cocalico (Lane.) Pa., Swamp or Little Cocalico Chh., 1755- 1760); became blind, 1757; Germ. Ref.; d. Lebanon, Pa., 1761.

name: John Conrad Templeman
settled at: Upper Leacock (Lane) Pa., Hellers' Hill, Conestoga or Salem Church

name: John Conrad Templeman
settled at: Brecknock (Lane) Pa., Muddy Creek Church, , Dec.

name: John Conrad Templeman
settled at: North Annville (Leb.) Pa., Hill or Quittopehilla Church

name: John Conrad Templeman
settled at: North Lebanon (Leb.) Pa., St. Jacob's or Kimmerling Church

name: John Conrad Templeman
settled at: West Cocalico (Lane.) Pa., Swamp or Little Cocalico Church,  )

name: Gilbert Tennent
son of: the Rev. William (I) and Catharine (Kennedy) Tennent
raw: GILBERT TENNENT, D.D., b. co. Armagh, Ireland, 5 Feb. 1702/3, son of the Rev. William (I) and Catharine (Kennedy) Tennent; came to America, a. 14 years, ca. 1716; A.M. (hon.) Y.C, 1725; D.D.; lie. Philadelphia, May 1725; Ord. New Brunswick, N.J., 1726-1743; sett. New Castle, Del., ist Chh., 1726-1727; Philadelphia, Pa., 2nd Presb. or Whitefield Soc, May 1743-1764; Trustee of Princeton, 1746-1764; went abroad in 1753 to solicit funds for Princeton; in 1740, he went on a preaching tour to Boston; Old Side Presb.; d. Philadelphia, Pa., 10 Feb. 1764, a. 62 (GS).

name: John Tennent
ordained: Freehold, N.J., Tennent Chh., 19 Nov. 1730-23 Apr. 1732
son of: the Rev. William (I) and Catharine (Kennedy) Tennent by the New Castle Presbytery, 18 Sept. 1729
raw: JOHN TENNENT, b. co. Antrim, Ireland, 12 Nov. 1707, son of the Rev. William (I) and Catharine (Kennedy) Tennent; came to America, a. 12 years; ed. Log Coll.; lie. by the New Castle Presbytery, 18 Sept. 1729; Ord. Freehold, N.J., Tennent Chh., 19 Nov. 1730-23 Apr. 1732; Presb.; d. Freehold, N.J., 23 Apr. 1732, a. 25 (GS).

name: William Tennent
raw: WILLIAM (I) TENNENT, b. Ireland, 1673, a distant relation to the Laird of Dundas and the Earl of Panmure; grad. U. of Edinburgh, ii July 1693; Ord. Ep., by the Bishop of Down, 22 Sept. 1706; arriv. Philadelphia, 6 Sept. 1718; became a Presb., 17 Sept. 1718; received by the Synod of Philadelphia, 17 Sept. 1718; sett. East Chester (Westchester) N.Y., 22 Nov. 1718-May 1720; Bedford (Westchester) N.Y., 3 May 1720-Aug. 1721; Bensalem (Bucks) Pa., 1721-1726; Smithfield (Monroe) Pa., 1721-1726; Warwick (Bucks) Pa., 1726-1742; founder of the Log Coll.; Ep.; Presb.; d. Warwick, Pa., 6 May 1746, a. 73 (GS).

name: William Ii Tennent
son of: the Rev. William (I) and Catharine (Kennedy) T'ennent
raw: WILLIAM (II) TENNENT, b. co. Antrim, Ireland, 3 June 1705, son of the Rev. William (I) and Catharine (Kennedy) T'ennent; came to America, ae. 13, in 1718; Ord. Freehold (Monmouth) N.J., Tennent Chh., 25 Oct. 1753; sett. Freehold, N.J., 1732-1777; sett. Kingston (Franklin) N.J., 1750-1750; Presb.; d. Freehold, N.J., 8 Mar. 1777, a. 72 (GS).

name: William Macky Tennent
degrees: D.D., A.B., Princeton, 1763, Trustee, 1785-1808 D.D., Y.C, 1794
son of: the Rev. Charles and Martha (Macky) Tennent
raw: WILLIAM MACKY TENNENT, D.D., b. New Castle co., Del., I Jan. 1744, son of the Rev. Charles and Martha (Macky) Tennent; A.B., Princeton, 1763, Trustee, 1785-1808; D.D., Y.C, 1794; lie. 17 June 1772; Ord. Greenfield, Conn., 17 June 1772-Dec. 1781; sett. Abington (Montgomery) Pa., 1781-1810; Chaplain, Conn. Regt., Rev. War, 1776; moderator. General Assembly of the Presb. Chh., 1797; Presb.; d. Abington, Pa., 2 Dec. 1810, a. 66.

name: Peter Tesschenmaeker
settled at: Kingston (Ulster) N.Y., Church at Esopus, , Apr. Sept.
ordained: South River (Middlesex) N.J., 9 Oct. 1679 (first Dutch Reformed minister ordained in America)
raw: PETER TESSCHENMAEKER, ed. Leyden, 1669, Groningen, 1671, and Utrecht, 1671-1673; Ord. South River (Middlesex) N.J., 9 Oct. 1679 (first Dutch Reformed minister ordained in America); sett. Kingston (Ulster) N.Y., Chh. at Esopus, 1675-1676, Apr. 1678-Sept. 1678; Guiana, South America, 1676-1678; New Castle (New Castle) Del., ist Chh., 1679-1682; Staten Island, N.Y., Dutch Ref. Chh. at Port Richmond, 1680-1682, Fr. Ref. Chh. at Fresh Kills, 1682-1683, Fr. Ref. Chh. at South Side, 1682-1683; Schenectady, N.Y., 1682-1690/1; Hacken- sack (Bergen) N.J., Chh. at New Barbadoes, 1686-1687; Dutch Ref.; massacred by the Indians at Schenectady, N.Y., 8 Feb. 1690/1.

name: Tetard
raw: Dominie TETARD (Tetrard.?), sett. Fordham, N.Y. (formerly West Farms, now part of the City of N.Y.), 1712-1744; French Ref.

name: Jean Pierre Tetrard
raw: JEAN PIERRE TETRARD, b. Switzerland, 1722 (poss. a son or relative of the preceding), sett. Charleston, S.C, Huguenot Chh., 1753- 1764; N.Y., N.Y., Chh. of the Saint Esprit, 1764-1767; New Rochelle (Westchester) N.Y., Fr. Ref. Chh., 1764-1775; Fordham, N.Y., 1764- 1775; Fr. Ref.; d. N.Y. state, 1787.

name: Daniel Thane
settled at: New Castle (New Castle) Del., first Church, i May
raw: DANIEL THANE, A.M., b. Scotland; ed. Aberdeen; A.B., Princeton, 1748; A.M.; Ord. Connecticut Farms (Union) N.J., 29 Aug. 1750-1756; inst. New Castle (New Castle) Del., ist Chh., i May 1757-1763; White Clay Creek, Del., New Side Chh., 1757-1763; Christiana Bridge (New Castle) Del., 1753-1763; New Windsor (Orange) N.Y., 1763-1764; Presb.; d. Del., 1764.

name: Daniel Thaxter
raw: DANIEL THAXTER, sett. Wallpack (Sussex) N.J., Old Shapanack Chh., 1772-1785; Presb.

name: John Thomas
raw: JOHN THOMAS, b. Radnor, Wales, 9 Dec. 1703, son of the Rev. William Thomas; called to the ministry, 1749; Ord. 1751; sett. Montgomery (Montgomery) Pa., 1749-1783; Hilltown (Bucks) Pa., Upper Perkasie Chh., 1749-1783, and Lower Chh., 1749-1783; New Britain (Bucks) Pa., Perkasie Chh., 1754-1783; Bapt.; d. Montgomery, Pa., 1790.

name: John Thomas
settled at: Philadelphia, Pa., Christ Church, assistant and schoolmaster
raw: JŒiN THOMAS, K.B. for Pa., 5 July 1700; sett. Philadelphia, Pa., Christ Chh., assistant and school-master, 1700-1704; Oxford, Pa., Trinity Chh., assistant and school-master, 1702-1704; inst. Hempstead, L.L, N.Y., St. George's Chh., 26 Dec. 1704-1724; S.P.G. missionary; Ep.; d. Hempstead, L.L, N.Y., 1724.

name: John Thomas
settled at: Hempstead, L.L, N.Y., St. George's Church

name: Joseph Thomas
raw: JOSEPH THOMAS, sett. New Britain (Bucks) Pa., 1749-1766; Ord. 1766; Bapt.

name: Owen Thomas
settled at: Pencader Hundred (New Castle) Del., Welsh Tract Church
raw: OWEN THOMAS, b. Gwrgodllys, Cilmanllwyd, Pembroke, Wales, 1692; came to America, 1707; sett. Pencader Hundred (New Castle) Del., Welsh Tract Chh., 1740-27 May 1748; Newlin (Chester) Pa., Hephzibah Chh., 1748-1759; Yellow Springs (Frederick) Md., 1748- 1760; Vincent (Chester) Pa., 1748-1760; Bapt.; d. Vincent, Pa., 12 Nov. 1760, a. 68 (GS).

name: William Thomas
raw: WILLIAM THOMAS, b. Llanwenarth, Monmouthshire, Wales, 1678; arriv. in America, 14 Feb. 1712; sett. Montgomery (Montgomery) Pa., 1722-1757; Hilltown (Bucks) Pa., Lower Chh., 1737-1757, and Perkasie Chh., 1737-1757; New Britain (Bucks) Pa., Upper Perkasie Chh., 1754-1757; Bapt.; lay preacher; d. Montgomery, Pa., 1757.

name: Thomas Thompson
degrees: A.M., adm. pens. Christ's Coll., Camb., 29 Feb. 1727/8, A.B., 1731/2, A.M., 1735, Fellow, 1738-1745
son of: William Thompson by Bsp. of London, 25 Mar. 1744/5
raw: THOMAS THOMPSON, A.M., b. Gilling, Richmond, co. York, England, 1708, son of William Thompson; adm. pens. Christ's Coll., Camb., 29 Feb. 1727/8, A.B., 1731/2, A.M., 1735, Fellow, 1738-1745; Senior Dean, 1744; lie. by Bsp. of London, 25 Mar. 1744/5; K..B., N.J., 2 Apr. 1745; sailed, 8 May 1745; ^^riv. N.Y., N.Y., 29 Sept. 1745; sett. Shrewsbury, N.J., Christ Chh., 1745-Sept. 1751; Middletown, N.J., Christ Chh., 1745-1751; Freehold, N.J., St. Peter's Chh., 1745-1751; AUentown, N.J., Christ Chh., 1745-1751; left N.J., 25 Nov. 1751; sett. Sierre Leone, West Africa, 1751-1756; vicar, Reculver, Kent, England, 1756-1761; vicar, Elham, England, 1761-1763; in 1758,; he published a short account of his missionary travels; Ep.; d. Elham, England, 5 June 1773-

name: John Thomson
raw: JOHN THOMSON, b. Scotland, 1690, came from co. Down, Ireland, to N.Y., N.Y., 1715; Ord. Lewes (Sussex) Del., Apr. 1717-1729; Bart (Lane.) Pa., Middle Octoraro Chh., 1730-1732; Chestnut Level (Lane.) Pa., Drumore Chh., 1732-31 July 1744; North Middleton, Pa., Meeting House Springs Chh., 1735-1735; Opequon Creek (Frederick) Va., 1739- 1739; Cub Creek (Charlotte) Va., Round Oak Chh., 1744-1753; Buffalo (Prince Edward) Va., 1744-1753; made missionary visits to North Carolina, 1744, 1751, I753; Moderator of the Presb. Chh. of America, 1722; Presb.; d. Centre, North Carolina, 1753.

name: John Thomson
edited_raw: Moderator of the Presb. Church of America

name: Samuel Thomson
settled at: Guilford (Franklin) Pa., Falling Springs Church at Chambersburg
raw: SAMUEL THOMSON, Ord. Pennsborough, Pa., 14 Nov. 1739; sett. Guilford (Franklin) Pa., Falling Springs Chh. at Chambersburg, 1737- 1739; Silver Spring (Cumberland) Pa., Lower Pennsborough Chh., 1739- 1745; North Middleton (Cumberland) Pa., Meeting House Springs Chh., Upper Pennsborough, 1739-1749; Straban (Adams) Pa., Hunterstown Chh., 1749-1787; Presb.; d. Hunterstown, Pa., 29 Apr. 1787.

name: Thomas Thomson
arrived: I Sept. 1743| again for N.J., 20 July 1748
raw: THOMAS THOMSON, Ord. (Bsp. of Litchfield) 15 Nov. 1730; K.B., I Sept. 1743; sett. St. Bartholomew's Parish (CoUeton) S.C, 1734-1744; St. George's Parish, Dorchester (Dorchester) S.C, 1744-1746; returned to England; K.B. again for N.J., 20 July 1748; sett. St. John's Parish (Colleton) S.C, Sept. 1748-1750; Salem (Salem) N.J., St. John's Chh., 1750-1750; Chester (Del.) Pa., St. Paul's Chh., 1750-1758; Concord (Del.) Pa., St. John's Chh., 1750-1756; Antrim Parish (Halifax) Va., 1762-1763, an aged man; Ep.

name: William Thomson
son of: the Rev. Samuel Thomson (a Presb. clergyman) of Carlisle, Pa.
raw: WILLIAM THOMSON, D.D., b. Pa., 22 May 1735, son of the Rev. Samuel Thomson (a Presb. clergyman) of Carlisle, Pa.; D.D., Washington Coll., 1785; Ord. deacon (Bsp. of London) 1759; lie. 23 Dec. 1759, K.B. for Pa., 16 Jan. 1760; S.P.G. missionary, 1760-1769; sett. Carlisle (Cumberland) Pa., St. John's Chh., 1760-1769; Huntington (Adams) Pa., Chh. at York Springs, 1760-1769; York (York) Pa., St. John's Chh., 1760-1769; Trenton (Mercer) N.J., St. Michael's Chh., i Apr. 1769-12 Apr. 1773 ; resigned; Lawrence (Mercer) N.J., Maidenhead Chh., 1769-1773; Allentown (Monmouth) N.J., Christ Chh., 1769-1773; North Elk (Cecil) Md., St. Mary Anne's Parish, 1773-1779; North Sassafras Parish (Cecil) Md., 1779-1785; Augustine Parish (Cecil) Md., 1780- 1785; Ep.; d. North Sassafras Parish (Cecil) Md., 1785, a. 50.

name: William Thomson
edited_raw: North Elk (Cecil) Md. Mary Anne's Parish

name: Daniel Thorn
ordained: sett. Chestnut Level (Lane.) Pa., Chh. at Drumore, 1746-1750
raw: DANIEL THORN, b. Delaware; Ord. by the Donegal Presbytery, between May 1746 and May 1747; sett. Chestnut Level (Lane.) Pa., Chh. at Drumore, 1746-1750; Presb.; d. Chestnut Level, Pa., 1750.

name: Sydenham Thorn
raw: SYDENHAM THORN, K.B. for Pa., 12 Sept. 1774; sett. Philadelphia, Pa., St. Paul's Chh., 1774-1781; Milford (Kent) Del., Christ Chh., 1774-1781; Mispillion (Kent) Del., Christ Chh., 1774-1781; Ep.

name: Amandeus Paul Thrane
raw: AMANDEUS PAUL THRANE, b. Aalborg, Jutland, Denmark, 1716; theol. student at Lindheim, 1744, a. 25; cantor and asst. minister at Aalborg, before 1744; arriv. N.Y., N.Y., 19 Oct. 1761; sett. Bethlehem, Pa., as head pastor, 1761-1776; Moravian; d. Bethlehem, Pa., 19 Apr. 1776.

name: William Throop
ordained: Mansfield, Conn., 2nd or North Chh. at Storrs, 11 Oct. 1744, as the first minister
degrees: A.M., A.B., Y.C, 1743, A.M. A.M., Princeton, 1755
raw: WILLIAM THROOP, A.M., b. Bristol, R.L, 22 Aug. 1720, son of William and Abigail Throop; A.B., Y.C, 1743, A.M.; A.M., Princeton, 1755; Ord. Mansfield, Conn., 2nd or North Chh. at Storrs, 11 Oct. 1744, as the first minister; sett. Storrs, Conn., 1744-15 Jan. 1746/7; inst. Southold, L.L, N.Y., 21 Sept. 1748-1756; Cong.; Presb.; d. Southold, L.L, N.Y., 29 Sept. 1756, a. 36.

name: Jacob Till
settled at: Warwick (Lane.) Pa., St. James's Church at Lititz
raw: JACOB TILL, arriv. N.Y., N.Y., 19 Sept. 1753; sett. Warwick (Lane.) Pa., St. James's Chh. at Lititz, 1759-1760; Moravian.

name: William Tillinghast
raw: WILLIAM TILLINGHAST, A.M., A.M. (hon.) Brown, 1774; sett. Pa.; Bapt.

name: Lars Tollstadius
raw: LARS TOLLSTADIUS, sett. Philadelphia, Pa., Gloria Dei Chh., 1702-1702; Swedesborough (Gloueester) N.J., Trinity Chh., on Raeeoon Creek, 1703-1706; Pennsneck (Salem) N.J., St. George's Chh., 1703-1706; Sw. Luth.; drowned, 9 May 1706.

name: Ichabod Tompkins
raw: ICHABOD TOMPKINS, b. Morristown, N.J.; Ruling Elder at Morristown, 19 Aug. 1752; lie. 28 Dee. 1757; Ord. Morristown (Morris) N.J., 6 Nov. 1759; sett. Morristown, N.J., 1759-1761; Bapt.; d. Morristown, N.J., 8 Jan. 1761.

name: Epenetus Townsend
settled at: North Salem (Westehester) N.Y., St. James's Church
raw: EPENETUS TOWNSEND, A.M., b. Cedar Swamp, L.L, N.Y., Apr. 1742, son of Mieajah and Elizabeth (Platt) Townsend; A.B., Columbia, 1759, A.M.; Ord. London, 1767; K.B. for N.Y., 7 Jan. 1768; arriv. N.Y., N.Y., 22 Apr. 1768; sett. North Salem (Westehester) N.Y., St. James's Chh., 29 May 1768-1779; South Salem (Westehester) N.Y., St. John's Chh., 1768-1779; Chaplain of a Tory Regt., 1779; Ep.; d. off Halifax, Nova Seotia, 1779.

name: Peter Tranberg
raw: PETER TRANBERG, sett. Pennsneek (Salem) N.J., St. George's Chh., 1726-1741; Swedesborough (Gloueester) N.J., Trinity Chh. in Raeeoon Creek, 1726-1741; Chester (Del.) Pa., Chh. at Upland, 1742- 1748; Wilmington (New Castle) Del., Old Swedes Chh., 1742-1748; preached in German, Swedish and English; Sw. Luth.; d. Pennsneck, N.J., 8 Nov. 1748.

name: Agur Treadwell
degrees: A.M., A.B., Y.C., 1760, A.M. A.B., Columbia, 1761
raw: AGUR TREADWELL, A.M., b. Stratford, Conn., 16 Dec. 1734, son of Lieut. Hezekiah and Mehitable (Minor) Treadwell; A.B., Y.C., 1760, A.M.; A.B., Columbia, 1761; became an Ep., Aug. 1760; Ord. Apr. 1762; lie. 30 Apr. 1762; K.B. for N.J., 7 May 1762; sett. Trenton (Mercer) N.J., St. Michael's Chh., 4 Apr. 1763-1765; Lawrence (Mercer) N.J., Maiden- head Chh., 1763-1765; Allentown (Monmouth) N.J., Christ Chh., 1763- 1765; S.P.G. missionary, 1763-1765; Ep.; d. Trenton, N.J., 19 Aug. 1765, a. 31.

name: Joseph Treat
son of: the Rev. Dr. Richard and Rebecca Treat
raw: JOSEPH TREAT, A.M., b. Abington, Pa., son of the Rev. Dr. Richard and Rebecca Treat; A.B., Princeton, 1757, A.M., Tutor, 1758- 1760; lie 1760; sett. N.Y., N.Y., ist Presb. Chh., 1762-1784; Greenwich (Warren) N.J., 1776-1776, 1784-1797; Chaplain, Continental Army; Presb.; d. Greenwich, N.J., 1797.

name: Richard Treat
raw: RICHARD TREAT, D.D., b. Milford, Conn., 25 Sept. 1708, son of Capt. Joseph Treat; A.B., Y.C, 1725, A.M., D.D., 1776; Trustee, Princeton, 1748-1778; Ord. Abington (Montgomery) Pa., 30 Dee 1731- 1778; sett. Norriton (Montgomery) Pa., 1731-1741, 1763-1772; Tinicum (Bucks) Pa., 1741-1768; Presb.; d. Abington, Pa., 20 Nov. 1778, a. 70.

name: Hans Tschantz
raw: Bishop HANS TSCHANTZ, minister and Bishop in Europe; came to America, 1711; sett. Strasburg (Lane) Pa., 1717-1742; West Lampeter (Lane) Pa., Willow Street Chh., 1719-1742; Menn.; d. West Lampeter, Pa., after 1742.

name: Nathan Tucker
raw: NATHAN TUCKER, A.B., b. Milton, Mass.; A.B., H.C, 1744; Ord. (N.Y. Presbytery) 9 Apr. 1747; Presb.; d. Stratford, Conn., Dee 1747.

name: Samuel Tudor
raw: SAMUEL TUDOR, A.M., b. Windsor, Conn., 8 Mar. 1704/5» son of Samuel and Abigail (Filley) Tudor; A.B., Y.C, 1728, A.M.; sett. Goshen (Orange) N.Y., 1733-1735; Ord. Windsor, Conn., Jan. 1740- 1757; Cong.; Presb.; d. Windsor, Conn., 21 Sept. 1757,1 a. 53.

name: James Tuttle
raw: JAMES TUTTLE, A.M., A.B., Princeton, 1764, A.M.; Ord. Hanover (Morris) N.J., Parsippany Chh., Apr. 1768-1770; sett. Rockaway (Morris) N.J., Pequannock Chh., 1768-1771; Presb.; d. Rockaway, N.J.,Apr. 1771.

name: Moses Tuttle
raw: MOSES TUTTLE, A.M., b. New Haven, Conn., 25 June 1715, son of John and Hannah (Humiston) Tuttle; A.B., Y.C, 1745, A.M.; Ord. Granville, Mass., Jan. 1746/7-1754; sett. Laurel (Sussex) Del., 1756- Sept. 1762; sett. New Jersey, May 1764-May 1769; Cong.; New Side Presb.; d. Southold, L.L, N.Y., 21 Nov. 1785, a. 70. ;

name: Eric Unander
settled at: Swedesborough (Gloucester) N.J., Trinity Church on Raccoon Creek
raw: ERIC UNANDER, sett. Swedesborough (Gloucester) N.J., Trinity Chh. on Raccoon Creek, 1749-175S ; Pennsneck (Salem) N.J., St. George's Chh., 1749-1756; Marcus Hook (Del.) Pa., St. Matin's Chh., 1749-1756; Wilmington, Del., Old Swedes Chh., 1755-1759; Chester (Del.) Pa., Chh. at Upland, 1755-1759; left for Sweden, July 1760; Sw. Luth.

name: Peter Underhill
raw: PETER UNDERHILL, b. Oyster Bay, L.L, N.Y., 24 Jan. 1737, son of Peter and Penelope (Ailing) Underhill; sett. Oyster Bay, L.L, N.Y., Separatist Bapt. Chh., 1759-1789, and ist Bapt. Chh., 1789-1806, during which time he was asst. to Dr. Benjamin Coles, 1783-1806, who had formerly been the minister of the Baptist Chh. at Hopewell, N.J. (1774-1781), q.v.; blacksmith and preacher; Bapt.; d. Oyster Bay, L.L, N.Y., 24 June 1806.

name: Martin Urner
raw: Bishop MARTIN URNER, b. Alsace, France, 1695, son of Ulrich Urner, of Swiss descent; came to Pa., 1708; resided in Lancaster co.. Pa., 1712; Ord. Coventry (Chester) Pa., 1729; sett. Coventry, Pa., 1722- 1755; Germ. Bapt.; d. Coventry, Pa., 1755.

name: Martin Urner Ii
raw: Bishop MARTIN URNER II, b. New Hanover, Pa., 1725, son of Jacob Urner; Ord. Bishop, Coventry (Chester) Pa., 1756; sett. Coventry, Pa., 1756-1799; Germ. Bapt.; d. Coventry, Pa., 1799.

name: William Urquhart
settled at: Flushing, L.L, N.Y., St. George's Church
raw: WILLIAM URQUHART, b. Scotland; K.B. for N.Y., 29 Jan. 1703/4; Jamaica, L.L, N.Y., Grace Chh., induct. 27 July 1704-1708; sett. Flushing, L.L, N.Y., St. George's Chh., 1705-1707; Ep.; d. Jamaica, L.L, N.Y., 1709.

name: John Ury
raw: JOHN URY, sett. N.Y., 1741, as a school-teacher; was accused of fomenting a plot and of being a Roman Catholic—both were incorrect, but he was declared guilty and hanged; a non-juring Ep. clergyman; hanged, N.Y., 15 Aug. 1741.

name: Arthur Ussher
degrees: A.M., pens. Trinity Coll., Dublin, 9 June 1724, a. 19 yrs. A.B., 1728, A.M., 1734
raw: ARTHUR USSHER, A.M., b. co. Waterford, Ireland, 1705, son of James Ussher, gent.; pens. Trinity Coll., Dublin, 9 June 1724, a. 19 yrs.; scholar, 1727, A.B., 1728, A.M., 1734; K.B., 10 Feb. 1736/7; S.P.G. missionary; sett. Dover (Kent) Del., Christ Chh., 1737-1743; Milford (Kent) Del., Christ Chh., 1740-1743; Mispillion (Kent) Del., Christ Chh., 1740-1743; Smyrna (Kent) Del., St. Peter's Chh., 1740-1743; Broadkill (Sussex) Del., St. John Baptist Chh., 1744-1752; Cedar Creek Hundred, Del., St. Matthew's Chh., 1744-1752; Dagsborough (Sussex) Del., Prince George's Chapel, 1744-1752; Indian River (Sussex) Del., St. George's Chapel, 1744-1752; Lewes (Sussex) Del., St. Peter's Chh., 1744-1752; Newtown (Del.) Pa., St. David's Chh. at Radnor, 1749-1753 ; resigned, 1753 ; Ep.

name: Richard Utley
raw: RICHARD UTLEY, b. Yorkshire, England, 22 Feb. 1722; became a Moravian, 1742; arriv. Staten Island, N.Y., 26 Nov. 1743; Ord. deacon, Philadelphia, Pa., 14 Aug. 1746; sett. N.Y., N.Y., 1743-1748; Lancaster (Lane.) Pa., 1748-1748; Oley (Berks) Pa., 1749-1750; Graceham (Frederick) Md., 1752-1755, 1770-1771; Staten Island, N.Y., i75S-^755i Newport, R.L, 1758-1758; Philadelphia, Pa., 1762-1772; Bethabara, North Carolina, at Wacovia, 1766-1770; Salem, N.C, 1772-1775; also an itinerant preacher at the following places between the years 1743- 1749; Dover, Duck Creek and Lewes, Del., Burlington, Cranbury, Lawrence, Middletown, Princeton, Swedish Settlements, and Trenton, N.J.; and Durham (Bucks), Lower Salford (Montgomery), Manatawny (Berks), Southampton (Bucks), and Upper Providence (Montgomery), all in Pa.; Moravian; d. Salem, N.C, 9 Oct. 1775.

name: Richard Utley
settled at: the following places between the years

name: Richard Utley
edited_raw: Durham (Bucks), Lower Salford (Montgomery), Manatawny (Berks), Southampton (Bucks), and Upper Providence (Montgomery), all in Pa.

name: Francis Vaillant Du Gueslis
settled at: Victor (Ontario) N.Y., Mission of the Conception to the Senecas
raw: FRANCIS VAILLANT DU GUESLIS, sett. Victor (Ontario) N.Y., Mission of the Conception to the Sénecas, 1678-1709; R.C

name: Jacob Van Arsdalen
raw: JACOB VAN ARSDALEN, A.M., A.B., Princeton, 1765, A.M., Trustee, 1793-1802; sett. Kingston (Franklin) N.J., 19 June 1771-13 Dec. 1775; Springfield (Union) N.J., 1775-1801; Presb.; d. Springfield, N.J., 1803.

name: John Herman Van Basten
raw: JOHN HERMAN VAN BASTEN, arriv. on the "St. Andrew Galley," 26 Sept. 1737; preached as a candidate in theology, at Poughkeepsie, N.Y., 1739-1739; sett. Jamaica, L.L, N.Y., 1739-1740; Success, L.L, N.Y., Success Pond Chh. at North Hempstead, 1739-1740; Oyster Bay, L.L, N.Y., Chh. at Wolver Hollow, 1739-1740; Newtown, L.L, N.Y., 1739-1740; Dutch Ref.

name: Elias Van Bunschooten
raw: ELIAS VAN BUNSCHOOTEN, A.B., b. New Hackensack, N.Y., 26 Oct. 1738, son of Teunis Van Bunschooten; A.B., Princeton, 1768; Trustee of Rutgers Coll., 1787-1815; Ord. 1773; sett. Schagticoke (Rensselaer) N.Y., 1773-1785; Minisink (Sullivan) N.Y., 28 Aug. 1785- 1799; Mahakemack (i.e. Port Jervis) (Orange) N.Y., 28 Aug. 1785- 1799; Wallpack (Sussex) N.J., 28 Aug. 1785-1799; Westtown (Orange) N.Y., 1788-1799; Clove (Dutchess) N.Y., 1788-1812; Dutch Ref.; d. New Brunswick, N.J., 10 Jan. 1815, a. 76(GS).

name: Jacob Van Buskirk
ordained: New Hanover, Pa., 12 Oct. 1763, sett. New Hanover (Montgomery) Falkner's Swamp Chh., 1762-1765
raw: JACOB VAN BUSKIRK, b. Hackensack, N.J., 11 Feb. 1739, son of Captain Jacob Van Buskirk; ed. Halle; studied under Weyberg and Muhlenberg, 1759-1762; Ord. New Hanover, Pa., 12 Oct. 1763, sett. New Hanover (Montgomery) Falkner's Swamp Chh., 1762-1765; Germantown, Pa., asst., 1765-1769; Douglass (Berks) Pa., Oley Hill Chh., 1762-1765; Upper Providence( Montgomery) Pa., Augustus Chh. at Trappe, 1763-1765; Pikeland (Chester) Pa., Zion Chh., 1763-1765; Upper Dublin, Pa., Puff's Chh., 1765-1769, 1793-1800; Whitemarsh (Montgomery) Pa., St. Peter's Chh., Barren Hill, 1765-1769; Allentown (Lehigh) Pa., St. Paul's Chh., 1769-1778; Germantown, Pa., St. Michael's Chh., 1765-1786; Lower Macungie (Lehigh) Pa., 9 July 1769-18 Feb. 1800; Upper Milford (Lehigh) Pa., Zionsville Chh., 1769- 1793; 1795-1800; Whitehall (Lehigh) Pa., Egypt Chh., 1769-1770; Salisbury (Lehigh) Pa., 1769-1793, 1795-1800; Upper Saucon (Lehigh) Pa., St. Paul's, Blue, or Organ Chh., 1769-1793, 1797-1800; Lower Saucon (Northampton) Pa., 1769-1793, 1795-1800; Whitpain (Montgomery) Pa., St. John's Chh. at Centre Square, 1793-1800; Gwynedd (Montgomery) Pa., 1793-1800; North Wales (Montgomery) Pa., 1783- 1797; Luth.; d. North Wales, Pa., 5 Aug. 1800.

settled at: Upper Providence( Montgomery) Pa., Augustus Church
